title: 'Prison was holiday camp compared to forced labour', court hears
text: wages for forced labor at their traveller site in Leighton Buzzard, Bedfordshire. During the trial, the prosecution presented evidence that the four accused men had subjected Michael Hughes and the other man to deplorable living conditions at the site. They were kept in cramped and filthy caravans, given only meager portions of food, and forced to work long hours doing hard physical labor without proper rest or breaks. In his testimony, Michael Hughes described the conditions at the site as akin to slavery. He told the court that he was made to work from early morning until late at night, often without any time off. He recounted instances of physical abuse at the hands of the accused, who reportedly used threats and intimidation to keep him and the other man in line. When questioned by the prosecution, Hughes said that despite his time in prison, it was a "holiday camp" compared to the forced labor he endured at the hands of the accused. He spoke of the sense of hopelessness and fear that pervaded his existence while living and working at the site under their control. The defense team for the accused argued that the allegations against their clients were unfounded and that the living conditions at the site were not as bad as the prosecution claimed. They sought to portray the men as hardworking individuals who had provided employment opportunities to those in need. As the trial progressed, more witnesses came forward with similar accounts of abuse and exploitation at the hands of the accused. Some spoke of being coerced into working for long hours with little pay, while others described being threatened and physically assaulted when they tried to leave. The case has drawn attention to the issue of forced labor and exploitation within the traveller community, shining a light on the often hidden and overlooked struggles faced by vulnerable individuals. While the outcome of the trial remains to be seen, it serves as a stark reminder of the importance of protecting the rights and dignity of all individuals, regardless of their background or circumstances. As the trial continues, the accused men maintain their innocence, insisting that they have done nothing wrong. The evidence presented in court, however, paints a troubling picture of the conditions endured by those under their control. The prosecution is expected to call more witnesses in the coming days in an effort to secure a conviction against the four men accused of exploiting and abusing vulnerable individuals for their own gain.

title: Delhi rape: PM promises to pursue panel recommendations
text: Manmohan Singh wrote to the panel's head, ex-chief justice JS Verma, saying the report would be taken up promptly. The commission called for faster trials and longer sentences for convicted rapists, as well as suggesting amendments to the criminal law to provide better protection for women against sexual violence. In the wake of public outrage over the brutal gang rape of a young woman in Delhi, Prime Minister Singh has promised to pursue the panel's recommendations and work towards implementing them as soon as possible. The government has come under immense pressure to address the issue of violence against women and to take concrete steps to ensure the safety and security of all citizens, particularly women. The gang rape incident, which took place on a moving bus in December 2012, shocked the nation and sparked widespread protests calling for justice and action to prevent such heinous crimes from happening again. The victim, a 23-year-old physiotherapy student, succumbed to her injuries two weeks after the attack, leading to a national outcry and demands for change. The Verma Commission, constituted in the aftermath of the Delhi gang rape, was tasked with reviewing the existing laws and suggesting measures to address the rising cases of sexual violence against women. The panel consulted with stakeholders, legal experts, and activists to come up with a comprehensive set of recommendations aimed at improving the justice system and ensuring the safety of women in India. Some of the key recommendations of the panel included the creation of a new law on sexual assault, introducing stricter punishment for offenders, defining consent in cases of sexual violence, establishing a mechanism for monitoring and evaluating the implementation of laws related to sexual crimes, and enhancing the capacity of law enforcement agencies to handle such cases effectively. Prime Minister Singh has expressed his commitment to taking swift action on the recommendations of the Verma Commission and has assured the public that the government will do everything in its power to make sure that justice is served and that women are protected from violence and abuse. The government has already initiated steps to amend the criminal law and strengthen the legal framework to address the issue of sexual violence in the country. The fight against violence and discrimination towards women is an ongoing struggle in India, and the government's response to the recommendations of the Verma Commission will be a crucial test of its commitment to upholding the rights and dignity of all citizens. Only time will tell if the promises made by Prime Minister Singh will be translated into concrete actions that will make a meaningful difference in the lives of women across the country.

title: Vulnerable adult abuse cases in Wales rise by 11%
text: common types of abuse reported, according to the latest figures released by the National Independent Safeguarding Board. The rise in adult protection referrals in Wales highlights a growing concern regarding the safety and wellbeing of vulnerable adults in the country. The increase in reported cases suggests that more individuals are coming forward to seek help and protection from abuse. However, it also raises questions about the effectiveness of current safeguarding measures in place to prevent and respond to such incidents. Neglect, which accounted for 36% of reported cases, is a particularly concerning issue as it can have serious consequences on the physical and emotional health of vulnerable adults. This type of abuse often goes unnoticed or unreported, making it essential for caregivers, family members, and communities to remain vigilant and report any signs of neglect to the appropriate authorities. Physical abuse, the second most common type of reported abuse at 32%, can have immediate and long-lasting effects on the health and wellbeing of vulnerable adults. This form of abuse can be perpetrated by caregivers, family members, or even strangers, making it crucial for communities to be educated on how to recognize and report instances of physical abuse. Other types of abuse reported in the figures include psychological abuse, financial abuse, and sexual abuse, each of which can have devastating impacts on the lives of vulnerable adults. It is essential for individuals and organizations involved in the care and support of vulnerable adults to be aware of the signs and symptoms of abuse and to take immediate action to protect those at risk. The increase in reported adult protection referrals in Wales is a reminder of the importance of safeguarding vulnerable adults and providing them with the necessary support and protection. It is crucial for agencies, caregivers, and communities to work together to create a safe and supportive environment for vulnerable adults and to ensure that those who perpetrate abuse are held accountable for their actions. The National Independent Safeguarding Board has called for increased training and awareness-raising initiatives to help prevent and respond to abuse against vulnerable adults. By working together and taking a proactive approach to safeguarding, we can help protect the most vulnerable members of our communities and ensure that they receive the care and support they deserve.

title: Call for commissioner to fight for autism and learning disability rights
text: The three charities behind the campaign say families are exhausted from fighting to get much-needed support and status as equal citizens. They say a commissioner would close the current gap between what the law says and what actually happens for individuals with autism and learning disabilities. The proposal for a commissioner comes after years of frustration and struggle for many families. Current systems and services often fail to adequately address the unique needs of individuals with autism and learning disabilities, leaving them and their families feeling overlooked and unheard. The charities argue that a commissioner would provide a dedicated voice to champion the rights and well-being of this often marginalized group in society. One of the key functions of the commissioner would be to ensure that individuals with autism and learning disabilities have equal access to education, healthcare, housing, and employment opportunities. This would mean working to address systemic barriers and discrimination that too often prevent individuals with disabilities from fully participating in society. It would also involve monitoring and overseeing the implementation of existing laws and policies that are meant to protect the rights of individuals with disabilities. In addition to advocating for systemic change, the commissioner would also serve as a point of contact for individuals and families seeking support and guidance. This could involve providing information, resources, and referrals to appropriate services, as well as offering a platform for individuals to voice their concerns and experiences. By centralizing support and advocacy efforts, the commissioner would be able to streamline services and ensure that individuals with autism and learning disabilities are able to access the help they need in a timely and effective manner. The call for a commissioner has received widespread support from advocacy groups, lawmakers, and individuals with autism and learning disabilities and their families. Many see it as a critical step towards ensuring that individuals with disabilities are able to live full and meaningful lives, free from barriers and discrimination. By appointing a commissioner to specifically focus on the rights and well-being of individuals with autism and learning disabilities, the government would send a powerful message that it is committed to upholding the rights of all of its citizens. As the campaign for a commissioner gains momentum, the hope is that individuals with autism and learning disabilities will no longer have to struggle and fight for their rights and recognition as equal citizens. Instead, they will have a dedicated advocate in their corner, working tirelessly to ensure that their needs and voices are heard and respected.

title: Bath and Bristol streets exceed EU pollution levels
text: By Luke Hanrahan BBC News Data from Bath and North East Somerset and Bristol City Council showed nitrogen dioxide levels were more than twice the EU limit in some roads. Bristol City Council said reducing the amount of air pollution was a top priority and that measures were being put in place to tackle the issue. The data revealed that areas such as the A4 Portway in Bristol and the A367 Wellsway in Bath were among the worst affected, with nitrogen dioxide levels exceeding EU limits on a regular basis. This has raised concerns among environmentalists and local residents about the impact of air pollution on public health and the environment. In response to the findings, Bristol City Council has introduced a Clean Air Zone in the city center, which restricts access to high-polluting vehicles and encourages the use of public transport and cycling. The council has also implemented measures such as retrofitting buses with cleaner engines and promoting electric vehicles to reduce emissions. In Bath, the local authority has introduced similar initiatives, such as pedestrianizing certain streets to reduce traffic congestion and emissions. The council is also working with businesses to encourage them to adopt environmentally-friendly practices and reduce their carbon footprint. Despite these efforts, some residents and environmental groups argue that more needs to be done to tackle air pollution in the region. They are calling for stricter regulations on vehicle emissions, increased investment in public transport, and better infrastructure for cyclists and pedestrians. Air pollution is a major concern in cities across the UK, with research showing that it can have serious health impacts, particularly for children, the elderly, and people with respiratory conditions. It is also a significant contributor to climate change and environmental degradation. As Bath and Bristol continue to grapple with high levels of nitrogen dioxide in their streets, the importance of taking action to improve air quality cannot be overstated. The local authorities must work together with residents, businesses, and environmental groups to find sustainable solutions that will protect public health and the environment for future generations.

title: William Roache trial: Girl 'humiliated and ashamed after rapes'
text: The woman, now 62, told Preston Crown Court two alleged rapes took place at his homes in Haslingden, Lancashire, on separate occasions. She suffered in silence for years before finding the courage to come forward and speak out against the actor. During her emotional testimony, she described the feeling of shame and humiliation that consumed her in the aftermath of the alleged attacks. She detailed how Roache allegedly took advantage of her vulnerability and trust, leaving her feeling violated and powerless. The woman's voice trembled as she recounted the traumatic events that had haunted her for decades. The court heard how the woman struggled to come to terms with what had happened to her, grappling with feelings of guilt and self-blame. She described feeling isolated and disconnected from the world, unable to share her pain with anyone out of fear and shame. It was only through therapy and support that she found the strength to confront her past and seek justice. As she faced Roache in the courtroom, the woman's words carried a weight of sorrow and anger. She accused him of robbing her of her innocence and dignity, leaving scars that would never fully heal. The emotional toll of reliving the trauma was evident in her tear-streaked face, a painful reminder of the long-lasting impact of sexual violence. Roache, known for his long-running role in the British soap opera "Coronation Street," sat solemnly in the dock, his eyes fixed on the witness as she bravely shared her story. The courtroom fell silent as she spoke, her words resonating with all who listened. It was a moment of reckoning for both the accused and the accuser, a pivotal point in a legal battle that would determine the course of justice. As the trial unfolded, more details emerged about the alleged incidents, painting a disturbing picture of manipulation and abuse. The woman's testimony was corroborated by evidence and witness statements, lending credibility to her claims. Roache's defense team vehemently denied the allegations, arguing that the accusations were fabricated and unfounded. The trial continued with fervor and intensity, each session bringing new revelations and testimonies to light. The woman's bravery in coming forward sparked a wave of support and solidarity from other survivors of sexual violence, who stood in solidarity with her in her quest for justice. The courtroom became a battleground of truth and justice, where the voice of the survivor was heard loud and clear. As the trial drew to a close, the woman's testimony remained a powerful reminder of the resilience and courage of survivors in the face of adversity. Her words echoed in the courtroom long after she had stepped down from the witness stand, leaving a lasting impact on all who had borne witness to her bravery. The trial may have ended, but the fight for justice and accountability would continue to reverberate in the halls of justice for years to come.

title: London 2012: India 'to raise role of Dow Chemical'
text: issue. The controversy surrounding Dow Chemical's involvement as a sponsor for the London 2012 Olympics has sparked a heated debate in India. The sports ministry has instructed the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) to address the public's concerns regarding the association with the controversial corporation. Dow Chemical's role as a sponsor for the London 2012 Olympics has come under scrutiny due to its connection to the Bhopal gas tragedy in 1984. The disaster, considered one of the worst industrial accidents in history, resulted in thousands of deaths and long-term health issues for many survivors. The Indian government has long held Dow Chemical responsible for the tragic events in Bhopal and has demanded justice for the victims. The sports ministry's decision to raise the issue with the IOA is a significant step towards addressing the public's concerns over Dow Chemical's involvement with the Olympics. In a statement, the ministry emphasized the need to respect the sentiments of the people of India and to uphold the country's commitment to social responsibility and ethical practices. The IOA has faced mounting pressure from various quarters to reconsider its partnership with Dow Chemical. Many athletes, activists, and members of the public have voiced their opposition to the corporation's sponsorship of the Olympics. The controversy has also attracted international attention, with human rights organizations and environmental groups urging the IOA to sever ties with Dow Chemical. The decision on whether to continue Dow Chemical's association with the London 2012 Olympics poses a complex dilemma for the IOA. While the corporation's sponsorship has provided crucial financial support for Team India's participation in the Games, the ethical implications of partnering with a company linked to a tragedy of such magnitude cannot be overlooked. The IOA now faces a critical choice between honoring its commitments to its athletes and sponsors and acknowledging the concerns of the Indian public. The decision will undoubtedly have far-reaching implications for India's reputation on the global stage and its stance on corporate accountability and social justice. As the debate over Dow Chemical's role in the London 2012 Olympics continues to escalate, the IOA must tread carefully to navigate the delicate balance between upholding its obligations and responsibilities. The outcome of this controversy will not only impact India's participation in the upcoming Games but also shape the country's approach to ethical dilemmas in the future. Only time will tell how the IOA will ultimately address this contentious issue and what implications it will have for India's sporting community and society at large.

title: Poland profile - Overview
text: There have been periods of independence as well as periods of domination by other countries. Several million people, half of them Jews, died in World War II. A new era began when Poland became an EU member in May 2004.  Poland, officially known as the Republic of Poland, is a country located in Central Europe. It shares borders with Germany, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Ukraine, Belarus, Lithuania, and Russia. With a population of over 38 million people, Poland is the ninth most populous country in Europe. Warsaw is the capital and largest city of Poland, serving as the political, economic, and cultural center of the country. Other major cities include Krakow, Wroclaw, Poznan, and Gdansk. Polish is the official language spoken by the majority of the population. Poland has a rich cultural heritage, with a history that dates back over a thousand years. The country has made significant contributions to art, literature, music, and science. Poland is also known for its delicious cuisine, which includes traditional dishes such as pierogi, kielbasa, and bigos. The economy of Poland is considered one of the fastest-growing in the European Union. The country has a diverse economy, with industries such as manufacturing, agriculture, and services playing key roles. Poland is a leading producer of food, machinery, and furniture in the region. Poland's political landscape is characterized by a democratic system of government. The President serves as the head of state, while the Prime Minister is the head of government. The Polish parliament consists of two chambers: the Sejm (lower house) and the Senate (upper house). In recent years, Poland has faced some challenges related to issues such as corruption and media freedom. However, the country has made progress in addressing these issues and remains committed to upholding democratic values and principles. Poland is a member of various international organizations, including the United Nations, NATO, and the World Trade Organization. The country also plays an active role in European affairs as a member of the European Union. Overall, Poland is a vibrant and diverse country with a rich history and a promising future. Its strategic location in Central Europe, combined with its strong economy and cultural heritage, make it an important player on the global stage. As Poland continues to develop and grow, it is likely to remain a key player in European politics and economics for many years to come.

title: Eminem attacks Trump in freestyle rap at BET Hip Hop Awards
text: The rapper calls him a "racist 94-year-old grandpa" and slammed fans who back the president during a four-and-half minute freestyle. "Any fan of mine who's a supporter of his, I'm drawing in the sand a line, you're either for or against", Eminem rapped in a blistering attack on President Trump at the BET Hip Hop Awards. The performance, which was pre-recorded and aired on October 10th, took aim at several of Trump's policies and behaviors, including his response to the violence in Charlottesville, his attacks on NFL players who kneel during the national anthem, and his immigration policies. Eminem, whose real name is Marshall Mathers, has never been one to shy away from political commentary in his music. In the past, he has criticized both Democratic and Republican politicians, but his latest freestyle marks one of his most direct attacks on a sitting president. The reaction from fans and commentators has been mixed, with some praising Eminem for speaking out against Trump, while others have accused the rapper of being out of touch and using his platform for political gain. However, one thing is clear - Eminem is not afraid to speak his mind, even if it means alienating some of his fans. In his freestyle, Eminem also took aim at Trump's supporters, calling them out for their blind loyalty to the president. "We better give Obama props, 'cause what we got in office now is a kamikaze that will probably cause a nuclear holocaust", he rapped, referencing the escalating tensions between the US and North Korea. The rapper's performance has sparked a debate about the role of celebrities in politics, with some arguing that artists and musicians should stick to entertaining and stay out of political discussions. However, Eminem made it clear that he feels a responsibility to use his platform to speak out against injustice and hold those in power accountable. Trump has yet to respond to Eminem's freestyle, but given the president's history of using Twitter to lash out at his critics, it's likely that he will have something to say in the coming days. Whether or not Eminem's words will have any impact on Trump or his supporters remains to be seen, but one thing is certain - the rapper is not afraid to use his voice to speak truth to power.

title: Three teenagers arrive in Fiji after Pacific ordeal
text: whatever fish they were able to catch with makeshift fishing hooks. They had been lost at sea for 50 days, their small wooden boat drifting aimlessly in the vast expanse of the Pacific Ocean. The boys had set out on a fishing trip that went terribly wrong when a storm hit unexpectedly, overturning their boat and tossing them into the churning waters. Despite their desperate attempts to right the vessel, the damage was too severe, and they were forced to abandon ship and cling to a small piece of driftwood for dear life. As days turned into weeks, the boys struggled to stay alive, battling hunger, thirst, and exhaustion. At times, they were tempted to give up, but the thought of their families waiting for them back home in Tokelau kept them going. They knew they had to survive, no matter what. Finally, after what seemed like an eternity, they spotted land on the horizon. Exhausted but filled with hope, they paddled towards the shore, eventually making landfall on a remote beach in Fiji. The boys were discovered by local villagers who were shocked to see three emaciated teenagers emerging from the sea. The villagers quickly took the boys in, providing them with food, water, and medical attention. News of their incredible survival spread rapidly, captivating people around the world who followed their miraculous journey with bated breath. When the New Zealand authorities were informed of their discovery, they were overjoyed to hear that the boys were alive and well. A rescue mission was launched immediately, and within hours, the boys were reunited with their families, who were overcome with emotion at the sight of their long-lost sons. The boys' incredible tale of survival captured the hearts of people everywhere, inspiring countless others with their resilience and determination in the face of unimaginable odds. They became instant celebrities, hailed as heroes for their bravery and strength in the face of adversity. As they settled back into their normal lives in Tokelau, the boys reflected on their harrowing ordeal and the lessons they had learned. They vowed never to take anything for granted again, cherishing every moment with their loved ones and never forgetting the incredible bond that had sustained them through their darkest hours. Their remarkable story will be remembered for generations to come, a testament to the power of the human spirit and the unbreakable will to survive against all odds. The boys, once lost at sea, had found their way back home, forever changed by their extraordinary journey of courage and hope.

title: Climate change to drive 'massive' investment shift
text: Larry Fink, who runs BlackRock, said the shift will happen "sooner than most anticipate". His company has announced "sustainable" versions of its popular investment products, in response to the growing demand for environmentally friendly options. Fink believes that climate change will be a driving force behind a massive investment shift, as more investors seek to align their portfolios with their values and contribute to a more sustainable future. The urgency of addressing climate change has become increasingly clear in recent years, with record-breaking temperatures, wildfires, and extreme weather events becoming more frequent and severe. Scientists warn that without immediate action to curb greenhouse gas emissions and transition to a low-carbon economy, the consequences of climate change will only intensify. Investors are beginning to recognize the financial risks associated with climate change, as companies that fail to adapt to the transition to a greener economy are at risk of losing value or facing regulatory action. Fink's prediction of a massive investment shift towards sustainable and climate-resilient assets reflects this growing awareness among investors. BlackRock's move to offer sustainable investment options is just one example of the increasing focus on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in the investment community. ESG considerations are becoming a key part of investment decision-making, as investors look to incorporate sustainability metrics into their analysis of companies and industries. The shift towards sustainable investing is not just driven by moral and ethical considerations, but also by the economic benefits of investing in companies that are well-positioned to thrive in a low-carbon future. Companies that prioritize sustainability and are able to adapt to the challenges of climate change are likely to outperform their peers in the long term. As Fink predicts, the transition to a more sustainable investment landscape is likely to happen sooner than many anticipate. Investors who are able to recognize the opportunities presented by the shift towards sustainable and climate-resilient assets stand to benefit both financially and environmentally. In conclusion, the growing awareness of the financial risks and opportunities associated with climate change is driving a massive investment shift towards sustainability. BlackRock's decision to offer sustainable investment options is a reflection of this trend, as more investors seek to align their portfolios with their values and contribute to a more sustainable future. The time to act on climate change is now, and investors play a crucial role in driving the transition to a greener economy.

title: Duchess of Cornwall to judge 500 words competition
text: Duchess of Cornwall lent her support to the creative writing competition by agreeing to serve as one of the judges. The 500 words contest, which is open to children aged between 5 and 13, aims to encourage young people to express themselves through storytelling. In the promotional video, Camilla, the Duchess of Cornwall, appeared alongside renowned author, David Walliams, who also serves as a judge for the competition. The animated version of the Duchess was depicted as an encouraging and enthusiastic character, inspiring children to participate in the contest and unleash their imagination. "It was a pleasure to voice my animated self for this wonderful initiative," the Duchess said in a statement. "I believe that storytelling is a powerful tool that can not only entertain but also educate and inspire. I am thrilled to be a part of this project and look forward to reading the entries from young writers all across the country." The Duchess of Cornwall is known for her advocacy for literacy and education, and her involvement in the 500 words competition adds another dimension to her commitment to promoting the importance of reading and writing. By taking on the role of a judge, she will have the opportunity to engage with the creative work of young people and help recognize their talents. The 500 words contest has become a popular annual event, attracting thousands of entries from children across the UK. The competition has also garnered support from various celebrities and public figures who serve as judges, providing inspiration and encouragement to budding writers. Earlier this year, Camilla, the Duchess of Cornwall, launched her own book club called "The Reading Room," showcasing her passion for literature and storytelling. The book club has featured a diverse range of works from classic novels to contemporary fiction, reflecting the Duchess's wide-ranging literary interests. As a judge for the 500 words competition, the Duchess will bring her keen eye for storytelling and her love of reading to the judging panel. She will be looking for creativity, originality, and imagination in the entries, as well as a strong sense of storytelling and character development. The 500 words contest has proven to be a valuable platform for young writers to showcase their talents and gain recognition for their work. With the support of the Duchess of Cornwall and other esteemed judges, the competition continues to inspire the next generation of storytellers and foster a love of writing among children across the UK.

title: Teenagers risk missing out on savings pots
text: initial government contribution of £250 for each child, with additional top-ups available for families on lower incomes. However, recent data from HM Revenue and Customs has revealed that the number of teenagers with a Child Trust Fund who have failed to access their accounts once they turn 18 has risen significantly in recent years. This means that a substantial number of young people are missing out on potentially substantial savings pots that have been accumulating over the years. One of the main reasons for this trend is lack of awareness. Many teenagers simply do not know that they have a Child Trust Fund, or are unsure how to access it once they reach adulthood. This lack of understanding around personal finance is a growing concern, as it could have a significant impact on young people's financial futures. In response to this issue, financial experts are urging parents to talk to their children about the importance of saving and budgeting from a young age. By instilling good financial habits early on, parents can help set their children up for financial success in the future. Encouraging teenagers to access their Child Trust Funds once they reach 18 is a crucial step in this process. Furthermore, there are worries that teenagers who do not access their Child Trust Funds may miss out on important financial lessons. Learning how to manage a savings pot, whether large or small, is an essential skill that can benefit young people throughout their lives. By neglecting to access these funds, teenagers may be missing out on valuable opportunities to learn about budgeting, saving, and investing. In addition, failing to access a Child Trust Fund could mean missing out on potentially significant sums of money. Over the years, the initial government contribution of £250 could have grown to a substantial amount, thanks to interest and any additional contributions. By not accessing their funds, teenagers could be losing out on a valuable financial resource that could help them with future expenses, such as university fees, buying a home, or starting a business. Overall, the increasing number of teenagers who are failing to access their Child Trust Funds is a cause for concern. It highlights the need for greater financial education and awareness among young people, as well as the importance of parents taking an active role in teaching their children about money management. By ensuring that teenagers access their savings pots and learn valuable financial lessons, we can help set them up for a secure and prosperous financial future.

title: Call to extend EU settlement scheme pilot to include family members
text: members of these individuals are not currently included in the pilot scheme. This exclusion has raised concerns among many individuals working in these sectors, as they fear the uncertainty surrounding the status of their family members post-Brexit. Many health and social care workers and university staff have family members who rely on them for support and care, and the lack of clarity on their settlement status is causing significant anxiety and distress. Calls are now being made for the EU Settlement Scheme pilot to be extended to include family members of eligible individuals. This would provide much-needed reassurance and security to those who have made the UK their home and wish to continue living and working here without fear of separation from their loved ones. The exclusion of family members from the pilot scheme is seen as a significant oversight, as the well-being of these individuals is closely linked to the well-being of those employed in critical sectors such as health and education. By extending the scheme to include family members, the UK government would be demonstrating its commitment to supporting these individuals and recognizing the invaluable contributions they make to the country. One health and social care worker, who preferred to remain anonymous, expressed their concerns about the current situation. They stated, "My family is my rock, and the thought of being separated from them is unbearable. I urge the government to extend the settlement scheme to include family members, so that we can continue to work and contribute to society without the constant worry about our loved ones' future." The EU Settlement Scheme pilot has been welcomed as a positive step towards providing certainty for EU nationals living in the UK. However, the exclusion of family members has cast a shadow of uncertainty over the process. By extending the scheme to include family members, the government would be addressing a key concern and alleviating the anxiety felt by many individuals in critical sectors. In light of these concerns, campaigners are calling for urgent action to be taken to ensure that the settlement scheme is inclusive of all those who have made the UK their home. They argue that the well-being of these individuals and their families should be a top priority as the UK prepares to leave the EU. As the Brexit deadline looms closer, the government faces increasing pressure to address the issue of family members' settlement status. By extending the EU Settlement Scheme pilot to include family members, the government would be taking a positive step towards providing clarity and security for those who have built their lives in the UK.

title: Coronavirus: Climate action cannot be another Covid victim - PM
text: By Justin Rowlatt Chief environment correspondent The prime minister will tell a meeting hosted by UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres that climate action "cannot be another victim of coronavirus". He will urge leaders to "look ahead to how we will rebuild and how we can seize the opportunity to build back better".  The impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on the environment has been complex. On one hand, lockdown measures have led to a significant reduction in carbon emissions and air pollution as industries grind to a halt and people stay at home. This unintended consequence has given us a glimpse of what is possible if we take bold action to address the climate crisis.  However, the economic fallout of the pandemic has also put a strain on renewable energy projects and sustainability initiatives. Budget cuts and shifts in priorities have threatened the progress that has been made in recent years towards a more sustainable future.  The prime minister's call to prioritize climate action in the recovery efforts is timely and crucial. As countries begin the process of rebuilding their economies, it is essential that they do so with a focus on sustainability and resilience. Investing in green technologies, renewable energy, and sustainable infrastructure can not only create jobs and stimulate economic growth but also help to mitigate the impacts of climate change.  The urgency of addressing the climate crisis has not diminished in the face of the pandemic. In fact, the interconnections between public health, environmental degradation, and social inequities have become even more apparent in recent months. The need for a comprehensive and coordinated approach to building a more sustainable and resilient future has never been more pressing.  The prime minister's message to world leaders is a reminder that we cannot afford to lose sight of our long-term goals in the midst of a crisis. Climate action is not a luxury that can be put on hold while we deal with immediate challenges. It is a fundamental component of our collective efforts to build a better, more equitable world for future generations.  As we navigate the uncertainties and disruptions brought about by the Covid-19 pandemic, let us not lose sight of the opportunities it presents to rethink and reshape our societies in a more sustainable and inclusive manner. Let us heed the prime minister's call to ensure that climate action does not become another casualty of this crisis, but rather a central pillar of our recovery and transformation efforts.

title: Rotherham children's services 'transformed'
text: Rotherham Council has been given an overall "good" rating following an Ofsted inspection in November. The service had been judged to be failing following 2014's Jay Report, which exposed widespread child sexual exploitation in the town and severe failings in the response of local authorities. Since then, significant changes have been made to Rotherham's children's services, with a focus on addressing the issues identified in the Jay Report. The council has made improvements in key areas such as leadership, governance, workforce development, and partnership working. One of the key changes that has been implemented is the introduction of a new leadership team that is committed to improving outcomes for children in Rotherham. This team has worked closely with frontline staff to ensure that they have the resources and support they need to deliver high-quality services to children and families. The council has also invested in workforce development, providing training and support to staff to help them better identify and respond to the needs of vulnerable children. This has resulted in improved outcomes for children in areas such as safeguarding, mental health, and education. Partnership working has been another focus for Rotherham Council, with the council collaborating closely with other agencies such as the police, health services, and voluntary sector organizations to ensure that children receive the support they need. Joint working has improved communication between agencies, enabling them to share information more effectively and coordinate their responses to children's needs. Ofsted's inspection in November found that children's services in Rotherham had made significant progress since the previous inspection and were now performing well across a range of areas. The inspection report praised the council for its commitment to improving outcomes for children and its focus on partnership working. Despite the improvements that have been made, the report also highlighted areas for further development, including the need to strengthen oversight of performance management and the need to continue developing a workforce that is skilled and empowered to deliver high-quality services to children and families. Overall, the inspection report was positive about the progress that has been made in transforming children's services in Rotherham. The council and its partners have worked tirelessly to address the failings identified in the Jay Report and have made significant improvements in a relatively short period of time. However, the council recognizes that there is still more work to be done to ensure that all children in Rotherham receive the support and protection they need to thrive. The council is committed to continuing its work to improve outcomes for children and families and will use the findings of the inspection report to drive further improvements in the coming months and years.

title: Ken Skates: Access to EU single market without free movement
text: But Plaid Cymru AM Sian Gwenllian warned the Welsh Government should be "advocating membership of the single market" not just access. She stated that it is vital for Wales to maintain its current level of access to the EU single market in order to protect jobs and economic stability. Gwenllian emphasized the importance of maintaining close ties with our European neighbors to ensure continued growth and prosperity for the Welsh people. On the other hand, Caroline Jones of UKIP expressed a different perspective, stating that UKIP would fight to secure a Brexit deal that prioritizes the interests of the British people above all else. Jones argued that free movement of people must end in order to control immigration and protect jobs for British citizens. She believed that it is essential for the UK to have full control over its borders and laws in order to regain sovereignty and restore national pride. The debate over access to the EU single market without free movement has been a contentious issue since the UK voted to leave the European Union in 2016. The Welsh Government has been working tirelessly to negotiate the best possible Brexit deal for Wales, taking into consideration the impact on jobs, trade, and investment in the region. Economy Minister Ken Skates has been leading the charge in advocating for continued access to the single market, arguing that it is essential for Welsh businesses to be able to trade freely with their European counterparts. Skates has been working closely with the UK government to ensure that the interests of Wales are represented in the Brexit negotiations, emphasizing the need for a comprehensive trade deal that benefits the Welsh economy. Despite the differing opinions within the Welsh Assembly, there is a consensus that maintaining access to the EU single market is crucial for the future prosperity of Wales. The Welsh Government is committed to working with all parties to secure a Brexit deal that protects jobs, strengthens trade relationships, and ensures a bright future for the people of Wales. As negotiations with the EU continue, it is clear that the issue of access to the single market without free movement will remain a hot topic in Welsh politics. The Welsh Government will continue to fight for the best possible deal for Wales, advocating for policies that prioritize the interests of the Welsh people above all else. With strong leadership and a commitment to finding common ground, Wales can navigate the challenges of Brexit and emerge stronger and more resilient than ever before.

title: Children's heart surgery: Edwin Poots to meet Irish minister
text: Edwin Poots was speaking during a debate on the future of children's heart surgery in Belfast. A report has said that while safe, the service at the Royal Belfast Hospital for Sick Children needed to be updated to meet recommended standards. The Health Minister for Northern Ireland acknowledged the need for improvements in the children's heart surgery department, highlighting the importance of ensuring the highest level of care for young patients with congenital heart defects. Poots emphasized the government's commitment to providing top-notch medical services for all residents, especially vulnerable children in need of specialized care. During the debate, concerns were raised about the limited resources and staffing issues in the children's heart surgery unit. Some politicians called for increased funding to enhance facilities and recruit more experts in pediatric cardiology. The pressure was on Poots to address these concerns and deliver on promises to improve the quality of care for children with complex heart conditions. In response to the criticisms, Poots announced plans to meet with the Irish Minister for Health to discuss potential collaboration in the field of pediatric cardiology. The meeting was seen as a step towards fostering greater cooperation between the two countries in providing advanced medical treatment for children with heart problems. The prospect of joint efforts between Northern Ireland and Ireland was welcomed by medical professionals and patient advocacy groups. They believed that sharing expertise and resources could lead to better outcomes for young patients in both jurisdictions. The collaboration was seen as a way to bridge the gap in healthcare services and ensure that no child was left behind due to limitations in one country's healthcare system. Poots expressed optimism about the future of children's heart surgery in Belfast, stating that he was committed to making the necessary changes to elevate the standard of care in the Royal Belfast Hospital for Sick Children. He acknowledged the challenges ahead but remained confident in his ability to drive improvements and address the shortcomings identified in the recent report. As the debate concluded, Poots emphasized the need for a comprehensive approach to reforming the children's heart surgery department. He promised to work closely with all stakeholders, including healthcare professionals, patient advocates, and government officials, to develop a sustainable plan for enhancing pediatric cardiology services in Northern Ireland. With the upcoming meeting with the Irish Minister for Health on the agenda, Poots was determined to explore all avenues for collaboration and innovation in the field of children's heart surgery. The future looked promising for young patients in Belfast as efforts were being made to ensure that they received the best possible care for their heart conditions.

title: Crab and lobster fishermen fear for their livelihoods
text: They argue the traditional 'pot' method of fishing is sustainable and that restrictions are not needed. The Welsh Government said consultation has not yet started, but highly protected areas are essential. Despite these arguments, crab and lobster fishermen in Wales are growing increasingly concerned about the future of their livelihoods. For generations, fishermen along the Welsh coast have relied on the age-old practice of using pots to catch crabs and lobsters. This method, they say, is not only sustainable but also ensures that they can continue to support their families and contribute to the local economy. However, recent proposals to impose restrictions on fishing in certain areas have left many of these fishermen feeling anxious about what lies ahead. John Davies, a crab fisherman from Pembrokeshire, expressed his frustration with the potential restrictions. "We've been fishing in these waters for years, using the same methods that have been passed down from our fathers and grandfathers. It's not right for the government to come in and tell us we can't do what we've always done," he said. The Welsh Government, on the other hand, argues that highly protected areas are necessary to safeguard the marine environment and ensure the long-term sustainability of crab and lobster populations. These areas, if implemented, would prohibit fishing activities in certain zones to allow depleted stocks to recover and protect sensitive habitats. Despite the government's assurances that the proposals are aimed at preserving the marine environment, many fishermen feel that their way of life is being threatened. "Fishing is not just a job for us, it's a way of life," said Rhys Evans, a lobster fisherman from Cardigan Bay. "If we can't fish in the areas we know best, our businesses will suffer and our communities will feel the impact." In response to the concerns raised by fishermen, the Welsh Government has promised to engage in a consultation process before any final decisions are made. However, the uncertainty surrounding the future of their livelihoods has left many in the industry feeling anxious and unsure about what the future holds. As the debate over the future of crab and lobster fishing in Wales continues, both fishermen and the government must work together to find a solution that balances the need for conservation with the preservation of a way of life that has sustained communities for generations. Only time will tell whether a compromise can be reached that satisfies both parties and ensures the long-term viability of the industry.

title: King Charles III: Outcry 'surprises' Prince William actor Oliver Chris
text: BBC Two's King Charles III, which will be shown on Wednesday, imagines events after the death of the Queen. It has ruffled feathers for raising the question of Prince Charles's accession to the throne and the implications of his controversial decisions as king. However, one surprise that has emerged from the production is the reaction of actor Oliver Chris, who plays Prince William in the TV adaptation of the acclaimed play. Chris, known for his role in The Office and numerous other stage and screen appearances, has garnered praise for his portrayal of Prince William, showcasing the Duke of Cambridge's struggles with the pressures of his royal duties and the weight of his father's legacy. However, what has truly surprised viewers and critics alike is Chris's response to the public outcry over the portrayal of the royal family in King Charles III. In a recent interview with BBC News, Chris expressed his astonishment at the controversy surrounding the play, stating, "I think people might be surprised by how sympathetic the portrayal of the royal family is in King Charles III. It's a nuanced look at the challenges they face and the personal sacrifices they make in service to the crown." Chris went on to explain that his approach to playing Prince William was to humanize the character and explore the emotional turmoil that comes with being a member of the royal family. Despite the backlash against King Charles III for its portrayal of the royals, Chris has stood by the production and defended its artistic liberties. He emphasized the importance of exploring alternate realities and challenging preconceived notions about the monarchy, stating, "As actors, our job is to tell stories and provoke thought. King Charles III offers a unique perspective on the royal family and pushes the boundaries of traditional storytelling. I believe that is something to be celebrated, not condemned." Chris's remarks have sparked debate among fans of the royal family, with some praising his commitment to his role and others criticizing his defense of a controversial production. However, one thing is clear: Oliver Chris has proven himself to be a versatile and talented actor, capable of tackling complex and challenging roles with nuance and sensitivity. As King Charles III prepares to make its debut on BBC Two, all eyes will be on Oliver Chris and his portrayal of Prince William. Whether the production will live up to the hype and controversy surrounding it remains to be seen, but one thing is certain: Chris's performance is sure to leave a lasting impression on audiences around the world.

title: Anonymous backs new encrypted social network site
text: central server that stores user data, making it virtually impossible for governments or hackers to access private information. Minds.com has been gaining popularity among users who are concerned about their privacy and want to have more control over their personal data. The decision by Anonymous to back Minds.com comes as no surprise, as the decentralized nature of the social network aligns perfectly with the hacktivist group's ethos of fighting for internet freedom and privacy. Anonymous has a long history of targeting websites and organizations that they believe infringe upon these values, so it is no wonder that they would throw their support behind Minds.com. In a statement released on their official website, Anonymous praised Minds.com for its commitment to protecting user privacy and for providing a platform that focuses on free speech and censorship-resistant communication. The group emphasized the importance of supporting alternative social networks that do not rely on centralized servers controlled by tech giants known for their data mining practices. Minds.com has experienced steady growth over the past few years, attracting a diverse user base that values the platform's emphasis on privacy and security. The social network has also introduced features such as end-to-end encryption and the ability to earn tokens for participating in the community, further distinguishing itself from its competitors. With the backing of Anonymous, Minds.com is likely to see a surge in new users who are drawn to the platform's promise of secure and private communication. This could pose a challenge to established social networks like Facebook and Twitter, which have faced criticism for their handling of user data and privacy concerns in recent years. As more people become aware of the risks associated with sharing personal information online, the demand for alternative social networks that prioritize privacy is only expected to grow. Minds.com's partnership with Anonymous could serve as a catalyst for change in the industry, encouraging other platforms to adopt similar practices and focus on protecting user data from intrusive surveillance. In a world where data breaches and privacy violations are all too common, the rise of decentralized social networks like Minds.com offers a glimmer of hope for users who are looking for a safer and more secure way to connect with others online. With the support of groups like Anonymous, these platforms have the potential to reshape the way we interact on the internet and pave the way for a more private and censorship-resistant digital future.

title: Stamp duty holiday extended to end of June
text: The government announced that the stamp duty holiday, which was initially set to expire at the end of March, has been extended to the end of June. This decision comes as a relief to many homebuyers who were rushing to complete their transactions before the original deadline to take advantage of the tax break. Chancellor Rishi Sunak confirmed that the extension would provide a further boost to the property market, which has been experiencing a surge in activity due to the temporary tax relief. The stamp duty holiday was introduced last year as part of the government's efforts to stimulate the housing market in the wake of the Covid-19 pandemic. The tax break suspends the payment of stamp duty on the first £500,000 of all property sales in England and Northern Ireland. This has resulted in significant savings for many buyers, with the average homeowner saving around £4,500 on their purchase. The extension of the holiday will give buyers more time to take advantage of these savings and help to keep the property market buoyant in the coming months. The government has also announced that there will be a tapered transition period after the end of June, during which the threshold for stamp duty will be gradually reduced. From July to September, the threshold will be set at £250,000 before returning to its normal level of £125,000 in October. This phased approach is designed to prevent a sudden drop-off in activity once the tax break ends. Industry experts have welcomed the extension of the stamp duty holiday, noting that it will provide a much-needed boost to the housing market during a challenging period. The property market has been a bright spot in the economy during the pandemic, with record levels of activity reported in recent months. The government's decision to extend the tax break will help to sustain this momentum and support the recovery of the sector. However, some critics have raised concerns about the potential cliff-edge effect that could occur when the holiday finally comes to an end. They argue that the phased transition period may not be sufficient to prevent a sudden drop in activity, which could have negative consequences for the housing market. It remains to be seen how the market will react once the stamp duty holiday is fully phased out, but for now, buyers can breathe a sigh of relief knowing that they have a few more months to take advantage of the tax break.

title: Supreme Court: Trump to name nominee on 9 July
text: retirement last month. Justice Kennedy was often seen as a swing vote on the Supreme Court, making his replacement a crucial decision that could potentially shift the ideological balance of the court for years to come. President Trump has made it clear that he intends to nominate a conservative judge to fill the vacancy left by Justice Kennedy, a move that has sparked both excitement and concern among lawmakers and the American public. With the nomination process set to begin on July 9th, the stakes are high as the president's choice could have a lasting impact on a variety of important issues, including abortion rights, gun control, and same-sex marriage. While President Trump has not revealed the names of the individuals on his shortlist, speculation has been rife about who might be chosen to fill the crucial seat on the nation's highest court. Many believe that Amy Coney Barrett, a federal appeals court judge, is a top contender due to her conservative credentials and strong track record on the bench. Others have pointed to Mike Lee, a senator from Utah, as a potential nominee given his close ties to the president and his conservative views. Whoever is ultimately chosen to fill the vacancy on the Supreme Court will undoubtedly face a tough confirmation battle in the Senate, where Republicans hold a narrow majority. Democrats have already expressed their concerns about the president's potential nominee, with many vowing to do everything in their power to oppose a candidate who they believe could roll back important legal protections and rights. President Trump, for his part, has promised to choose a nominee who is dedicated to upholding the Constitution and protecting the rights of all Americans. In a recent tweet, he stated, "I believe any of the final four would be excellent justices. They are really incredible people in so many different ways, academically and in every other way. I'm very close to making a decision." The president's choice will undoubtedly shape the direction of the Supreme Court for years to come, highlighting the importance of the upcoming nomination process. As the nation waits with bated breath for President Trump to announce his pick on July 9th, the spotlight will be firmly on the potential nominees and their qualifications to serve on the highest court in the land. With the balance of the court hanging in the balance, the stakes could not be higher as the president prepares to make one of the most significant decisions of his presidency.

title: Southeastern customers face worsening services
text: Tom EdwardsTransport correspondent, London @BBCTomEdwards on Twitter If you thought your commute was bad now, it will get worse for the next five years. That's the message hidden away in an official Network Rail document that paints a bleak picture for Southeastern customers. According to the report, Southeastern customers can expect worsening services due to a combination of factors, including aging infrastructure, increasing demand, and ongoing maintenance works. Passengers may face more delays, cancellations, and overcrowding as the network struggles to keep up with the growing number of passengers. One of the main concerns highlighted in the document is the state of the tracks and signals on the Southeastern network. Many of them are reaching the end of their operational lives and are in need of urgent replacement. This poses a significant risk to the reliability and safety of the services, as any failure in the infrastructure could lead to severe disruptions and potential safety hazards. Additionally, the report also points out the challenges posed by the increasing demand for rail services in the region. As more people choose to travel by train, there is added pressure on the already strained network, leading to more delays and overcrowding. Without significant investment in new trains and infrastructure, Southeastern customers can expect a deteriorating service in the coming years. To make matters worse, ongoing maintenance works are set to disrupt services even further. Network Rail has outlined a series of upgrade projects that will take place over the next five years, leading to more disruptions and diversions for passengers. This will not only inconvenience customers but also put additional strain on the already overstretched network. In response to the report, Southeastern has acknowledged the challenges ahead and pledged to work closely with Network Rail to minimize disruptions and improve services for customers. They have also highlighted their commitment to investing in new trains and infrastructure to address the growing demand and ensure a more reliable service in the future. Despite these reassurances, many Southeastern customers are understandably concerned about the prospect of worsening services in the years to come. With delays and cancellations already a common occurrence, the prospect of more disruptions and overcrowding is unwelcome news for passengers who rely on the rail network for their daily commute. As Southeastern customers brace themselves for the challenges ahead, it is clear that urgent action is needed to address the issues highlighted in the report and ensure a more reliable and efficient rail service for the region. Without significant investment and a coordinated effort between all stakeholders, the outlook for Southeastern customers looks increasingly grim.

title: RHI inquiry: Call for review of special adviser role
text: By Jayne McCormackBBC News NI Political Reporter David Sterling's witness statements to the Renewable Heat Incentive (RHI) inquiry were published on Wednesday. He is due to give evidence again on Thursday. In his statements, Mr. Sterling, who is the head of the Northern Ireland Civil Service, discussed the role of special advisers in the RHI scheme. Special advisers, known as Spads, are political appointees who work closely with ministers to provide political advice and support. Mr. Sterling acknowledged that special advisers played a key role in the development and implementation of the RHI scheme. However, he also noted that their involvement raised questions about their accountability and potential conflicts of interest. This has led to calls for a review of the special adviser role in Northern Ireland. Some have argued that Spads should be subject to greater scrutiny and oversight to prevent situations like the RHI scandal from happening again. The RHI inquiry, led by Sir Patrick Coghlin, has been investigating the botched green energy scheme that led to a massive overspend of public money. The inquiry has heard evidence from a range of witnesses, including former ministers and civil servants. Mr. Sterling's statements shed light on the inner workings of the civil service during the RHI scandal. He described a "culture of not challenging" within the civil service, suggesting that there was a lack of rigorous scrutiny of key decisions. The role of special advisers has been a focal point of the inquiry, with many questioning their influence over government policy. Some have raised concerns about the blurred lines between political decisions and civil service advice. As the inquiry continues, there is growing pressure on the Northern Ireland Executive to address the issues raised by Mr. Sterling and others. Calls for transparency and accountability in government decision-making have intensified in the wake of the RHI scandal. The role of special advisers will likely be a key focus of any future reforms to prevent similar scandals from occurring. The need for greater scrutiny and oversight of political appointees is clear, and the public is demanding answers about how such a costly mistake was allowed to happen. Mr. Sterling's evidence has raised important questions about the role of special advisers in government, and it is clear that changes need to be made to ensure accountability and transparency in future decision-making processes. The RHI scandal has exposed serious failings in the system, and it is crucial that lessons are learned to prevent such mistakes from happening again.

title: Video 'shows hunt law breached'
text: filmed by investigators from the League Against Cruel Sports, who claim to have captured footage showing dogs hunting a fox during a trail hunt. The hunt masters deny any wrongdoing, stating that they always follow the rules and have strict practices in place to ensure that they remain within the confines of the law. However, this is not the first time that the Jedforest Hunt has come under scrutiny for potentially breaching hunting laws. In 2018, a member of the hunt was found guilty of illegal fox hunting after evidence was presented showing hounds chasing a fox before it was killed. Despite this conviction, the hunt has continued to operate under the guise of trail hunting, which allows for the use of dogs to follow a scent trail laid down in advance. The League Against Cruel Sports and other animal welfare groups argue that trail hunting is often used as a cover for illegal hunting, with hunters allegedly using loopholes to continue traditional fox hunting practices. They are calling for stricter enforcement of the hunting ban and more oversight to ensure that hunts are not exploiting these loopholes to continue hunting with dogs. In response to the recent allegations, the Scottish government has stated that they are taking the matter seriously and are looking into the footage provided by the League Against Cruel Sports. A spokesperson for the government emphasized the importance of upholding the ban on fox hunting and ensuring that hunts are not circumventing the law. The debate over hunting with dogs continues to be a contentious issue in Scotland, with strong opinions on both sides of the argument. Hunt supporters argue that hunting is a traditional countryside pursuit that plays an important role in wildlife management, while opponents view it as a cruel and unnecessary practice that should be banned outright. As the investigation into the Jedforest Hunt unfolds, both sides will be closely watching the outcome. For the League Against Cruel Sports and other animal welfare groups, the hope is that the recent footage will lead to stricter enforcement of hunting laws and better protection for Scotland's wildlife. Hunt supporters, on the other hand, will be hoping that the allegations are proven false and that they can continue to enjoy their sport without interference. The battle over hunting with dogs looks set to continue, with no easy resolution in sight.

title: Coronavirus: Welsh arts organisations 'losing £1.4m a week'
text: Nick Capaldi warned the Wales Millennium Centre in Cardiff could lose £20m over the current financial year. He told a BBC reporter that the devastating impact of the coronavirus pandemic on Welsh arts organisations is unprecedented and could potentially have long-lasting effects. Capaldi, who is the Chief Executive of the Arts Council of Wales, highlighted that the closure of venues and cancellation of events due to the lockdown has put many arts organisations in a precarious financial situation. He mentioned that the sector is currently losing £1.4m a week, with the Wales Millennium Centre alone facing a significant financial shortfall. The Wales Millennium Centre, known for hosting a wide range of cultural events and performances, has been forced to cancel or postpone numerous shows due to the pandemic. This has not only resulted in financial losses but has also deprived audiences of the opportunity to experience the arts. Capaldi emphasized the importance of arts and culture to the economy and well-being of Wales, stressing that the sector contributes significantly to tourism and local communities. He expressed concerns about the long-term viability of many arts organisations if they are unable to generate income or secure financial support during these challenging times. Despite the hardships faced by the arts sector in Wales, Capaldi praised the resilience and creativity of arts organisations in adapting to the new normal. Many have pivoted to online platforms and virtual events to engage with audiences and generate some revenue during the lockdown. However, the Chief Executive acknowledged that digital solutions can only provide a temporary lifeline and cannot fully replace the live experience of attending a performance or exhibition in person. He called for continued support from the government and funders to ensure the survival of the arts sector in Wales. Capaldi expressed hope that the arts community in Wales will emerge stronger from the current crisis and continue to thrive in the future. He encouraged audiences to support their local arts organisations by donating, attending virtual events, or purchasing memberships to help sustain the sector during these challenging times. Overall, the impact of the coronavirus pandemic on Welsh arts organisations is profound, with significant financial losses and uncertain futures. The resilience and innovation of the arts community will be crucial in navigating through these unprecedented challenges and ensuring the continued vibrancy of the cultural sector in Wales.

title: Theresa May 'not considering election' on walking break, says No 10
text: But - stand down everyone - Number 10 has insisted the prime minister is not considering calling a general election. Mrs May famously decided to take a walking holiday in the Swiss Alps, sparking speculation that she might be preparing to make a surprise announcement upon her return. However, sources close to the prime minister have stated that there is no truth to these rumors and that Mrs. May is simply taking some much-needed time to rest and recharge. Despite facing increased pressure from opposition parties and members of her own party to call an early election, Mrs. May appears to be focused on her current role as prime minister and has no plans to seek a fresh mandate from the British public. The decision to go on a walking break was likely a strategic move to distance herself from the ongoing Brexit negotiations and domestic political turmoil, allowing her to clear her head and regain her focus. Since taking office in the aftermath of the Brexit referendum in 2016, Mrs. May has faced numerous challenges and setbacks, from the resignation of key cabinet ministers to multiple failed attempts to secure a Brexit deal with the European Union. Despite these obstacles, she has managed to cling on to power and maintain some level of stability within her government. However, with the deadline for Brexit looming and a potential vote of no confidence looming, Mrs. May's position remains precarious. Critics argue that she has mishandled the Brexit negotiations and that her government lacks a clear vision for the future of the country. Proponents, on the other hand, believe that she is the best person to lead Britain through the current uncertainty and that a change in leadership would only create further instability. As the political landscape continues to shift and evolve, Mrs. May must carefully navigate the challenges ahead and make difficult decisions that will shape the future of the country. Whether she will ultimately decide to call a general election remains to be seen, but for now, it appears that she is content to focus on her current responsibilities and work towards finding a solution to the Brexit impasse. In the meantime, the prime minister will continue to enjoy her walking break in the Swiss Alps, taking in the fresh mountain air and stunning scenery. And who can blame her? After all, even world leaders need a break from time to time.

title: Endangered species: Gunshot detection technology deployed
text: protected areas can now detect gunshots and alert authorities to potential poaching activities in real-time. This groundbreaking technology is providing a new tool in the fight against the illegal wildlife trade, which threatens the survival of many endangered species. The acoustic sensors are able to distinguish between the sounds of gunshots and other noises, such as thunder or vehicles passing by. Once a gunshot is detected, the system sends an alert to park rangers or law enforcement officers, allowing them to respond quickly and investigate the source of the noise. This rapid response is crucial in catching poachers in the act and protecting vulnerable wildlife from harm. Poaching remains a major threat to endangered species around the world, driven by the demand for exotic animal products and trophies. The illegal wildlife trade is a multi-billion dollar industry, and poachers often operate in remote areas where enforcement is limited. By deploying gunshot detection technology, conservationists hope to turn the tide against these criminal activities and protect some of the world's most vulnerable animals. The collaboration between ZSL and Google Cloud has been hailed as a game-changer in conservation efforts. By using advanced technology to monitor and protect wildlife, researchers are able to gather valuable data on poaching patterns and hotspots. This information can then be used to develop strategies for more effective law enforcement and anti-poaching measures. In addition to detecting gunshots, the acoustic sensors can also capture other sounds in the environment, providing valuable insights into the behavior of wildlife. Researchers can analyze the data collected by the sensors to better understand the movements and habits of endangered species, helping to inform conservation efforts and ensure their survival in the wild. The deployment of gunshot detection technology in nature reserves and protected areas represents a significant step forward in the fight against poaching. By combining cutting-edge technology with on-the-ground conservation efforts, organizations like ZSL and Google Cloud are making a tangible impact on the preservation of endangered species. With continued innovation and collaboration, there is hope that we can protect these animals for future generations to enjoy.

title: Carrie Fisher given 'amazing' send-off in Star Wars: The Last Jedi
text: The London-born actor said he shares "many scenes" with the late actress in Star Wars: The Last Jedi and that the sci-fi franchise "keeps her spirit alive." Fisher, who passed away in December 2016, was given an amazing send-off in the latest installment of the Star Wars saga. Carrie Fisher, known for her iconic role as Princess Leia, was beloved by fans all over the world. Her portrayal of the strong and fearless leader of the Rebel Alliance captured the hearts of millions. Fisher's untimely death left a void in the Star Wars universe, but director Rian Johnson made sure to give her character a fitting farewell in The Last Jedi. The film does justice to Fisher's legacy by showcasing her talent and charisma in every scene she appears in. The chemistry between Fisher and her co-stars, including the London-born actor, is palpable on screen. Their interactions are filled with emotion and depth, bringing a sense of closure to her character's journey. Fisher's presence in The Last Jedi is a testament to her enduring impact on the Star Wars franchise and its fans. Her character's strength and resilience is a reflection of Fisher's own spirit, and her legacy will continue to inspire future generations of Star Wars fans. The London-born actor, who plays a key role in the film, praised Fisher's performance and expressed gratitude for the opportunity to work alongside her. He spoke about the emotional experience of filming scenes with Fisher and the honor of carrying on her legacy in the Star Wars universe. The Last Jedi is a fitting tribute to Fisher's contribution to the Star Wars saga, and fans have praised the film for its respectful handling of her character. Fisher's presence is felt throughout the movie, and her impact on the story is undeniable. As fans around the world gather to watch The Last Jedi, they are reminded of the incredible talent and spirit of Carrie Fisher. Her performance in the film is a poignant reminder of her lasting legacy in the Star Wars universe. In a galaxy far, far away, Carrie Fisher's Princess Leia will forever be remembered as a symbol of hope, courage, and resilience. The Last Jedi honors Fisher's memory in a truly amazing way, ensuring that her spirit will continue to live on in the hearts of fans for years to come.

title: Coronavirus: Paris restrictions to stay as France reopens
text: 'Edouard Philippe said the country was "cut in two" in terms of the rate of infections. Restrictions will remain in the capital and north-eastern regions. It comes as France prepares to relax its lockdown on Monday, with shops and some schools reopening.
