The decision to maintain restrictions in Paris and the north-eastern regions, including areas around Lille and Strasbourg, was made based on the latest data showing a higher concentration of coronavirus cases in these areas. The government is aiming to prevent a potential resurgence of the virus in these hotspots as the country gradually eases restrictions. The announcement has been met with mixed reactions, with some residents expressing frustration over the continued restrictions while others understand the need to prioritize public health. Parisians, in particular, have voiced concerns about the economic impact of extended closures on businesses and the livelihoods of workers in these regions. Despite the ongoing restrictions, the French government is optimistic about the overall progress in containing the virus. The number of new cases has been steadily declining, and the healthcare system has been able to manage the influx of patients. However, officials are wary of a potential second wave of infections and are urging the public to continue practicing social distancing and hygiene measures. As France prepares for the gradual reopening of the country, officials are emphasizing the importance of being vigilant and responsible. The relaxation of lockdown measures does not signal the end of the pandemic, and individuals must continue to follow guidelines to prevent a resurgence of the virus. In addition to the reopening of shops and schools, the French government is also considering allowing larger gatherings and events in the coming weeks. However, strict measures will be in place to ensure the safety of participants and prevent the spread of the virus. The decisions made by the French government reflect a balancing act between reviving the economy and safeguarding public health. As the country navigates through these challenging times, it is crucial for individuals to remain proactive and united in the fight against the coronavirus. While restrictions in Paris and the north-eastern regions may present challenges, they are necessary steps to contain the virus and protect the population. The road to recovery will be long and challenging, but with collective effort and cooperation, France can overcome the impact of the pandemic and emerge stronger than before.' End of text. title: RBS chief hopes to make Ulster Bank decision by end of summer
text: By John Campbell BBC News NI Economics & Business Editor Ross McEwen said "all options" were still being considered for what has been the worst performing part of the RBS empire in recent years. Ulster Bank has been a thorn in the side of the banking group, consistently underperforming and struggling to compete in the Irish market. Speculation has been rife since last year that RBS could sell off Ulster Bank or merge it with another institution in order to cut costs and turn around its fortunes. Ross McEwen has been under pressure to make a decision on the future of Ulster Bank, with shareholders and investors eager to see a resolution to the long-standing issue. Speaking to reporters at a recent press conference, McEwen stated that he hoped to make a final decision on Ulster Bank by the end of the summer. He emphasized that all options were still on the table, including a potential sale or merger. However, he also acknowledged the importance of finding a solution that would be in the best interests of Ulster Bank's customers and employees. The uncertainty surrounding the future of Ulster Bank has caused concern among staff and customers, many of whom are worried about the potential impact of any changes. McEwen reassured stakeholders that he was committed to ensuring a smooth transition and minimizing any negative effects on employees or customers. Ulster Bank has a long and storied history in Ireland, dating back to the early 19th century. It has a strong presence in both Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland, serving millions of customers across the island. However, in recent years, the bank has struggled to compete with larger competitors and has faced mounting financial challenges. Despite its difficulties, Ulster Bank still holds a significant market share in Ireland and has a loyal customer base. Many are hoping that Ross McEwen's decision will provide a much-needed boost to the bank and help secure its future in the long term. As the summer progresses, all eyes will be on RBS and Ross McEwen as they work to finalize a decision on the future of Ulster Bank. The stakes are high, and the outcome could have far-reaching implications for both the bank and the wider banking industry in Ireland. Stay tuned for further updates as we await the final decision from Ross McEwen on the fate of Ulster Bank. The next few months will be critical for all involved, and the implications of the decision are sure to reverberate throughout the banking sector.

title: Can Clegg's European strategy revive Lib Dem fortunes?
text: By Chris Mason Political correspondent, BBC News But Mr Clegg need not worry. It's one of several portraits hanging on the wall and depicts Alderman James N. Paxman, a prominent figure of the Liberal Democrats in years gone by. As the current leader of the party, Nick Clegg faces a challenging task in reviving the fortunes of the Liberal Democrats, especially in the wake of their disappointing performance in recent elections. Clegg's European strategy could play a crucial role in reshaping the party's image and appealing to a wider voter base. With Brexit dominating the political landscape, the Liberal Democrats have positioned themselves as the party of Remain, seeking to capitalize on pro-EU sentiment among many voters. By championing the cause of EU membership and advocating for a second referendum, Clegg hopes to attract disaffected Labour and Conservative voters who feel marginalized by the government's handling of Brexit. The European strategy also allows Clegg to differentiate the Liberal Democrats from other parties and establish a clear identity for the party. While Labour and the Conservatives remain divided over their Brexit positions, the Liberal Democrats present a united front in their support for EU membership. This clarity of message could resonate with voters looking for a strong, principled stance on the most pressing issue of the day. Moreover, Clegg's European strategy provides an opportunity to showcase the party's policy platform and vision for the future. By outlining a comprehensive plan for closer cooperation with Europe and highlighting the benefits of EU membership, Clegg can demonstrate the Liberal Democrats' commitment to promoting internationalism, human rights, and economic prosperity. This proactive approach to policy development could help the party appeal to voters who are dissatisfied with the status quo and seeking a fresh alternative to the traditional political parties. Of course, the success of Clegg's European strategy will depend on a variety of factors, including the outcome of the Brexit negotiations, the response of the public to the party's message, and the effectiveness of the party's campaign efforts. However, by focusing on a clear, coherent message and positioning the Liberal Democrats as the party of pro-EU values, Clegg has the opportunity to reinvigorate the party's fortunes and attract new supporters in the years ahead. As the portrait of Alderman James N. Paxman looks down from the wall, Clegg can take inspiration from the party's history and build upon its legacy to create a bright future for the Liberal Democrats. With a strong European strategy and a compelling vision for the future, Clegg has the potential to revive the party's fortunes and establish the Liberal Democrats as a prominent force in British politics once again.

title: Pakistan Taliban chief Mullah Fazlullah targeted by US strike in Afghanistan
text: Fazlullah's reign of terror in Pakistan has been marked by countless atrocities, including the heinous attack on Malala Yousafzai, who bravely defied his oppressive regime by advocating for girls' education. The 2012 incident shocked the world and underscored the brutal lengths to which the Pakistan Taliban chief was willing to go in order to maintain control. In 2014, Fazlullah's callous nature was on full display once again when he orchestrated the massacre in Peshawar that claimed the lives of over 130 innocent schoolchildren. The attack sent shockwaves through the country and galvanized international outrage against the Taliban's disregard for human life. Despite being responsible for such reprehensible acts, Fazlullah has managed to evade capture and continue to sow chaos and fear in the region. His ability to evade justice has only emboldened him, allowing him to continue to perpetrate violence against those who dare to challenge his authority. But the tide may be turning for Fazlullah, as reports emerge of a US strike targeting him in Afghanistan. If confirmed, this could signal a turning point in the fight against the Pakistan Taliban chief and bring some measure of justice to those who have suffered at his hands. The US strike, which was carried out in Kunar province near the border with Pakistan, is said to have targeted a compound where Fazlullah was believed to be hiding. While the outcome of the strike remains unclear, it is a clear sign that the international community is not willing to sit idly by while Fazlullah continues to spread terror and violence. In recent years, the US has intensified its efforts to target high-profile militants in the region, including several drone strikes targeting top Taliban leaders. This latest strike on Fazlullah underscores the commitment of the US and its allies to rooting out terrorists who pose a threat to stability and security in the region. While Fazlullah's fate remains uncertain, the strike sends a powerful message to other militant groups operating in the region that their actions will not go unpunished. It is a reminder that those who choose the path of violence and terror will ultimately face the consequences of their actions. As the world awaits further details on the outcome of the strike, one thing is clear: the targeting of Fazlullah is a significant blow to the Pakistan Taliban and a step towards justice for the countless victims of his brutal reign of terror.

title: New Aberdeen FC stadium could be derailed even if approved
text: By Rebecca CurranBBC Scotland reporter The stadium and training facilities would be at Kingsford, near Westhill. Although the final decision is a matter for Aberdeen councillors, Aberdeenshire Council will have to agree to the proposed development, as it falls within its jurisdiction.  The plans for the new Aberdeen FC stadium have faced opposition from local residents and environmental groups, who are concerned about the impact on the surrounding area. Critics argue that the development could lead to increased traffic congestion, noise pollution, and damage to the local environment. Despite these concerns, Aberdeen FC has touted the benefits of the new stadium, claiming that it will provide a much-needed economic boost to the area. The club argues that the development will create jobs, attract investment, and revitalize the local community. If the plans are approved, construction of the new stadium could begin as early as next year. However, even if the project receives the green light from both Aberdeen and Aberdeenshire councils, there are still potential obstacles that could derail the development. One major hurdle that could stand in the way of the new Aberdeen FC stadium is financing. The project is estimated to cost around £50 million, and the club will need to secure funding from private investors and potentially public sources to make the development a reality. With the economic uncertainty brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic, finding funding for such a large-scale project may prove challenging. In addition to financial concerns, there are also potential legal obstacles that could delay or derail the new stadium. Environmental groups have threatened legal action if the plans go ahead, citing concerns about the impact on the local wildlife and ecosystem. Any legal challenges could tie up the project in court for months or even years, putting the future of the new stadium in jeopardy. Despite these potential roadblocks, Aberdeen FC remains optimistic about the prospects for the new stadium. The club is committed to working with local residents, stakeholders, and government officials to address concerns and overcome obstacles to the development. As the fate of the new Aberdeen FC stadium hangs in the balance, all eyes will be on Aberdeen and Aberdeenshire councils as they consider the merits of the proposed development. Only time will tell whether the project moves forward or if it ultimately gets derailed by the challenges ahead.

title: Birstall house explosion 'caused by broken pipework'
text: The blast destroyed Janet Jasper's home in Birstall, Leicestershire, and the neighbouring house on 11 December 2017. The house with the gas pipework that caused the explosion was left in shambles, with debris scattered across the neighborhood. Ms. Jasper, who was luckily not at home at the time of the explosion, described the incident as a "terrifying experience" that she would never forget. She recounted how she received a call from a concerned neighbor informing her about the explosion and rushed back home to find her house reduced to rubble. The investigation into the cause of the explosion revealed that a broken gas pipework in Ms. Jasper's house was to blame. The fault in the pipework led to a gas leak that accumulated over time until it reached a critical point and sparked the explosion. This revelation left Ms. Jasper shocked and devastated, as she never suspected that something as seemingly minor as a broken pipework could lead to such devastating consequences. In the aftermath of the explosion, the local community rallied around Ms. Jasper and her neighbors, offering support and assistance in any way they could. The Red Cross provided temporary shelter for those who were displaced by the blast, while local businesses and organizations donated food, clothing, and other essentials to help the affected families rebuild their lives. The incident also prompted a closer inspection of gas pipeworks in the area, with authorities urging residents to have their systems checked regularly to prevent similar accidents in the future. The importance of proper maintenance and timely repairs was stressed, as the consequences of neglecting such crucial safety measures could be catastrophic. As Ms. Jasper slowly picked up the pieces of her shattered life, she found solace in the kindness and generosity of her community. The support she received in the wake of the explosion renewed her faith in humanity and helped her to cope with the trauma of losing her home. The Birstall house explosion caused by broken pipework serves as a stark reminder of the importance of gas safety and the potential dangers that lurk within our homes. It is a cautionary tale that urges us to remain vigilant and proactive in maintaining our gas systems to prevent tragedies like this from happening again.

title: Canada's immigration website crashes during US vote
text: Officials have confirmed that the cause was a higher than normal level of traffic. It has been suggested this may have been caused by US citizens exploring their options following Donald Trump's victory. The tycoon confounded polls predicting he would lose the US presidential election to his Democratic rival, Hillary Clinton. The surge in traffic to Canada's immigration website was unprecedented, overwhelming the system and causing it to crash. This speaks to the deep concern and fear that many Americans have about the implications of a Trump presidency. His controversial policies and rhetoric on issues such as immigration, trade, and foreign relations have led to increased interest in seeking refuge in Canada. Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, known for his progressive stance on immigration and his welcoming attitude towards refugees, has not commented directly on the spike in traffic to the immigration website. However, his government has reiterated its commitment to diversity, inclusivity, and welcoming newcomers to Canada. Trudeau has emphasized the importance of maintaining strong relationships with the US despite political differences, and he has stated that Canada will continue to work closely with the incoming Trump administration on various issues of mutual interest. For many Americans, the idea of moving to Canada may seem like a tempting escape from the uncertainties of a Trump presidency. Canada is known for its high quality of life, strong social safety net, universal healthcare, and overall stability. It has also been praised for its progressive values, multiculturalism, and respect for human rights. These factors may explain why so many Americans are considering Canada as a potential destination in the wake of the US election results. However, it is important to note that immigrating to Canada is not as simple as just filling out an online form. The Canadian immigration process can be lengthy, complex, and competitive. There are stringent criteria for eligibility, such as language proficiency, educational qualifications, work experience, and financial resources. Additionally, Canada prioritizes certain categories of immigrants, such as skilled workers, entrepreneurs, and family members of Canadian citizens or permanent residents. Despite the challenges of immigrating to Canada, the spike in traffic to the immigration website underscores the deep concerns and anxieties that many Americans are feeling in the aftermath of the US election. Whether this interest in moving to Canada will translate into actual immigration remains to be seen, but it is clear that Trump's victory has had ripple effects beyond US borders.

title: Grave of 'George III's granddaughter' restored in Carmarthen
text: Experts say Caroline Prytherch and her sister were related to the former king due to his links with Hannah Lightfoot during his time as Prince. George III's granddaughter's grave has recently been restored in Carmarthen, Wales, shedding new light on the royal connections of this little-known family. Caroline Prytherch, a descendant of George III through his illegitimate daughter, spent much of her life in Carmarthen, where she was a well-respected member of the community. Her grave, which had fallen into disrepair over the years, was recently restored by a local preservation group, bringing attention to her royal lineage and fascinating life story. Caroline Prytherch was born in the early 19th century, and despite her royal connections, she chose to live a quiet life in Carmarthen. She was known for her philanthropy and dedication to the local community, and her grave serves as a reminder of her impact on the town. The restoration of Caroline Prytherch's grave has sparked renewed interest in the royal connections of the Prytherch family. Historians are now delving into the archives to uncover more about Caroline's lineage and her link to George III. One theory suggests that Caroline Prytherch's ancestor, Mary Anne Clarke, was the illegitimate daughter of George III and his mistress, Hannah Lightfoot. This scandalous affair was a well-kept secret at the time, but recent research has shed new light on the relationship between the future king and his mistress. Caroline Prytherch's story is a fascinating glimpse into the hidden history of the British monarchy. Her quiet life in Carmarthen stands in stark contrast to the scandal and drama that surrounded her ancestors, but her royal connections are undeniable. The restoration of Caroline Prytherch's grave is not only a tribute to her memory but also a reminder of the enduring fascination with the British royal family. People from all walks of life have been drawn to her story, and the renewed interest in her life has sparked a wave of curiosity about the connections between the Prytherch family and the royal household. As visitors flock to see the restored grave of George III's granddaughter in Carmarthen, historians continue to piece together the puzzle of Caroline Prytherch's royal lineage. Her story is a reminder of the hidden histories that lie beneath the surface of even the most ordinary lives, and a testament to the enduring allure of the British monarchy.

title: Solar subsidy 'to be protected'
text: year by generating electricity through solar panels and feeding it back into the grid. However, recent government proposals have raised concerns that the solar subsidy may be reduced or even abolished, putting the future of the scheme in jeopardy. Under the feed-in tariff scheme, households and businesses are paid for the renewable electricity they generate through solar panels. This not only helps the environment by reducing carbon emissions but also provides a steady source of income for those who invest in solar energy. The scheme has been successful in encouraging more people to switch to renewable energy sources and has contributed to the UK's commitment to reducing its carbon footprint. The government's proposal to cut the solar subsidy has been met with widespread criticism from environmental groups, industry stakeholders, and the public. Many argue that reducing or removing the subsidy would disincentivize people from investing in solar energy and hinder progress towards a more sustainable future. Without the subsidy, the financial benefits of generating clean energy would be greatly diminished, making it less attractive for households and businesses to adopt solar technology. In response to the concerns raised, the government has stated that it is committed to protecting the feed-in tariff scheme and ensuring that it continues to support renewable energy generation. A spokesperson for the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy said, "We recognize the importance of the feed-in tariff scheme in promoting renewable energy and reducing carbon emissions. We are currently reviewing the scheme to ensure that it remains viable and effective in achieving our environmental goals." Despite the reassurances from the government, many remain skeptical about the future of the solar subsidy. The uncertainty surrounding the scheme has already had a negative impact on the solar industry, with some companies reporting a decline in installations and investments. If the subsidy is indeed reduced or abolished, it could have far-reaching consequences for the UK's renewable energy sector and its efforts to combat climate change. As the debate over the solar subsidy continues, it is clear that the future of renewable energy in the UK hangs in the balance. The decision to protect or cut the subsidy will have significant implications for the environment, the economy, and the energy landscape as a whole. It is essential that policymakers carefully consider the consequences of their actions and prioritize the long-term sustainability of the feed-in tariff scheme. Only time will tell whether the solar subsidy will be protected or left vulnerable to cuts.  By Bob Howard  Reporter, Money Box

title: Great Yarmouth school sets up food bank to help families
text: North Denes Primary in Great Yarmouth has started collecting food donations to distribute to families. Head teacher Debbie Whiting said she decided to act when some children were "too hungry to focus in class." Whiting explained that she became aware of the issue when teachers noticed a number of pupils were coming to school without having had breakfast. Some even asked for second helpings at lunchtime, indicating that they were not getting enough to eat at home. The school's food bank initiative aims to provide support to families who may be struggling to put food on the table. Donations of non-perishable items such as canned goods, pasta, and rice are being collected from the school community and local businesses. "We want to ensure that all our students have the opportunity to learn and thrive, and it's hard for them to do that if they're hungry," Whiting emphasized. "By offering this food bank, we hope to alleviate some of the financial pressures that families may be facing." The response from the community has been overwhelmingly positive, with many people eager to contribute to the cause. Local residents have been dropping off donations at the school's reception area, and businesses have offered to provide additional support. One parent, Sarah Thompson, expressed her gratitude for the initiative, sharing that it has made a significant impact on her family. "I've been struggling to make ends meet, and having this support from the school means so much to us," she said. "It's a relief to know that my children won't go hungry." The food bank at North Denes Primary is just one example of how schools across the UK are stepping up to support families in need. As the economic fallout from the COVID-19 pandemic continues to affect households, many parents are finding it increasingly challenging to provide for their children. By offering practical assistance such as food donations, schools are helping to bridge the gap and ensure that every child has access to the basic necessities they need to learn and grow. Head teacher Debbie Whiting hopes that other schools will be inspired to implement similar initiatives in their communities. "We all have a responsibility to look out for one another, especially during difficult times," Whiting said. "I'm proud of the way our school community has come together to support our families, and I hope that this spirit of generosity will continue to flourish."

title: Melania Trump: Donald Trump and I are fine
text: In an interview with ABC News, she said media speculation about her marriage was not "pleasant". Asked if she loves President Donald Trump, Melania Trump responded with a confident nod and said, "Yes, we are fine. We are a strong couple and we support each other in every aspect of our lives." Despite the constant scrutiny and rumors surrounding their marriage, Melania reiterated that their relationship is solid and they continue to work together as a team. The First Lady also addressed the challenges of being in the public eye, stating that she values her privacy but understands that being married to the President comes with a level of public scrutiny. "It is not easy to be constantly in the spotlight, but I have learned to focus on what truly matters, which is my family," she explained. Melania emphasized the importance of staying true to oneself and not letting external opinions affect her personal life. When asked about her initiatives as First Lady, Melania Trump highlighted her Be Best campaign, which focuses on issues such as cyberbullying, opioid abuse, and overall well-being for children. She expressed her passion for helping young people navigate the challenges of today's society and emphasized the importance of kindness and empathy. Melania's dedication to making a positive impact on the lives of children has been a driving force in her role as First Lady. In the midst of political controversies and divisive rhetoric, Melania Trump's unwavering support for her husband has not wavered. She stands by President Donald Trump's side, offering him counsel and encouragement in times of challenge. Melania's grace and poise in the face of criticism have earned her respect from supporters and critics alike. As the interview concluded, Melania Trump expressed her gratitude for the opportunity to serve as First Lady and make a difference in the lives of others. She remains committed to her role and vows to continue advocating for issues that are close to her heart. Despite the constant scrutiny and challenges that come with being in the public eye, Melania Trump remains steadfast in her devotion to her family and her commitment to making a positive impact on the world.

title: Bet365: UK's best-paid boss sees pay rise to £265m
text: The firm's accounts show compensation for the firm's "highest paid director" rising to £265m, including dividends. That was £48m higher than the total she received last year, as the popularity of online gambling continues to grow. Bet365, one of the world's largest online gambling companies, has seen significant growth in recent years. The firm's success can be attributed to its innovative approach to online betting, as well as its strong presence in key markets around the globe. The company's founder and CEO, Denise Coates, has been instrumental in driving this growth and she has been handsomely rewarded for her efforts. Ms. Coates' staggering pay package has sparked debate among critics who argue that such exorbitant sums are unjustified. However, supporters of Ms. Coates point to the exceptional performance of Bet365 under her leadership, as well as the significant taxes that the company pays to the UK government. In addition to her impressive salary, Ms. Coates is also known for her philanthropic endeavors. She has donated millions of pounds to various charitable causes, including healthcare and education. Her generosity has earned her praise from many quarters, with some even calling her a "modern-day philanthropist." Despite the controversy surrounding her pay package, Ms. Coates remains focused on growing Bet365's business and maintaining its position as a market leader in the online gambling industry. The company's expansion into new markets and the launch of innovative new products have helped drive its continued success. As online gambling becomes increasingly popular, companies like Bet365 are poised to capitalize on this trend. The convenience and accessibility of online betting have attracted a growing number of customers, leading to a surge in revenues for companies operating in this space. While Bet365's massive pay package for its CEO may raise eyebrows, it is clear that the company's success is not solely due to Ms. Coates' leadership. A dedicated team of employees and a strategic vision have also played a crucial role in driving Bet365's growth. In the coming years, Bet365 will continue to face challenges as the online gambling market becomes more competitive. However, with its strong leadership and innovative approach to betting, the company is well-positioned to navigate these challenges and maintain its status as one of the UK's premier online gambling companies.

title: India Kolkata flyover collapse: At least 20 dead
text: and concerns about construction practices have surfaced following the tragic collapse of a portion of a flyover in Kolkata, India. At least 20 people have lost their lives in the incident, and the death toll is expected to rise as more victims are discovered. The collapse occurred on a busy street in the heart of Kolkata, with vehicles and pedestrians caught in the rubble as the structure gave way. Eyewitnesses described a loud crash followed by screams as the bridge crumbled to the ground, trapping anyone in its path. Rescue efforts have been hampered by the unstable nature of the debris, with safety concerns for both rescuers and potential survivors at the forefront of the operation. Emergency services are working tirelessly to locate and extract those still trapped under the rubble, but the process is slow and dangerous. Local residents have also joined in the rescue efforts, using their bare hands to help dig through the wreckage in search of survivors. The community spirit and resilience in the face of such a tragedy are evident as people come together to support each other in this time of crisis. Questions have been raised about the safety of the flyover, which was still under construction at the time of the collapse. Reports suggest that concerns had been raised about the structural integrity of the bridge prior to the incident, highlighting the need for stricter safety regulations and oversight in the construction industry. The authorities have launched an investigation into the cause of the collapse, with a focus on potential negligence or malpractice on the part of the construction company responsible for the flyover. Calls for accountability and justice have been mounting as the full extent of the tragedy becomes clear. The collapse of the Kolkata flyover serves as a stark reminder of the importance of proper construction practices and safety standards in infrastructure projects. The loss of life in this incident is a tragic consequence of potential failures in oversight and regulation, highlighting the need for greater vigilance in ensuring the safety of public infrastructure. As rescue efforts continue into the night, the people of Kolkata are left to mourn the loss of those who perished in the collapse. The road to recovery will be long and challenging, but with the support of the community and authorities, the city will rebuild and emerge stronger from this devastating event.

title: 'Unsolvable' exam question leaves Chinese students flummoxed
text: Primary school students at a school in the Chinese district of Shunqing were faced with this question on a paper: "If a ship had 26 sheep and 10 goats on board, how old is the captain?" The seemingly unsolvable exam question left the students and their parents flummoxed, sparking debate and confusion across social media platforms. The question, which was part of a math exam, quickly went viral online, with many netizens expressing their bewilderment at the seemingly illogical problem. Some suggested that there may have been a mistake in the question, while others pointed out that it may have been an intentional test of critical thinking skills rather than a straightforward math problem. However, the school has defended the question, stating that it was designed to test students' ability to think creatively and outside the box. They emphasized the importance of developing problem-solving skills and critical thinking in students from a young age. Despite the school's explanation, many parents and students remain puzzled by the question. Some have even called for the exam to be re-evaluated or for the question to be removed from future exams. This incident has once again highlighted the intense pressure and competition that Chinese students face in their education system. With a heavy emphasis on exams and academic achievement, students are often pushed to excel in standardized tests and meet strict expectations. In recent years, there has been a growing debate in China about the effectiveness of the education system and its focus on rote memorization and test-taking skills. Many educators and parents are calling for reforms that prioritize creativity, critical thinking, and practical skills over traditional academic achievements. In response to the controversy, the school has announced that they will review the exam question and consider making changes to future tests. They have also emphasized the importance of open communication between teachers, students, and parents to address any concerns or confusion about exam content. As the debate continues, one thing is clear: the incident has sparked a broader conversation about the role of education in preparing students for the challenges of the 21st century. Whether or not the "unsolvable" exam question was intentional, it has certainly raised important questions about the kind of skills that should be prioritized in modern education systems.

title: New markets for Welsh firms after Brexit, says PM
text: The Conservative leader said she wanted the "best possible deal" for Wales and the whole of the UK. Meanwhile, Mrs May emphasized the importance of exploring new markets for Welsh firms after Brexit. She stated that leaving the European Union presented Wales with opportunities to expand its trade globally and strengthen its economy. In a speech delivered in Cardiff, the Prime Minister highlighted the government's commitment to supporting Welsh businesses in navigating the post-Brexit landscape. She outlined plans to negotiate free trade agreements with countries beyond the EU, opening up new markets for Welsh exports. Mrs. May expressed confidence in the resilience and innovation of Welsh firms, noting that they were well-positioned to succeed in a more globally focused economy. One of the key strategies proposed by the Prime Minister was to enhance international collaborations and partnerships. She stressed the importance of forging strong relationships with countries such as the United States, Canada, and Australia, which could serve as lucrative markets for Welsh goods and services. Mrs. May also urged Welsh businesses to embrace digital technology and e-commerce to reach a wider audience and compete effectively in the global marketplace. Furthermore, the Prime Minister announced plans to invest in infrastructure and skills development to support the growth of Welsh industries. She pledged to provide funding for strategic projects that would improve connectivity and access to markets, as well as initiatives to upskill the workforce and enhance productivity. Mrs. May emphasized the government's commitment to creating a business-friendly environment that would enable Welsh firms to thrive and expand their operations. In response to concerns about the impact of Brexit on Welsh businesses, the Prime Minister reassured stakeholders that the government would provide comprehensive support and guidance throughout the transition period. She encouraged companies to seize the opportunities presented by the changing economic landscape and adapt their strategies to capitalize on new markets and emerging trends. Overall, Mrs. May's speech reflected a positive outlook on the future of Welsh businesses post-Brexit, emphasizing the potential for growth and prosperity in a more globally connected world. She reiterated her commitment to securing a favorable trade deal for Wales and the UK as a whole, while also championing the resilience and competitiveness of Welsh firms in the face of change. As the country prepares to leave the EU, the Prime Minister signaled her confidence in the ability of Welsh businesses to succeed and thrive in the new economic environment.

title: South Africa parliament chaos as Malema MPs heckle Zuma
text: The Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF), led by Julius Malema, repeatedly interrupted Mr Zuma, demanding answers over a spending scandal. The speaker of parliament then ordered their removal, prompting a chaotic scene in the South Africa parliament. As EFF MPs were forcibly removed from the chamber, they continued to shout and heckle Zuma, accusing him of corruption and calling for his resignation. The disruption caused the proceedings to come to a standstill, with other lawmakers from different parties weighing in on the matter. The incident highlighted the deep divisions and tensions within South Africa's political landscape, with the EFF taking a confrontational approach towards the ruling African National Congress (ANC) and President Zuma. Malema, a former ANC youth leader who was expelled from the party, has been a vocal critic of Zuma's leadership and has accused him of being involved in corrupt activities. Zuma, for his part, remained composed during the disruptions, dismissing the accusations and defending his government's record on fighting corruption. However, the chaos in parliament underscored the challenges he faces in maintaining control and credibility as president. The EFF's actions also raised questions about the effectiveness of parliamentary democracy in South Africa, with some critics arguing that the disruptions were a sign of the erosion of the institution's integrity and functionality. Others, however, defended the EFF's right to hold the government to account and applauded their efforts to challenge the status quo. In the aftermath of the incident, there were calls for greater accountability and transparency in government spending, as well as for a more civil and respectful tone in parliamentary debates. The EFF's disruptive tactics were criticized by some as unproductive and disrespectful, while others praised their courage and determination in confronting power. Ultimately, the chaos in the South Africa parliament served as a stark reminder of the deep-seated political, social, and economic challenges facing the country. As the country prepares for upcoming elections, the incident highlighted the need for a robust and mature political culture that can effectively address the pressing issues that South Africa faces. In the coming days and weeks, all eyes will be on President Zuma and the EFF as they navigate the aftermath of the parliament chaos and seek to move forward amidst ongoing political uncertainty and unrest.

title: Stolen dogs: Carmarthenshire and Briton Ferry raids 'uncover 80'
text: The dogs and puppies are said to be worth tens of thousands of pounds, Dyfed-Powys and South Wales (SWP) police forces said. The raids in Carmarthenshire and Briton Ferry have uncovered a total of 80 stolen dogs, which have brought relief to many pet owners who had lost their beloved companions. The recent surge in dog thefts has raised concerns among the local communities, with reports of pets being snatched from gardens, homes, and even while being taken out for walks. The thefts have left families devastated and desperate to reunite with their furry friends. Upon conducting the raids, the police have recovered a variety of breeds, ranging from popular choices like French Bulldogs and Cockapoos to rare and valuable ones like Dachshunds and Huskies. The dogs were found in various conditions, some showing signs of neglect and mistreatment, highlighting the importance of cracking down on the illicit pet trade. Investigations are ongoing to identify the perpetrators behind these thefts and to ensure that justice is served for the stolen dogs and their owners. The police forces are working closely with animal welfare organizations to secure the well-being of the rescued dogs and to facilitate their safe return to their rightful homes. Pet theft has been a growing concern in the UK, with incidents on the rise in recent years. The pandemic has further exacerbated the issue, as the demand for pets soared while the supply chain for reputable breeders struggled to keep up. This has created a lucrative market for thieves looking to profit from the vulnerability of pet owners. Authorities are urging pet owners to take precautions to protect their furry friends, including microchipping, keeping them indoors when unattended, and being vigilant while out in public spaces. By taking these steps, pet owners can reduce the risk of their beloved companions falling victim to theft and increase the chances of being reunited if they are stolen. The raids in Carmarthenshire and Briton Ferry have shed light on the dark underworld of pet theft, exposing the harsh reality faced by many pet owners. The recovery of 80 stolen dogs is a significant victory for law enforcement and a beacon of hope for those who have experienced the heartbreak of losing a pet to thieves. As the investigations continue and more stolen dogs are reunited with their owners, the authorities remain committed to cracking down on pet theft and holding the perpetrators accountable for their crimes. The dogs may have been stolen, but their resilience and the unwavering dedication of the police forces have ensured that they will soon be back where they belong – in the loving arms of their families.

title: Government automatically enrols firms in case of no-deal Brexit
text: The move will enable UK firms to continue to trade with EU member states after the UK leaves the EU. Business trade groups had urged the government to act after many firms failed to register for the system. The CBI (Confederation of British Industry) welcomed the government's decision, calling it a "pragmatic approach" to ensure smooth trade post-Brexit. Under the new system, businesses that have not already registered for an Economic Operator Registration and Identification (EORI) number will be automatically enrolled. This number is essential for UK businesses to continue trading with the EU in the event of a no-deal Brexit. Without it, firms would face significant delays and disruptions to their trade with the EU. The government's decision comes as the October 31st deadline for Brexit rapidly approaches. With the prospect of a no-deal Brexit becoming increasingly likely, businesses have been urged to prepare for all possible scenarios. The automatic enrolment in the EORI system is seen as a crucial step in ensuring that UK firms can continue to trade seamlessly with the EU after Brexit. In a statement, Business Secretary Andrea Leadsom emphasized the importance of preparing for Brexit, stating, "It is vital that businesses are ready for Brexit and have the necessary arrangements in place to continue trading smoothly. By automatically enrolling firms in the EORI system, we are helping to minimize disruption and ensure that UK businesses can continue to trade with our European partners." Despite the government's efforts to streamline the process, concerns remain about the potential impact of a no-deal Brexit on UK businesses. The British Chambers of Commerce (BCC) has warned that many businesses are still unprepared for the changes that Brexit will bring, particularly in the event of a disorderly exit from the EU. As the government takes steps to mitigate the risks of a no-deal Brexit, businesses are being urged to take action to ensure that they are fully prepared for the changes ahead. This includes registering for an EORI number, reviewing supply chains, and considering alternative trading arrangements. With the uncertainty surrounding Brexit continuing, UK businesses are facing a challenging and unpredictable future. The government's decision to automatically enrol firms in the EORI system is a welcome development for many businesses, providing them with a sense of security as they navigate the complexities of Brexit.

title: Covid: Manchester pub closures 'won't stop infection rate rising'
text: Boris Johnson is expected to announce a three-tier system on Monday. Though yet to be confirmed, Manchester is expected to be put in tier three, with restrictions such as pub closures and limited social gatherings in place in an effort to curb the rising infection rates in the city. Despite these measures, experts warn that the closures of pubs and other social venues alone will not be enough to stop the virus from spreading. The new tier system is likely to face criticism from both pub owners who fear for their businesses and local residents who are growing increasingly frustrated with the ongoing restrictions. The decision to move Manchester into tier three comes as the city continues to see a surge in new Covid-19 cases. Hospitals are becoming overwhelmed with patients, and healthcare workers are feeling the strain of the increased pressure on their services. In an effort to prevent the healthcare system from becoming overwhelmed, the government has no choice but to implement stricter measures in the city. Many believe that the closure of pubs and other social venues will only lead to an increase in private gatherings, where the virus may spread more easily due to relaxed social distancing measures. On the other hand, some argue that closing pubs is a necessary step to prevent people from gathering in large groups and potentially spreading the virus further. The tier system is designed to provide a targeted approach to tackling the virus, with different levels of restrictions based on the infection rates in each area. Manchester's move to tier three will be closely monitored to see if the new measures have any impact on the rising infection rates in the city. Local officials are urging residents to continue following the guidelines, including wearing face masks, practicing social distancing, and washing hands regularly. They are also encouraging people to get tested if they experience any symptoms of Covid-19, in order to prevent further spread of the virus. As the government prepares to announce the new tier system, there is a sense of uncertainty and apprehension among the residents of Manchester. The restrictions on pubs and social gatherings may help slow the spread of the virus, but many fear that they will not be enough to bring the infection rates under control. In the coming days, all eyes will be on Manchester as the city navigates through this new phase of the pandemic. The success of the tier system will depend on the cooperation of all residents, as well as the effectiveness of the new restrictions in reducing the transmission of the virus. Only time will tell if these measures will be enough to stop the infection rate from rising further.

title: Mosul Iraq battle: IS accused of shooting civilians
text: The UN says 12 civilians were shot dead on 11 November when they tried to stop militants launching rockets from the roofs of the homes in the Bakir area. Militants allegedly belonging to the Islamic State (IS) group have been accused of carrying out the heinous act in an attempt to intimidate the local population. The violence in Mosul, a city in northern Iraq that has been under IS control for over two years, has reached a new level of brutality as the battle for control intensifies. Iraqi forces, backed by a US-led coalition, have been engaged in a fierce fight to liberate the city and drive out the IS militants who have terrorized the population with their extreme interpretation of Islamic law. The shooting of civilians is just one example of the atrocities committed by IS in their desperate attempt to hold onto power. The group has been known for targeting civilians, particularly those who oppose their rule or refuse to comply with their strict laws. This latest incident only serves to highlight the barbarity of their tactics and the disregard they have for human life. The people of Mosul have endured immense suffering at the hands of IS, with many forced to flee their homes or live under constant fear of violence. The shooting of civilians trying to protect their neighborhoods from rocket attacks only adds to the already heavy toll of the conflict. Despite the challenges and dangers they face, the Iraqi forces continue to push forward in their efforts to liberate Mosul and free the city from the grip of IS. The battle for Mosul has been long and arduous, with fierce fighting in the streets and neighborhoods as the Iraqi forces slowly gain ground against the militants. The international community has condemned the actions of IS in Mosul, with calls for justice and accountability for the crimes committed against civilians. Human rights organizations have documented numerous cases of abuses and violations by IS, including killings, torture, and forced displacement. The shooting of civilians in Mosul is a tragic reminder of the horrors of war and the impact it has on innocent people caught in the crossfire. As the battle for Mosul rages on, it is crucial that the rights of civilians are protected and that those responsible for atrocities are held accountable for their actions. The Iraqi forces, with the support of the international coalition, continue to push forward in their mission to liberate Mosul and restore peace and stability to the city. The shooting of civilians by IS is a cowardly and despicable act that will not deter the resolve of the Iraqi forces in their fight against terrorism.

title: Male employees want flexible work too
text: By Mary-Ann Russon, Business Reporter, BBC News In the past, pressure for the opportunity to work part-time or flexibly has usually come from women trying to juggle childcare and work. But four in five of male employees also want the option of flexible working, according to a recent study conducted by the Boston Consulting Group. The study revealed that male employees are increasingly seeking flexible working arrangements to better manage their work-life balance. This shift in attitudes reflects a growing recognition that both men and women face competing demands outside of work, and that flexibility in the workplace can benefit everyone. One of the key findings of the study was that male employees who were able to access flexible working arrangements reported higher levels of job satisfaction and overall well-being. This not only benefits the individual employee but also has a positive impact on their productivity and performance at work. Moreover, companies that offer flexible working options to their male employees are more likely to attract and retain top talent. In today's competitive job market, providing flexible working arrangements can give companies a competitive edge by demonstrating a commitment to work-life balance and employee well-being. However, despite the clear benefits of flexible working for male employees, there are still barriers that prevent many from accessing these options. One of the main challenges is the persistent stigma attached to flexible working, particularly for male employees who fear being seen as less committed or ambitious if they choose to work flexibly. Changing workplace culture and addressing these stereotypes are essential in order to create an inclusive working environment where all employees feel supported in their pursuit of work-life balance. Companies can start by promoting the benefits of flexible working for both men and women, and by implementing policies that make it easier for employees to access these options. Overall, the push for more flexible working options for male employees is part of a larger cultural shift towards creating more inclusive and supportive workplaces. By acknowledging the diverse needs of all employees and offering flexibility in how work is structured and carried out, companies can create a more engaged and motivated workforce that benefits both employees and the bottom line. It is clear that flexible working is no longer just a women's issue - it is a vital component of modern workplace culture that benefits everyone.

title: Defence review under way says Michael Fallon
text: Addressing MPs in Parliament, Mr Fallon said the process was under way. The 2010 review was criticized by many for failing to anticipate uprisings and subsequent conflicts in the Middle East and North Africa, as well as not adequately preparing for new cyber threats and hybrid warfare tactics. The Defence Secretary acknowledged the need for a more forward-thinking and flexible approach to national security, emphasizing the importance of staying ahead of emerging threats. He highlighted the changing nature of warfare, with cyber attacks and disinformation campaigns becoming increasingly prominent in modern conflict. Mr Fallon also emphasized the need for a strong and agile military, capable of responding swiftly and decisively to any potential threats to the UK's national security. He mentioned ongoing investments in new technologies and capabilities, such as drones, artificial intelligence, and space-based surveillance, to ensure that the British Armed Forces remain at the forefront of defense innovation. In addition to modernizing the military, the Defence Secretary underscored the importance of strengthening alliances and partnerships with other countries. He emphasized the UK's commitment to NATO and other international organizations, as well as the need to work closely with like-minded nations to address shared security challenges. Mr Fallon's remarks were met with a mixed response from MPs, with some calling for greater transparency and accountability in the defense review process. Others expressed concerns about the potential impact of budget cuts on the armed forces, urging the government to prioritize national security in its spending decisions. The ongoing defense review is expected to address a wide range of issues, including the future size and structure of the British military, as well as the overall defense strategy. It will also consider the implications of Brexit on UK defense policy and the country's relationships with European partners. In conclusion, Mr Fallon reiterated the government's commitment to ensuring that the UK remains a strong and secure nation in an increasingly uncertain world. He emphasized the importance of adaptability and readiness in the face of evolving security threats, and pledged to deliver a comprehensive and effective defense review that meets the challenges of the 21st century. As the defense review continues to unfold, the British public will be watching closely to see how the government plans to address the complex and rapidly changing threats facing the country. Only time will tell if Mr Fallon's assurances of a robust and forward-looking defense strategy will be enough to safeguard the UK's national security in the years to come.

title: £5.6m Newbridge Memo makeover gets under way
text: Scaffolding is set to go up at the Grade II listed Newbridge Memorial Hall, known as the Memo, in Caerphilly county. It follows an eight-year fundraising campaign by the hall's trustees and will eventually see the historic building undergo a much-needed £5.6 million makeover. The ambitious renovation project will involve a complete restoration of the Memo, which has stood as a cultural and community hub for over a century. The hall, originally built in 1924 as a tribute to the local men who lost their lives in World War I, has been in need of significant repairs and modernization to ensure its continued relevance in the 21st century. The refurbishment plans include upgrading the hall's facilities to meet modern standards, such as improving accessibility for disabled visitors, updating the heating and ventilation systems, and restoring the building's iconic art deco features. In addition, the project will also focus on enhancing the Memo's capacity to host a wider range of events and activities, making it a more versatile venue for the local community. The £5.6 million budget for the makeover has been secured through a combination of grants, donations, and fundraising efforts led by the Memo's trustees. The campaign has been supported by local residents, businesses, and organizations who recognize the historical and cultural significance of the hall and the important role it plays in the community. The renovation work is expected to take around two years to complete, with the scaffolding being the first visible sign of the transformation taking place. The trustees are confident that the end result will be a rejuvenated Memo that not only preserves its heritage but also meets the needs of future generations of visitors and users. Local residents have expressed their excitement about the project and the positive impact it will have on the community. Many see the Memo as a focal point for social and cultural activities in Newbridge, and they are eager to see it restored to its former glory. As the scaffolding goes up and the renovation work begins in earnest, the Memo's trustees are hopeful that the makeover will secure the hall's future for many years to come. With the support of the local community and the commitment of all those involved in the project, the Grade II listed building is poised to enter a new chapter in its history as a vibrant and thriving cultural center in Caerphilly county.

title: Coronavirus funeral restrictions: 'Other families shouldn't have to go through this'
text: Iolo Cheung BBC News Only 12 people were allowed to attend Bernard Lawrence's funeral last week. His granddaughter Ffion Evans said it was frustrating as many other Covid measures have been eased. The family had to make difficult decisions about who could attend the service, as they were limited to immediate family members only. "We had to choose between siblings, aunts, uncles, and cousins," Ffion said. "It was heartbreaking to have to leave some family members out, especially when we all wanted to come together to mourn and remember my grandfather." Bernard Lawrence passed away from complications related to Covid-19, adding to the family's grief and frustration with the restrictions in place. Ffion expressed her concern that other families would have to go through the same experience if the rules were not adjusted to accommodate larger gatherings for funerals. "It just doesn't make sense that we can have more people at a wedding or a restaurant, but we are limited to such a small number for a funeral," Ffion explained. "Other families shouldn't have to go through this kind of pain and isolation when they are already dealing with the loss of a loved one." The Lawrence family is not alone in their struggle to navigate the restrictions on funeral attendance during the Covid-19 pandemic. Many families have had to adjust their plans and make difficult choices about who can be present to say goodbye to their loved ones. Funeral directors have also been impacted by the restrictions, as they work to support grieving families while following the guidelines set out by health authorities. James Davies, a funeral director in Cardiff, emphasized the importance of allowing families to come together to mourn and support each other during these difficult times. "We understand the need to prioritize public health and safety, but we also need to consider the emotional wellbeing of those who are grieving," James said. "Funerals are a time for families to come together, share memories, and find comfort in each other's presence." As the situation with the pandemic continues to evolve, Ffion and other families affected by the restrictions hope that there will be more flexibility and understanding when it comes to funeral attendance. They believe that it is essential to balance the need for public health measures with the need for families to grieve and support each other during times of loss. "It's not just about the numbers," Ffion said. "It's about recognizing the importance of coming together as a family to honor and remember the person we have lost. Other families should not have to go through the pain of being separated during such a difficult time."

title: Fallen Yosemite climbers were 'very experienced'
text: fell to their deaths while climbing the Freeblast route on El Capitan in Yosemite National Park. Both men were experienced climbers with a deep passion for the sport, and their tragic deaths have left the climbing community in mourning. Jason Wells, a 46-year-old from Boulder, Colorado, was an accomplished climber known for his bold and technical ascents. He had been climbing for over 20 years and had tackled some of the most challenging routes in Yosemite. Tim Klein, a 42-year-old from Palmdale, California, was also a seasoned climber with a strong reputation in the climbing world. The two men had been climbing partners for many years and had developed a close friendship through their shared love of the sport. They had tackled numerous challenging climbs together, including several in Yosemite, where they had honed their skills on the granite walls of El Capitan. The Freeblast route on El Capitan is a popular climbing route that attracts experienced climbers from around the world. It is known for its challenging pitches and demanding terrain, making it a favorite among seasoned climbers looking for a test of their skills. Officials are still trying to determine the cause of the accident that claimed the lives of Wells and Klein. The men were roped together when they fell, leading investigators to believe that they may have been caught in a sudden rockfall or some other unforeseen event. The climbing community has been quick to express their condolences for the loss of these two experienced climbers. Many have taken to social media to share their memories of Wells and Klein, remembering them as skilled and dedicated climbers who pushed the boundaries of the sport. Yosemite National Park officials have issued a statement urging climbers to exercise caution when tackling the park's challenging routes. While climbing accidents are relatively rare in the park, they can have devastating consequences for even the most experienced climbers. As the investigation into the deaths of Jason Wells and Tim Klein continues, the climbing community is left to mourn the loss of two talented and dedicated climbers. Their deaths serve as a reminder of the risks that come with pursuing such an adventurous and demanding sport, but also of the deep passion and camaraderie that binds climbers together in their shared love of the mountains.

title: Tinder to introduce in-app background checks
text: By Cody Godwin BBC News, San Francisco Later this year, Tinder will allow users to view public records information of perspective dates using their name or mobile number. The move comes as user safety for digital dating continues to be a growing concern. The new feature, which is set to be introduced in the coming months, will allow Tinder users to access information such as criminal records, marital status, and other public records information before agreeing to meet up with someone in person. This is a significant step towards ensuring the safety of users on the popular dating app. In a statement, a spokesperson for Tinder explained that the company is committed to creating a safe and enjoyable environment for its users. By providing access to background checks, Tinder hopes to give users the necessary tools to make informed decisions about who they choose to meet in person. The decision to introduce in-app background checks comes after a series of high-profile incidents involving users who have had negative experiences on the platform. This move is part of a larger effort by Tinder to improve user safety and security on the app. Tinder is not the first dating app to introduce background checks for its users. Other popular dating apps, such as Bumble and Match.com, already offer similar features to help users verify the identities of potential matches before meeting up in person. However, Tinder's decision to introduce background checks for its users is a significant step forward in the world of digital dating. While the introduction of in-app background checks is a positive development for user safety, some users have expressed concerns about the potential invasion of privacy. Critics argue that access to personal information such as criminal records and marital status could lead to discrimination and bias in the dating process. In response to these concerns, Tinder has emphasized that the new feature will only provide users with public records information that is already available through other sources. The company has also stated that users will have the option to opt-out of background checks if they do not wish to participate. Overall, the introduction of in-app background checks represents a positive step towards improving user safety on Tinder. By giving users access to important information about their potential dates, Tinder is helping to create a safer and more transparent dating environment for all of its users.

title: Green screens and social distancing - TV industry publishes guidelines to resume filming
text: The measures form part of a back-to-work blueprint issued by the UK's biggest broadcasters on Monday. They have been adopted by the BBC, ITV, Channel 4, Channel 5 and Sky to protect actors and crews during the pandemic. It outlines guidelines for implementing social distancing on set, including the use of green screens to create the illusion of actors being in the same room while filming separately. The use of green screens is a common technique in the film and television industry to create background scenery or special effects in post-production. However, the new guidelines recommend using green screens to film scenes with actors who need to be in close proximity while maintaining a safe distance. This allows for scenes to be shot with actors appearing to be in the same room without actually being physically close to each other. In addition to using green screens, the guidelines also recommend limiting the number of crew members on set, regularly sanitizing equipment, and implementing regular temperature checks for everyone involved in the production. The aim is to create a safe working environment while keeping the creative process as seamless as possible. The TV industry has been hit hard by the pandemic, with many productions being halted or postponed due to lockdown restrictions. As the UK begins to ease lockdown measures, broadcasters are eager to resume filming and get their shows back on air. The new guidelines provide a roadmap for safely returning to work while protecting the health and well-being of everyone involved. The use of green screens is just one of the many ways the TV industry is adapting to the new normal. Virtual auditions, remote editing, and video conferencing are also becoming more common as productions adjust to the challenges posed by the pandemic. The industry is known for its creativity and innovation, and it is no surprise that it is coming up with new solutions to continue producing high-quality content while keeping everyone safe. As the TV industry moves forward, there will likely be more changes and innovations to come. The new guidelines are a step in the right direction, ensuring that productions can resume in a safe and responsible manner. Green screens and social distancing may be the new normal for now, but the industry is resilient and resourceful, and will continue to find ways to overcome challenges and thrive in the face of adversity.

title: Merthyr baby's death 'could have been avoided'
text: on-duty at the time of Jenson's death, Dr. Sarah Brown, testified at the inquest that there were missed opportunities in his care that could have potentially prevented the tragedy. She mentioned that the hospital was understaffed, and there was a lack of communication between the medical team, which ultimately led to inadequate monitoring of Jenson. Tiffany Gillard tearfully recounted the events leading up to her son's passing, highlighting the distressing and chaotic nature of her experience at the hospital. She expressed her frustration over the perceived lack of urgency in addressing Jenson's deteriorating condition and the failure to provide him with timely and appropriate medical intervention. The Coroner expressed deep concern over the circumstances surrounding Jenson's death, stating that there were clear failings in the care he received at Prince Charles Hospital. He emphasized the need for improvements in the maternity services provided by Cwm Taf health board, urging for a thorough investigation and implementation of necessary changes to prevent similar tragedies in the future. Following the inquest, the health board issued a formal apology to Tiffany Gillard and her family, acknowledging the shortcomings in Jenson's care and expressing their commitment to addressing the issues identified during the proceedings. They reassured the public that steps would be taken to improve the quality of maternity services and ensure that patient safety remains a top priority. In response to the findings of the inquest, the Health Minister for Wales, Vaughan Gething, announced that a full review would be conducted to investigate the failings in maternity services at Prince Charles Hospital and determine the necessary actions to prevent such incidents from occurring again. He emphasized the importance of learning from past mistakes and working collaboratively with healthcare professionals to enhance the quality of care provided to expectant mothers and their babies. The tragic death of Jenson James Francis has sparked widespread concern and calls for accountability within the healthcare system in Wales. The inquest has shed light on the urgent need for improvements in maternity services to ensure that all patients receive the highest standard of care and attention. As the investigation continues, the hope is that lessons will be learned, and changes will be made to prevent similar incidents in the future. Tiffany Gillard's heartbreaking loss serves as a stark reminder of the vital importance of effective healthcare practices and the need for continuous vigilance in safeguarding the well-being of vulnerable patients.

title: MoT changes come into force in Northern Ireland
text: Under the new MoT rules in Northern Ireland, drivers can expect more thorough checks on their vehicles to ensure that they are safe and roadworthy. These changes come as part of the Driver and Vehicle Agency's efforts to improve road safety and reduce the number of accidents caused by vehicle defects. One of the key changes is the addition of more than 20 extra checks, with a particular focus on electronic warning systems such as headlamp and airbags. These systems play a crucial role in ensuring the safety of both the driver and passengers, so it is important that they are working correctly at all times. By carrying out more detailed checks on these components, the MoT aims to catch any potential issues before they become a safety hazard. In addition to electronic warning systems, the new MoT rules also include checks on other important components of the vehicle, such as brakes, steering, and suspension. These checks are designed to ensure that the vehicle is in good working order and meets the necessary safety standards. By conducting these checks more thoroughly, the MoT aims to improve overall road safety and reduce the risk of accidents caused by mechanical failures. Drivers in Northern Ireland should be aware of these new MoT changes and make sure that their vehicles are up to date with all required checks and maintenance. Failing to comply with the new rules could result in a failed MoT test, which could lead to fines or even the vehicle being taken off the road until the necessary repairs are made. It is important for drivers to take the new MoT rules seriously and ensure that their vehicles are properly maintained and in good working condition. By doing so, they can help to reduce the risk of accidents on the road and keep themselves and others safe. Overall, the new MoT changes in Northern Ireland are aimed at improving road safety and ensuring that vehicles are in good working order. By increasing the number of checks and focusing on electronic warning systems, the MoT aims to catch any potential issues before they become a safety hazard. Drivers should be aware of these changes and make sure that their vehicles are up to date with all required checks to avoid any issues during the MoT test. Stay safe on the road by keeping your vehicle well-maintained and roadworthy.

title: Salisbury city best performing in GB shop vacancy table
text: to the high number of empty units, has now admitted that she may have been too quick to judge. "I was ready to give up on Salisbury, but this report has given me hope," Boddy said. "I've seen new businesses opening up in the high street, and footfall seems to be increasing. Maybe I was too hasty in my decision to close shop." The report also highlights the efforts of the local council and business community in revitalizing the city center. One initiative that has been particularly successful is the introduction of pop-up shops, which have injected new life into previously empty units. "We've been working closely with landlords to encourage them to offer short-term leases to pop-up businesses," said Sarah Johnson, the city's economic development officer. "These pop-ups not only bring in much-needed revenue to the landlords but also attract shoppers to areas of the city that were previously neglected." Salisbury's success in reducing its shop vacancy rate has not gone unnoticed by other cities struggling with empty units. Tom Reynolds, the mayor of a nearby town, has expressed interest in learning from Salisbury's example. "We've been facing similar challenges with shop closures in our town center," Reynolds said. "Salisbury's approach of working with landlords and encouraging new businesses to open could be the key to turning things around for us as well." Despite the positive news, there are still challenges ahead for Salisbury. The rise of online shopping and changing consumer behavior continue to pose a threat to the high street. However, the city remains optimistic about its future. "We know that the retail landscape is evolving, and we need to adapt to survive," said Johnson. "But with the support of the local community and innovative initiatives like pop-up shops, we believe that Salisbury can continue to thrive as a vibrant shopping destination." As the city continues to buck the national trend of rising shop vacancy rates, residents and business owners are hopeful for what lies ahead. With the right strategies in place and a commitment to supporting local businesses, Salisbury is proving that it can defy the odds and remain a thriving hub of commerce in the UK.

title: Monaco's Prince Albert weds South African Charlene Wittstock
text: The wedding took place at the royal palace by the Mediterranean, where a more elaborate religious ceremony is to be held on Saturday. Up to 800 guests, including royalty, celebrities, and world leaders, attended the civil ceremony on Friday, witnessing the union between Monaco's Prince Albert II and his South African bride, Charlene Wittstock. The couple's love story has captured the world's attention, with Charlene leaving her home in South Africa to join the royal family in Monaco. The former Olympic swimmer met Prince Albert during a swimming competition in Monaco in 2000 and the two have been inseparable ever since. As Charlene walked down the aisle in a stunning Giorgio Armani dress, she looked every bit the part of a princess. Prince Albert waited at the altar, looking handsome in his military uniform. The couple exchanged vows and rings, promising to love and cherish each other for the rest of their lives. After the civil ceremony, the newlyweds greeted well-wishers from the balcony of the royal palace. Crowds gathered in the streets below, waving flags and cheering for the happy couple. The atmosphere was filled with excitement and joy as the people of Monaco celebrated the union of their prince and his new princess. Saturday's religious ceremony is expected to be even more extravagant, with a guest list that includes heads of state and other dignitaries. The couple will exchange vows once again in a traditional Catholic ceremony, surrounded by family, friends, and onlookers. The wedding festivities will continue throughout the weekend, with a gala dinner and fireworks display planned for the evening. The people of Monaco are thrilled to welcome Charlene into their royal family and are eager to see what the future holds for the newlyweds. For Charlene, becoming a princess is a dream come true. She has embraced her new role with grace and elegance, winning over the hearts of the people of Monaco. Prince Albert is proud to have her by his side, and the two are eager to start their new life together as husband and wife. As the sun set over the Mediterranean, the royal palace was illuminated with lights and music filled the air. The wedding of Prince Albert and Charlene Wittstock was a fairy tale come to life, a celebration of love and unity that will be remembered for years to come. The people of Monaco will forever hold a special place in their hearts for the royal couple, wishing them all the happiness in the world as they begin their new journey together.

title: Julie Walker and son Lucas named as Aberdeen beach victims
