Fans were both relieved and impressed by Bieber's dedication to putting on a great performance for them, even in less than perfect health. The singer powered through the rest of his set, delivering a flawless performance that left the crowd in awe. After the concert, Bieber's team confirmed that he had been seen by a doctor after the show to ensure he was receiving appropriate care for his illness. While the specifics of his condition were not disclosed, it was clear that he was in good hands and being looked after by professionals. Despite the health scare, Bieber showed incredible resilience and determination to finish the show for his loyal fans. His commitment to his craft and his audience was evident as he pushed through his illness to deliver an unforgettable performance. As news of Bieber's health scare spread, fans and well-wishers took to social media to express their concern and send their best wishes to the singer. The outpouring of support from around the world was a testament to Bieber's dedicated fan base and the impact he has on people of all ages. As Bieber continues his world tour, fans can rest assured that he is in good hands and receiving the care he needs to stay healthy and continue to wow audiences with his incredible talent. Despite the challenges he may face along the way, Bieber's passion for music and performing shines through, making him a truly remarkable artist.

title: Swine flu offers 'extraordinary super immunity'
text: By Michelle Roberts Health reporter, BBC News In beating a bout of H1N1 the body makes antibodies that can kill many other flu strains, a study has found. Researchers believe this discovery could hold the key to developing a universal flu vaccine that protects against all types of influenza virus. The findings come from a study conducted at the University of Oxford, where scientists analyzed blood samples from individuals who had been infected with the H1N1 swine flu virus. The study, published in the journal Science, revealed that the antibodies produced in response to the H1N1 virus were not only effective at neutralizing H1N1 itself but also several other strains of influenza virus, including the seasonal flu strains H3N2 and H2N2. This extraordinary super immunity is a rare phenomenon in the world of infectious diseases and could have major implications for the future of flu prevention and treatment. Dr. Sarah Gilbert, lead researcher on the study, described the findings as groundbreaking and potentially game-changing. "We have long been searching for a way to create a universal flu vaccine that can protect against all strains of influenza virus, and it seems that the key to this may lie in the antibodies produced by the body in response to H1N1 infection," she said. The discovery of this super immunity could not have come at a more critical time, as the world continues to battle the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. By understanding how the body's immune system responds to flu viruses, scientists may be able to develop more effective vaccines and treatments for not only the flu but also other infectious diseases. Experts caution, however, that more research is needed to fully understand the implications of the study and to determine how best to harness this newfound super immunity. "While these findings are certainly exciting, we must proceed with caution and continue to study how these antibodies work and whether they can be replicated in a vaccine," said Dr. Anthony Fauci, director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases. Despite the challenges that lie ahead, the discovery of super immunity in response to H1N1 infection offers hope for a future where flu vaccines are more effective and potentially even universal. If scientists can unlock the secrets of these powerful antibodies, we may one day see a world where the threat of the flu is greatly reduced, and outbreaks are no longer a cause for panic and concern.

title: Wanted: PA to the Duchess
text: Because the Duchess of Cambridge is looking for a new private secretary. Her current assistant, 34-year-old Rebecca Deacon, is stepping down from the role in the Summer after 10 years of service to the Royal family. So what qualities does the Duchess seek in her new right-hand woman? The ideal candidate must possess a strong sense of discretion, as they will be privy to sensitive information regarding the Duchess's personal and professional life. They must also demonstrate excellent organizational skills, as they will be responsible for managing the Duchess's schedule and coordinating her engagements. In addition, the Duchess is looking for someone who is personable and approachable, as they will be interacting with a wide range of people on behalf of the royal family. The ability to work well under pressure and remain calm in high-stress situations is also essential, as the role can be demanding and fast-paced. Experience in a similar role is highly desirable, as the successful candidate will need to hit the ground running and be able to adapt quickly to the demands of the job. A background in public relations or event management could also be beneficial, as the role involves planning and executing official engagements and public appearances. Above all, the Duchess is looking for someone who is dedicated, loyal, and committed to supporting her in her royal duties. The new private secretary will play a crucial role in helping the Duchess navigate her royal responsibilities and fulfill her role as a prominent member of the royal family. The position offers a unique opportunity to work closely with one of the most high-profile members of the British monarchy and to be a part of the inner workings of the royal household. The successful candidate will have the chance to travel both domestically and internationally with the Duchess, as well as attend high-profile events and engagements. The recruitment process for the new private secretary is expected to be rigorous, with candidates undergoing a series of interviews and assessments to determine their suitability for the role. The Duchess is committed to finding the right person to fill this important position and will take the time necessary to make sure that the successful candidate is the perfect fit for her team. As the search for a new private secretary gets underway, all eyes will be on who will be chosen to fill this prestigious role. The Duchess of Cambridge is looking for a dedicated and talented individual to join her team and help her carry out her royal duties with grace and professionalism. It is an exciting opportunity for the right candidate to make a significant impact in the world of royalty and to be a part of history in the making.

title: Saudi Arabia's women vote in election for first time
text: Women were also standing as candidates, another first, despite the conservative kingdom being the only nation where women are not allowed to drive. A total of 978 women have registered as candidates, competing for seats on municipal councils across Saudi Arabia. This marks a significant milestone in the country's slow progress towards gender equality. For many Saudi women, the ability to vote and run for office represents a long-awaited opportunity to participate in the political process. In a country where women's rights have historically been restricted, the right to vote is seen as a step towards greater empowerment and representation. One of the candidates, Hadeel Ayoub, expressed her excitement at being able to run for office. "I never thought I would live to see this day," she said. "It's a small step, but it's a big victory for us as women." Despite this progress, challenges remain for women in Saudi Arabia. The strict guardianship laws, which require women to obtain permission from a male relative for major life decisions, continue to limit women's autonomy and freedom. Additionally, women still face discrimination in areas such as employment and education. However, the participation of women in the upcoming elections is a positive sign that change is possible. Many hope that the increased visibility of women in politics will pave the way for further reforms and greater gender equality in the country. The elections themselves present a unique opportunity for Saudi women to make their voices heard and drive change in their communities. Issues such as women's rights, education, healthcare, and economic empowerment are all on the agenda for candidates, reflecting the diverse perspectives and priorities of the female electorate. It is important to note that while the inclusion of women in the electoral process is a significant step forward, there is still work to be done to ensure that women's rights are fully protected and respected in Saudi Arabia. The upcoming elections will be a test of the government's commitment to promoting gender equality and creating a more inclusive society. As Saudi women prepare to cast their votes and make history in the upcoming elections, it is clear that this moment represents a turning point in the country's journey towards greater gender equality. The participation of women in politics is not just a symbolic gesture – it is a crucial step towards building a more inclusive and representative society for all.

title: Life-extending lung cancer nivolumab drug approved
text: Campaigners, including the late Sunday Times restaurant critic AA Gill, have repeatedly called for access to the immunotherapy, which can add months to life. Scotland already offers nivolumab to people with advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), and now, the drug has been approved by the National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) for use in England. Nivolumab, marketed under the brand name Opdivo, works by blocking a protein called PD-1 on the surface of T-cells, which allows the immune system to recognize and attack cancer cells more effectively. Clinical trials have shown that nivolumab can significantly prolong survival in patients with NSCLC, with some patients experiencing a durable response to the treatment. The approval of nivolumab is a significant milestone in the treatment of lung cancer, which is the leading cause of cancer-related deaths worldwide. For many patients, especially those with advanced-stage NSCLC, traditional treatments such as chemotherapy and radiation therapy have limited effectiveness and can often cause debilitating side effects. Immunotherapy like nivolumab offers a promising alternative, with fewer side effects and the potential for long-lasting benefits. Dr. Sanjay Popat, Consultant Thoracic Medical Oncologist at The Royal Marsden NHS Foundation Trust, welcomed the approval of nivolumab, stating, "This decision by NICE is a positive step forward for patients with advanced lung cancer. Nivolumab has been shown to extend survival and improve quality of life in this patient group, and it is heartening to see that more patients will now have access to this life-extending treatment." While the approval of nivolumab is a positive development, there are still challenges ahead in ensuring that all patients who could benefit from the drug have access to it. The cost of immunotherapy drugs like nivolumab is a concern for many healthcare systems, and there is an ongoing debate about how to make these treatments more affordable and accessible to patients. Campaigners and healthcare professionals are calling for more investment in research and development of immunotherapy drugs, as well as measures to ensure that cost does not prevent patients from receiving life-extending treatments. As more evidence emerges about the effectiveness of immunotherapy in treating different types of cancer, it is clear that these drugs have the potential to revolutionize cancer treatment and improve outcomes for patients. The approval of nivolumab for use in England is a step in the right direction, but more needs to be done to ensure that all patients have access to the latest and most effective treatments. With continued research and investment in immunotherapy, the future of cancer treatment looks brighter than ever before.

title: UK to probe Huawei staff's role at cybersecurity centre
text: The news follows a report by Parliament's intelligence committee which raised concerns that staff working at the base in Oxfordshire were employed by the Chinese telecoms firm. Part of their job is to test Huawei's equipment for security vulnerabilities, raising fears about potential Chinese espionage. The concerns stem from the fact that Huawei has been repeatedly accused of having close ties to the Chinese government and intelligence services, raising fears that the company could be using its position in the UK to gather intelligence and potentially engage in cyber attacks. The UK government has been under increasing pressure to address these concerns and take action to protect national security. The decision to probe Huawei staff's role at the cybersecurity centre is part of this effort to ensure that the UK's critical infrastructure is secure and protected from potential threats. The investigation will focus on whether Huawei staff working at the cybersecurity centre have access to sensitive information and whether they are following proper security protocols. The goal is to determine whether there are any vulnerabilities or risks associated with having Huawei employees in such a crucial role. The outcome of the investigation could have significant implications for Huawei's operations in the UK. If it is found that the company's staff pose a security risk, the government may decide to impose stricter regulations or even ban Huawei from taking part in sensitive projects. However, Huawei has repeatedly denied allegations of ties to the Chinese government and has insisted that it operates independently and follows all necessary security protocols. The company has also pledged to work closely with UK authorities to address any concerns and ensure that its operations in the country are secure and transparent. The investigation into Huawei staff's role at the cybersecurity centre is just the latest development in the ongoing debate over the company's presence in the UK. The government faces a delicate balancing act between protecting national security and maintaining strong economic ties with China, where Huawei is a major player in the telecommunications industry. As the investigation unfolds, all eyes will be on the UK government to see how it navigates these complex issues and what steps it takes to ensure that the country's cybersecurity remains robust and secure. Only time will tell what the future holds for Huawei's operations in the UK and the broader implications for national security.

title: UK government to press for European Court reform
text: Show, the Justice Secretary emphasized the need for reform, citing concerns about the efficiency and effectiveness of the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR). Clarke pointed out that the court had been facing a backlog of cases for years, leading to delays in providing justice to those who need it most. Clarke highlighted the importance of striking a balance between safeguarding human rights and ensuring that the court functions smoothly. He expressed the government's commitment to pushing for reforms that would streamline the court's processes and increase its efficiency. This includes measures to reduce the backlog of cases and improve the timeliness of judgments. The Justice Secretary also addressed the issue of the ECHR's relationship with the UK. He acknowledged that while the court plays a crucial role in upholding human rights across Europe, there have been tensions between the court's decisions and the UK government's policies. Clarke stressed the importance of finding a way to resolve these differences while maintaining respect for the court's authority. In addition to calling for reforms within the ECHR, Clarke emphasized the need for broader changes to the European human rights system. He highlighted the government's support for creating a new international court to handle cases that currently fall under the jurisdiction of the ECHR. This would help to relieve some of the pressure on the existing court and improve the overall effectiveness of the European human rights framework. Clarke's comments come as the UK prepares to assume the chairmanship of the Council of Europe in November. This provides a valuable opportunity for the government to advocate for changes within the ECHR and advance its vision for a more efficient and responsive human rights system. By leveraging its position within the Council of Europe, the UK can push for reforms that will benefit not only its own citizens but all those who rely on the ECHR for protection of their rights. As the government gears up to take the reins of the Council of Europe, Clarke's remarks serve as a clear signal of its intentions to push for European Court reform. By addressing the challenges facing the ECHR head-on and advocating for solutions that will improve its functioning, the UK is demonstrating its commitment to upholding human rights while also seeking to make the European human rights system more effective and efficient.

title: Irish boy struck dumb by First Lady Michelle Obama
text: husband, former President Barack Obama, had attended a meeting with Irish leaders to discuss important issues facing the country. The atmosphere was buzzing with excitement as the young children eagerly awaited the famous couple's arrival. When Mrs. Obama finally made her way backstage to meet the children, Billy couldn't believe his eyes. The First Lady, known for her warmth and charisma, immediately made her way over to him, a warm smile on her face. Billy stood there, his mouth agape, unable to find the words to express how starstruck he was. Mrs. Obama knelt down to his level, her kind eyes meeting his. "Hello there, young man," she said gently. "What's your name?" Billy managed to stammer out his name, his cheeks flushing with embarrassment. Mrs. Obama chuckled softly, putting a hand on his shoulder. "It's okay, Billy. I know meeting new people can be overwhelming sometimes," she reassured him. The other children watched in awe as Mrs. Obama chatted with Billy, asking him about his favorite subjects in school and his hobbies. Billy, slowly but surely, began to relax in her presence. It was as if the world around him faded away, leaving just him and the First Lady in their own little bubble. After a few minutes of conversation, Mrs. Obama had to move on to greet the other children. Billy watched her go, a wistful expression on his face. He couldn't believe that he had just spoken to one of the most influential women in the world. As the performance of Riverdance began, Billy found himself lost in the music and the intricate dance moves. His shyness seemed to melt away as he clapped and cheered along with the rest of the audience. Mrs. Obama sat in the front row, her eyes sparkling with joy as she watched the children enjoy the show. As the curtain fell on the performance, Mrs. Obama made her way backstage to say goodbye to the children. When she reached Billy, he surprised himself by giving her a hug. Mrs. Obama laughed, hugging him back tightly. "Thank you for being so brave, Billy," she said, her voice full of pride. "You have a bright future ahead of you, I can just tell. Keep following your dreams." And with those words, Mrs. Obama bid farewell to the Irish boy who had been struck dumb by her presence. But in that brief moment, Billy had found his voice and his confidence, thanks to the kindness and encouragement of one remarkable woman.

title: Pensioner liable for Donald Trump golf court expenses
text: US tycoon Mr Trump hopes to build the "world's greatest golf resort" at Menie, north of Aberdeen. Molly Forbes, 86, raised judicial concerns after receiving a bill of £1,000 for damage caused to the golf course during a protest against the development. Forbes, a retired schoolteacher, was one of the local pensioners who took part in a peaceful demonstration on the grounds of the proposed golf resort. The protest aimed to highlight the environmental impact of the development on the sand dunes and wildlife in the area. However, the demonstration turned chaotic when a small group of activists clashed with security guards hired by the Trump Organization. In the ensuing chaos, some of the golf course greens were damaged, leading to claims by the Trump Organization that the protesters were responsible for the costs of repair. Forbes, along with several other pensioners, received letters demanding payment for the damages caused during the protest. "I was shocked when I received the bill for the damage caused during the protest," Forbes said. "I was peacefully demonstrating against the destruction of our local environment, and now I am being held financially responsible for it. It's unfair and unjust." Forbes, who has lived in the area for over 50 years, has vowed to fight the charges and has sought legal advice on the matter. She believes that the Trump Organization should take responsibility for the damage caused to the golf course, as they are the ones pushing for the development in the first place. "I will not back down until justice is served. I refuse to pay for something I did not do," Forbes declared. The case has sparked a debate on the rights of protesters and the accountability of developers in cases of environmental damage. Environmental groups have rallied behind Forbes, calling for a fair resolution to the situation. The Trump Organization has not responded to requests for comment on the matter. However, a spokesperson for the company has stated previously that they will take all necessary steps to protect their property and ensure that any damages are paid for. As the legal battle between Forbes and the Trump Organization continues, the fate of the proposed golf resort hangs in the balance. Local residents remain divided over the development, with some supporting the economic benefits it could bring to the area, while others fear the irreversible damage it could cause to the environment.

title: City of Culture: Leicester 'disappointed but defiant'
text: the challenge of being named City of Culture, but the news was still a blow to the city. Despite the disappointment, Soulsby remained defiant, determined to continue showcasing Leicester's vibrant arts and culture scene. The City of Culture initiative was a competition launched by the UK government to promote culture and tourism in different cities across the country. Leicester had high hopes of winning the prestigious title, but ultimately lost out to Hull. Soulsby acknowledged the efforts made by Hull to secure the title, emphasizing that the city perhaps needed the regeneration more than Leicester did. However, the Mayor was quick to point out that Leicester had made significant progress in recent years, establishing itself as a cultural hub in the Midlands. With a diverse population and a rich history, Leicester has a lot to offer in terms of arts and culture. The city boasts a thriving music and arts scene, with numerous galleries, theatres, and music venues showcasing local talent. Soulsby highlighted the importance of continuing to invest in the arts, despite the setback of not being named City of Culture. He stressed that Leicester will not be deterred by this disappointment and will continue to support and promote its cultural heritage. The Mayor also expressed his gratitude to all those who had worked hard to put together Leicester's bid, praising their dedication and creativity. Moving forward, Soulsby outlined his vision for Leicester as a cultural destination, with plans to further develop and expand the city's arts and cultural offerings. He emphasized the need for continued collaboration between artists, cultural institutions, and the community to foster a vibrant and inclusive cultural scene. Leicester may have missed out on the City of Culture title this time, but Soulsby remains optimistic about the city's future. With its resilient spirit and creative talent, Leicester is well-positioned to continue growing and thriving as a cultural powerhouse in the Midlands. As the city reflects on this disappointment, there is a sense of determination and resilience in the air. Leicester may not have won the title of City of Culture, but its cultural spirit remains strong. The city will continue to celebrate its arts and culture, showcasing the creativity and talent that make Leicester a truly special place.

title: Ex-officers rehired: Case studies
text: The PSNI said the appropriate place to discuss the detail of the report was with the Policing Board and the Public Accounts Committee. Here are some case studies taken from the report. CASE ONE Constable B retired in October after serving twenty-five years in the police force. Less than a year later, he was rehired as a consultant on a temporary contract, working on a project aimed at improving community engagement. The decision to rehire Constable B was based on his extensive experience and knowledge of the local area, which was deemed invaluable to the success of the project. While some critics questioned the need to rehire a retired officer instead of promoting internal talent, others praised the move as a cost-effective way to leverage the expertise of experienced officers. CASE TWO Sergeant L took early retirement due to health reasons, but found himself struggling to adjust to life outside of the police force. After seeking support from various organizations, he was offered a part-time position in the PSNI's training department, where he could continue to contribute to the force in a less physically demanding role. Despite concerns about Sergeant L's health issues impacting his ability to perform his duties effectively, he has since excelled in his new role and has become a valuable asset to the training department. CASE THREE Inspector M retired from the force after reaching the mandatory retirement age of 55. However, due to a shortage of experienced investigators in his department, he was rehired on a short-term contract to lead a major investigation into organized crime. Inspector M's knowledge of the local criminal landscape and his expertise in investigative techniques were crucial to the success of the operation, which resulted in multiple arrests and convictions. While some questioned the legality of rehiring a retired officer for such a high-profile case, the PSNI defended their decision as necessary to ensure the safety and security of the community. These case studies highlight the complex nature of rehiring ex-officers in the police force. While some may view it as a cost-effective way to retain valuable expertise and experience, others may raise concerns about fairness, transparency, and accountability in the recruitment process. The PSNI will continue to review its policies and procedures regarding the rehiring of retired officers to ensure that it is done in a way that benefits both the force and the community it serves.

title: Kent's festivals set to draw large crowds this summer
text: By Andrew Parry BBC Kent In fact, we have more festivals than most down in the sunny south-east. From farms to parks, hills to zoos, no large space of land is safe from the influx of festival-goers in Kent this summer. With a diverse range of events catering to all tastes, Kent is set to draw in large crowds from near and far. One of the most popular festivals in Kent is the Canterbury Food and Drink Festival, which takes place in the heart of the historic city. This festival showcases the best of local produce, with food stalls selling everything from artisan cheeses to freshly baked bread. Visitors can also enjoy live music, cooking demonstrations, and tastings from local breweries and wineries. This year, the festival is set to be bigger and better than ever, with a line-up of top chefs and food experts taking to the stage. If music is more your thing, then the Ramblin' Man Fair in Maidstone is the place to be. This rock music festival attracts some of the biggest names in the industry, with past headliners including Black Stone Cherry, The Darkness, and Blackberry Smoke. With multiple stages, camping facilities, and a family-friendly atmosphere, the Ramblin' Man Fair is a must-visit for music lovers of all ages. For those seeking a more cultural experience, the Rochester Sweeps Festival is not to be missed. This traditional English festival celebrates the coming of spring with Morris dancing, music, and entertainment throughout the historic streets of Rochester. The festival culminates in the Grand Procession, where hundreds of dancers in traditional costume parade through the city, accompanied by music and merriment. With its unique blend of history and entertainment, the Rochester Sweeps Festival is a true highlight of the Kent festival calendar. And let's not forget the gardens of Kent, which come alive with the sound of music during the summer months. From the beautiful gardens of Leeds Castle to the sprawling grounds of Sissinghurst Castle, there are a range of music festivals to choose from. Whether you're a fan of classical music, jazz, or folk, there's something for everyone in the stunning settings of Kent's gardens. With such a packed schedule of festivals and events, Kent is sure to draw in large crowds this summer. Whether you're a foodie, a music lover, or a history buff, there's something for everyone to enjoy in the sunny south-east. So pack your bags, grab your friends, and get ready to experience the best that Kent has to offer this festival season.

title: Jersey States discussing local fish quotas
text: Jersey currently works to the EU quota system, which restricts what can be caught in island waters. Deputy Carolyn Labey, a member of the Environment, Housing and Infrastructure Scrutiny Panel, highlighted the importance of these quotas during a recent session in the States Assembly. She emphasized the need for Jersey to have its own say in the management of its fisheries, rather than being subject to regulations set by the European Union. Labey pointed out that the current system often results in unfair allocations for Jersey fishermen, who are competing with larger nations for access to the same waters. She argued that having control over local fish quotas would enable the island to manage its resources more sustainably and ensure a fair distribution of fishing opportunities among local fishermen. The discussion in the States Assembly also touched on the potential impact of Brexit on Jersey's fishing industry. With the UK set to leave the European Union, there are concerns about the future of fisheries management in the region. Some Members of the Assembly expressed a desire for Jersey to assert its independence and negotiate directly with the UK on fishing rights post-Brexit. Deputy Steve Luce, Minister for the Environment, confirmed that talks were ongoing with the UK government regarding the future of fisheries in Jersey waters. He assured the Assembly that the government is committed to securing a fair deal for local fishermen and ensuring that Jersey's fishing industry remains sustainable in the long term. In response to these discussions, the States Assembly passed a proposition calling for the establishment of a working group to explore the possibility of creating a local fish quotas system. The group will be tasked with gathering evidence, consulting with stakeholders, and making recommendations for a new fisheries management regime that is tailored to the unique needs of Jersey. The move has been welcomed by local fishermen and industry groups, who see it as a step towards greater autonomy and control over Jersey's fisheries. They hope that a locally managed quotas system will lead to more sustainable fishing practices, a level playing field for all fishermen, and a brighter future for the island's fishing industry. As Jersey moves towards establishing its own fish quotas system, the island is poised to set an example for other regions grappling with similar challenges in the management of their fisheries. By taking control of its resources and working collaboratively with stakeholders, Jersey aims to secure a prosperous and sustainable future for its fishing industry.

title: Sunday Times Rich List suggests UK's wealthiest defy recession
text: the previous year's record of £395.8bn. Despite the economic challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic, the UK's richest individuals have managed to not only weather the storm but actually increase their wealth. One of the key reasons for this surge in wealth among the UK's wealthiest individuals is the continued booming stock market. The FTSE 100 index has seen significant gains over the past year, buoyed by optimism around the economic recovery and the success of the vaccination rollout. This has led to substantial gains for many of the country's top billionaires who have significant investments in the stock market. Another factor contributing to the growing fortunes of the UK's wealthiest individuals is the property market. Despite initial fears of a crash in property prices due to the pandemic, the market has remained resilient, with prices continuing to rise in many parts of the country. This has led to substantial gains for property investors and developers, further adding to the wealth of the country's richest individuals. However, the Sunday Times Rich List also highlights the stark wealth inequality present in the UK. While the country's richest individuals have seen their wealth soar, many people across the country continue to struggle with financial insecurity. The pandemic has exacerbated existing inequalities, with low-income households disproportionately affected by job losses and reduced incomes. Critics have pointed out that the growing wealth of the UK's richest individuals is a stark reminder of the unequal distribution of wealth in the country. They argue that the government should do more to address this inequality through measures such as increasing taxes on the wealthy and investing in public services to support those most in need. Despite the criticisms, the UK's richest individuals show no signs of slowing down in their quest for wealth accumulation. Many are continuing to expand their business empires and make savvy investments to further increase their fortunes. As the country looks towards a post-pandemic recovery, the Sunday Times Rich List serves as a reminder of the complex interplay between wealth, power, and inequality in the UK.

title: '500 killed' due to medicine shortage
text: In a letter to the Secretary of Health Ministry, Regional Directors of Health Services of Mullaitivu and Kilinochchi say that the region was not provided with much-needed medication for several months, leading to the deaths of approximately 500 people. The shortage of medicine has caused severe hardship for the residents of these war-torn areas, where access to basic healthcare services is already limited. The lack of essential medicines has resulted in patients being unable to receive proper treatment for their illnesses, exacerbating their conditions and ultimately leading to fatalities. Both regions have been facing challenges in securing adequate medical supplies, with health facilities struggling to meet the growing demands of the local population. The Regional Directors have urged the Health Ministry to take immediate action to address the critical shortage of medication in Mullaitivu and Kilinochchi. They have highlighted the devastating impact of the scarcity of essential drugs on the health and well-being of the residents, particularly the most vulnerable members of the community. The Secretary of Health Ministry has acknowledged the seriousness of the situation and has promised to expedite the procurement and distribution of essential medicines to the affected regions. However, he also cited budgetary constraints and logistical challenges as hindrances to the timely delivery of medical supplies. The tragic deaths of 500 individuals highlight the urgent need for a comprehensive and sustainable solution to the health crisis in Mullaitivu and Kilinochchi. The lack of access to essential medicines not only jeopardizes the lives of those in need but also undermines the overall healthcare system in the region. Local health officials have emphasized the importance of proactive measures to prevent similar tragedies in the future, calling for improved coordination between government agencies, healthcare providers, and humanitarian organizations. They have underscored the need for greater transparency and accountability in the management of medical supplies to ensure timely and equitable distribution to all regions. As the authorities work towards addressing the root causes of the medicine shortage in Mullaitivu and Kilinochchi, the focus remains on saving lives and providing essential healthcare services to those in need. The tragic loss of 500 individuals serves as a stark reminder of the critical need for a robust and responsive healthcare system that can effectively meet the health needs of all citizens, especially in conflict-affected regions like Mullaitivu and Kilinochchi.

title: University of Nottingham rent protesters offered 'support package'
text: Hundreds of University of Nottingham students called for rents to be suspended when they were unable to return due to national restrictions. Now the university has said support will be available for those affected by the ongoing situation. The University of Nottingham announced a support package which includes a rent rebate for students who have been unable to return to their accommodation on campus. This news comes after a wave of protests and demands from students who were struggling to pay for empty rooms while studying from home. The support package also includes financial assistance for students who are facing hardship due to the pandemic. This is a welcomed relief for many students who have been struggling to make ends meet during these challenging times. In addition to financial support, the university has also pledged to provide mental health and wellbeing resources for students who may be feeling isolated or overwhelmed. This holistic approach to supporting students shows a commitment to their overall well-being, not just their financial needs. The university's response to the rent protests has been met with mixed reactions from students. Some feel that the support package is a step in the right direction, while others believe that more could be done to alleviate the financial burden on students. There are calls for a rent freeze or further reductions in accommodation costs to better reflect the current circumstances. One student, who wished to remain anonymous, expressed their frustration with the university's handling of the situation. They stated, "It's great that they are offering some support now, but it shouldn't have taken this long for them to acknowledge our struggles. I hope they will continue to listen to our concerns and make further changes to help us out." Despite the mixed reactions, the University of Nottingham has emphasized their commitment to supporting students during these challenging times. They have encouraged students to reach out for assistance if needed and have promised to continue monitoring the situation to ensure that all students are being properly supported. As students continue to navigate these uncertain times, it is clear that the support and assistance provided by the university will be crucial in helping them overcome the challenges they face. The University of Nottingham's response to the rent protests is a positive step towards addressing the concerns of students and working towards a more equitable solution for all involved.

title: Covid anxiety: Child 'asking if he's going to die'
text: By Sarah Easedale BBC Wales news  Jane Griffiths, 47, said her four children had all been affected by the stress of the coronavirus pandemic. It comes as no surprise that children's mental health has been deeply impacted by the uncertainties brought about by Covid-19. One of Griffiths' sons, Jack, 10, recently startled her with a question that no parent wants to hear. "Mom, am I going to die?" Jack asked as he looked up at his mother with wide, fearful eyes. Jane's heart sank at the gravity of his question. She knew that her son must have been feeling overwhelmed by the constant news reports of rising Covid-19 cases and deaths. Seeing the distress in her son's eyes, Jane took a deep breath and knelt down to his level. She gently reassured him that he was safe and that she would do everything in her power to protect him. She explained that while the virus was a serious threat, they were taking all the necessary precautions to keep their family healthy. Despite her best efforts to calm Jack's fears, Jane couldn't shake the feeling of helplessness that had taken hold of her. She knew that her son's question was just the tip of the iceberg when it came to the anxiety children across the globe were facing due to the pandemic. Child psychologists have noted a significant increase in anxiety among children as they try to make sense of the changes brought about by the pandemic. The disruption to their routines, the isolation from their friends, and the constant fear of getting sick have all contributed to a rise in mental health issues among young people. As Jane tried to navigate her way through the maze of uncertainty, she made a conscious effort to create a sense of normalcy for her children. She dedicated more time to family activities, encouraged open conversations about their feelings, and sought professional help when needed. While the road ahead was filled with challenges, Jane was determined to be a source of strength and support for her children. She knew that the road to recovery from the mental scars left by the pandemic would be long and arduous, but she was willing to do whatever it took to ensure the well-being of her family. As Jack clung to his mother's hand, a sense of peace washed over Jane. In that moment, she realized that in the face of uncertainty and fear, the strongest weapon she had was the love she shared with her children. And with that love as her guide, she knew that they would weather the storm together, no matter what challenges lay ahead.

title: Power at Fukushima nuclear fuel ponds restored
text: A power cut shut down cooling systems for four spent fuel ponds at reactors 1, 3, and 4 on Monday evening, although cooling to the reactors themselves was not affected. All cooling systems at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant were restored on Tuesday morning after a power outage caused by a problem with an electrical transformer. The power cut occurred when a worker accidentally cut off the power supply to the plant while carrying out maintenance work. This resulted in the loss of power to the cooling systems for the spent fuel ponds, which are used to store spent nuclear fuel rods. The loss of power to the cooling systems raised concerns about the safety of the spent fuel ponds, as without adequate cooling, the fuel rods could overheat and potentially lead to a meltdown. However, authorities at the plant were quick to assure the public that the reactors themselves were not at risk, as they have their own backup cooling systems in place. The restoration of power to the cooling systems was a relief to many, as the potential consequences of a prolonged power outage at the plant could have been catastrophic. The Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant is still dealing with the aftermath of the 2011 nuclear disaster, when a massive earthquake and tsunami led to multiple meltdowns and releases of radioactive material. Since then, the plant has undergone extensive cleanup and decommissioning efforts, but the site remains a reminder of the dangers of nuclear power and the importance of safety precautions. The recent power outage serves as a stark reminder of the fragility of the systems in place to ensure the safety of the plant and the surrounding area. Authorities at the plant have pledged to investigate the cause of the power outage and take steps to prevent a similar incident from occurring in the future. They have also assured the public that there was no release of radioactive material as a result of the power cut, and that the situation is now under control. Despite the scare caused by the power cut, the Fukushima Daiichi plant continues to operate, providing electricity to the surrounding area. The restoration of power to the cooling systems for the spent fuel ponds is a testament to the resilience and dedication of the workers at the plant, who are committed to ensuring the safety and security of the facility. The incident serves as a reminder of the ongoing challenges faced by the Fukushima Daiichi plant, as it continues its long road to recovery from the 2011 disaster. It also highlights the importance of robust safety measures and emergency protocols to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.

title: Demon dog Black Shuck celebrated in graphic novel
text: By Nic Rigby BBC News, East Mark Allard-Will is writing the book about Black Shuck - who is said to have terrorised churchgoers in East Anglia during the medieval period. The graphic novel is set to bring the legend of the demon dog to a new audience, offering a fresh perspective on this centuries-old tale of horror and fear. Black Shuck, a large black dog with fiery red eyes, is said to roam the countryside, appearing as an omen of death to those unlucky enough to encounter him. Allard-Will's retelling of the story aims to capture the essence of the legend while imbuing it with a modern twist. The graphic novel will not only showcase the dog's terrifying antics but also explore the psychological impact of superstition and folklore on a community. "It's fascinating to delve into the history of Black Shuck and examine how this myth has endured over the centuries," said Allard-Will. "I hope to bring a fresh perspective to the story, shedding new light on this enigmatic creature and its significance in East Anglian folklore." Black Shuck's legend has inspired countless tales of terror and cautionary stories throughout the region. People have recounted encounters with the demon dog, describing his ghostly howls and chilling presence that foretells a grim fate. The graphic novel promises to delve into the darker aspects of the legend, exploring the fears and anxieties that underpin the tale of Black Shuck. It will offer readers a chance to confront their own fears and superstitions while immersing themselves in the rich tapestry of East Anglian folklore. Allard-Will's meticulous research and attention to detail are evident in the vivid illustrations and compelling narrative of the graphic novel. The dog's malevolent gaze and ominous presence are rendered with a striking realism that brings the legend to life on the page. As the story unfolds, readers will be transported back in time to a world where superstition and fear held sway over the hearts and minds of the populace. Black Shuck's shadowy figure looms large in the narrative, a spectral presence that evokes primal terror and awe. The graphic novel is set to be a thrilling and immersive experience, offering readers a chance to explore the dark side of folklore and myth. Allard-Will's innovative take on the legend of Black Shuck promises to captivate audiences and reignite interest in this enduring tale of horror and mystery.

title: Macedonia parliament votes to start name change process
text: finalized, but this initial vote is a significant step towards resolving a longstanding dispute with Greece. The name change has been a contentious issue for decades, dating back to Macedonia's independence from Yugoslavia in 1991. Greece has long objected to the country being called "Macedonia," arguing that it implies territorial claims to the northern Greek region of the same name. This dispute has led to Greece blocking Macedonia's efforts to join NATO and the European Union, hindering the country's path to Euro-Atlantic integration. The historic vote in the Macedonian parliament comes after years of negotiations between the two countries and intense domestic debate within Macedonia itself. Supporters of the name change argue that it is necessary to secure the country's future and open up opportunities for economic and political development. Critics, on the other hand, view it as a concession to Greece and a betrayal of Macedonian identity. Prime Minister Zoran Zaev, who has championed the name change as part of his government's reform agenda, hailed the parliamentary vote as a victory for the country. "Today is a historic day for Macedonia," he declared. "We have shown that we are responsible and mature politicians who can put the interests of the country above all else." The process of changing the country's name to North Macedonia is expected to unfold over the coming months, with constitutional amendments and a referendum planned to confirm the decision. If successful, this move could pave the way for Macedonia to finally join NATO and the EU, bringing an end to years of isolation and uncertainty. Greece has welcomed the parliamentary vote as a positive development, with Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras expressing hope that it will lead to improved relations between the two countries. "This is a courageous decision that will benefit both Macedonia and Greece," he stated. "I am confident that we can now move forward towards a more positive future together." While the road ahead is still uncertain, with potential challenges and obstacles to overcome, the vote in the Macedonian parliament marks a significant milestone in the country's efforts to resolve the name dispute with Greece. It represents a bold and decisive step towards a more stable and prosperous future for Macedonia, signaling a new era of cooperation and partnership in the region.

title: What has the UK accomplished in Afghanistan?
text: of "Mission Accomplished" in 2003. Since then, the focus of Western military efforts has shifted towards Afghanistan, where the UK has played a significant role in the NATO-led mission to support the Afghan government and combat insurgents. Over the past two decades, British troops have been deployed to Afghanistan in support of both combat and training missions. The UK's military involvement in the country has been marked by both successes and challenges, as coalition forces have sought to stabilize the region and build up the capacity of the Afghan security forces. One of the key accomplishments of the UK in Afghanistan has been its role in helping to degrade the capabilities of the Taliban and other insurgent groups. British forces have been involved in numerous operations aimed at targeting and dismantling insurgent networks, as well as training and advising Afghan security forces to take on a greater role in counter-insurgency operations. In addition to its combat efforts, the UK has also played a crucial role in supporting development and reconstruction efforts in Afghanistan. British aid has helped to fund projects aimed at improving infrastructure, healthcare, and education in the country, as well as providing training and support to government institutions. Despite these efforts, the situation in Afghanistan remains complex and challenging. The security situation in the country remains fragile, with insurgent attacks continuing to pose a threat to both Afghan civilians and coalition forces. The Taliban, in particular, has proven to be a resilient and adaptive foe, able to regroup and launch attacks even after suffering territorial losses. The UK's military presence in Afghanistan has also come at a cost. Over the course of the conflict, British forces have suffered significant casualties, with hundreds of troops losing their lives in the line of duty. The human toll of the conflict has been immense, both for the families of the fallen and for the veterans who have returned home with physical and psychological scars. As the UK prepares to withdraw its remaining troops from Afghanistan, the focus is now shifting towards supporting the Afghan government and security forces to take on a greater role in securing the country. The hope is that the progress made over the past two decades will endure, and that Afghanistan will be able to build a more stable and prosperous future for its people. In conclusion, the UK has accomplished a great deal in Afghanistan over the past two decades, from degrading insurgent capabilities to supporting development and reconstruction efforts. However, the challenges facing the country remain significant, and the road ahead will not be easy. The legacy of the UK's involvement in Afghanistan will be one of sacrifice, determination, and a commitment to supporting the Afghan people in their quest for peace and stability.

title: New prostate therapy recommended on NHS
text: procedure is effective in treating symptoms of an enlarged prostate, also known as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) has recommended this new therapy to be offered on the NHS as an option for men with BPH. BPH is a common condition in older men, where the prostate gland becomes enlarged and can cause urinary problems such as frequent urination, difficulty in starting or maintaining a urine stream, and a feeling of not completely emptying the bladder. It can have a significant impact on a man's quality of life, leading to discomfort and embarrassment. Traditional treatments for BPH include medications to relax the muscles of the prostate and surgery to remove part of the gland. However, these options may come with side effects or risks that some men may want to avoid. Prostate artery embolisation offers a less invasive alternative that can provide relief from symptoms without the need for major surgery. During the procedure, a catheter is inserted into an artery in the groin and advanced to the blood vessels that supply the prostate. The tiny beads are then injected into these vessels, blocking the blood flow to the prostate and causing the overgrown tissue to shrink. The procedure is typically performed under local anesthesia and most men can return home the same day. Studies have shown that prostate artery embolisation can significantly improve urinary symptoms in men with BPH, reducing the need for frequent trips to the bathroom and improving the flow of urine. It has also been found to have a low risk of complications, making it a safe option for many patients. Professor Mark Smith, from NICE, stated, "Prostate artery embolisation is a promising new treatment for BPH that can provide relief from symptoms without the need for major surgery. We have reviewed the evidence and are pleased to recommend this therapy to be offered on the NHS, giving men another choice in managing their condition." Patients considering prostate artery embolisation should discuss with their healthcare providers to determine if they are suitable candidates for the procedure. It is important to weigh the potential benefits and risks to make an informed decision about the best treatment option for one's individual needs.

title: Trump petition: Areas most opposed to US President's visit
text: By Daniel Wainwright BBC News The petition on the Parliament website passed one million signatures earlier and will now be debated by MPs. It came amid growing opposition to US President Donald Trump's state visit to the UK.  The areas showing the strongest resistance to President Trump's visit are predominately urban areas with diverse populations. Cities like London, Manchester, and Birmingham have seen high levels of signatures on the petition, reflecting the widespread disapproval of Trump's policies and controversial statements. London, the capital, has led the way in opposition to Trump's visit, with over 100,000 signatures coming from residents in the city. Mayor Sadiq Khan has been vocal in his criticism of the US President, calling him divisive and dangerous. The multicultural and liberal population of London has been highly vocal in their objection to Trump's visit, citing his stance on immigration, climate change, and human rights as reasons for their opposition. In Manchester, a city known for its progressive values and history of activism, thousands have added their names to the petition in protest of Trump's visit. The Northern city has a strong tradition of standing up to injustice, and many feel that Trump's policies go against the values of equality and inclusion that they hold dear. Birmingham, the second-largest city in the UK, has also seen a significant number of signatures on the petition. The diverse population of the city, made up of people from all backgrounds and walks of life, has united in their rejection of Trump's visit. Many residents feel that Trump's inflammatory rhetoric and divisive policies have no place in a city that prides itself on its multiculturalism and tolerance. While urban areas have shown the most opposition to Trump's visit, there are pockets of support for the President in more rural and conservative areas of the UK. Some residents in these regions feel that Trump's tough stance on issues like immigration and national security make him a strong leader, despite his controversial remarks. As the petition heads to Parliament for debate, MPs will have to consider the strong feelings of the British public on both sides of the issue. The outcome of the debate remains uncertain, but one thing is clear - President Trump's visit to the UK is already a divisive and contentious issue, sparking debate and protest across the country.

title: China and US 'agree North Korea nuclear test measures'
text: Council within the next few days. The resolution would impose strict sanctions on North Korea in response to its recent nuclear tests, which have escalated tensions in the region. The agreement between China and the US is seen as a positive step towards addressing the growing threat posed by North Korea's nuclear program. Both countries have been working closely to find a diplomatic solution to the crisis, and the latest development is a sign of progress in their efforts. The proposed resolution is expected to include measures such as a ban on the export of coal, iron, and other key resources from North Korea, as well as restrictions on its access to the international financial system. These sanctions are designed to put pressure on the reclusive state and compel it to abandon its nuclear ambitions. While the details of the resolution are still being finalized, diplomats are hopeful that it will receive widespread support from other members of the Security Council. Russia, another key player in the region, has expressed its willingness to cooperate with the US and China on this issue, indicating a growing consensus on the need to address the North Korean threat. The situation on the Korean peninsula has been increasingly volatile in recent months, with North Korea conducting a series of missile tests and a sixth nuclear test in defiance of international sanctions. The reclusive state's leader, Kim Jong-un, has shown no signs of backing down, raising fears of a potential military confrontation. The agreement between China and the US is a significant development in the ongoing efforts to defuse the crisis and prevent further escalation. Both countries have stressed the importance of finding a peaceful solution to the North Korean issue, and their cooperation is seen as crucial in achieving that goal. As the draft resolution is presented to the Security Council for consideration, all eyes will be on how other members of the international community respond. The situation in North Korea remains fluid and unpredictable, and it is essential for the global community to stand united in its response to the growing threat posed by the reclusive state. China and the US are hopeful that the proposed sanctions will send a strong message to North Korea and compel it to change course. However, the ultimate success of the resolution will depend on the willingness of all parties to enforce the measures and work together towards a lasting solution to the crisis.

title: Removing school bus chaperones in Birmingham 'dangerous'
text: Some pupils who used the free council bus service with guides to the Wilson Stuart School in Birmingham were told they did not need it. Parent Heidi Wells said her 15-year-old disabled son could choke on his saliva without a chaperone present. The decision to remove chaperones from the school bus service has left many parents concerned about the safety of their children, especially those with disabilities or special needs. The chaperones played a crucial role in ensuring that vulnerable students made it to school safely and without any incidents. They provided support, assistance, and supervision during the bus journey, which gave parents peace of mind knowing that their children were in good hands. Heidi Wells expressed her frustration with the sudden change, stating that her son's safety was her top priority. She explained how her son relied on the chaperone for help with his disability, including the risk of choking on his saliva. Without the presence of a chaperone, she feared that her son would be at risk of harm or injury. Other parents have also voiced their concerns, citing the importance of having a dedicated adult on board to ensure the well-being of students. The chaperones not only provided physical assistance but also emotional support for students who may have anxiety or other special needs. By removing them from the bus service, the council has left many families feeling vulnerable and worried about the future. In response to the backlash, a spokesperson for the local council stated that the decision to remove chaperones was made due to budget constraints and a lack of resources. They claimed that the bus service could still safely transport students to school without the need for additional support. However, parents argue that the council's cost-cutting measures should not come at the expense of student safety. The controversy surrounding the removal of chaperones highlights the ongoing challenges faced by families with children who have disabilities. It raises questions about the responsibilities of schools and councils in ensuring the safety and well-being of all students, regardless of their individual needs. As the debate continues, parents like Heidi Wells are left grappling with the uncertainty of how to best protect their children in an increasingly complex and demanding educational system. The fate of the chaperones may be uncertain, but one thing is clear – the safety of students should always be the top priority.

title: Climate change: May was sunniest calendar month on record in UK
text: By Roger Harrabin BBC environment analyst The UK enjoyed 266 hours of sunshine in May - surpassing the previous record of 265 hours in June 1957. And it is even more extraordinary when considering the context of climate change.  While many may see the sunny weather as a positive outcome, there is growing concern among scientists and environmentalists about the impact of such unusual weather patterns on the planet. Climate change is causing disruptions to weather systems worldwide, leading to more frequent and extreme weather events. The record-breaking sunshine in May is just another example of how climate change is reshaping our world. It may seem harmless, even pleasant, to have sunny days and warm temperatures, but the long-term consequences can be devastating. Rising global temperatures are melting ice caps, causing sea levels to rise, and leading to more frequent and severe heatwaves, droughts, and storms. In the UK, the sunny weather in May led to concerns about drought and water shortages, as the lack of rainfall combined with high temperatures dried up reservoirs and depleted water supplies. Farmers also faced challenges as crops struggled to survive in the intense heat, leading to concerns about food shortages and price hikes. The record-breaking sunshine in May also had a significant impact on wildlife and ecosystems. Plants and animals that rely on specific weather conditions to thrive may struggle to adapt to the changing climate, leading to declines in populations and disruptions to entire ecosystems. The UK's biodiversity is already under threat from habitat loss, pollution, and other human activities, and climate change is exacerbating these threats. As we continue to break records for sunshine, temperatures, and other weather-related phenomena, it is essential that we take action to mitigate the impacts of climate change. Governments, businesses, and individuals all have a role to play in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, transitioning to renewable energy sources, and adapting to the changing climate. The sunny weather in May may have brought smiles to many faces, but it serves as a stark reminder of the urgent need to address climate change. We cannot afford to sit back and enjoy the sunshine while the planet suffers. It is time to act decisively to protect our world for future generations.

title: Child sex abuse live streams loophole to be closed
text: to 14 years in prison. The government's announcement comes after a series of high-profile cases where perpetrators have used live streaming platforms to broadcast horrific acts of child abuse in real-time. This loophole has allowed offenders to evade prosecution, as current legislation only covers the distribution of pre-recorded material. Justice Minister, Sarah Johnson, stated, "We cannot allow this loophole to continue enabling individuals to exploit vulnerable children for their own gratification. The proposed changes will bring the law up-to-date with the reality of how these crimes are being committed in the digital age." Under the proposed legislation, individuals who livestream child abuse material could face a maximum sentence of up to 14 years in prison. In addition, those found guilty could also be placed on the sex offenders register, preventing them from working with children in the future. The move has been widely welcomed by child protection organizations, with many calling it a necessary step in combating online child sexual exploitation. An NSPCC spokesperson stated, "Live streaming of abuse is a particularly insidious form of exploitation that requires urgent action. This change in the law will send a strong message to perpetrators that they will be held accountable for their heinous crimes." In a recent case that sparked public outrage, a man in his 30s was able to livestream the sexual assault of a young child for over an hour before being caught by authorities. Despite the evidence of his heinous act, he was only charged with possessing indecent images of children, as the live streaming aspect fell into a legal gray area. The proposed legislation aims to close this loophole and ensure that individuals who engage in live streaming child abuse material are held accountable for their actions. By bringing the law into line with the technology used by offenders, the government hopes to provide better protection for vulnerable children and punish those who seek to exploit them for their own gain. While the proposed changes have been met with widespread support, some legal experts have raised concerns about the potential implications for freedom of speech and the regulation of online content. However, Justice Minister Sarah Johnson has emphasized that the primary focus is on protecting children from harm and ensuring that those who engage in such despicable acts are brought to justice. The government's commitment to closing the live streaming loophole is a significant step forward in the fight against online child sexual exploitation. With these proposed changes, the UK is sending a clear message that those who seek to exploit vulnerable children will be held accountable for their crimes.

title: Trump aide Michael Flynn Jnr out after 'Pizzagate' tweets
text: Michael Flynn, 33, left the US president-elect's transition team on Tuesday following his tweets about the so-called Pizzagate fake news story. His father, Michael Flynn Snr, Mr Trump's pick to be US national security adviser, has also been embroiled in controversy surrounding the incident. The Pizzagate conspiracy theory suggests that a pizzeria in Washington DC is the center of a child sex ring involving top Democrats, including Hillary Clinton. Despite being widely debunked, the theory has gained traction on social media and alt-right websites. Flynn Jnr, who served as his father's chief of staff, took to Twitter to defend the conspiracy theory, claiming that the mainstream media was covering up the truth. His tweets, which included references to "#Pizzagate," sparked outrage and disbelief among many, leading to calls for his dismissal. In response, the Trump transition team announced that Flynn Jnr was no longer a part of the team, citing his inappropriate and unacceptable behavior. The controversy surrounding the Flynns and the Pizzagate conspiracy theory has raised concerns about the influence of fake news and misinformation in the current political climate. Many critics argue that the proliferation of false information on social media platforms has led to a dangerous erosion of trust in established institutions and the spread of dangerous conspiracy theories. In a statement, Flynn Jnr expressed regret for his actions and apologized for any harm he may have caused. He admitted that his tweets were a "distraction" and that he did not intend to spread false information. Despite his apology, many remain skeptical of his motives and the impact of his actions on public discourse. Meanwhile, Michael Flynn Snr continues to face scrutiny over his own ties to controversial figures and his past statements. His appointment as national security adviser has sparked debate over his fitness for the role, with critics pointing to his history of divisive rhetoric and close ties to Russia. The elder Flynn has also been accused of spreading misinformation and engaging in conspiracy theories, further fueling concerns about his judgment and credibility. As the Trump administration prepares to take office, the controversy surrounding the Flynns serves as a reminder of the challenges and pitfalls of navigating the complex intersection of politics, social media, and fake news. The incident highlights the importance of critical thinking and media literacy in an era marked by the rapid spread of information and the blurring of lines between fact and fiction. Only time will tell how the new administration will address these challenges and work to rebuild trust in the face of widespread misinformation.

title: Yardie actor on Idris Elba proposal: I had tears in my eyes
text: By Hannah Moore Newsbeat reporter The 21-year-old has said he was already overwhelmed with emotion to be at the screening of Yardie. But when Idris Elba got down on one knee and proposed to his girlfriend Sabrina Dhowre during the film's premiere, the young actor had tears in his eyes. "It was such a beautiful moment," he said, wiping away the tears that had started to fall. "I couldn't help but feel so happy for them. Idris is not only a talented actor but also a great person, and seeing him so in love just filled my heart with joy." The rising star, who plays a key role in Yardie, described the proposal as a "dream come true" moment. "To witness something so special in person was truly unforgettable," he added. He went on to praise Elba for his professionalism and guiding presence on set. "Idris is a true mentor and a role model for young actors like myself. Working with him was an incredible learning experience, and I am grateful for the opportunity to be a part of Yardie." The young actor's performance in the film has been widely praised by critics and audiences alike, with many commenting on his raw and authentic portrayal of his character. "It was a challenging role, but one that I was eager to take on," he said. "I wanted to do justice to the story and the character, and I am proud of the work we did on Yardie." As he continues to gain recognition for his work, the actor remains humble and focused on honing his craft. "I am grateful for every opportunity that comes my way, and I am committed to pushing myself as an actor and storyteller," he said. With Yardie receiving critical acclaim and generating buzz in the industry, the young actor's career is on an upward trajectory. He has already lined up several exciting projects, including a lead role in a new drama series and a supporting role in a highly anticipated film. "I am excited for what the future holds and grateful for the support of my fans and the industry," he said. "I hope to continue to challenge myself and grow as an artist, and I am eager to see where this journey takes me." As he looks ahead to the next chapter of his career, the young actor remains grounded and grateful for the opportunities that have come his way. With talent, determination, and humility on his side, there's no doubt that he will continue to make waves in the industry for years to come.

title: Jimmy Carr faces crowd after tax furore
text: Carr has been widely condemned for taking part in a tax avoidance scheme. In response to a heckler who called him a "tax dodger", he replied: "I've got to take that, I'm here to entertain you, not to be liked." The comedian found himself facing a crowd that was clearly divided on the issue, with some fans sticking by him while others expressed disappointment and anger. The controversy surrounding Carr's tax affairs began when it was revealed that he had invested in a scheme that allowed him to pay as little as one percent tax on his earnings. This news sparked outrage among many people, who accused him of hypocrisy for making jokes about tax avoidance on stage while benefiting from such schemes in real life. Despite the backlash, Carr seemed unapologetic during his latest stand-up show, where he addressed the issue head-on. "I understand why people are upset, but let's not pretend that tax avoidance is something only done by the super-rich. We all try to pay as little tax as possible, it's human nature," he said. His comments did little to appease his critics, who continued to heckle and boo him throughout the performance. Some audience members even walked out in protest, leaving Carr to deal with a hostile crowd for the rest of the night. Despite the negative response, there were still some fans who stood by Carr, praising his honesty and ability to confront the issue with humor. "I may not agree with what he did, but I appreciate his willingness to address the situation openly. At least he's not trying to hide from it," said one supporter. As the show came to an end, Carr thanked the audience for their mixed reactions and promised to reflect on his actions. "I know I've made mistakes and upset a lot of people. I'm sorry for that, and I'll do my best to make amends," he said. The controversy surrounding Jimmy Carr's tax affairs is likely to continue in the coming days, as more people weigh in on the issue and the comedian faces further scrutiny. Only time will tell if he is able to repair his public image and regain the trust of his fans.

title: Files released on 1974 'Welsh Roswell'

title: Amnesty calls for GCHQ spying inquiry
