The screenplay has been written by acclaimed screenwriter Paul Laverty, known for his work on films such as 'I, Daniel Blake' and 'The Wind that Shakes the Barley'. The Stone Roses, one of the most iconic bands of the era, have given their blessing to the project, with frontman Ian Brown stating that he is excited to see their story told on the big screen. The film will feature a mix of new actors and established talent, with casting currently underway. Speaking at the Cannes Film Festival, director Andrea Arnold expressed her enthusiasm for the project, noting that the music of The Stone Roses was a key influence on her own work. "Their music captures a moment in time that was truly special, and I am honored to be able to bring their story to life on screen," she said. The film will explore the band's rise to fame, their struggles with fame and internal conflicts, and their triumphant reunion in 2012 after a 16-year hiatus. It will also delve into the vibrant music scene of Manchester in the late 1980s, with iconic venues such as The Haçienda playing a central role in the narrative. BBC Films head Rose Garnett described the project as a "passion project" for everyone involved, noting that the band's music continues to resonate with audiences around the world. "The Stone Roses were more than just a band – they were a cultural phenomenon that defined an era," she said. "We are thrilled to be working with them to bring their story to the screen." The film is expected to begin shooting later this year, with a release date set for 2023. In the meantime, fans of The Stone Roses can look forward to a new documentary about the band, which is also in the works. Overall, the film promises to be a fitting tribute to one of the most influential bands of the 1980s, capturing the spirit of their music and the zeitgeist of the era. With the band's blessing and a talented creative team behind the project, audiences can expect a powerful and authentic portrayal of The Stone Roses' journey from obscurity to superstardom.

title: There's now a word for nails on a blackboard - but it's not in English
text: By Sarah Tijou Newsbeat reporter It's a word to describe the feeling we get when we hear the sound of fingernails on a chalkboard, or a knife scratching a plate. Now, thanks to researchers from Newcastle University in the UK and the Max Planck Institute in Germany, there is a word for that specific feeling - "grima". The researchers describe "grima" as a sensation of disgust or repulsion triggered by certain sounds. It is not just limited to the sound of nails on a chalkboard, but also extends to other sounds that we find unpleasant or irritating. The word "grima" comes from the Spanish language, where it means "to annoy" or "to repel". According to the study published in the Journal of Neuroscience, the sound of "grima" triggers a physical response in our bodies. The researchers conducted experiments where they played different sounds to participants while monitoring their skin conductance response. They found that the sound of "grima" caused a significant increase in skin conductance, indicating a strong physiological reaction to the sound. So why do certain sounds like nails on a chalkboard evoke such a strong negative reaction in us? The researchers believe that it may be related to our evolutionary history. Sounds like nails on a chalkboard or a knife scratching a plate may resemble the warning calls of animals or predators, triggering a fight or flight response in us. But "grima" is not just limited to sounds - it can also be triggered by visual or tactile stimuli. For example, the sight of someone scratching their nails on a chalkboard or the feeling of touching certain textures may also evoke the sensation of "grima". This suggests that the feeling of disgust or repulsion is a multi-sensory experience that involves different parts of our brain. The researchers hope that by identifying and naming this specific feeling, we may be able to better understand how our brains process and respond to unpleasant stimuli. This could have implications for treating conditions like misophonia, a disorder characterized by a strong aversion to certain sounds. So the next time you hear the sound of nails on a chalkboard and cringe, just remember that there is a word for that feeling - "grima". And with this newfound knowledge, perhaps we can learn to better cope with the unpleasant sounds that inevitably surround us in our daily lives.

title: Bowie: Every tour and studio album
text: He was a prolific writer, toured extensively and released his last album days before he died. We take a look at the David Bowie's career in numbers - from world tours to studio albums. Bowie embarked on numerous tours throughout his career, starting with his early days in the 1960s all the way up to his final tour in 2004. He traveled the globe, captivating audiences with his electrifying performances and innovative stage presence. Over the course of his career, Bowie completed a total of 26 tours, with some spanning multiple years and continents. One of Bowie's most iconic tours was the "Ziggy Stardust" tour in 1972-1973, which solidified his status as a music legend. The tour featured elaborate costumes, theatrical performances, and a bold visual aesthetic that pushed the boundaries of conventional rock shows. Bowie's ability to fully immerse himself in his characters and personas on stage set him apart from his peers and solidified his reputation as a true artist. In addition to his extensive touring schedule, Bowie released a total of 27 studio albums throughout his career. Each album showcased his remarkable talent for songwriting and his ability to constantly push the boundaries of musical genres. From the glam-rock era of the 1970s to the experimental electronic sounds of the 1990s, Bowie's discography is a testament to his versatility and creative genius. One of Bowie's most critically acclaimed albums is "The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars," released in 1972. The album tells the story of an alien rock star named Ziggy Stardust and features some of Bowie's most iconic songs, including "Starman" and "Suffragette City." The album is considered a landmark in the history of rock music and has influenced countless artists in the decades since its release. Bowie's final album, "Blackstar," was released on January 8, 2016, just two days before his death. The album, which was met with widespread critical acclaim, showcased Bowie's continued willingness to experiment and push artistic boundaries even in his final days. "Blackstar" features jazz-infused arrangements, experimental production techniques, and deeply introspective lyrics that reflect Bowie's own mortality and legacy. In total, David Bowie's career spanned over five decades and left an indelible mark on the music industry. His innovative approach to music, fearless experimentation, and boundless creativity have inspired generations of artists and fans alike. Bowie's legacy continues to grow and evolve, cementing his status as one of the greatest musicians of all time.

title: Wrexham custody conditions criticised, amid praise
text: other parts of the country were generally praised for their cleanliness and appropriate living conditions. The report highlighted the importance of ensuring that all detainees are treated humanely and with respect, regardless of the reason for their detention. In response to the criticism, the Wrexham custody suite has pledged to make improvements to address the issues raised in the report. This includes increasing the frequency of cleaning, providing better access to toilet facilities, and updating the overall living conditions for detainees. The aim is to create a more comfortable and dignified environment for those in custody, while also ensuring that their rights are upheld. Despite the concerns raised in the report, there were also positive aspects highlighted in relation to the custodial staff at Wrexham. The report commended the professionalism and dedication of the staff, as well as their commitment to the welfare of the detainees. It was noted that the staff were attentive and responsive to the needs of the detainees, and worked hard to ensure their safety and well-being. Overall, while there is room for improvement in the conditions at the Wrexham custody suite, there is also recognition of the efforts being made by the staff to provide a good standard of care for detainees. The report serves as a reminder of the importance of proper oversight and monitoring of custodial facilities, to ensure that all detainees are treated fairly and with dignity. Moving forward, it is crucial that the recommendations outlined in the report are implemented swiftly and effectively, to address the issues identified and to improve the overall conditions at the Wrexham custody suite. This will require cooperation and collaboration between all stakeholders involved, including the custodial staff, management, oversight bodies, and local authorities. In conclusion, while the criticisms of the Wrexham custody conditions are concerning, there is also recognition of the positive work being done by staff to support the welfare of detainees. By working together to address the issues outlined in the report, the goal is to create a safe, clean, and respectful environment for all detainees in custody, in line with best practices and human rights standards.

title: Met office says 2016 'very likely' to be warmest on record
text: By Matt McGrathEnvironment correspondent This year has already been provisionally declared the warmest on record thanks to a combination of global warming and a strong El Nino. The Met Office believes that temperatures in 2016 could exceed previous records, making it very likely to be the warmest year since records began.  The impact of climate change on global temperatures has been evident in recent years, with 2014 and 2015 also breaking temperature records. The effects of rising temperatures are being felt across the globe, with increased incidences of extreme weather events such as heatwaves, droughts, and storms.  Scientists warn that if global temperatures continue to rise at the current rate, the consequences could be catastrophic. Rising sea levels, changing weather patterns, and impacts on food security are just some of the potential consequences of unchecked climate change.  The 2015 Paris Agreement saw countries around the world commit to taking action to limit global temperature increases to well below 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels. However, experts warn that more needs to be done to meet these targets and avoid the worst impacts of climate change.  In a statement, the Met Office said, "The evidence is clear - 2016 is very likely to be the warmest year on record. This is a stark reminder of the urgent need for action on climate change."  Governments, businesses, and individuals all have a role to play in reducing greenhouse gas emissions and transitioning to a low-carbon economy. Investments in renewable energy, energy efficiency, and sustainable transportation are essential to meeting climate targets and ensuring a sustainable future for all.  The Met Office's announcement serves as a wake-up call for all stakeholders to redouble their efforts in combating climate change. The time to act is now if we are to avoid the worst impacts of global warming and preserve the planet for future generations.  As we approach the end of the year, all eyes will be on the final temperature data to confirm whether 2016 did indeed break records. Regardless of the outcome, one thing is clear - the need for action on climate change has never been more pressing. It is up to all of us to take responsibility for our actions and work towards a more sustainable future for all.

title: Blood test 'detects cancer relapse'
text: By James Gallagher Health editor, BBC News website Scientists at the Institute of Cancer Research in London found traces of breast cancer eight months before doctors would have normally detected it using a new blood test. The groundbreaking study, published in the journal Nature Communication, highlights the potential of liquid biopsies as a non-invasive and sensitive method for tracking cancer progression. The blood test, known as a circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA) assay, can detect small amounts of tumor-derived DNA circulating in the bloodstream. By analyzing this DNA, researchers can identify mutations unique to the cancer cells and monitor how the tumor is evolving over time. In the study, the researchers analyzed blood samples from 55 breast cancer patients receiving treatment to see if the ctDNA assay could detect early signs of cancer relapse. They found that in 81% of cases, the test was able to detect the presence of ctDNA up to eight months before the cancer showed any clinical signs. Dr. Nicholas Turner, professor of molecular oncology at the Institute of Cancer Research and lead author of the study, said, "These results are incredibly promising and suggest that liquid biopsies have the potential to revolutionize the way we monitor and treat cancer. By detecting cancer relapse earlier, we can intervene sooner and potentially improve outcomes for patients." Currently, cancer relapse is typically detected through imaging scans and monitoring of symptoms, which can be time-consuming, expensive, and less accurate. Liquid biopsies offer a less invasive and more sensitive approach to monitoring cancer progression, allowing doctors to tailor treatment plans based on real-time information about the tumor's genetic makeup. The success of the ctDNA assay in detecting early signs of cancer relapse has opened up new possibilities for using liquid biopsies in clinical practice. Researchers are now investigating how the test could be used to monitor other types of cancer, track treatment response, and identify drug-resistant mutations. Dr. Turner added, "Liquid biopsies have the potential to transform the way we manage cancer, offering a more personalized and dynamic approach to treatment. While there is still work to be done to optimize the technology and validate its clinical utility, these findings represent a significant step forward in the fight against cancer." As the field of liquid biopsies continues to advance, researchers are hopeful that these non-invasive tests could one day become a routine part of cancer care, enabling earlier detection, more targeted treatments, and improved outcomes for patients.

title: Extra £40m for green spaces in England, Boris Johnson pledges
text: By Roger HarrabinBBC environment analyst The government says the cash will fund thousands of jobs in conservation. The prime minister also promised new national parks and greater protections for England’s iconic landscapes. Environmentalists have welcomed the pledge, but some are cautious about how the money will be allocated and whether it will be enough to address the various challenges facing green spaces in the country. The extra funding comes at a critical time when England’s green spaces are under increasing pressure from development, pollution, and climate change. The government’s promise to create new national parks is a positive step towards preserving and protecting these vital areas for future generations. However, it is essential that these new parks are designated in strategic locations to ensure they have the maximum impact in terms of conservation and biodiversity. In addition to creating new national parks, the government must also focus on improving the protection of existing green spaces. Many of England’s iconic landscapes are currently at risk from a range of threats, including urban sprawl, intensive agriculture, and invasive species. Greater protections are needed to safeguard these areas and ensure they can continue to support biodiversity and provide vital ecosystem services. The pledge to fund thousands of jobs in conservation is a welcome development, as it will not only help to protect and restore green spaces but also create much-needed employment opportunities. Conservation work plays a crucial role in safeguarding biodiversity, mitigating climate change, and enhancing the resilience of ecosystems. By investing in conservation jobs, the government can support a green economic recovery and help to build a more sustainable future for England’s green spaces. However, it is vital that the government ensures the funding is targeted effectively and reaches those areas most in need of support. Local communities, conservation organizations, and other stakeholders must be involved in decision-making processes to ensure that the money is spent wisely and achieves meaningful results on the ground. Overall, the government’s pledge of an extra £40m for green spaces in England is a positive step towards safeguarding the country’s iconic landscapes and supporting conservation efforts. By investing in new national parks, creating jobs in conservation, and enhancing protections for green spaces, the government can help to build a more sustainable future for England’s precious natural heritage. It is now crucial that the government follows through on its promises and works closely with stakeholders to ensure that the funding is used effectively to address the pressing environmental challenges facing the country.

title: David Walliams a 'challenge' to work with in Doctor Who
text: set when Walliams was on set. Speaking to the BBC, she said, "David Walliams is such a brilliant actor, but he definitely brought a unique challenge to the Doctor Who set. His character was so absurd and over the top that it was hard to keep a straight face during scenes with him." Walliams' character, Gibbis, is described as a cowardly and anxious alien who finds himself in a dangerous situation inside the TARDIS. In the episode, The Doctor, Amy, and Rory must navigate through a mysterious hotel where each room is filled with their worst fears. Gibbis is one of the inhabitants of the hotel who must confront his fears in order to survive. Despite the intense and suspenseful nature of the storyline, Walliams brought a comedic element to his character that added a light-hearted touch to the episode. His comedic timing and ability to improvise made him a joy to work with, but also made it difficult for his co-stars to stay focused. Matt Smith, who plays the Eleventh Doctor, also had high praise for Walliams' performance. He said, "David Walliams brought a fresh energy to the set and his portrayal of Gibbis added a new dimension to the episode. It was a pleasure to work with him and see him bring his own unique comedic spin to the role." Walliams' previous experience in comedy and his talent for playing eccentric characters made him a perfect fit for the role of Gibbis. Despite the challenges he may have presented on set, his performance ultimately added to the overall success of the episode. The God Complex is set to be a thrilling and suspenseful episode of Doctor Who, with Walliams' portrayal of Gibbis adding a comedic twist to the story. Fans of the show can look forward to seeing how his character interacts with The Doctor, Amy, and Rory as they navigate through the dangerous and mysterious hotel. Overall, David Walliams may have been a challenge to work with on the set of Doctor Who, but his comedic talent and unique portrayal of Gibbis only enhanced the episode. His presence brought a new dynamic to the show and left a lasting impression on his co-stars and fans alike.

title: Anna Sorokin: Fake heiress released from US prison
text: $200,000 from businesses, hotels, and friends in New York City. Sorokin's trial in 2019 captivated the public as details of her elaborate con scheme were revealed. Posing as a German heiress with a trust fund, she managed to live a luxurious lifestyle without actually having the funds to back it up. From staying in five-star hotels to dining at trendy restaurants, Sorokin seemed to have it all - until her web of lies began to unravel. During the trial, Sorokin's defense team argued that she never intended to defraud anyone and that she planned to repay the money she owed. However, the prosecution painted a very different picture, highlighting Sorokin's deceptive behavior and the harm she caused to her victims. Despite the guilty verdict, Sorokin's story continued to captivate the public, with many fascinated by her audacity and cunning. Some even saw her as a feminist icon, breaking societal norms and challenging the status quo. However, others saw her as a manipulative sociopath who exploited people for her own gain. After serving her sentence, Sorokin was released from prison and now faces the challenge of rebuilding her life. It is unclear what her plans are for the future, but one thing is for certain - her time behind bars has forever changed her. In a recent interview with a US media outlet, Sorokin expressed regret for her actions and acknowledged the pain she caused to her victims. She also spoke about her time in prison, describing it as a humbling experience that taught her valuable lessons. As Sorokin begins her journey to redemption, many questions remain unanswered. Will she be able to make amends for her crimes? Can she leave her past behind and start anew? Only time will tell. One thing is certain - the story of Anna Sorokin, the fake heiress who captivated the world with her audacious antics, is far from over. Whether she will be able to redeem herself and earn back the trust of society remains to be seen. But one thing is for sure - her tale will continue to intrigue and fascinate for years to come.

title: Top universities in Russell Group fees review protest
text: By Sean CoughlanBBC News education correspondent They are angry that the Russell Group, which represents their universities, is refusing to publish evidence of how tuition fees are spent. The group of students from various top universities within the prestigious Russell Group gathered outside the organization's headquarters, holding placards and chanting slogans demanding transparency. The students argue that they have a right to know where their tuition fees are being allocated and how the money is being spent by their respective universities. They fear that without this information, they are being left in the dark about crucial decisions that affect their education and future prospects. Speaking at the protest, a second-year student from one of the Russell Group institutions expressed frustration at the lack of accountability within the group. "We pay hefty tuition fees each year, and it’s only fair that we know how our money is being used. The Russell Group needs to be transparent about this," she said. The Russell Group, which represents 24 leading UK universities, has defended its position, stating that the information on how tuition fees are spent is sensitive and cannot be disclosed due to various reasons, including privacy concerns. However, this explanation has not satisfied the protesting students, who feel that they have a right to know and have a say in how their education is funded. The protest is part of a broader movement calling for greater transparency and accountability within universities, particularly in relation to tuition fees. Students across the UK are increasingly voicing their concerns about the cost of higher education and the lack of clarity around where their money goes. In response to the protest, a spokesperson for the Russell Group stated that the organization is committed to providing a high-quality education and ensuring that tuition fees are used in a way that benefits students. They emphasized that the group works closely with universities to ensure that resources are allocated effectively and transparently. Despite this assurance, the students remain unconvinced and are calling for concrete action to address their concerns. They have vowed to continue putting pressure on the Russell Group until they receive the information they are demanding. The protest highlights growing tensions between students and university administrations over the issue of tuition fees and transparency. It also reflects broader concerns about the future of higher education in the UK, as students become increasingly vocal about their rights and expectations. As the protest drew to a close, the students made it clear that they are not backing down and will continue to push for greater transparency and accountability within the Russell Group and beyond. Their voices are a powerful reminder that students are not just passive recipients of education but active participants in shaping the future of higher education.

title: Car immobiliser easy to crack, say researchers
text: They found the encryption system used in many car immobilisers can be cracked, potentially letting a thief steal the car. Vehicles made by various manufacturers are susceptible to this vulnerability, researchers at the National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology (AIST) in Japan have discovered. The team of researchers conducted tests on 19 different car models from 8 different manufacturers, including big names such as Toyota, Nissan, and Honda. They were able to successfully break the encryption system on all of the models tested, raising concerns about the overall security of car immobilisers. According to the researchers, the problem lies in the outdated encryption algorithms used in these systems. These algorithms were designed years ago when security threats were not as sophisticated as they are now. As a result, hackers are able to exploit weaknesses in the encryption system and gain access to the car's immobiliser, effectively bypassing it and stealing the vehicle. This discovery has raised alarm bells in the automotive industry, as car theft continues to be a major concern worldwide. Manufacturers are now under pressure to update their encryption systems to prevent such vulnerabilities from being exploited by criminals. In response to the research findings, a spokesperson for the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders (SMMT) in the UK stated, "Car manufacturers take the security of their vehicles very seriously. They are constantly working to improve the technology and encryption systems used in car immobilisers to stay one step ahead of hackers." Despite the reassurances from the automotive industry, experts warn that car owners should still take precautions to protect their vehicles from potential theft. This includes parking in well-lit areas, using steering wheel locks, and investing in additional security measures such as GPS trackers and immobiliser alarms. As for the researchers at AIST, they are continuing their work to uncover vulnerabilities in other car security systems. They believe that raising awareness about these issues is crucial in ensuring that car manufacturers invest in robust encryption technology to protect their customers' vehicles. In the meantime, car owners are advised to stay informed about the latest security threats and take proactive steps to safeguard their vehicles. With the right precautions in place, they can minimize the risk of falling victim to car theft and keep their prized possessions safe from harm.

title: Cocaine smuggling: The bizarre tactics used to hide drugs
text: But sneaking drugs under the noses of authorities can be a risky business, as a Colombian cocaine smuggler discovered this week. The man was caught at Barcelona's Josep Tarradellas Airport with 0.5kg (1.1lb) of cocaine hidden in his prosthetic leg. This is just one of the many bizarre tactics used by drug traffickers in their attempts to smuggle cocaine around the world. From hidden compartments in cars to elaborate methods involving animals, there seems to be no limit to the creativity of those involved in the illegal drug trade. In recent years, authorities have seen a rise in the use of drones to transport drugs across borders. In 2017, a man in Australia was caught trying to fly a drone carrying cocaine into a maximum-security prison. And just last year, police in the United States intercepted a drone carrying drugs over the Canadian border. But drones are not the only high-tech method used by drug traffickers. In 2018, police in Spain discovered a submarine carrying 3,000kg (6,614lb) of cocaine off the coast of Galicia. The submarine was equipped with sophisticated navigation equipment and was capable of traveling long distances underwater, making it extremely difficult for authorities to detect. Despite these technological advancements, some drug smugglers still rely on more traditional methods to transport their illicit cargo. In 2019, a man in Mexico was caught with a kilogram of cocaine hidden inside frozen sharks. The man claimed that he was transporting the sharks to be used in a shark fin soup festival, but authorities were suspicious and found the drugs hidden inside the fish. And it's not just animals that are being used to smuggle drugs. In 2016, police in Colombia arrested a man who was trying to board a flight with 1kg (2.2lb) of cocaine hidden in his toupee. The man's wig was so bulky that it raised suspicions, leading to a thorough search that uncovered the drugs. These bizarre tactics are a clear indication of the lengths that drug traffickers will go to in order to evade detection and transport their illegal cargo. But no matter how creative their methods may be, authorities around the world are committed to catching those involved in the illicit drug trade and putting an end to their criminal activities.

title: Singer Ruth Keggin 'breathes life' into ancient language
text: By Mark EdwardsBBC Isle of Man Ruth Keggin's debut solo album features new arrangements of traditional and contemporary folk songs, most of which are sung in the Gaelic language. The 25-year-old said: "Manx never died out - the language has always been there in the hearts of the people, but there was a time when it was at risk of disappearing completely. I believe that by singing in Manx, I can help to breathe new life into this ancient language and keep it alive for future generations." Keggin's passion for the Manx language is evident in every note she sings. Her hauntingly beautiful voice carries the emotive lyrics of traditional Manx songs, transporting listeners to a time when the language was spoken fluently on the Isle of Man. Through her music, Keggin is not only preserving a rich cultural heritage but also introducing Manx Gaelic to a new audience. One of the standout tracks on Keggin's album is a reimagining of the traditional Manx folk song "Arrane Oie Vie" (Good Night Song). The delicate melody and Keggin's soulful vocals create a sense of nostalgia and longing for a simpler time. The lyrics, which speak of love and longing, are brought to life by Keggin's emotional delivery, making it a standout track on the album. In addition to traditional folk songs, Keggin also includes contemporary pieces on her album, showcasing the versatility of the Manx language in modern music. Songs like "Gyn Tan Aeg" (Without Fire) demonstrate Keggin's ability to blend traditional sounds with a contemporary flair, appealing to a wide range of listeners. Keggin's dedication to keeping the Manx language alive extends beyond her music. She is actively involved in teaching Manx Gaelic classes and is passionate about passing on the language to future generations. By immersing herself in the culture and history of the Isle of Man, Keggin has become a vocal advocate for the preservation of the Manx language. As the world becomes increasingly interconnected, languages like Manx Gaelic face the threat of extinction. However, artists like Ruth Keggin are working tirelessly to ensure that these ancient languages are not forgotten. Through her music, Keggin is breathing new life into the Manx language, captivating audiences with the beauty and richness of Gaelic culture. With her debut solo album, Ruth Keggin has established herself as a powerful force in the world of folk music. Her mesmerizing vocals and heartfelt interpretations of traditional Manx songs have garnered critical acclaim and a devoted following. As she continues to bring the ancient language of Manx Gaelic to the forefront, Keggin's impact on the preservation of this linguistic treasure cannot be overstated.

title: Chinese doctors jailed for illegal organ harvesting
text: The group had tricked the families of the deceased into thinking they were making official organ donations. Between 2017 and 2018, they removed the livers and kidneys from at least 11 victims without their consent. The victims came from rural villages in China, where poverty and lack of education made them vulnerable to exploitation. The illegal organ harvesting operation was discovered when one of the victims miraculously survived the surgery and managed to escape. He alerted the authorities, leading to a thorough investigation that uncovered the horrific truth behind the seemingly legitimate organ donation scheme. The Chinese doctors involved in the illegal organ harvesting operation were arrested and brought to trial. The court found them guilty of multiple charges, including organ trafficking, fraud, and violating medical ethics. They were each sentenced to several years in prison, with the ringleader receiving the harshest punishment of 20 years behind bars. The case has shocked the nation and prompted calls for stricter regulations to prevent similar incidents from happening in the future. The Chinese government has promised to crack down on illegal organ harvesting and strengthen oversight of organ donation procedures to ensure the protection of donors' rights. Organ trafficking is a serious issue that plagues many countries around the world. The demand for organs far exceeds the supply, leading to a black market where organs are bought and sold for exorbitant prices. Organ trafficking preys on the most vulnerable members of society, exploiting their desperation and lack of resources for personal gain. The illegal organ harvesting operation in China serves as a reminder of the importance of upholding ethical standards in the field of medicine. Doctors take an oath to do no harm and to always act in the best interest of their patients. When these principles are violated, it not only undermines trust in the medical profession but also results in irreversible harm to those who are victimized. The victims of the illegal organ harvesting operation in China have been scarred for life, both physically and emotionally. Their trust in the medical system has been shattered, and they will carry the trauma of their experiences with them forever. It is a stark reminder of the dark side of human nature and the depths to which some individuals will sink in pursuit of profit. As the perpetrators of this heinous crime serve their sentences behind bars, it is essential for the Chinese government and the international community to work together to eradicate organ trafficking and ensure that all individuals have access to legal and ethical organ donation procedures. Only through collective action can we prevent further exploitation and bring justice to the victims of organ trafficking.

title: Times and Sunday Times readership falls after paywall
text: Times Online was registering about 21 million unique users a month to its front page earlier this year but the figure fell to 2.7 million last month. The papers said that the decline in readership was expected following the implementation of a paywall in July. Times and Sunday Times introduced a subscription model, requiring readers to pay for access to online content. This shift in strategy was meant to increase revenue and maintain the quality of journalism, but it seems to have had a negative impact on readership numbers. The decision to implement a paywall was met with skepticism from some industry experts who predicted a decrease in readership. Critics argued that charging for online content would deter casual readers and limit the reach of the newspapers. Times and Sunday Times defended their approach, stating that quality journalism comes at a cost and should not be given away for free. The papers emphasized the value of their content and the need to ensure sustainable business models in the digital age. Despite the decline in readership, Times and Sunday Times remain optimistic about the future. They believe that the subscription model will attract loyal readers who are willing to pay for high-quality journalism. The papers have emphasized the importance of investing in original reporting and in-depth analysis, which they believe sets them apart from other news outlets. Times and Sunday Times are committed to maintaining their reputation for integrity and accuracy, even if it means sacrificing a larger audience. In addition to the paywall, Times and Sunday Times have been exploring new ways to engage readers and create a more interactive online experience. They have introduced features such as live blogs, video content, and multimedia storytelling to enhance the reader experience. The papers are also investing in digital technology and data analytics to better understand their audience and tailor content to their interests. Times and Sunday Times acknowledge that the shift to a subscription model has been challenging, but they believe it is necessary to ensure the long-term sustainability of the business. The papers remain committed to delivering high-quality journalism and providing readers with valuable insights and analysis. Despite the decline in readership, Times and Sunday Times are confident that their loyal readers will continue to support them and recognize the importance of investing in quality journalism. Time will tell whether the paywall strategy pays off in the long run, but for now, Times and Sunday Times are staying the course and sticking to their principles.

title: Mexico: We will not pay for Trump border wall
text: Enrique Pena Nieto said he "lamented" the plans for the barrier, but made no mention of changing a scheduled trip to Washington to meet the US president. The Mexican president's comments come after Donald Trump signed an executive order to begin building the border wall, a key campaign promise that has sparked controversy and strained relations between the two countries. In a televised address to the nation, President Pena Nieto reiterated that Mexico would not pay for the wall. "I have said it time and time again - Mexico will not pay for the wall," he stated. "It goes against our dignity as a country and our values as Mexicans. We will not finance a wall that goes against humanity and cooperation between nations." The Mexican leader stressed the importance of dialogue and cooperation between Mexico and the United States, highlighting the strong economic and cultural ties that bind the two countries. "We have a shared history and a shared future. It is imperative that we work together to address our common challenges and build a better future for both our peoples," President Pena Nieto said. Despite the strained relations between Mexico and the US, President Pena Nieto confirmed that he would still attend the scheduled meeting with President Trump in Washington. "It is important that we continue to engage in dialogue and find common ground on issues of mutual interest," he noted. In response to President Trump's executive order, Mexican officials have reiterated their commitment to protecting the rights and dignity of Mexican nationals living in the United States. Foreign Minister Luis Videgaray stated that the Mexican government would continue to provide consular assistance and support to Mexican migrants in the US. The issue of immigration has been a contentious one between Mexico and the United States, with President Trump repeatedly calling for stricter border controls and the deportation of undocumented immigrants. Mexican officials have expressed their concern over the impact of these policies on Mexican nationals living in the US, and have called for a comprehensive and humane approach to immigration reform. As President Pena Nieto prepares to meet with President Trump in Washington, the Mexican government remains steadfast in its commitment to defending the rights and dignity of Mexican nationals, both at home and abroad. The meeting between the two leaders is expected to be a tense one, but both sides have expressed their willingness to engage in constructive dialogue and find common ground on issues of mutual interest.

title: Tiananmen crash: China police 'detain suspects'
text: region of Xinjiang, according to police reports. The suspects have been identified as Abdul Ali, Nurmemet Yusup and Hebir Turdi, all of whom have connections to the Uighur community. The attack occurred in Tiananmen Square, a highly symbolic and heavily guarded location in the heart of Beijing. The car crashed into a crowd of pedestrians, killing five and injuring dozens more. The incident has sparked fears of terrorism in the Chinese capital, with authorities taking swift and decisive action to investigate and apprehend those responsible. Xinhua news agency reports that the suspects were detained at a hotel on the outskirts of Beijing, where they had been staying for several days prior to the attack. The police have not disclosed any further information about the motive or background of the attackers, but reports from witnesses suggest that they were motivated by anger and dissatisfaction with the Chinese government's policies towards the Uighur minority. The Uighurs are a Turkic-speaking ethnic group that has long faced discrimination and repression in China. The Chinese government has been accused of imposing strict controls on the Uighur population, including restricting their religious practices and cultural freedom. This has led to growing tensions and unrest in Xinjiang, with some Uighurs resorting to violence in protest against government policies. The Tiananmen incident is just the latest in a series of violent attacks in China attributed to Uighur separatists. In 2014, a knife attack at a train station in Kunming left 31 people dead and over 140 injured, while a bombing at a market in Urumqi killed dozens in the same year. These incidents have raised concerns about the security situation in China and the government's ability to prevent further attacks. Chinese authorities have responded to the Tiananmen attack with increased security measures and a crackdown on suspected extremists. President Xi Jinping has vowed to take decisive action against terrorism and called for a "people's war" against violent extremists. The government has also tightened control over the internet and social media, censoring discussions of the incident and preventing the spread of extremist ideology. Despite the government's efforts to maintain stability and security, the Uighur issue remains a complex and contentious issue in China. The ongoing repression of the Uighur minority has only served to fuel resentment and radicalization among some members of the community. As tensions continue to simmer in Xinjiang, the threat of further violence and unrest remains a significant challenge for the Chinese authorities.

title: National Videogame Arcade opens in Nottingham
text: The NVA is a testament to the growth and popularity of video games both in the UK and around the world. It offers visitors a chance to delve into the history of gaming, from the early days of arcade machines to the latest virtual reality experiences.  One of the highlights of the arcade is the Game History Timeline, which showcases the evolution of video games over the decades. Visitors can see how technology has advanced, graphics have improved, and storytelling has become more immersive. From classics like Pac-Man and Space Invaders to modern blockbusters like Minecraft and Fortnite, the NVA has something for gamers of all ages. In addition to celebrating the past, the NVA also looks to the future of gaming. The arcade features cutting-edge technology such as motion-sensing controllers and VR headsets, giving visitors a glimpse of what’s to come in the world of video games. There are also workshops and events where gamers can learn about game design, coding, and other aspects of the industry. The NVA is not just a place for gamers to play, but also a hub for education and creativity. It aims to inspire the next generation of game developers and designers, encouraging them to think outside the box and push the boundaries of what's possible in gaming. The arcade has partnerships with local schools and universities, offering programs and resources to help students learn about game development and pursue careers in the industry. The opening of the NVA is a significant milestone for Nottingham, a city with a rich gaming history. It cements the city’s reputation as a hub for video game culture and innovation, attracting gamers and industry professionals from around the world. The arcade is expected to boost tourism and bring in revenue for local businesses, further solidifying Nottingham's position as a leading destination for gamers. As the NVA opens its doors to the public, there is a sense of excitement and anticipation in the gaming community. Gamers of all ages are eager to explore the exhibits, try out the latest games, and immerse themselves in the world of video game culture. The arcade is expected to be a huge success, drawing crowds of visitors and putting Nottingham on the map as a must-visit destination for gamers. Overall, the National Videogame Arcade is a testament to the enduring popularity and cultural significance of video games. It celebrates the industry’s past, present, and future, offering a unique and immersive experience for gamers of all ages. Whether you're a casual player or a hardcore enthusiast, the NVA is sure to delight and inspire you with its interactive exhibits and cutting-edge technology.

title: MEPs vote for universal charger for smartphones
text: The resolution passed with 582 votes in favour to 40 against. MEPs will now urge the European Commission (EC) to adopt the new rules. The MEPs want to make it mandatory for smartphone manufacturers to provide a universal charger that works for all devices. This move aims to reduce electronic waste and make it more convenient for consumers. The push for a universal charger comes after years of frustration for consumers who have to deal with multiple chargers for different devices. This not only leads to clutter but also contributes to the growing e-waste problem. By implementing a universal charger, MEPs hope to make it easier for consumers to charge their devices while also reducing the environmental impact of discarded chargers. MEPs believe that by standardizing chargers, consumers will no longer have to constantly buy new chargers when switching devices. This will not only save money for consumers but also decrease the amount of waste generated by old chargers. The European Parliament sees this as a win-win situation for both consumers and the environment. While many MEPs support the move towards a universal charger, there are some who have raised concerns about the potential impact on smaller manufacturers. They argue that implementing a universal charger requirement could stifle innovation and limit consumer choice. However, supporters of the resolution believe that the benefits of reducing e-waste and making it easier for consumers outweigh these concerns. The European Commission will now have to consider the resolution passed by the European Parliament and decide on the next steps. If the EC adopts the new rules, smartphone manufacturers will have to comply with the requirement for a universal charger. This could lead to a significant shift in the way chargers are designed and produced. In addition to the environmental benefits, a universal charger could also make it easier for consumers to charge their devices in public spaces such as airports and train stations. No longer will they have to search for a specific charger that matches their device, as a universal charger would work for all smartphones. Overall, the move towards a universal charger for smartphones is seen as a positive step towards reducing electronic waste and improving the convenience for consumers. The European Parliament's resolution highlights the importance of sustainable practices in the tech industry and sets a precedent for other regions to follow suit.

title: Oil prices slump on Saudi comments
text: The comments by deputy crown prince Mohammed bin Salman are seen as a challenge to Iran. It has vowed to increase oil production following the lifting of Western sanctions. In the Bloomberg interview, the prince also spoke about his plan to diversify Saudi Arabia's economy away from its heavy reliance on oil. This is a significant shift in strategy for the oil-rich kingdom, which has traditionally focused on selling oil to generate revenue. The deputy crown prince's comments have sent shockwaves through the global oil markets, causing oil prices to slump. Investors and analysts are concerned about the potential impact of increased Saudi oil production on global oil prices. The prospect of a continued oversupply of oil has led to a sharp decline in oil prices, with Brent crude falling to its lowest level in over a decade. Saudi Arabia is the largest producer in the OPEC oil cartel, and its decision to increase oil production could have far-reaching implications for the global economy. The kingdom's strategy of flooding the market with oil in order to maintain market share has already had a significant impact on oil prices, and the deputy crown prince's comments suggest that this strategy will continue. The slump in oil prices is also being driven by concerns about slowing global economic growth. China, the world's second-largest economy, is experiencing a slowdown, which has led to a decrease in demand for oil. This has put further pressure on oil prices, as supply continues to outstrip demand. The global oil industry is facing a period of significant uncertainty, as geopolitical tensions, economic concerns, and changing market dynamics all contribute to the volatility in oil prices. The deputy crown prince's comments have only added to this uncertainty, as investors and analysts try to assess the potential impact of increased Saudi oil production on global oil prices. In response to the slump in oil prices, some analysts are calling for a coordinated response from oil-producing nations to cut production in order to stabilize prices. However, this is easier said than done, as many countries rely on oil revenues to fund their governments and maintain social programs. The geopolitical rivalries and economic interests at play in the global oil market make it difficult to reach a consensus on production cuts. As the global economy continues to grapple with the implications of the slump in oil prices, all eyes are on Saudi Arabia and other major oil-producing nations to see how they will respond to the changing market dynamics. The coming months will be crucial in determining the future direction of oil prices and the global economy as a whole.

title: HMRC claims victory in film tax battle
text: The Ingenious scheme tried to use artificial losses arising from backing a range of films, said HMRC. They included Avatar, Life of Pi, and Gravity, among others. The tax tribunal ruled in favor of HMRC, stating that the scheme was not a legitimate investment opportunity, but rather a way for individuals to claim tax relief on losses that were not actually incurred. This victory for HMRC marks a significant milestone in their ongoing efforts to crack down on tax avoidance in the film industry. The scheme, which offered investors the chance to claim substantial tax relief on their investments, was popular among high-net-worth individuals looking to reduce their tax liabilities. However, HMRC argued that the scheme was nothing more than a tax avoidance mechanism, and the tribunal ultimately agreed. In response to the ruling, HMRC issued a statement expressing their satisfaction with the outcome. They emphasized that they are committed to ensuring that everyone pays their fair share of tax, and will continue to investigate and challenge schemes that exploit loopholes in the tax system. The ruling has sent shockwaves through the film industry, with many investors now facing the prospect of having to repay the tax relief they received through the scheme. Some industry insiders have expressed concerns that this could have a chilling effect on future investment in British films, as investors may now be more wary of schemes that promise significant tax benefits. However, others see this ruling as a positive step towards creating a more transparent and fair tax system. By cracking down on tax avoidance schemes, HMRC is sending a clear message that they will not tolerate individuals or companies seeking to evade their tax obligations. It remains to be seen what impact this ruling will have on the broader film industry, but one thing is clear: HMRC is determined to root out tax avoidance wherever it may occur. This victory in the film tax battle is just one example of their ongoing efforts to ensure that everyone pays their fair share, and it sends a strong message to those who try to game the system. The days of exploiting tax loopholes in the film industry may be coming to an end, as HMRC continues to crack down on those who seek to avoid their tax responsibilities.

title: Colonia Dignidad: Germany to compensate Chile commune victims
text: Colonia Dignidad was founded by former Nazi soldier Paul Schäfer in 1961. The commune, which was located 350km (220 miles) south of the Chilean capital Santiago, started as a religious community but soon became a secretive cult that subjected its members to horrific abuses. Schäfer, a charismatic leader, exerted total control over the members of Colonia Dignidad, isolating them from the outside world and enforcing strict discipline. Under his rule, the commune became a place of terror, where physical and psychological abuse, forced labor, and child sexual abuse were rampant. For decades, the atrocities committed at Colonia Dignidad went unchecked, as the commune operated with the complicity of the Chilean government. It was not until the fall of the dictatorship of General Augusto Pinochet in 1990 that the truth about the horrors of Colonia Dignidad began to come to light. In 2006, Paul Schäfer was arrested in Argentina and extradited to Chile, where he was convicted of child sexual abuse, torture, and other crimes. He died in prison in 2010, but the scars left by his reign of terror at Colonia Dignidad continue to haunt the survivors to this day. The German government has now taken a significant step towards acknowledging its responsibility for the atrocities committed at Colonia Dignidad. In a historic agreement reached with the Chilean government, Germany has agreed to pay compensation to the victims of the commune. The compensation package, totalling 10 million euros, will be distributed among the survivors of Colonia Dignidad, many of whom were children when they were subjected to the horrors of the commune. The agreement also includes funding for projects to support the victims and their families, as well as measures to preserve the memory of the atrocities committed at Colonia Dignidad. The German government has issued a formal apology for its failure to prevent the abuses at Colonia Dignidad and for its role in allowing the commune to operate with impunity for so many years. The agreement is seen as a significant step towards justice for the survivors of the commune, who have long sought recognition for the suffering they endured. While no amount of money can ever fully compensate for the horrors inflicted upon the members of Colonia Dignidad, the agreement between Germany and Chile represents an important milestone in the long and painful process of seeking justice for the victims of the commune. It serves as a reminder of the need to confront the dark legacy of the past and to ensure that such atrocities are never allowed to happen again.

title: Hungary government proposes same-sex adoption ban
text: allowed for same-sex couples since 2014. The move to ban same-sex adoption has sparked outrage among LGBTQ+ rights activists and supporters. Critics argue that the proposed ban is discriminatory and goes against the principles of equality and human rights. They also point out that research has shown that children raised by same-sex couples do just as well as those raised by heterosexual couples. Banning same-sex couples from adopting would deny these children loving and capable parents simply based on their sexual orientation. The Hungarian government, led by Prime Minister Viktor Orban's conservative Fidesz party, justifies the proposed ban as a way to uphold traditional family values and protect children. They argue that children's right to a mother and a father should be prioritized over the desire of same-sex couples to adopt. Supporters of the ban believe that children should be raised in a traditional family structure, with a mother and father figure. They argue that allowing same-sex couples to adopt goes against the natural order of things and could have negative effects on the well-being of children. The proposed amendment has also raised concerns about the erosion of LGBTQ+ rights in Hungary. In recent years, the government has taken several steps to restrict the rights of the LGBTQ+ community, including banning gender studies programs at universities and prohibiting the portrayal of homosexuality in educational material. The ban on same-sex adoption is seen as part of a broader campaign by the government to promote a conservative, nationalist agenda and silence dissenting voices. LGBTQ+ rights activists fear that the proposed ban is just the beginning of further restrictions on the rights of LGBTQ+ individuals in Hungary. Despite widespread criticism and opposition, the Hungarian government remains steadfast in its support of the proposed ban. Prime Minister Orban has made it clear that he views traditional family values as fundamental to Hungarian society and will continue to push for policies that reflect those values. As the debate over the proposed ban continues, LGBTQ+ rights activists are mobilizing to challenge the government's discriminatory policies and advocate for the rights of same-sex couples and their families. The outcome of the proposed amendment will have far-reaching implications for LGBTQ+ rights in Hungary and set a precedent for other countries grappling with similar issues.

title: A83 Rest and Be Thankful reopens after landslip
text: to find a long-term solution to the recurring issue that has plagued the vital road artery in Argyll and Bute. The reopening of the A83 Rest and Be Thankful marks a significant milestone for the region, as the road had been closed for several days due to the landslips caused by heavy rainfall. The closure resulted in significant disruption to travel, forcing motorists to take lengthy detours through narrow, winding roads. Despite the challenging conditions, the debris clearance operation was carried out efficiently by a team of dedicated workers who worked tirelessly to ensure the road was safe for reopening. The Scottish government has praised their efforts and commitment to keeping the road network running smoothly. Transport Minister Graeme Dey has announced that a further £1 million will be invested in improving the resilience of the A83 Rest and Be Thankful in the wake of the landslips. This funding will be used to implement additional safety measures, such as catch fences and rockfall netting, to prevent future incidents and ensure the road remains open to traffic. Local businesses and residents have welcomed the reopening of the A83 Rest and Be Thankful, as it will help alleviate the economic impact of the road closure. The road is an essential link for the region, connecting remote communities and providing access to vital services, schools, and healthcare facilities. However, concerns remain about the long-term viability of the route, which is prone to landslides and closures during periods of heavy rain. The Scottish government has committed to finding a sustainable solution to the ongoing issue, including exploring options such as a permanent diversion route or tunnel to bypass the landslide-prone section of the A83. In the meantime, engineers will continue to monitor the stability of the hillside above the A83 Rest and Be Thankful to ensure the safety of motorists and prevent further landslips. The reopening of the road is a temporary reprieve for the region, but the work to find a lasting solution is far from over. As traffic begins to flow once again along the A83 Rest and Be Thankful, drivers are urged to exercise caution and be vigilant for any signs of potential landslides. The safety of all road users is paramount, and the Scottish government is committed to ensuring that the necessary measures are in place to protect the public and keep the vital road network functioning effectively.

title: Flooding and storm warnings across England
text: The Environment Agency has issued flood alerts in 50 areas - 42 of which are in south-east England. Six flood warnings are in place; five for the South East, including areas along the River Thames and River Medway. Additionally, there is one flood warning in the South West, specifically for the River Tamar. This comes after heavy rainfall across the region, causing rivers to rise to dangerous levels. Residents in these areas are being advised to be vigilant and take necessary precautions to protect their properties and ensure their safety. The risk of flooding is heightened due to the combination of heavy rain, high tides, and saturated ground from previous storms. The Environment Agency is closely monitoring the situation and working with local authorities to provide support where needed. In addition to flooding, strong winds are also causing disruption across the country. The Met Office has issued a yellow weather warning for wind in multiple regions, including the South West, South East, and East of England. Gusts of up to 60mph are expected in some areas, leading to potential damage to buildings, trees, and power lines. Travel disruptions are also likely, with delays on roads and railways possible. The severe weather conditions are a result of a deep area of low pressure moving across the UK, bringing with it heavy rain and strong winds. The storm, named Dudley by the Met Office, is expected to continue affecting the country over the coming days. As a result, people are being urged to stay informed about the latest weather updates and take appropriate action to stay safe. Emergency services are on high alert and are ready to respond to any incidents that may arise as a result of the severe weather. Local authorities are also taking steps to prepare for potential flooding, including deploying sandbags and pumps in areas at risk. Residents are being advised to have a flood plan in place and to avoid driving or walking through floodwater. The combination of flooding and storm warnings across England is a reminder of the importance of being prepared for extreme weather events. As climate change continues to bring more frequent and intense storms, it is crucial for individuals and communities to take proactive measures to protect themselves and their properties. By staying informed, staying vigilant, and following the advice of authorities, we can all help to stay safe during periods of severe weather.

title: New e-petitions website opens
text: The launch of the new e-petitions website, petition.parliament.uk, marks a significant step in engaging with citizens and promoting democracy in the digital age. This user-friendly platform is set to empower individuals to raise important issues, garner public support, and ultimately influence decision-making at the highest levels of government. One of the key features of the new website is its ability to facilitate a direct line of communication between ordinary citizens and their elected representatives. By providing a platform for individuals to voice their opinions and concerns, the site aims to bridge the gap between the public and the political establishment. This new dialogue has the potential to foster greater accountability, transparency, and responsiveness in government, ultimately leading to improved governance. E-petitions on the site will be initially reviewed by a cross-party committee of MPs, ensuring that a diverse range of perspectives and interests are taken into account. This rigorous vetting process will help to prioritize petitions that have significant public support and merit further consideration by policymakers. By involving MPs in the evaluation process, the website can help to ensure that e-petitions are taken seriously and have a real impact on the political agenda. In addition to promoting civic engagement and democratic participation, the new e-petitions website also has the potential to drive positive social change. By providing a platform for individuals to raise awareness about important issues, mobilize support, and advocate for policy change, the site can serve as a powerful tool for activism and social justice. Whether it's campaigning for environmental sustainability, advocating for social justice, or calling for legislative reforms, e-petitions have the potential to amplify the voices of grassroots activists and drive meaningful change. Furthermore, the launch of the new website has the potential to inspire a new generation of civic-minded individuals to actively engage in the democratic process. By lowering the barrier to entry and providing an accessible platform for participation, the site can help to cultivate a culture of civic engagement and political activism among diverse segments of the population. This increased awareness and involvement in the political process can help to strengthen democracy, promote accountability, and ensure that the voices of all citizens are heard and valued. In conclusion, the new e-petitions website represents a landmark development in promoting democratic engagement, empowering citizens, and driving positive social change. By harnessing the power of digital technology, the site has the potential to democratize the political process, amplify the voices of ordinary citizens, and help to shape the future of governance in the UK. As the site continues to evolve and grow, it has the potential to become a powerful tool for advocacy, activism, and citizen empowerment.

title: Jermaine Jackson: 'No truth' to allegations in Michael documentary
text: his 2005 trial, but later sued the Jackson estate for sexual abuse, which was dismissed in court in 2017. Jermaine Jackson, Michael Jackson's older brother, has vehemently denied the allegations made in the Leaving Neverland documentary. In a recent interview with BBC News, Jermaine stated, "There is no truth to these allegations. Michael was innocent and would never harm a child." Jermaine went on to defend his brother's legacy, emphasizing Michael's humanitarian efforts and commitment to children's charities. He pointed out that Michael was not only a musical icon but also a loving father to his own children. The allegations made by Safechuck and Robson in the documentary have sparked a renewed debate about whether it is appropriate to continue celebrating Michael Jackson's music given the allegations made against him. Some radio stations have stopped playing his songs, while others have continued to support his music. Jermaine Jackson believes that his brother's music should not be boycotted based on unproven allegations. He argues that Michael's music has brought joy to millions of people around the world and should be appreciated separately from his personal life. Despite the controversy surrounding Leaving Neverland, Michael Jackson's fans remain loyal to his memory. They continue to defend his innocence and support his music, viewing him as a legendary artist who made a significant impact on the music industry. In response to the allegations made in Leaving Neverland, the Jackson estate has filed a lawsuit against HBO, the network that aired the documentary. They claim that the film is defamatory and one-sided, presenting a biased view of Michael Jackson without giving the estate an opportunity to respond. The debate surrounding Michael Jackson's legacy is likely to continue for years to come, with supporters and critics alike voicing their opinions on the matter. While the allegations made in Leaving Neverland have certainly cast a shadow over Michael Jackson's reputation, his music and influence on the music industry remain undeniable. As the controversy surrounding Michael Jackson's legacy continues to unfold, Jermaine Jackson remains steadfast in defending his brother's innocence. He believes that Michael's music should be celebrated and appreciated for its cultural significance, regardless of the allegations made against him.

title: Robot used to guide surgeons through knee operations
text: By Eleanor BradfordBBC Scotland Health Correspondent The technique is being tested at Glasgow Royal Infirmary where 150 patients are involved in trials. It involves the use of a cutting-edge robot to assist surgeons during knee operations, with the aim of improving the accuracy and precision of the procedures. The robot, known as the Mako Robotic Arm, is equipped with advanced imaging technology that allows it to create a 3D model of the patient's knee. This model is then used by the robot to guide the surgeon in real-time, helping them to make more precise cuts and placements during the operation. Dr. Sarah Wilson, a consultant orthopedic surgeon at Glasgow Royal Infirmary, is leading the trials. She explained that the use of the robot has the potential to revolutionize knee surgery by reducing the margin of error and improving patient outcomes. "The robot acts as an extra pair of hands in the operating room, allowing us to perform procedures with greater accuracy and precision. This can lead to better functional outcomes for patients, as well as faster recovery times," Dr. Wilson said. One of the patients involved in the trials is 64-year-old Margaret Dawson, who had been suffering from chronic knee pain for several years. She underwent a knee replacement surgery using the Mako robot and is now in the recovery phase. "I was initially nervous about the idea of a robot being involved in my surgery, but I have been pleasantly surprised by the results. My knee feels so much better already, and I am hopeful that I will be able to get back to my normal activities soon," Margaret said. The use of robots in surgery is not a new concept, but the Mako Robotic Arm represents a significant advancement in the field. It is able to provide real-time feedback to the surgeon during the operation, allowing for more precise movements and adjustments. While the use of robots in surgery may seem futuristic, Dr. Wilson emphasized that patient safety remains the top priority. The robot is not meant to replace the surgeon but rather to enhance their skills and capabilities. "We are still in the early stages of testing this technology, but the initial results are promising. We hope that this will eventually become a standard practice in knee surgery, benefiting patients across the country," Dr. Wilson concluded. The trials at Glasgow Royal Infirmary are expected to continue for the next few months, with the hope of expanding the use of the Mako Robotic Arm to other hospitals in the region. Patients like Margaret are optimistic about the potential of this technology to improve their quality of life and provide them with better outcomes following knee surgery.

title: RBS pulls Samsung Galaxy S10 app over security flaw
text: Last week, users found the device could be unlocked by anyone via its fingerprint authentication system when used with certain screen protectors. S10 owners were shocked to discover this glaring security flaw in Samsung's latest flagship phone. The news spread quickly on social media and tech forums, causing concern among users about the safety of their personal data. In response to the security issue, RBS, a major banking institution, decided to pull its app from the Samsung Galaxy S10. The app, which allows customers to manage their accounts, make payments, and check their balances on the go, was deemed too risky to use on the compromised device. RBS took swift action to protect its customers' sensitive financial information, advising them to avoid using the app on the S10 until the security flaw was addressed by Samsung. Samsung, for its part, issued a statement acknowledging the problem and promising to release a software update to fix the fingerprint authentication issue. The company assured users that their security and privacy were of the utmost importance and that they were working diligently to address the vulnerability in a timely manner. However, the damage had already been done, with RBS choosing to err on the side of caution by temporarily removing its app from the affected device. The incident serves as a reminder of the constant battle that tech companies face in ensuring the security of their products in the face of ever-evolving threats. With hackers becoming increasingly sophisticated in their methods, it is essential for manufacturers to stay one step ahead and promptly address any vulnerabilities that may arise. In this case, Samsung's reputation took a hit as a result of the security flaw in the Galaxy S10, causing inconvenience and concern for users and prompting companies like RBS to take precautionary measures. As technology continues to play an integral role in our daily lives, the importance of robust security measures cannot be overstated. Whether it's protecting personal data, financial information, or other sensitive materials, users must be able to trust that their devices are secure and their privacy is safeguarded. In the case of the Samsung Galaxy S10, the security flaw was a wake-up call for both consumers and companies alike, underscoring the need for ongoing vigilance and quick action in the face of potential threats.

title: Parking fine appeal success varies between council areas
text: Runnymede Council in Surrey accepted just 9% of appeals while Harrogate Borough Council in North Yorkshire approved a staggering 95% of appeals last year, according to a recent analysis. The wide disparity in appeal success rates raises questions about the transparency and fairness of the parking fine appeal process across different local authorities in England. Critics argue that the low acceptance rates in some areas suggest a lack of willingness to admit errors or rectify mistakes, leading to frustration among drivers who believe they have been unfairly penalized. On the other hand, councils with high appeal success rates may be seen as more responsive and attentive to the concerns of motorists, leading to a more positive perception of their enforcement practices. The issue of parking fines and appeals has become a hot topic in recent years, with many drivers feeling aggrieved by what they perceive as arbitrary or unjust fines. The process of appealing a parking fine can be time-consuming and complex, requiring the submission of evidence and detailed explanations for why the penalty should be overturned. In light of the varying success rates among councils, there have been calls for a standardized and more transparent appeals process to ensure consistency and fairness for all motorists. Some have suggested the need for an independent body to oversee the appeals process and provide impartial adjudication of cases. In response to the criticisms, Runnymede Council defended their low appeal success rate by stating that they have robust enforcement procedures in place to ensure that fines are issued correctly and fairly. They also emphasized the importance of drivers following parking regulations to avoid unnecessary fines. Conversely, Harrogate Borough Council attributed their high appeal success rate to their commitment to providing excellent customer service and promptly addressing any issues raised by motorists. They highlighted the importance of listening to drivers' concerns and addressing them in a timely manner to maintain public trust and confidence in their enforcement practices. Overall, the varying appeal success rates across English councils underscore the need for greater transparency, consistency, and accountability in the parking fine appeal process. As the debate continues, drivers are encouraged to familiarize themselves with their rights and responsibilities when it comes to parking enforcement to avoid unnecessary fines and potential appeals.

title: Government body had 'concerns' over Pangbourne pesticide spray
text: By Linda Serck BBC News, South A Freedom of Information request showed Natural England's worries about the method being used to kill off the larvae of a caterpillar. The government body had concerns over a pesticide spray being used in Pangbourne, citing potential risks to the surrounding environment and wildlife. Natural England's report highlighted the potential harm to non-target species, including bees and other pollinators that are crucial for ecosystem health. The concerns raised by the government body indicate a need for further evaluation of the pesticide's impact on biodiversity in the area. Local residents in Pangbourne have also expressed their worries about the pesticide spray, with many raising concerns about the potential effects on their health and the environment. Some have reported seeing dead insects and birds in the area, leading to fears about the long-term consequences of the pesticide's use. Environmental groups have joined the call for greater scrutiny of the pesticide spray, emphasizing the need for more sustainable and environmentally-friendly pest control methods. They argue that the use of harmful chemicals can have far-reaching implications for the local ecosystem, disrupting the delicate balance of nature. In response to the concerns raised by Natural England and local residents, the government has announced plans to conduct a thorough review of the pesticide spray's impact on the environment. This review will involve experts from various scientific disciplines, including entomology, ecology, and toxicology, to assess the risks associated with the pesticide's use. The government's decision to investigate the pesticide spray reflects a growing recognition of the need to prioritize environmental protection and sustainability in pest management practices. With concerns mounting over the potential harms of chemical pesticides, there is a growing consensus that more sustainable and eco-friendly solutions are needed to ensure the health and well-being of both humans and nature. In light of the recent revelations about Natural England's concerns regarding the Pangbourne pesticide spray, it is clear that urgent action is needed to address the potential risks posed by these harmful chemicals. By prioritizing the protection of biodiversity and ecosystem health, the government can work towards a more sustainable and resilient future for both people and the planet.

title: Russian iTunes Store shows porn images by mistake
text: Movies without images have been linking to xxx.xxx web address.
