The intention might have been to link to a placeholder, said one IT expert, but addresses ending in .xxx are commonly associated with adult content websites. This blunder has caused quite a stir in Russia, where the iTunes Store is a popular platform for purchasing and downloading music, movies, and other digital content. Users who were innocently browsing the Russian version of the iTunes Store were shocked to see explicit pornographic images instead of the movie posters they were expecting. The mistake was quickly rectified by Apple, but not before causing embarrassment and outrage among many customers. Russian authorities have launched an investigation into the incident, with the Federal Service for Supervision of Communications, Information Technology, and Mass Media (Roskomnadzor) expressing concerns about the breach of online content regulations. The Russian legislation strictly prohibits the distribution of adult content, especially on widely used platforms like the iTunes Store. In response to the incident, Apple issued a public apology, stating that the error was unintentional and that they are working to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. The company assured users that steps have been taken to tighten security measures and review the content that is being linked to on the iTunes Store. This incident has raised questions about the vulnerability of online platforms and the need for stricter oversight to prevent the accidental exposure of inappropriate content to users, particularly minors. With the increasing reliance on digital platforms for entertainment and information, ensuring the safety and integrity of online content has become more crucial than ever. Experts have advised users to be cautious when browsing online platforms and to report any suspicious or inappropriate content immediately. As technology continues to evolve, so too must the mechanisms in place to protect users from unwanted exposure to harmful or explicit material. The Russian iTunes Store incident serves as a stark reminder of the risks and challenges associated with the digital age, highlighting the importance of vigilance and responsible use of online platforms. As authorities and tech companies work together to address these issues, it is hoped that such incidents will become increasingly rare, ensuring a safer and more enjoyable online experience for all users.

title: Google: The most searched for questions and phrases of 2019 revealed
text: These are some of the top phrases and questions you searched for on Google in 2019. The Rugby World Cup - which South Africa won after beating England in the final - topped the list. The sporting event captured the attention of people around the world, with millions tuning in to watch the thrilling matches. Following closely behind the Rugby World Cup, the next most searched for phrase was "Game of Thrones." The popular television show came to an end in 2019, and fans across the globe turned to Google to search for plot details, cast information, and fan theories. The show's epic finale left viewers divided, with some praising the ending while others expressed disappointment. Other top searches included the Hong Kong protests, which dominated headlines throughout the year. People searched for information about the ongoing protests, as well as the political situation in Hong Kong. The demonstrations sparked debate and drew attention to issues of human rights and democracy. In the realm of entertainment, "Avengers: Endgame" was one of the most searched phrases of the year. The film, which marked the culmination of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, was highly anticipated by fans and broke numerous box office records. People eagerly searched for spoilers, reviews, and behind-the-scenes information about the blockbuster movie. In the world of music, "Old Town Road" by Lil Nas X featuring Billy Ray Cyrus was one of the most searched for songs of 2019. The catchy tune topped the charts and sparked a viral dance craze, making it a cultural phenomenon. Fans flocked to Google to discover more about the song and its creators. On a more serious note, the Notre Dame Cathedral fire in Paris prompted a surge in searches as people around the world sought to learn more about the devastating blaze. The iconic cathedral suffered extensive damage, and millions of dollars were raised for its restoration efforts in the aftermath of the fire. These are just a few of the top searches on Google in 2019, showcasing the diverse interests and concerns of people around the world. From sports to entertainment to current events, people turned to the search engine for information, answers, and entertainment. As we look back on the year that was, these top searches offer a glimpse into the trends and topics that captured our collective attention.

title: Megan Lee: Takeaway bosses jailed over allergy death
text: Megan Lee, 15, suffered irreversible brain damage after having an allergic reaction to food from Royal Spice in Oswaldtwistle, Lancashire, in 2016. Mohammed Abdul Kuddus and Harun Rashid were found guilty in October. At Manchester Crown Court on Monday, they were both sentenced to prison for their roles in Megan's tragic death. The court heard how Kuddus, the owner of Royal Spice, and Rashid, the manager, had failed to take proper precautions when preparing Megan's food. Despite her severe allergy to nuts, the meal she ordered was found to contain traces of peanut protein, which led to her fatal allergic reaction. During the trial, it was revealed that Megan had clearly stated her allergy when placing her order. Despite this, the restaurant staff did not take the necessary steps to ensure that her food was safe for her to eat. The prosecutors argued that Kuddus and Rashid had disregarded their duty of care towards customers with allergies, and their negligence had cost Megan her life. In a statement read out in court, Megan's parents expressed their deep grief and anger over the loss of their daughter. They described her as a bright and caring young girl, whose life had been cut short due to the negligent actions of the restaurant staff. They called for stricter regulations to be put in place to protect people with allergies and prevent similar tragedies from happening in the future. The judge, Honorable Justice Patel, condemned Kuddus and Rashid for their "reckless disregard for the safety of their customers." He noted that they had shown no remorse for their actions, and their lack of concern for Megan's wellbeing had been a contributing factor in her death. Both men were sentenced to serve time in prison for their roles in the incident, with Kuddus receiving a longer sentence due to his ownership of the restaurant. Following the sentencing, the Crown Prosecution Service praised the efforts of the police and prosecutors in bringing Kuddus and Rashid to justice. They emphasized the importance of restaurant owners and staff taking allergies seriously and ensuring that food is prepared safely for all customers. The tragic death of Megan Lee has highlighted the need for greater awareness and understanding of food allergies in the hospitality industry. It serves as a reminder that the consequences of failing to properly manage allergies can be devastating, and that the safety of customers should always be a top priority. Hopefully, this case will lead to positive changes in the way restaurants handle allergen information and prevent similar tragedies from occurring in the future.

title: EasyJet half-year loss widens on weaker pound
text: The airline recorded a loss of £212m in the six months to March. That compares with a loss of £21m in the same period last year, marking a significant increase in losses for EasyJet. The company attributes this widening loss to the impact of a weaker pound, which has made travel more expensive for UK-based customers. The weaker pound has affected EasyJet's bottom line in several ways. The airline is faced with higher costs for items priced in foreign currencies, such as fuel and aircraft maintenance. In addition, the increased cost of travel has led to a decrease in demand for flights, as customers look for cheaper alternatives or choose to stay closer to home. Despite the challenges posed by the weaker pound, EasyJet remains optimistic about its future prospects. The company has taken steps to mitigate the impact of the weak currency, including hedging its fuel costs to protect against fluctuations in exchange rates. EasyJet is also focusing on expanding its route network and improving its customer service to attract and retain customers in the face of increasing competition. In a statement, EasyJet CEO Johan Lundgren acknowledged the challenges facing the airline but remained confident in its ability to weather the storm. "The aviation industry is facing unprecedented challenges, but EasyJet is well-positioned to navigate these turbulent times," Lundgren said. "We have a strong balance sheet, a loyal customer base, and a dedicated team of employees who are committed to delivering the best possible service to our passengers." Despite the widening losses, EasyJet is not alone in its struggles. Airlines around the world have been hit hard by the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, with many facing financial difficulties and the threat of bankruptcy. EasyJet's loss of £212m is just the latest in a series of setbacks for the aviation industry, which is still reeling from the impact of travel restrictions and reduced demand for flights. Looking ahead, EasyJet is focused on rebuilding its business and returning to profitability. The airline is optimistic that as travel restrictions are lifted and demand for flights increases, it will be able to recover from its recent losses and return to a position of strength in the market. EasyJet remains committed to providing affordable, high-quality air travel to its customers and is confident that it will emerge stronger from the challenges of the past year.

title: Everest: Top Sherpas slam Nepal's plan to clean rubbish from mountain
text: By Surendra PhuyalBBC Nepali The government says the army will be used for the task, which will cost 860 million Nepali rupees ($7.5m; £5.7m). Last year, they managed to clear about 10,000kg of waste from the mountain, but many are questioning whether using military personnel is the best solution. Several top Sherpas have expressed concerns about the government's plan to clean rubbish from Everest, arguing that the real issue is not the litter left behind by climbers, but the lack of proper waste management systems in place. They believe that simply removing the garbage without addressing the root cause of the problem will not lead to a sustainable solution. Ang Tsering Sherpa, former president of the Nepal Mountaineering Association, emphasized the need for long-term planning and investment in waste management infrastructure in the region. "Cleaning up the mountain is important, but it should be part of a broader strategy to preserve the environment and protect the fragile ecosystem of the Himalayas," he said. Others have raised concerns about the potential environmental impacts of using military personnel to clean Everest. Tashi Lhamu Sherpa, a prominent mountaineer, pointed out that the army's methods may not be as environmentally friendly as those used by experienced Sherpas who are familiar with the mountain. She urged the government to consult local communities and experts in the field to come up with a more effective and sustainable plan. Despite these criticisms, the government remains determined to proceed with its clean-up operation. Officials have defended the use of the army, citing their expertise in logistical operations and their ability to work in extreme conditions. They have also highlighted the importance of maintaining the pristine beauty of Everest, not only for environmental reasons but also for its impact on tourism and the local economy. Nepal is heavily reliant on revenue from tourism, particularly mountaineering, and the government is keen to protect the country's reputation as a premier destination for climbers. Cleaning up Everest is seen as a crucial step in ensuring that the mountain remains a sustainable and attractive place for visitors. As the debate continues, one thing is clear: the issue of waste management on Everest is a complex and multifaceted problem that requires a coordinated and comprehensive approach. Balancing the need to protect the environment with the demands of tourism and economic development will be a delicate task, but one that must be addressed if Everest is to remain the iconic symbol of adventure and achievement that it has always been.

title: Concern raised over changes to probation service
text: By the beginning of next year, 70% of its work in England and Wales will be run by private companies and charities. The UK government said it will make the system more robust and will cut costs, but concerns have been raised over the potential impact on the quality of probation services. Critics argue that the move towards privatization could lead to a focus on profit rather than rehabilitation, with companies cutting corners to save money. This could potentially result in a decrease in the quality of support offered to offenders, jeopardizing their chances of successful reintegration into society. Furthermore, there are worries that the emphasis on profit-making could lead to a lack of accountability and transparency in the probation service. Private companies may not be as transparent or subject to the same level of scrutiny as the publicly-run service, raising concerns over the safeguarding of vulnerable individuals within the criminal justice system. Many within the probation service are also concerned about the impact of privatization on staff morale and job security. The transition to a predominantly privatized system could lead to job losses and changes in working conditions, potentially affecting the quality of service delivery and the relationships built between probation officers and their clients. On the other hand, proponents of the changes argue that the privatization of the probation service will bring in new ideas and innovation, potentially leading to improvements in the efficiency and effectiveness of the system. They believe that the involvement of private companies and charities will inject much-needed competition and diversity into the provision of probation services, ultimately benefiting offenders and the wider community. Despite these arguments, the concerns raised over the changes to the probation service cannot be easily dismissed. The shift towards privatization raises important questions about the priorities and objectives of the criminal justice system, and the potential consequences for the rehabilitation of offenders and the safety of the public. Ultimately, the success of the changes to the probation service will depend on how they are implemented and monitored. It is crucial for the government to carefully consider the potential risks and benefits of privatization, and to ensure that the quality of probation services is not compromised in the pursuit of cost-cutting measures. Only time will tell whether these changes prove to be a positive step forward or a cause for concern in the UK's criminal justice system.

title: Extreme pubic grooming 'may not cause sexually transmitted infections'
text: The findings go against past research warning shaving and waxing could leave cuts in the skin and help sexually transmitted infections. A recent study conducted by a team of researchers from the University of California found that extreme pubic grooming practices, such as shaving or waxing, may not increase the risk of sexually transmitted infections (STIs). The study, published in the Journal of Sexual Medicine, surveyed over 7,500 men and women about their pubic grooming habits and their history of STIs. The results showed that there was no significant difference in the prevalence of STIs between individuals who engaged in extreme pubic grooming and those who did not. These findings may come as a surprise to many, as previous research has suggested that shaving or waxing the pubic area could increase the risk of STIs by creating small cuts or tears in the skin that make it easier for pathogens to enter the body. However, the researchers behind this study believe that other factors may be at play. Lead researcher Dr. Emily Jones explained, "While it is true that shaving or waxing can cause minor injuries to the skin, our study suggests that these injuries may not actually increase the risk of STIs. There could be other factors, such as sexual behaviors or hygiene practices, that play a larger role in determining STI risk." Despite these findings, experts caution against interpreting them as a green light to engage in extreme pubic grooming without taking precautions. Dr. Sarah Patel, a sexual health expert, emphasized the importance of proper hygiene and safe sexual practices to reduce the risk of STIs. "While this study suggests that extreme pubic grooming may not directly cause STIs, it is still important to take care of your pubic area and practice safe sex. Using condoms and getting regular STI screenings are essential for maintaining good sexual health," Dr. Patel advised. In conclusion, the idea that extreme pubic grooming could lead to an increased risk of STIs may not hold true, according to the findings of this recent study. However, it is important for individuals to maintain good hygiene practices and take precautions to protect themselves from sexually transmitted infections. Further research is needed to fully understand the relationship between pubic grooming and STI risk.

title: Coronavirus: Survey suggests business confidence at record low
text: significant decrease in business confidence. The survey paints a grim picture of the economic landscape in Scotland, with many businesses facing unprecedented challenges and uncertainty. According to the SCC survey, retail businesses have been struggling with closures and reduced footfall, leading to a significant drop in sales and revenue. Construction firms have also been hit hard, with many projects put on hold or cancelled due to the pandemic. The tourism industry, which is a key driver of Scotland's economy, has been devastated by travel restrictions and a dramatic decline in visitors. The lack of confidence in these sectors is reflected in the overall sentiment among businesses in Scotland. The survey found that only 5% of businesses reported feeling confident about their future prospects, with the overwhelming majority expressing concern and uncertainty. In response to the findings, the SCC has called for urgent government support to help businesses weather the storm and ensure their survival. The organization has urged policymakers to provide financial assistance, guidance, and resources to help businesses navigate the challenges posed by the pandemic. "We are facing an unprecedented crisis that is having a profound impact on businesses across Scotland," said the SCC's Chief Executive. "It is essential that the government steps in to provide the necessary support to help businesses survive this difficult period and emerge stronger on the other side." The survey's results are a sobering reminder of the devastating toll that the pandemic has taken on businesses in Scotland. Many companies are struggling to stay afloat, with some facing the prospect of permanent closure. The lack of confidence in the business community is a clear indication of the challenges that lie ahead as Scotland strives to recover from the economic fallout of the Covid-19 crisis. As businesses continue to grapple with the uncertainty and disruption caused by the pandemic, the need for government intervention and support has never been more critical. It is essential that policymakers work closely with businesses to provide the necessary assistance and resources to help them survive and rebuild in the post-pandemic world. The SCC survey serves as a stark reminder of the challenges facing businesses in Scotland and the urgent need for action to support them through these difficult times. Only through a concerted effort and collaboration between businesses, government, and other stakeholders can Scotland hope to overcome the economic challenges posed by the Covid-19 crisis.

title: Euro MP David Martin dismisses anti-counterfeiting treaty
text: David Martin, the MEP responsible for his report on the Anti-Counterfeiting Trade Agreement (Acta), said the treaty threatened civil liberties. His comments came less than a week after the European Parliament's international trade committee voted to reject the controversial agreement. Speaking to BBC News, Martin emphasized the need to strike a balance between protecting intellectual property rights and safeguarding fundamental rights. He argued that Acta's provisions could potentially undermine freedom of expression and privacy, raising concerns about its impact on internet users and consumers. "It is essential that we find ways to combat counterfeiting and piracy without compromising our fundamental rights. Acta, in its current form, fails to achieve this balance and therefore cannot be supported," Martin said. The MEP also criticized the lack of transparency and public consultation during the negotiation process, which he believed contributed to the treaty's flawed provisions. He urged policymakers to engage with stakeholders and the public to address legitimate concerns and ensure that any future agreements respect democratic principles. Martin's stance garnered support from civil liberties groups and internet activists, who have long campaigned against Acta. They praised his courage to challenge the treaty and called for a more inclusive and accountable approach to addressing intellectual property issues. However, not everyone welcomed Martin's position. Some industry representatives and proponents of Acta highlighted the importance of combating counterfeit goods and intellectual property theft. They argued that the treaty provided a valuable tool to protect rights holders and promote innovation, particularly in the digital economy. Despite the rejection by the European Parliament's trade committee, Acta still faces uncertainty in the wider legislative process. The agreement needs to be approved by the full parliament in a plenary vote before it can be ratified by member states. The debate over Acta reflects broader tensions between intellectual property rights and civil liberties in the digital age. As the internet continues to transform the way we create, share, and consume content, policymakers face the challenge of striking a balance between innovation and protection. As the discussion unfolds, David Martin's steadfast opposition to Acta serves as a reminder of the importance of upholding fundamental rights in the face of global trade agreements. Whether his concerns will shape the future of intellectual property enforcement remains to be seen, but his voice has undoubtedly added a critical dimension to the ongoing debate.

title: Nuisance calls out of control, says taskforce
text: It also wants company directors to be held responsible for unwanted phone calls from their businesses. The taskforce has recommended that the threshold at which regulators are able to take action against companies making nuisance calls be lowered. Currently, regulators can only take action if a company is found to have made "persistent and aggressive" calls, but the taskforce believes this threshold is too high. One of the key recommendations made by the taskforce is for regulators to be given more power to take action against companies that are found to be making nuisance calls. This could include imposing fines or even banning companies from making unsolicited calls altogether. The taskforce also recommends that companies found to be making nuisance calls should be forced to compensate those who have been affected by their actions. In addition to cracking down on companies making nuisance calls, the taskforce has also recommended that consumers be given more tools to protect themselves from unwanted calls. This could include making it easier for people to opt out of receiving marketing calls, as well as providing better guidance on how to deal with nuisance calls when they do occur. The taskforce has warned that if action is not taken to tackle the problem of nuisance calls, the situation will only get worse. The number of complaints about nuisance calls has been steadily increasing in recent years, with many people reporting that they are receiving multiple unwanted calls every day. This not only causes annoyance and frustration for consumers, but can also have a serious impact on vulnerable individuals, such as the elderly or those with mental health issues. The taskforce has called on regulators, the government, and the industry to work together to tackle the problem of nuisance calls. It believes that a multi-faceted approach is needed, including stronger regulation, better enforcement, and increased awareness among consumers. Only by working together can we hope to bring an end to the scourge of nuisance calls once and for all. In the meantime, the taskforce is urging consumers to report any unwanted calls they receive to the appropriate authorities. By working together and standing up against nuisance calls, we can all play a part in putting an end to this invasive and disruptive practice.

title: Coronavirus: Intensive care demand surged at peak of crisis
text: An official report on Covid cases requiring intensive care shows demand peaked on 29 March, with 29 patients admitted in a single day. Admissions to intensive care units surged during the peak of the crisis, putting significant strain on healthcare systems around the country.  The report, compiled by a team of healthcare experts, highlights the unprecedented pressure faced by hospitals as they scrambled to meet the rising demand for ICU beds. Doctors and nurses worked tirelessly around the clock, making difficult decisions about patient care and allocation of resources. At the peak of the crisis, hospitals were forced to convert operating theatres and other spaces into makeshift ICU units in order to accommodate the growing number of critically ill patients. Ventilators and other life-saving equipment were in short supply, leading to difficult choices about who would receive treatment. The report also notes that while the surge in ICU demand was challenging, hospitals were able to rapidly adapt their practices in order to meet the needs of patients. Telemedicine consultations, remote monitoring, and other innovations helped to alleviate some of the pressure on healthcare providers. Despite the challenges faced during the peak of the crisis, healthcare workers showed remarkable resilience and dedication in the face of adversity. Many worked long hours, sacrificing time with their families in order to care for those in need. Their tireless efforts saved countless lives and helped to prevent the healthcare system from being overwhelmed. As the number of Covid cases requiring intensive care begins to decline, hospitals are now able to catch their breath and take stock of the lessons learned during the crisis. The report emphasizes the importance of robust planning and preparation in anticipation of future outbreaks, as well as the need for continued investment in healthcare infrastructure and resources. Looking ahead, healthcare providers are focused on ensuring that they are better equipped to handle any future surges in demand for intensive care. This includes stockpiling essential supplies, developing clear protocols for patient care, and improving communication and coordination among healthcare teams. While the peak of the crisis was undoubtedly a challenging time for healthcare providers, it also highlighted the incredible dedication and professionalism of those working on the front lines. As the world continues to grapple with the impact of the pandemic, it is clear that the efforts of healthcare workers have been nothing short of heroic.

title: Oxford top of global university rankings
text: universities need to improve if they want to keep up with Oxford's success. Oxford University has once again claimed the top spot in the global university rankings, solidifying its position as one of the most prestigious institutions in the world. The university's exceptional performance in areas such as research, teaching, international outlook, and industry income is a testament to its commitment to excellence in higher education. In a statement released by the university, Vice-Chancellor Louise Richardson expressed her pride in Oxford's continued success. "We are thrilled to be recognized as the best university in the world once again. This achievement is a reflection of the hard work and dedication of our staff, students, and alumni who contribute to the university's outstanding reputation," said Richardson. The Times Higher Education rankings also highlighted Oxford's strong partnerships with industry and research institutions, which have led to groundbreaking discoveries and innovations in various fields. The university's commitment to collaboration and knowledge exchange has played a crucial role in advancing research and driving economic growth in the UK and beyond. However, despite Oxford's outstanding performance, there are concerns that other UK universities are falling behind in the global rankings. While Cambridge and Imperial College London have also secured top positions, there is a noticeable gap between the top three institutions and the rest of the UK's higher education sector. According to the compilers of the rankings, UK universities need to focus on increasing their research output, recruiting talented academics and students, and fostering stronger international partnerships to compete with the best in the world. Failure to do so could result in a decline in the global standing of UK universities, which would have far-reaching implications for the country's reputation as a leader in higher education. In response to these concerns, Education Secretary Nadhim Zahawi has announced plans to invest £1 billion in research and innovation to support UK universities in their efforts to climb up the global rankings. The funding will be used to enhance research facilities, attract top talent, and strengthen international collaborations to ensure that UK universities remain competitive on the world stage. As Oxford celebrates its continued success at the top of the global university rankings, there is a clear message to other UK institutions: the key to maintaining excellence in higher education lies in a relentless pursuit of innovation, collaboration, and academic excellence. Only by prioritizing these key areas can UK universities hope to keep pace with the best in the world and secure their position as global leaders in higher education.

title: Israeli 'Freedom is basic' niqab advert criticised
text: By George Pierpoint, BBC News and Osob Elmi, BBC News The ad, for clothing brand Hoodies, opens with a caption reading "Is Iran here?" and shows Israeli supermodel Shir Elmaliach walking through the bustling streets of Tel Aviv, wearing a black niqab. Throughout the ad, Elmaliach is seen engaging in various activities such as shopping, dining, and even dancing at a night club, all while wearing the traditional Islamic face veil. The ad, which has since sparked controversy and backlash on social media, was meant to convey a powerful message about freedom of expression and cultural diversity in Israel. However, critics argue that the ad is disrespectful and appropriative of Muslim culture. One Twitter user, @HananB132, expressed her outrage, stating, "As a Muslim woman, I find this ad deeply offensive. The niqab is not a fashion statement, it is a religious garment with deep cultural and religious significance. To use it as a prop in an advertisement is disrespectful and wrong." Others have defended the ad, arguing that Elmaliach was simply exercising her right to freedom of expression and creativity. In a statement to BBC News, Hoodies defended the ad, stating, "Freedom is a basic human right that should be celebrated and embraced by all. Our intention was to show that in Israel, people of all backgrounds and beliefs have the freedom to express themselves however they choose." The controversy surrounding the ad has also reignited the debate on cultural appropriation and the boundaries of freedom of expression. In a country as diverse and multicultural as Israel, where Jews, Muslims, Christians, and others live side by side, it is important to consider the implications of using religious and cultural symbols in advertising. One thing is clear - the ad has sparked a much-needed conversation about freedom, diversity, and respect for different cultures in Israel. As the backlash continues to grow, it remains to be seen how Hoodies will respond to the criticism and whether they will make any changes to the ad. For now, the ad continues to circulate on social media, with both supporters and critics voicing their opinions on the controversial campaign. As Israel grapples with issues of cultural sensitivity and freedom of expression, it is important for brands like Hoodies to tread carefully and thoughtfully when using religious and cultural symbols in their advertising campaigns. Only time will tell how this particular controversy will be resolved.

title: SNP conference: Sturgeon pledges childcare 'revolution'
text: The new SNP leader unveiled the ambitious plans at the party's conference in Perth. It would see the number of free hours increase from 16 to 30 every week. Ms Sturgeon said she wanted to revolutionize childcare in Scotland and provide families with the support they need to thrive. Speaking to a packed room of party members and supporters, Sturgeon outlined the vision for her childcare "revolution". She emphasized the importance of early years education and the positive impact it can have on children's development. By expanding the free hours available to families, she hopes to give every child in Scotland the best start in life. The announcement was met with widespread applause and support from attendees, who see it as a crucial step towards building a fairer and more prosperous society. The SNP has long been committed to investing in childcare and early years education, and Sturgeon's pledge is a continuation of that commitment. In her speech, Sturgeon also highlighted the economic benefits of investing in childcare. By supporting families and removing barriers to work, she believes that Scotland can unlock its full potential and build a stronger economy. With more parents able to return to work or increase their hours, businesses will benefit from a more talented and diverse workforce. But the childcare revolution is about more than just numbers on a balance sheet. Sturgeon stressed the importance of creating a nurturing and supportive environment for children, where they can learn, play, and grow. By providing high-quality childcare, she hopes to give every child the opportunity to fulfill their potential and succeed in life. The SNP's ambitious plans have already garnered praise from experts and stakeholders in the childcare sector. They see it as a bold and forward-thinking approach to tackling inequality and supporting families. By prioritizing childcare, Sturgeon is sending a clear message that the SNP is committed to building a fairer and more inclusive society for all. As the conference drew to a close, Sturgeon's childcare revolution remained a hot topic of discussion among attendees. Many expressed their excitement and optimism about the future of childcare in Scotland under her leadership. With the support of the party and the public, Sturgeon's vision for a childcare revolution looks set to become a reality in the coming years.

title: At what age do you feel you have reached adulthood?
text: Nationwide's study of 2,000 over-18s found more than one in 10 did not think of themselves as fully fledged grown-ups until they reached the age of 27. Lisa Daisy, 34, told the BBC: "Even after graduating from university, getting a job, and moving out on my own, I still didn't feel like a real adult. It wasn't until I started taking on more responsibilities, like paying bills and making important decisions, that I began to see myself as a grown-up." It seems that the concept of adulthood is subject to individual interpretation. Some may feel like they have reached adulthood as soon as they turn 18, while others may not feel truly adult until much later in life. Psychologist Dr. Rachel Johnson explains that there are external factors, such as societal expectations and cultural norms, that can influence when someone feels like an adult. "For many people, reaching adulthood is marked by milestones like getting a job, buying a house, or starting a family. These events can shape one's perception of themselves as an adult," she says. The transition to adulthood is a gradual process that can be influenced by various life experiences. For some, it may be a specific event or realization that triggers the feeling of being a grown-up. For others, it may be a gradual accumulation of experiences and responsibilities that solidify their identity as an adult. In today's society, the traditional markers of adulthood, such as getting married or having children, are no longer the only indicators of maturity. With changing social norms and expectations, individuals are redefining what it means to be an adult. Career achievements, personal growth, and emotional intelligence are now being seen as important aspects of adulthood. However, there is no one-size-fits-all answer to the question of when someone truly becomes an adult. Each person's journey to adulthood is unique and shaped by their own experiences and beliefs. Ultimately, feeling like an adult is a subjective experience that is dependent on personal growth and self-awareness. As society continues to evolve, the concept of adulthood may also continue to change. What is certain is that the journey to adulthood is an ongoing process that is influenced by a myriad of factors. Whether it happens at 18, 27, or beyond, the feeling of being a grown-up is a significant milestone in one's life.

title: Shoreham air crash pilot 'flew too low' at Southport airshow
text: Southport Airshow said the Jet Provost T5 the BBC has established was piloted by Mr Hill was seen too close to crowds and below the height set for the event. On Tuesday, Sussex Police confirmed that the pilot involved in the Shoreham air crash, which resulted in the death of 11 people, had flown the aircraft at an unsafe altitude during the Southport Airshow. The Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) has strict regulations in place for airshows to ensure the safety of spectators and participants. Aircraft are required to maintain a minimum distance from the crowd line and fly at a safe altitude to prevent any potential accidents or incidents. The CAA conducts regular inspections and enforces these regulations to uphold the highest standards of safety in aviation events. Mr Hill's decision to fly the Jet Provost T5 too low at the Southport Airshow has raised questions about his judgment and adherence to safety protocols. The tragic consequences of the Shoreham air crash could have been avoided if proper precautions had been taken to ensure the safety of everyone involved. In response to the findings of the investigation, the organizers of the Southport Airshow have stated that they will be reviewing their safety protocols and procedures to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. They are committed to working closely with the CAA and other authorities to establish a safer environment for airshow attendees and participants. The families of the victims of the Shoreham air crash have expressed their disappointment and frustration at the news that Mr Hill flew too low at the Southport Airshow. They feel that his actions were reckless and irresponsible, leading to the loss of their loved ones in a preventable tragedy. The aviation community as a whole has also been shaken by the revelations surrounding the Shoreham air crash pilot's behavior at the Southport Airshow. Pilots are held to a high standard of professionalism and are expected to prioritize safety above all else when operating aircraft in public spaces. Moving forward, it is crucial for all airshow organizers, participants, and spectators to be vigilant and adhere to safety guidelines to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. The lessons learned from the Shoreham air crash serve as a stark reminder of the importance of safety in aviation and the devastating consequences that can result from negligence or disregard for established regulations.

title: Gemma Arterton to play Nell Gwynn in London's West End
text: The production has been playing at London's Shakespeare's Globe but will move to the Apollo in February. The play charts the rise of the captivating Nell Gwynn, a historical figure known for her charm, wit, and talent as an actress during the 17th century. Gemma Arterton is set to take on the role of Nell Gwynn, a character that perfectly aligns with her own vibrant personality and impressive acting skills. Arterton, known for her roles in films such as "Prince of Persia" and "Quantum of Solace," brings a level of charisma and talent that will surely captivate audiences in this new production. Nell Gwynn's story is one of determination and resilience, as she navigated the male-dominated world of theatre to become one of the most beloved actresses of her time. Her rise from humble beginnings to the stage of the prestigious Theatre Royal, where she captured the heart of King Charles II, is a testament to her strength and tenacity. Arterton's portrayal of Nell Gwynn is sure to bring a fresh perspective to the character, highlighting her intelligence, humor, and unwavering spirit. The actress has proven time and time again her ability to embody complex and multi-dimensional characters, and Nell Gwynn is no exception. The move of the production to the Apollo Theatre is a testament to its success at the Globe, where it has received rave reviews from critics and audiences alike. The new venue will provide a larger stage for the cast to showcase their talents and bring Nell Gwynn's story to an even wider audience. The play's director, Christopher Luscombe, has praised Arterton's commitment to the role, noting her dedication to bringing Nell Gwynn to life in a way that is both authentic and captivating. The rest of the cast, including James Garnon as King Charles II and Amanda Lawrence as Nancy, bring their own unique talents to the production, creating a dynamic and engaging ensemble. As the opening night at the Apollo Theatre approaches, anticipation is high for what is sure to be a memorable and entertaining production. Gemma Arterton's portrayal of Nell Gwynn promises to be a highlight of the show, showcasing her talent as a performer and bringing a new level of depth to this iconic character. Audiences can expect a night of laughter, romance, and intrigue as they follow Nell Gwynn's journey from the streets of London to the heights of the theatrical world. With Gemma Arterton leading the way, this production is sure to be a must-see event in London's West End.

title: Italy's Giuseppe Conte tells populist leaders: 'Stop fighting or I'll quit'
text: and the Five Star Movement has been plagued by infighting and power struggles since its formation. Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte's ultimatum comes after weeks of tensions between the two populist parties, which have resulted in a string of policy disputes and stalled reforms. Conte's warning was met with mixed reactions from members of both parties. Matteo Salvini, the leader of the League, dismissed Conte's threat as a "bluff", accusing him of trying to hold the government hostage. Salvini has been pushing for more hardline immigration policies and tax cuts, while Luigi Di Maio, the leader of the Five Star Movement, has called for greater social welfare programs and environmental protections. The infighting has left Conte struggling to maintain control over his government, with both Salvini and Di Maio vying for influence and power. The tensions came to a head recently when Salvini announced a proposal to reduce the number of MPs in parliament, a move that was met with widespread skepticism and criticism from both parties. Conte has been walking a tightrope, trying to balance the demands of both parties while also appeasing the European Union and other international allies. The ongoing power struggle has led to a sense of instability and uncertainty in Italy, with many questioning the government's ability to effectively govern and address pressing issues facing the country. The Prime Minister's threats to resign have raised concerns about the future of Italy's government and the potential for further chaos and political instability. Conte's departure would likely lead to new elections, which could result in a more right-wing government coming to power, further complicating the already tumultuous political landscape in Italy. As the deadline for resolving the government's issues looms, Conte's future remains uncertain. The Prime Minister has made it clear that he will not stand for continued infighting and dysfunction within his government, but whether or not his ultimatum will be enough to bring the coalition parties back in line remains to be seen. Italy's political future hangs in the balance as Conte’s ultimatum sends shockwaves through the country. The coming days will be crucial in determining the fate of the government and whether or not the populist leaders can put their differences aside for the good of the country.

title: Conservation: Bid to save reptiles and amphibians in Wales
text: By Matt Lloyd BBC Wales More than 50% of snake, newt, and toad species are under threat globally, conservationists have said. Housing and road construction combined with a "terrible public image" are endangering populations. Now a charity plans to step in to help protect reptiles and amphibians in Wales. The Amphibian and Reptile Conservation (ARC) Trust, based in Cwmbran, is launching a new campaign to raise awareness of the importance of these often misunderstood creatures. The charity aims to educate the public on the vital role that snakes, newts, and toads play in the ecosystem and the threats they face in the modern world. As part of their efforts, the ARC Trust is partnering with local wildlife organizations and government agencies to create habitats and safe spaces for reptiles and amphibians to thrive. This includes the restoration of wetlands, creation of wildlife corridors, and implementation of road mitigation strategies to reduce the number of reptiles and amphibians killed by vehicles. One species that the ARC Trust is particularly focused on conserving is the common European adder. Once found throughout Wales, the adder population has declined sharply in recent years due to habitat loss and persecution. By working with landowners and local communities, the ARC Trust hopes to reverse this trend and secure a future for the adder in Wales. In addition to habitat restoration and conservation efforts, the ARC Trust is also running public outreach programs to dispel myths and misconceptions about snakes, newts, and toads. Through school visits, community events, and social media campaigns, the charity is working to change the negative perceptions that have contributed to the decline of these species. Dr. Emily Roberts, a herpetologist and spokesperson for the ARC Trust, emphasized the importance of raising awareness and taking action to protect reptiles and amphibians. "These creatures are an integral part of our ecosystem, playing key roles in controlling insect populations and maintaining ecological balance," she said. "If we don't act now to protect them, we risk losing valuable species that are irreplaceable." The conservation efforts of the ARC Trust are part of a broader movement to safeguard biodiversity in Wales and around the world. By working together with local communities, government agencies, and conservation organizations, we can ensure that future generations will be able to enjoy the beauty and diversity of reptiles and amphibians in their natural habitats.

title: Honour of Kings: China's most vilified online game
text: hours a day for teenagers aged 12 to 18. This drastic measure was implemented by the Chinese government in an effort to combat what they have deemed as the harmful effects of excessive gaming on the youth population. Honour of Kings, known as Wangzhe Rongyao in China, is a hugely popular online multiplayer game developed by Tencent. It has been downloaded over 200 million times and boasts a player base of over 100 million active users. The game allows players to choose from a variety of heroes and engage in battles against other players in a virtual world. Despite its popularity, Honour of Kings has come under fire for a variety of reasons. Critics argue that the game promotes violence and addictive behavior, with some players reportedly spending hours on end gaming, to the detriment of their physical and mental health. In extreme cases, players have even died as a result of marathon gaming sessions. The Chinese government's decision to restrict access to Honour of Kings is just the latest in a series of actions taken to regulate the gaming industry in the country. In 2018, the government implemented regulations that required game developers to limit the amount of time players spent on games, as well as to prevent minors from making in-game purchases without parental consent. Tencent, the company behind Honour of Kings, has responded to the restrictions by implementing real-name registration and age verification systems to ensure that underage players are not exceeding the allotted time limits. They have also introduced a feature that reminds players to take breaks and have implemented a system that punishes those who violate the restrictions. Despite these measures, concerns about the impact of Honour of Kings on young players persist. Some parents worry that the game is too addictive and that the restrictions do not go far enough to protect their children. Others argue that gaming, when done in moderation, can have educational and social benefits for young people. As the debate over Honour of Kings rages on, one thing is clear: the game has sparked a national conversation about the role of gaming in Chinese society and the responsibility of developers to ensure that their products do not harm the players who enjoy them. With the Chinese government taking such proactive measures to regulate access to Honour of Kings, it is likely that other countries will look to follow suit in an effort to protect vulnerable populations from the potential harms of excessive gaming. Only time will tell if these restrictions will have the desired effect or if they will simply drive players to find other ways to access their favorite game.

title: Cambridge homeless man Raymond Boyle's killer, 18, jailed
text: Jack Robinson stamped on 53-year-old Raymond Boyle's head and back, in Jesus Green last June. He dragged him unconscious to the River Cam, leaving him to drown in the shallow waters. This horrific crime shocked the close-knit community of Cambridge, where Boyle was known as a friendly and harmless homeless man who often sat by the riverbank. Robinson, an 18-year-old with a history of violent behavior, was arrested shortly after the incident and charged with murder. During the trial, it was revealed that Robinson had been under the influence of drugs and alcohol at the time of the attack. The prosecution argued that he had acted with intent to kill, showing a complete disregard for human life. The defense, on the other hand, claimed that Robinson had a troubled childhood and had been failed by the system. They argued that he was not in control of his actions and should be treated with leniency due to his young age. However, the jury found Robinson guilty of murder and he was sentenced to life in prison with a minimum term of 20 years. The judge, in delivering the sentence, described Robinson's actions as "savage and senseless" and expressed his condolences to Boyle's family. He emphasized the need for society to address the underlying issues that lead young people to commit such heinous crimes, calling for better support and intervention for troubled individuals. Boyle's family, who attended every day of the trial, welcomed the verdict but expressed their devastation at the loss of their loved one. They described Raymond as a kind and gentle soul who had struggled with addiction and homelessness but had always retained his dignity and humanity. In response to the tragedy, the local community organized a memorial service for Boyle, laying flowers and candles at the spot where his body was found. They also started a fundraising campaign to support homelessness charities in Cambridge, in memory of Boyle and in the hope of preventing similar tragedies in the future. As the case comes to a close, the focus now shifts to the wider issue of homelessness and addiction in Cambridge. Many are calling for increased resources and support for those living on the streets, to prevent vulnerable individuals from falling through the cracks of society. It is a tragic reminder of the challenges faced by the most marginalized members of our community and the urgent need for compassion and action to address their needs.

title: MP Yeo cleared by standards watchdog
text: The Tory MP was secretly filmed by Sunday Times investigators posing as representatives of a fictional energy company seeking to hire his services. The paper said he had admitted telling a business associate what to say, but maintained that he had done nothing wrong and had not breached parliamentary standards. The Standards Commissioner, Kathryn Stone, launched an investigation into the matter following the release of the footage. The investigation found that there was no evidence of Mr. Yeo breaking parliamentary rules or engaging in any wrongdoing. In a statement, Ms. Stone said: "Having considered the evidence, including the footage and testimony provided by Mr. Yeo, I am satisfied that there is no case to answer in this instance." Mr. Yeo, who has been a Member of Parliament for over 30 years, expressed relief at the decision, stating that he had been confident all along that he had acted in accordance with parliamentary rules. He also thanked his constituents for their support during what he described as a challenging time for him and his family. The MP reiterated that he takes his parliamentary duties and responsibilities very seriously and will continue to work tirelessly on behalf of his constituents. He also emphasized his commitment to transparency and ethical conduct in his role as an elected representative. The incident has reignited debates about the role of undercover journalism in exposing potential misconduct by public officials. Some critics argue that such tactics can sometimes be unethical and can unfairly tarnish the reputations of individuals who may have done nothing wrong. Others believe that undercover investigations are a necessary tool in holding those in power accountable and ensuring transparency in public affairs. Regardless of one's stance on this issue, the fact remains that Mr. Yeo has been cleared by the standards watchdog and can continue to serve as a Member of Parliament without any cloud of suspicion hanging over him. The decision by the Standards Commissioner brings this chapter to a close, but it serves as a reminder of the constant scrutiny that public officials must operate under and the importance of upholding high ethical standards in public office.

title: Indian media: Kashmir government
text: The state gave a "fractured mandate" on 23 December after a fiercely fought election and no party crossed the 44-seat mark needed to form a government in Indian-administered Kashmir. This has led to a situation where political parties are now engaged in intense negotiations to form a coalition government. The recent elections in Kashmir saw the People's Democratic Party (PDP) emerging as the single largest party with 27 seats, closely followed by the National Conference with 20 seats. The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) won 15 seats while the Congress party secured 12 seats. With the results throwing up a hung assembly, all eyes are now on which party will be able to garner the required support to form a government. The PDP, led by Mehbooba Mufti, has staked its claim to form the government, citing their status as the single largest party. However, the party still falls short of the required numbers to form a government on its own. The National Conference, on the other hand, has also expressed its willingness to explore alliances in order to form a government. The BJP, which had formed a coalition government with the PDP in the previous term, is also keen on being part of the government formation this time around. The party has been in talks with several smaller parties to secure the required numbers to form a government. The Congress party, despite having won only 12 seats, has also not ruled out the possibility of being part of a coalition government. The situation in Kashmir is further complicated by the recent abrogation of Article 370 by the Indian government, which revoked the special status accorded to the region. This move has led to widespread anger and protests in the region, with many political parties and groups demanding the restoration of the special status. The ongoing negotiations to form a government in Kashmir are being closely watched by all stakeholders, as the region grapples with political uncertainty and instability. The outcome of these coalition talks will have far-reaching implications for the future governance of the region and its relationship with the Indian government. As the various parties continue their discussions to form a government in Kashmir, the people of the region are hoping for a swift resolution to the political impasse. The coming days will be crucial in determining the political landscape of Kashmir and the direction it takes in the years to come.

title: Proud Boys: Far-right group becomes LGBT trend online
text: The trend is part of efforts to drown out posts and content related to a far-right, anti-immigrant group of the same name. Actors, artists and the Canadian armed forces are among those who have shared supportive pictures. The Proud Boys, a group known for promoting white supremacist ideologies and violence, have gained notoriety in recent years for their aggressive and often confrontational tactics. In response to the growing influence of the Proud Boys, many members of the LGBT community have taken to social media to reclaim the name and turn it into a symbol of pride and unity. By flooding the internet with images of rainbow flags and messages of love and acceptance, these activists hope to undermine the hateful message of the far-right group. One of the most prominent figures to join the campaign is actor and LGBTQ rights advocate, George Takei. Takei, best known for his role in the Star Trek series, has been using his platform to spread awareness about the Proud Boys and encourage others to stand up against hate. In a recent tweet, he wrote, "We will not let the Proud Boys tarnish our name. Love will always conquer hate. #ProudBoys." Other celebrities, such as pop star Taylor Swift and actress Ellen Page, have also shared messages of support for the movement. Swift, who has been vocal about her support for the LGBTQ community, posted a picture of a rainbow flag on her Instagram account with the caption, "Proud to stand with my LGBTQ fans against hate and intolerance. Love is love. #ProudBoys." While the trend has gained momentum online, some critics have raised concerns about the potential risks of using the Proud Boys name in this way. They argue that by appropriating the name, activists may inadvertently be giving the far-right group more attention and legitimacy. However, supporters of the movement believe that reclaiming the name is a powerful way to show solidarity and push back against hate. In addition to celebrities, members of the Canadian armed forces have also shown their support for the campaign. In a statement released by the Department of National Defense, a spokesperson said, "We stand with the LGBTQ community in denouncing hate and discrimination. The Proud Boys do not represent the values of the Canadian Armed Forces, and we are proud to join in the fight against intolerance." As the online movement continues to grow, activists are hopeful that their message of love and acceptance will eventually drown out the voices of hate and bigotry. By reclaiming the name Proud Boys and turning it into a symbol of pride, they are sending a powerful message that unity and inclusivity will always triumph over division and prejudice.

title: Birmingham bin strike: Council 'backtracking on deal'
text: Unite, the union representing the striking bin workers in Birmingham, has accused the council of backtracking on a deal that was supposed to end the ongoing dispute. The union claims that the council has started sending out refuse trucks without the necessary "leading hands", who are responsible for operating at the back of the vehicles. This development has reignited tensions between the council and the union, with Unite calling the issue "at the heart" of the long-standing argument over the working conditions of the bin workers. Unite has gone as far as to seek a High Court injunction in an attempt to force the council to honor the original agreement. The bin strike in Birmingham has been ongoing for weeks, causing chaos and disruption for residents who have been left with overflowing bins and uncollected waste. The strike has also had a significant impact on the city's streets, with rubbish piling up and causing a serious hygiene concern. The original deal that was reached between Unite and the council was supposed to address the union's concerns about working conditions, pay, and the use of agency staff. However, Unite now claims that the council is reneging on the deal by sending out refuse trucks without the necessary leading hands, putting the safety and well-being of the bin workers at risk. The council, on the other hand, has defended its actions, stating that it is committed to resolving the strike and ensuring that waste collection services are not disrupted. The council has also emphasized that it is working to recruit more leading hands to address the issue raised by Unite. Despite the council's assurances, Unite remains adamant that the council is backtracking on the original agreement and is now taking legal action to try to force the council to comply. The union has warned that if the situation is not resolved soon, the strike could escalate even further, causing more disruption and inconvenience for residents. The bin strike in Birmingham has become a contentious issue that has divided the city, with residents, businesses, and the council all feeling the effects of the ongoing dispute. The situation remains uncertain as both sides dig in their heels and refuse to back down, leaving residents caught in the middle of a messy and prolonged standoff.

title: Council demanded payment card details via email
text: By Leo KelionTechnology desk editor  Islington Council had required residents to share the security code from the rear of their cards, as well as their address, among other details. One security expert said the move raised serious concerns about the council's commitment to protecting the personal data of its residents. Mark James, a cybersecurity specialist at ESET, warned that requesting payment card details via email was a risky practice that could leave residents vulnerable to fraud and identity theft.  "It's shocking to see a local council requesting sensitive financial information in this way," James said. "Email is not a secure method of communication, and sending payment card details in this manner opens up the possibility of interception by cybercriminals. Residents should never be asked to share this type of information over email, and any legitimate organization should have secure systems in place for processing payments." Islington Council defended its actions, stating that the request for payment card details was part of a new online payment system designed to make it easier for residents to pay for services such as council tax and parking permits. The council claimed that the information was being used to set up direct debit payments and that residents' data would be securely stored and protected. However, many residents were left feeling uneasy about the council's request for their payment card details via email. Some took to social media to express their concerns, with one resident writing, "I'm not comfortable sending my card details over email. This seems like a very risky practice, and I'm worried about the security of my personal information." Following the backlash, Islington Council issued a statement apologizing for any confusion or inconvenience caused by its request for payment card details. The council assured residents that their data would be handled securely and said that it was working to improve its payment processing system to ensure residents' information was protected. In the wake of the incident, cybersecurity experts have urged organizations to review their data protection practices and implement secure methods for processing payment card information. James stressed the importance of using encrypted communication channels and secure payment gateways to safeguard sensitive financial data from falling into the wrong hands. As more organizations move toward digital payment systems, it is essential for them to prioritize data security and protect the personal information of their customers. By taking proactive steps to enhance data protection measures, organizations can build trust with their customers and ensure that their sensitive information remains secure.

title: New Zealand's Dunedin jokes about losing 'steepest street' title
text: On the Australian and New Zealand regional edition of BBC News Prime, locals in Dunedin expressed a mix of pride and jest as they bid farewell to their beloved Baldwin Street's title as the steepest street in the world. The recognition was now handed over to Ffordd Pen Llech in Harlech, Wales, leaving many Kiwis in good spirits and ready to poke fun at themselves. Although losing the title was bittersweet, Dunedin residents took to social media to share their favorite memories of Baldwin Street and crack jokes about the uphill battle to reclaim the record. One Twitter user quipped, "Looks like we'll have to start training harder to regain our title. Time to hit the stairs!" Another added, "Who needs the steepest street when you have the steepest sense of humor in the world?" Local businesses in Dunedin also joined in on the banter, offering discounts to anyone who could prove they conquered both Baldwin Street and its new Welsh rival. Some even suggested hosting a friendly competition between the two streets to settle the score once and for all. Despite the loss of the Guinness World Record title, Baldwin Street remains a cherished landmark in Dunedin, attracting visitors from near and far who are eager to test their endurance and snap a selfie at the top. The steep incline of the street has become synonymous with the city's unique charm and rugged landscape, making it a must-see destination for adrenaline junkies and curious travelers alike. As the sun sets on Baldwin Street's reign as the steepest street in the world, Dunedin residents are keeping their spirits high and their witty remarks flowing. Whether it's poking fun at their uphill struggles or reminiscing about past adventures on the iconic street, Kiwis are proving that losing a title doesn't mean losing their sense of humor. With a newfound appreciation for the quirky character of their city, Dunedin residents are ready to embrace the challenge of reclaiming the steepest street title in the future. Until then, they'll continue to laugh, share stories, and celebrate the legacy of Baldwin Street as a symbol of Dunedin's proud spirit and resilient nature.

title: Cour du Parc renovation to begin in September
text: Cour du Parc at La Charroterie in St Peter Port has been empty since 2011, when it was decided the building was not fit to house residents. The association plans to renovate and revitalize the historic property, bringing it back to its former glory. The Cour du Parc renovation project is set to begin in September, with a budget of £2 million allocated for the restoration. The building, which dates back to the 18th century, has a rich history and is considered a significant cultural heritage site in Guernsey. The renovation plans include restoring the exterior façade of the building, repairing the roof, and updating the interior to meet modern standards. The goal is to transform Cour du Parc into a mixed-use development that will include residential units, commercial spaces, and community facilities. Local residents have expressed their support for the renovation project, citing the importance of preserving Guernsey's architectural heritage. Many are excited to see the building brought back to life and believe it will contribute to the revitalization of the area. The association behind the project is working closely with heritage experts and architects to ensure that the renovation maintains the character and charm of the original building. Special care will be taken to preserve the historic features of Cour du Parc while incorporating modern amenities and design elements. In addition to the physical renovation of the building, the project will also focus on creating a sustainable and environmentally friendly development. Plans include the installation of energy-efficient heating and cooling systems, as well as the use of sustainable materials in the construction. The renovation of Cour du Parc is expected to take approximately two years to complete, with the first residents scheduled to move in by 2023. The project is seen as a positive step towards the revitalization of St Peter Port and the preservation of Guernsey's cultural heritage. Local businesses are also hopeful that the renovation of Cour du Parc will bring increased foot traffic to the area and boost the local economy. The mixed-use development is expected to attract residents, visitors, and businesses alike, creating a vibrant and dynamic community hub. Overall, the Cour du Parc renovation project represents an exciting opportunity to breathe new life into a historic building and contribute to the ongoing revitalization of St Peter Port. With careful planning and attention to detail, the project is poised to not only preserve Guernsey's architectural heritage but also create a thriving and sustainable community space for generations to come.

title: Tate Britain hits £45m renovation target
text: Nine of the building's gallery rooms are being refurbished, as are the entrance area and other public spaces. The target has been reached thanks to a £4.9m donation from the Wellcome Trust, along with additional contributions from other generous donors. Tate Britain, located in London, is one of the oldest and most prestigious art institutions in the world. With a collection that spans centuries of art history, the gallery is a must-visit for art enthusiasts and tourists alike. The renovation project aims to update and modernize the gallery spaces, while also preserving the historic charm of the building. The newly refurbished gallery rooms will feature state-of-the-art lighting and climate control systems, ensuring the optimal viewing conditions for the priceless artworks on display. The entrance area will be redesigned to create a more welcoming and accessible space for visitors, with improved signage and information points to enhance the visitor experience. In addition to the physical upgrades, the renovation project will also include a digital transformation, with plans to create a virtual tour of the gallery for those who are unable to visit in person. This innovative approach to accessibility will allow art lovers from around the world to experience the wonders of Tate Britain from the comfort of their own homes. The renovation project is being overseen by a team of expert architects, designers, and conservationists, who are dedicated to preserving the heritage of Tate Britain while ushering it into a new era of artistic excellence. The project is expected to be completed by the end of the year, with a grand reopening planned for early next year. The Director of Tate Britain, Sarah Smith, expressed her gratitude to the donors who have made the renovation project possible, stating that their support will ensure the gallery remains a world-class destination for art lovers for years to come. She also highlighted the importance of preserving the cultural heritage of Tate Britain for future generations, and the role that the renovation project will play in achieving this goal. As the renovation project continues to progress, art enthusiasts eagerly anticipate the unveiling of the newly refurbished gallery spaces at Tate Britain. With its rich history, unparalleled collection, and commitment to excellence, Tate Britain is poised to remain a cornerstone of the art world for generations to come.

title: Tropical forests 'better managed'
text: area remaining under threat is a concern for conservationists worldwide, as tropical forests are crucial ecosystems for biodiversity, climate regulation, and the livelihoods of millions of people. One of the key challenges in managing tropical forests better is ensuring that sustainable management plans are effectively implemented and enforced. This requires strong governance, adequate funding, and monitoring systems to track progress and address any issues that may arise. Without these key components, even the best intentions can fall short, leaving tropical forests vulnerable to exploitation and deforestation. In recent years, there has been growing recognition of the importance of indigenous peoples and local communities in the management of tropical forests. These groups have been stewards of the land for generations and possess a wealth of traditional knowledge about sustainable land use practices. By involving them in decision-making processes and land management activities, we can ensure that conservation efforts are more effective and more likely to succeed in the long term. At the international level, there have been efforts to promote sustainable management of tropical forests through initiatives like REDD+ (Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation). This scheme provides financial incentives for developing countries to reduce deforestation and invest in sustainable land use practices. While REDD+ has shown promise in some areas, there are still challenges to overcome, such as ensuring that funds reach the communities most affected by deforestation and that projects are implemented in a transparent and accountable manner. Ultimately, the future of tropical forests depends on the collective efforts of governments, businesses, local communities, and civil society to work together towards sustainable management. This will require a shift away from unsustainable practices like clear-cutting and conversion of forests for agriculture towards more sustainable alternatives that promote conservation and long-term forest health. As we look towards the future, it is clear that there is still much work to be done to ensure the sustainable management of tropical forests. By investing in stronger governance, supporting indigenous peoples and local communities, and promoting international initiatives like REDD+, we can make significant progress towards safeguarding these vital ecosystems for future generations. It is crucial that we act now to protect tropical forests before it is too late.

title: Artist's designs for Alabama church bombing window on display
text: The bombing by members of the Ku Klux Klan was a new low in the fight for civil rights. As news spread around the world, Carmarthenshire artist John Petts made a pledge to design a replacement stained glass window. The horrific event that took place at the 16th Street Baptist Church in Birmingham, Alabama, on September 15, 1963, shook the nation to its core. Four young African American girls lost their lives in the bombing, and the tragedy united people in their resolve to combat racism and hatred. Petts, known for his intricate stained glass designs, felt compelled to use his artistic talents to honor the memory of the victims and contribute to the healing process of the community. He reached out to the church and offered to create a new window that would commemorate the lives lost and serve as a symbol of hope and resilience. The church accepted his offer, and Petts began working on the design that would eventually become a powerful tribute to the victims of the bombing. The window, entitled "The New Day," depicted a scene of a phoenix rising from the ashes, symbolizing the church's rebirth and the community's strength in the face of adversity. Petts carefully selected vibrant colors and intricate patterns to capture the essence of hope and renewal. The design also incorporated four doves, representing the four young girls who lost their lives in the bombing. It was a poignant and moving tribute that resonated with all who saw it. After months of meticulous work, the stained glass window was completed and installed at the 16th Street Baptist Church. The unveiling ceremony was attended by community members, civil rights leaders, and supporters from around the world. The window became a focal point of remembrance and reflection, a beacon of light and love in a dark chapter of American history. Decades later, the window continues to inspire and uplift all who visit the church. Its message of unity and resilience remains as relevant today as it was when it was first created. The legacy of John Petts and his commitment to using art as a tool for social change lives on through the beautiful stained glass window that stands as a testament to the enduring power of hope and healing.

title: Deepfake queen prompts 200-plus complaints to Ofcom
text: The broadcaster said its intention had been to give a "stark warning" about fake news in the digital age. But commentators said the jokes made in the show were "disrespectful" and in "poor taste". The watchdog is now facing more than 200 complaints from viewers who were offended by the deepfake video featuring a fake Queen Elizabeth II. Ofcom, the broadcasting regulator in the UK, has confirmed that they are investigating the complaints and will be assessing whether the video breached any broadcasting standards. The deepfake video, which aired on a popular comedy show, depicted the Queen giving a speech about the coronavirus pandemic. However, her words were digitally altered to make her appear to say inappropriate and offensive statements. The use of deepfake technology to manipulate videos and create fake news has become a growing concern in recent years.
