In response to the hack, the Democratic National Committee (DNC) released a statement condemning the attack and calling for greater cybersecurity measures to protect political campaigns. The DNC emphasized the need for all parties to take the threat of cyber attacks seriously and work together to strengthen defenses. As the investigation into the hack continues, questions are being raised about the potential impact on the upcoming presidential election. With just weeks to go until Election Day, any disruption to the campaign's online presence could have serious consequences for both candidates. President Trump's campaign team has vowed to continue fighting against the spread of misinformation and fake news, even as they grapple with the fallout from the hack. The incident serves as a reminder of the ongoing challenges facing political campaigns in the digital age and the importance of cybersecurity in protecting democratic institutions. In the wake of this latest security breach, all eyes are on the Trump campaign as they work to secure their website and restore confidence in their digital operations. The outcome of the investigation will undoubtedly have far-reaching implications for the future of online political campaigning.

title: Ant and Dec 'wanted to quit' Britain's Got Talent
text: The presenting duo felt they were being "sidelined", as segments they filmed for the audition shows kept "ending up on the cutting room floor". Ant and Dec, beloved hosts of the popular talent show Britain's Got Talent, were growing frustrated with what they perceived as a lack of appreciation for their hard work. Sources close to the pair revealed that both Ant and Dec had expressed their concerns to show producers, pointing out that their contributions were consistently being overlooked in favor of other segments. The duo, known for their quick wit and easy banter, felt their chemistry on screen was being undermined by the editing process. The decision to potentially quit the show came as a shock to fans, who have come to love Ant and Dec's hosting style on Britain's Got Talent. The duo had been a staple of the show since its inception, with their dynamic partnership winning over audiences year after year. But behind the scenes, tensions were brewing. Ant and Dec felt they were not being given the recognition they deserved, despite their years of dedication to the show. The prospect of walking away from Britain's Got Talent was a difficult one for the duo, but they knew they had to stand up for themselves. After much deliberation, Ant and Dec decided to sit down with show producers to express their concerns in a clear and concise manner. They made it known that they were not happy with the way their segments were being treated, and that they felt their contributions were not being given the respect they deserved. To their surprise, the producers were receptive to their feedback. Recognizing the value that Ant and Dec brought to the show, they promised to make changes to ensure that the duo's segments were given the attention they deserved. With their concerns addressed, Ant and Dec decided to stay on as hosts of Britain's Got Talent. The presenting duo were relieved to know that their voices had been heard, and that their hard work would not go unnoticed. Fans of the show breathed a sigh of relief at the news that Ant and Dec would be returning for another season of Britain's Got Talent. The presenting duo's decision to speak up for themselves had paid off, and viewers could look forward to enjoying their trademark humor and charm for years to come.

title: Mexico police detain US 'sect leader' after triple murder
text: United States. Black, who is described as a "sect leader" by authorities, was apprehended by Mexican police in the state of Chihuahua after a violent standoff. The triple murder that Black is allegedly connected to took place in the small town of Iron River, Michigan. The victims were identified as two women and one man, all believed to be members of Black's sect. The motivations behind the murders remain unclear, but investigators are looking into Black's possible involvement. Authorities in Mexico had been tracking Black's movements for weeks before finally locating him in Chihuahua. The raid on his properties was carried out in the early hours of the morning, leading to a tense confrontation between Black and the police. Shots were fired, but ultimately Black was taken into custody without further violence. Black's sect, which reportedly has a small but dedicated following in both the US and Mexico, has long been the subject of controversy. Former members have come forward with allegations of physical and emotional abuse, as well as claims of brainwashing and manipulation. The US authorities had been trying to apprehend Black on charges of child abuse for months, but he had managed to evade capture by fleeing to Mexico. Now, with his arrest, it is hoped that justice will finally be served for the victims of his alleged crimes. Black's followers have expressed shock and disbelief at the news of his arrest. Many of them are still loyal to him, despite the serious allegations against him. They have vowed to stand by him and support him through this difficult time. The Mexican authorities are working with their US counterparts to gather evidence and build a case against Black. It is expected that he will be extradited to the United States to face trial for the charges of child abuse and now, possibly, murder. This case has sent shockwaves through both countries, highlighting the dangers of extremist groups and the importance of vigilant law enforcement. The investigation is ongoing, and more details are expected to emerge in the coming days. For now, Orson William Black Jr remains in custody, awaiting his fate as the legal process unfolds. The victims of the triple murder, and all those affected by Black's alleged crimes, are in the thoughts of both nations as they seek closure and justice.

title: Over to you, chancellor
text: Simon Jack, Business editor Although a cut of a quarter of a percent was not a surprise, a specific message that it could fall further towards zero by year end was unexpected. The looming threat of negative interest rates has certainly rattled markets and left many wondering what lies ahead for the economy. With the COVID-19 pandemic still wreaking havoc on businesses and livelihoods, the pressure on the Chancellor to navigate these uncertain waters is immense. The decision to lower interest rates further underscores the need for bold and decisive action in the face of economic uncertainty. As businesses struggle to stay afloat and consumers tighten their belts, the Chancellor must do everything in his power to provide support and stability for the economy. The threat of negative interest rates may be a last resort, but it is a stark reminder of the challenges that lie ahead. The Chancellor's message must be clear and unambiguous: the government stands ready to do whatever it takes to support the economy and protect jobs. Fiscal stimulus measures will be crucial in driving economic recovery and ensuring that businesses have the support they need to weather the storm. The Chancellor must also work closely with the Bank of England to coordinate monetary policy and ensure that interest rate cuts are effective in stimulating growth. The road ahead will not be easy, but the Chancellor must show leadership and vision in guiding the economy through these turbulent times. Tough decisions will need to be made, and sacrifices will have to be borne, but ultimately the goal must be to build a stronger and more resilient economy for the future. As the Chancellor addresses the nation and outlines his plans for economic recovery, the stakes could not be higher. The future of the economy hangs in the balance, and the decisions made now will have far-reaching implications for years to come. The Chancellor must rise to the occasion and demonstrate that he has the vision and courage to lead the country through this challenging period. Over to you, Chancellor. The nation is watching, and the future of the economy is in your hands. It is time to show bold and decisive leadership and chart a course towards a brighter and more prosperous future for all. The challenges may be great, but with determination and resolve, we can overcome them and build a better tomorrow for generations to come.

title: Hundreds of children wait years for asylum decisions
text: By Patrick Cowling & Sadaf MarufBBC News Home Office figures obtained by the BBC show delays have almost tripled since January 2014, when 484 children were waiting more than six months for a decision on their asylum applications. Fast forward to today, and that number has surged to over 1,400 children experiencing prolonged periods of uncertainty. For these hundreds of young asylum seekers, the wait is agonizing. Many have fled war or persecution in their home countries, only to be faced with a complex, drawn-out process in the UK. The emotional toll of not knowing their fate weighs heavily on these vulnerable children, leaving them in a state of limbo. In addition to the psychological impact, the lengthy delays also have practical implications for these children's lives. During the waiting period, many are unable to access basic services, such as healthcare and education, which are crucial for their wellbeing and development. Without a clear status, they remain in a state of instability, unable to fully integrate into society. Campaigners argue that the backlog in immigration cases not only harms individual children but also undermines the UK's commitment to protecting the rights of refugees. By prolonging the process, the government risks denying these children the chance of a safe and secure future in the UK. In response to these concerns, a Home Office spokesperson stated that they are working to address the delays in asylum decisions, acknowledging that improvements are needed. They highlighted initiatives such as the Vulnerable Persons Resettlement Scheme, which aims to provide assistance to the most vulnerable refugees. However, critics remain skeptical of the government's efforts, pointing to the continued rise in the number of children waiting for asylum decisions. They argue that more needs to be done to ensure timely and fair treatment for these vulnerable individuals. The situation facing hundreds of children waiting for asylum decisions underscores the need for a more efficient and compassionate system. It is essential that the UK prioritizes the welfare of these young asylum seekers, providing them with the support and protection they desperately need. As the backlog of immigration cases continues to grow, the government must take urgent action to address the delays and ensure that no child is left in limbo for years on end. The lives of these young individuals hang in the balance, and it is imperative that their voices are heard and their rights are respected. Only then can we truly fulfill our duty to protect and support those in need.

title: Hong Kong: What is China's 'patriot' plan for electoral reform?
text: In response to ongoing pro-democracy movements and protests in Hong Kong, China has proposed a controversial electoral reform plan that aims to ensure only "patriots" hold positions of political power in the semi-autonomous region. Beijing argues that the goal is to prevent individuals who are deemed "unpatriotic" from influencing or participating in the governance of Hong Kong. The proposed reform includes changes to the way candidates are vetted before they can run for office. Under the new plan, a committee would be established to assess candidates' adherence to Beijing's definition of patriotism. This committee would have the authority to disqualify any individual who is considered to be in violation of the guidelines set by the Chinese government. Critics argue that this would effectively eliminate any political opposition in Hong Kong, as only candidates approved by Beijing would be allowed to participate in elections. Opponents of the reform plan warn that it would mark the end of democracy in Hong Kong, which has operated under a "one country, two systems" framework since the handover from British to Chinese rule in 1997. This framework was supposed to guarantee a high degree of autonomy for Hong Kong, including the right to hold free and fair elections. However, recent moves by the Chinese government to tighten its grip on the region have raised concerns about the erosion of Hong Kong's democratic freedoms. The proposed electoral reform has sparked outrage among pro-democracy activists and politicians in Hong Kong. Many see it as a blatant attempt by Beijing to silence dissent and impose its will on the region. Some fear that the reform plan could lead to the disqualification of prominent pro-democracy figures, effectively dismantling any opposition to the Chinese government's rule in Hong Kong. International critics have also denounced the proposed reform, with the United States warning that it would undermine Hong Kong's democratic institutions and violate the rights and freedoms of its residents. The European Union has expressed similar concerns, calling on China to uphold its commitments to the people of Hong Kong and respect their right to choose their own leaders through free and fair elections. As tensions continue to escalate in Hong Kong over the proposed electoral reform, the future of the region's democracy hangs in the balance. While Beijing insists that the goal is to uphold stability and security in Hong Kong, critics argue that the real motivation behind the plan is to consolidate Chinese control and suppress any challenges to its authority. The outcome of this political struggle will have far-reaching implications for the people of Hong Kong and their aspirations for democracy and self-determination.

title: Iran scientist Shahram Amiri free to leave, US insists
text: The state department rejected claims by Tehran that Shahram Amiri, who surfaced at a Pakistani embassy building, had been abducted by US agents. Spokesperson John Kirby stated that Mr. Amiri had been in the United States of his own free will and was free to leave whenever he wished. This statement came after Iranian officials accused the US of kidnapping the nuclear scientist and demanded his immediate return. Mr. Amiri first made headlines in 2010 when he disappeared during a pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia. Iranian authorities claimed that he had been kidnapped by American intelligence agencies and was being held against his will. However, in subsequent videos released by Mr. Amiri himself, he claimed that he had voluntarily defected to the US in order to provide valuable intelligence on Iran's nuclear program. After spending several years in the United States, Mr. Amiri suddenly resurfaced at the Pakistani embassy in Washington D.C. requesting to be sent back to Iran. This surprising turn of events sparked a diplomatic crisis between the US and Iran, with each side accusing the other of foul play. The US government's insistence that Mr. Amiri was free to leave raised questions about the nature of his return to Iran. Iranian officials maintained that he had been abducted and forced to return against his will, while the US maintained that he had made the decision to return home on his own accord. Speculation swirled in the international media about Mr. Amiri's motivations for returning to Iran. Some suggested that he may have been coerced by Iranian authorities, while others believed that he may have had a change of heart and wanted to reunite with his family. The truth behind his sudden return remained a mystery, with conflicting reports coming from both sides. The case of Shahram Amiri highlighted the complexities of international diplomacy and espionage. His story served as a reminder of the high stakes involved in intelligence operations, where individuals may find themselves caught between conflicting loyalties and allegiances. As the diplomatic standoff between the US and Iran continued to escalate, the fate of Shahram Amiri hung in the balance. Whether he would be seen as a hero or a traitor, a victim or a pawn, remained to be seen. One thing was certain - his case had captured the attention of the world and would continue to be a topic of debate and discussion for years to come.

title: Meet the butterflies from 200 million years ago
text: The discovery of these tiny butterfly scales is shedding new light on the world of these delicate creatures from 200 million years ago. The study, published in the journal Science Advances, reveals that these ancient butterflies were similar in size and shape to modern-day species, despite having evolved millions of years apart. Dr. Huang Diying, one of the lead researchers on the study, explained that the finding was both surprising and exciting. "To find such well-preserved butterfly scales from the Jurassic period is truly remarkable. It gives us a rare glimpse into the world of these ancient insects and how they have evolved over time," she said. The fossilised scales were found in rock formations in a quarry in Germany, where scientists have been studying the ancient flora and fauna of the region for many years. Using advanced imaging techniques, the researchers were able to create detailed 3D models of the scales, revealing intricate patterns and structures that are similar to those seen in present-day butterflies. One of the most striking aspects of the discovery is the similarity between the ancient scales and those of modern butterflies. The researchers found that the shape, size, and arrangement of the scales were almost identical to those of species that are alive today. This suggests that the basic structure of butterfly wings has remained relatively unchanged over tens of millions of years. Dr. Maria Gomez, a co-author of the study, explained that this finding challenges our understanding of butterfly evolution. "We always assumed that butterflies underwent significant changes in their wing structure over time, but this discovery suggests that they have remained remarkably consistent throughout their long history," she said. The researchers believe that this discovery could have important implications for our understanding of butterfly evolution and adaptation. By studying the ancient scales in more detail, scientists hope to learn more about how butterflies have adapted to changes in their environment and how they have diversified into the different species we see today. As for the ancient butterflies themselves, their lives were likely very different from those of their modern counterparts. The researchers suspect that they may have lived in a world with very different environmental conditions, including higher atmospheric oxygen levels and different plant species. By studying these ancient scales, scientists hope to learn more about how butterflies have survived and thrived in a changing world for millions of years.

title: Cambridge anorexic woman who died 'wanted to be assessed'
text: Amanda Bowles, 45, was found at her Cambridge home in September 2017. The inquest heard Ms Bowles was not monitored for about four months after she was discharged from the eating disorder service. The inquest is the latest development in the case of the Cambridge woman who tragically lost her life due to complications related to anorexia nervosa. During the inquest, it was revealed that Amanda had expressed a desire to be assessed by mental health professionals. However, despite her requests, she was not seen by medical professionals, which ultimately led to her deteriorating health and eventual passing. This troubling revelation has raised questions about the adequacy of mental health services for individuals suffering from eating disorders in Cambridge and beyond. Amanda's family has been left devastated by her death, feeling that more could have been done to support her during her battle with anorexia. Her sister, Sarah Bowles, spoke out about the lack of proper care and support that Amanda received, highlighting the need for better access to mental health services for those struggling with eating disorders. In response to the findings of the inquest, the Cambridge Eating Disorder Service has pledged to review its discharge procedures and ensure that patients are properly monitored and supported after leaving their care. The service acknowledges that there were lapses in Amanda's care and has expressed deep regret for the oversight that led to her untimely death. The tragic case of Amanda Bowles serves as a stark reminder of the devastating impact that eating disorders can have on individuals and their loved ones. It highlights the importance of early intervention and ongoing support for those struggling with these complex conditions. In light of Amanda's passing, there have been calls for greater awareness and education surrounding eating disorders in Cambridge and throughout the UK. It is hoped that her story will prompt positive change within the mental health system, ensuring that individuals like Amanda receive the care and support they desperately need. As the inquest into Amanda Bowles' death draws to a close, her family is left grappling with the loss of a beloved sister and daughter. Their hope is that her story will serve as a catalyst for change, leading to improved care and support for individuals battling eating disorders in Cambridge and beyond. The legacy of Amanda Bowles lives on as a reminder of the importance of prioritizing mental health and well-being for all individuals.

title: Guildford Four's Gerry Conlon: Funeral takes place in Belfast
text: His coffin was carried into St Peter's Cathedral in west Belfast by four members of the Birmingham Six. Mr Conlon died at home in west Belfast on 21 June, surrounded by his loved ones. The funeral service was a somber and emotional occasion, as family, friends, and supporters gathered to pay their respects to a man who had spent 15 years wrongfully imprisoned for a crime he did not commit. Gerry Conlon was one of the Guildford Four, a group of Irish men who were falsely accused and convicted of carrying out bombings in England in the 1970s. Their case became a symbol of injustice and wrongful conviction, leading to a campaign for their release that eventually succeeded in 1989. During the funeral service, the tributes poured in for Gerry Conlon, with many remembering him as a man of great strength and resilience. His sister Anne spoke of the years of suffering he endured in prison, and how he never lost hope or gave up fighting for justice. The Birmingham Six, who had also been wrongfully imprisoned for a bombing they did not commit, paid their respects to Gerry Conlon, honoring his memory and the struggle for justice that they shared. The bond between these men, who had suffered together at the hands of an unjust system, was palpable as they stood together in solidarity. As the funeral procession made its way through the streets of west Belfast, crowds gathered to say goodbye to Gerry Conlon. The streets were lined with people who had been touched by his story, moved by his courage and determination to clear his name and seek justice for himself and others. At the graveside, Gerry Conlon was laid to rest, finally at peace after a lifetime of fighting for justice. His legacy as a symbol of resilience and determination in the face of injustice will live on, inspiring others to never give up the fight for truth and accountability. In the aftermath of the funeral, there was a renewed call for justice for all those who had been wrongfully convicted, a reminder that the fight for justice is ongoing and that the legacy of Gerry Conlon will continue to inspire others to stand up for what is right. As the sun set over St Peter's Cathedral, casting a golden glow over the gathering of mourners, there was a sense of closure and peace in the air. Gerry Conlon may be gone, but his spirit lives on in the hearts of those who knew him and in the ongoing struggle for justice that he dedicated his life to.

title: Staffordshire reveals cost of policing mental illness
text: Patrick BurnsPolitical editor, Midlands  One of the first things to strike Staffordshire's incoming PCC, Matthew Ellis, was the escalating cost to his force of dealing with people with mental illnesses. He tells us: "When you get a couple of police officers spending 12 hours in A&E with someone in crisis, that's not good value for money."  Ellis is not alone in his concerns. Across the country, police forces are facing similar challenges when it comes to responding to incidents involving individuals with mental health issues. The demands on police resources are significant, with officers often having to step in to assist individuals in crisis when mental health services are unable to provide timely support.  In Staffordshire, the cost of policing mental illness is estimated to be around £10 million per year. This includes the expense of responding to incidents, as well as the strain placed on officers who are not always equipped to handle complex mental health issues. Ellis is working with local mental health providers to find solutions that are more cost-effective and efficient.  One approach being explored is the implementation of a joint response team that pairs mental health professionals with police officers. This model has been successful in other areas of the country, reducing the burden on police resources and providing better outcomes for individuals in crisis.  However, funding remains a significant challenge. While the government has pledged to increase funding for mental health services, the reality is that police forces are still shouldering a large portion of the cost of responding to incidents. Ellis is calling for greater investment in mental health services to ensure that individuals receive the support they need before they reach a crisis point.  The human cost of failing to adequately address mental health issues is also significant. Individuals in crisis are often the most vulnerable members of society, and their interactions with law enforcement can have lasting consequences. By investing in early intervention and prevention strategies, police forces can help to reduce the number of individuals with mental health issues who come into contact with the criminal justice system.  Matthew Ellis is determined to tackle the issue head-on, working with stakeholders across the region to find sustainable solutions. As he continues to advocate for greater investment in mental health services, he remains committed to ensuring that individuals in crisis receive the care and support they need to thrive. The cost of policing mental illness may be high, but the cost of not addressing the issue is even higher.  It is clear that a coordinated approach is needed to address the complex intersection of mental health and policing. By working together, stakeholders can find solutions that benefit both individuals in crisis and the wider community. Matthew Ellis is leading the way in Staffordshire, and his efforts are likely to have a significant impact on how police forces across the country respond to incidents involving individuals with mental health issues.

title: Boris Johnson seeks spokesperson to front White House-style briefings
text: The job, advertised on the Conservative LinkedIn page, is described as a chance to "communicate with the nation on behalf of the prime minister." "Essential qualities for the role include strong communication skills, experience in media relations, and a deep understanding of government policy," the listing states. The chosen candidate will be responsible for delivering daily press briefings to the media, similar to those held in the White House by the US president's spokesperson. This move by Boris Johnson to establish a White House-style communications team comes as part of a broader effort to improve the government's communication strategy. In recent months, the prime minister has faced criticism for his handling of the Covid-19 pandemic, with many accusing him of not providing clear and consistent messaging to the public. By appointing a dedicated spokesperson to front daily briefings, Johnson hopes to better communicate key government policies and decisions to the public. The role will also involve engaging with journalists and other media outlets to ensure that the government's message is effectively communicated. The decision to adopt this White House-style approach to media relations has been met with mixed reactions. Some have praised the move as a necessary step towards improving transparency and accountability within the government. Others, however, have expressed concern that this new role could lead to a more controlled and sanitized approach to media relations, limiting the ability of journalists to hold the government to account. In a statement, a spokesperson for the prime minister defended the decision, stating that "effective communication is vital for any government, especially during challenging times like these. The establishment of a dedicated spokesperson will ensure that the government's message is clear, consistent, and easily accessible to the public." The search for a spokesperson to fill this crucial role is currently underway, with interviews expected to take place in the coming weeks. The chosen candidate will work closely with the prime minister's office and other government departments to ensure that the government's message is effectively delivered to the public. As the government continues to navigate the challenges posed by the Covid-19 pandemic and other pressing issues, the role of the spokesperson will be more important than ever. The successful candidate will play a key role in shaping the government's communication strategy and ensuring that the public is kept informed of key developments and decisions.

title: EU-student funding guarantee extended
text: By Katherine SellgrenBBC News education reporter And these students' loans and grants will be available for the duration of their degree. The UK government has announced that it will extend its guarantee of funding for EU students studying in the country until at least the end of the current academic year. This decision comes as a relief to many EU students who were concerned about the impact of Brexit on their ability to access financial support for their studies. The guarantee of student funding was due to expire at the end of the 2020-2021 academic year, but the government has now confirmed that it will be extended for the foreseeable future. This means that EU students will continue to be eligible for tuition fee loans and grants, as well as maintenance loans, for the duration of their degree. For many EU students, studying in the UK offers them access to high-quality education and the opportunity to experience a new culture. However, concerns have been raised about the financial implications of Brexit on their ability to afford their studies. The extension of the funding guarantee will provide reassurance to these students that they will be able to continue their education without facing additional financial pressures. The decision to extend the funding guarantee has been welcomed by universities and student groups, who have been advocating for greater support for EU students following Brexit. Universities UK, the representative organisation for universities in the UK, praised the government's commitment to ensuring that EU students can continue to access financial support for their studies. In addition to extending the funding guarantee, the government has also announced that it will be introducing a new immigration route for international students. This route will make it easier for EU students to study in the UK and will allow them to remain in the country for a period of two years after completing their studies. The introduction of this new immigration route is seen as a positive step towards attracting and retaining international students in the UK. It will provide EU students with greater flexibility and opportunities to pursue their education in the country, while also supporting the UK's higher education sector. Overall, the extension of the funding guarantee and the introduction of the new immigration route are positive developments for EU students studying in the UK. These measures will help to ease concerns about the financial implications of Brexit and will provide students with greater support and opportunities to pursue their education in the country.

title: General Election: Loyalists warn unionists not to vote Alliance
text: By Mark DevenportBBC News NI Political Editor The Loyalist Communities Council (LCC) was launched in 2015. In a statement, it said that "any unionist who votes for the Alliance Party is driving a nail into the coffin of the union". This warning comes as loyalist groups in Northern Ireland are increasingly concerned about the surge in support for the Alliance Party, particularly in areas where traditionally unionist parties have dominated. The Alliance Party, led by leader Naomi Long, has seen a rise in popularity among voters who are disenchanted with the traditional unionist parties. With a message of cross-community cooperation and a commitment to addressing issues such as education and healthcare, the Alliance Party has been able to attract voters from both unionist and nationalist backgrounds. This has caused alarm within loyalist circles, who see the Alliance Party as a threat to the unity of the unionist community. The LCC's warning to unionists not to vote for the Alliance Party is seen as a desperate attempt to stem the tide of support for the party. However, this tactic may not be effective in the long run. Many voters in Northern Ireland are tired of the political deadlock and division that has plagued the region for so long. They are looking for a party that can offer a fresh approach and a willingness to work with all sides to find solutions to the problems facing the country. The Alliance Party is seen as a party that embodies these values, offering a way forward that is not bound by the sectarian divisions of the past. This is why it has been able to attract a growing number of supporters who are looking for a change from the old way of doing politics in Northern Ireland. It remains to be seen whether the LCC's warning will have any impact on the election results. The people of Northern Ireland are free to vote for the party of their choice, and many are likely to see the LCC's message as an attempt to intimidate voters and stifle democratic expression. In a democracy, every citizen has the right to vote for the party that best represents their views and interests. The Alliance Party has been able to tap into a mood for change that is sweeping across Northern Ireland, and it is unlikely that loyalist warnings will be able to stop this momentum. As the election approaches, the people of Northern Ireland will have the opportunity to decide for themselves which party they believe is best placed to lead the country forward. Whether they heed the warnings of the LCC or not, it is clear that the Alliance Party has established itself as a viable alternative to the traditional unionist parties in the region.

title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: 'Stakes too high' to delay 'Martyn's Law'
text: Figen Murray, whose son Martyn Hett died in the attack, wants to bring in legislation to step up security in crowded public spaces and venues. The devastating bombing at Manchester Arena in May 2017, which killed 22 people and injured hundreds more, has brought the issue of public safety to the forefront. Murray believes that implementing Martyn's Law is essential to prevent similar tragedies from happening in the future. The law would require venues to have robust security measures in place, such as mandatory metal detectors, bag checks, and trained security personnel. It would also ensure that emergency response plans are in place and that staff are adequately prepared to handle any potential threats. The stakes are too high to delay the implementation of Martyn's Law. The Manchester Arena bombing was a stark reminder of the vulnerability of crowded public spaces to terrorist attacks. Without proper security measures in place, innocent lives are at risk. The inquiry into the attack has revealed a number of failings in the security arrangements at the arena on the night of the bombing. It has become clear that there were missed opportunities to prevent the attack and mitigate its impact. The failure to detect the bomber as he entered the venue, the lack of a clear evacuation plan, and the inadequate response from emergency services all contributed to the high number of casualties. Murray is determined to ensure that lessons are learned from the attack and that the necessary changes are made to prevent similar tragedies in the future. She has been campaigning tirelessly for the introduction of Martyn's Law and has received support from politicians, security experts, and members of the public. The government has indicated that it is open to considering new legislation to improve security in public spaces. Home Secretary Priti Patel has acknowledged the need for stronger security measures to protect the public from terrorist threats. She has committed to working with Murray and other campaigners to explore the possibility of introducing Martyn's Law. There is a growing consensus that action must be taken to enhance security in crowded public spaces and venues. The threat of terrorism remains high, and the risks are too great to ignore. The implementation of Martyn's Law would send a clear message that the safety and security of the public are of paramount importance. Murray's determination to honor her son's memory by ensuring that his death was not in vain is an inspiration to us all. It is time for the government to act and to prioritize the safety of the public. The stakes are too high to delay Martyn's Law any longer.

title: Runshaw college: Machete found after gang attack
text: people were injured during the incident, which has left the community in shock. Authorities have described the attack as a targeted assault involving a group of individuals armed with machetes. The violence erupted on the college premises, causing chaos and panic among students and staff. Students who witnessed the incident have spoken of their fear and disbelief at the brazenness of the attackers. The discovery of the machete by a police dog has raised concerns about the safety and security of the college campus. Many are questioning how such a dangerous weapon could have been brought onto the grounds undetected. The police have launched an investigation into the incident, and are urging anyone with information to come forward. Local residents are also expressing their shock and anger at the violence that has rocked their community. Many have called for increased police presence in the area to prevent any further incidents from occurring. Parents of students at the college are understandably concerned for the safety of their children, and are demanding answers from the authorities. In response to the incident, Runshaw College has cancelled classes and closed its doors until further notice. The principal of the college has released a statement condemning the violence and assuring the community that the safety of students and staff is their top priority. The college is working closely with the police to ensure the perpetrators are brought to justice. The incident at Runshaw College has highlighted the growing problem of gang violence in the area. Local community leaders are calling for action to address the root causes of such violence and to provide young people with alternatives to gang involvement. They are urging authorities to work together to prevent further attacks and to keep the community safe. As the investigation into the attack continues, the community is coming together to support one another and to show solidarity in the face of violence. Many are determined to stand strong against the actions of a few individuals who seek to sow fear and division. The resilience and unity of the community in the wake of this incident is a testament to their strength and determination to overcome adversity. The discovery of the machete at Runshaw College has shaken the community to its core, but it has also brought people together in a show of solidarity and support. In the face of violence, the community is standing strong and united, determined to overcome the challenges they face and to ensure the safety and well-being of all who live and work in the area.

title: Covid-19: Northamptonshire moves to tier 3
text: The county, currently in tier two, will face the higher level of restrictions from 00:01 GMT on 26 December, the government has announced. People in tier three can form bubbles with people they live with and up to two other households. However, they must not mix indoors with anyone outside their household or support bubble. Northamptonshire's move to tier three comes as the number of Covid-19 cases continues to rise in the area. Health officials are concerned about the increasing strain on hospitals and healthcare services, with the risk of the NHS becoming overwhelmed if action is not taken. Under the new restrictions, all hospitality venues such as pubs, restaurants, and cafes must close, except for takeaway, delivery, and drive-through services. Indoor entertainment venues, such as cinemas, theaters, and casinos, must also close, along with indoor attractions like zoos and museums. Non-essential shops, hairdressers, and gyms can remain open in tier three, but must adhere to strict social distancing and hygiene measures. People are advised to work from home if possible and to avoid unnecessary travel outside of the area. The move to tier three will undoubtedly have a significant impact on businesses and residents in Northamptonshire. Many people rely on the hospitality sector for their livelihoods, and the forced closures are likely to result in job losses and financial hardship. Local leaders in Northamptonshire have expressed their disappointment at the move to tier three but acknowledge the need to protect public health. They have urged residents to follow the new restrictions and to continue practicing good hygiene and social distancing measures to help curb the spread of the virus. The vaccine rollout offers hope for the future, but it will take time for enough people to be vaccinated to achieve herd immunity. In the meantime, it is essential for everyone to continue following the guidelines and restrictions in place to prevent further spread of the virus. As Christmas approaches, it is more important than ever for people to stay vigilant and avoid large gatherings or mixing with people from different households. By taking these precautions, we can help protect ourselves and our loved ones from the virus and work towards a brighter and healthier future for Northamptonshire and the rest of the country.

title: Gamer Hbomberguy hands funding row charity Donkey Kong boost
text: for the funding to be reconsidered due to Mermaids' alleged controversial stance on transgender issues. However, Hbomberguy's charity stream ended up surpassing its original goal of £3000 by a landslide, with donations pouring in from fans and supporters around the world. The YouTuber, whose real name is Harry Brewis, embarked on the marathon gaming session in support of Mermaids, a charity that provides support for transgender and gender-diverse children and their families. The organization had come under fire from Linehan and others who claimed that it promoted harmful ideologies and practices. Despite the controversy surrounding Mermaids, Hbomberguy remained steadfast in his support for the charity, using his platform to raise awareness and funds for a cause he believed in. As he played through the classic Donkey Kong game, viewers tuned in to watch and donate, ultimately contributing to a staggering six-figure sum. The success of Hbomberguy's charity stream not only generated substantial financial support for Mermaids but also sparked a larger conversation about the importance of standing up for marginalized communities. The overwhelming response to the fundraiser demonstrated the power of collective action and solidarity in pushing back against discrimination and prejudice. In the wake of the fundraiser, Mermaids released a statement expressing gratitude for the outpouring of support they had received. The charity emphasized the positive impact that the donations would have on their ability to continue providing vital services to transgender youth and their families. Hbomberguy's fundraising efforts also drew attention to the harmful rhetoric and misinformation spread by individuals like Linehan, who seek to undermine organizations working to support LGBTQ+ communities. By turning a negative situation into a positive opportunity for advocacy and fundraising, Hbomberguy sent a powerful message about the importance of using one's platform for good. As the dust settled on the charity stream, Hbomberguy reflected on the experience and the impact it had made. He expressed gratitude for the overwhelming support he had received and reaffirmed his commitment to using his platform to promote social justice and equality. In a time of divisiveness and hostility, Hbomberguy's act of solidarity and generosity served as a beacon of hope and unity. Through his passion for gaming and activism, he managed to turn a potentially devastating situation into a triumph of compassion and community spirit. The funds raised during the Donkey Kong charity stream will undoubtedly make a significant difference in the lives of those supported by Mermaids, proving that even in the face of adversity, kindness and generosity can prevail.

title: Olympic Games £500k steam cloud artwork in Wirral delayed
text: The £500,000 publicly funded spinning column of cloud was set to rise over the Wirral estuary from 31 December as part of the Cultural Olympiad. However, due to unforeseen technical issues, the artwork's installation has been delayed indefinitely. The steam cloud, created by artist David Best, was intended to symbolize the spirit of the Olympic Games and Liverpool's status as a host city for the 2012 games. The column of cloud was meant to rotate gently, emitting bursts of steam to create an immersive and interactive experience for viewers. Unfortunately, a malfunction in the cloud's machinery has caused the delay in its installation. The intricate system of pipes and valves that control the steam emissions has encountered a glitch that cannot be fixed in time for the original launch date. Residents and visitors to the Wirral area have expressed disappointment at the news of the delay. Many were looking forward to experiencing the unique and innovative artwork, which was expected to draw attention to the region's cultural significance. Local authorities are working closely with the artist to resolve the technical issues and reschedule the installation of the steam cloud. David Best has assured the public that he is doing everything in his power to expedite the repairs and get the artwork up and running as soon as possible. In the meantime, alternative plans are being considered to keep the public engaged and excited about the upcoming Cultural Olympiad events. Virtual tours of the steam cloud design process, behind-the-scenes interviews with the artist, and interactive workshops are all being explored as potential ways to make up for the delay. Despite the setback, both the artist and local officials remain committed to bringing the steam cloud to life and showcasing it to the community. The column of cloud is not just a piece of public art; it is a symbol of unity, creativity, and celebration - all of which are values that resonate with the Olympic Games and the spirit of the Wirral region. As preparations continue behind the scenes to resolve the technical issues and reschedule the installation, residents and visitors are encouraged to stay tuned for updates on the steam cloud artwork. The delay may be disappointing, but the anticipation and excitement surrounding its unveiling remain strong.

title: Not guilty plea in landmark Kodi box trial
text: By Jane Wakefield Technology reporter Mr Thompson is accused of selling "fully loaded" Kodi boxes, modified with software that allowed users to watch pirated content. The case will be closely watched by other traders who sell similar devices, as it could set a precedent for how the law deals with these types of products. In a landmark trial, Mr Thompson has pleaded not guilty to charges of copyright infringement and will be fighting the case in court. His defense team argues that Kodi boxes are simply hardware devices that can be used for legitimate purposes, and it is up to the users to decide how they want to use them. The prosecution, on the other hand, maintains that Mr Thompson was well aware of the illegal nature of the content being accessed through the Kodi boxes he sold. They argue that by selling these "fully loaded" devices, Mr Thompson was actively facilitating piracy and profiting from the illegal distribution of copyrighted material. Kodi boxes have become a popular alternative for consumers who are looking to access a wide range of content without having to pay for expensive cable or satellite subscriptions. However, the legality of using these devices to stream copyrighted content has been a hotly debated issue. In recent years, authorities have cracked down on the sale of Kodi boxes that are pre-loaded with apps and add-ons that provide access to pirated content. This has led to a number of high-profile cases where individuals have been prosecuted for selling these devices. Mr Thompson's case is particularly significant as it could have far-reaching implications for other traders in the industry. If he is found guilty, it could set a precedent that would make it more difficult for sellers of Kodi boxes to operate without facing legal consequences. On the other hand, if Mr Thompson is acquitted, it could embolden other traders to continue selling these devices without fear of repercussion. This would undoubtedly be a blow to content creators and copyright holders who rely on licensing agreements to protect their intellectual property. The outcome of this trial will be closely monitored by both the industry and consumers, as it could shape the future of how we access and consume digital content. In an age where technology is constantly evolving, it is important for the law to keep up with these changes and ensure that copyright protections are upheld. As the trial unfolds, all eyes will be on Mr Thompson and the legal arguments put forth by both the prosecution and defense. The implications of this case could be far-reaching and could have a lasting impact on the way we use technology to access entertainment content. The verdict in this trial could shape the future of the Kodi box industry and set a precedent for how similar cases are handled in the future. Stay tuned for updates as the trial progresses.

title: Surrey Police investigation over 'misgendering' tweets
text: Caroline Farrow said Surrey Police wants to "conduct a taped interview under caution" because of tweets posted in October. They were made after she was on ITV's Good Morning Britain with Susie Green, whose daughter Jackie had gender reassignment surgery in Thailand. Farrow's tweets expressed her belief that Green was wrong to allow her child to undergo such a procedure at a young age. The investigation by Surrey Police has garnered significant attention, with many questioning whether or not misgendering someone should be considered a criminal offense. Farrow herself has been vocal about her concerns regarding the impact of such a police investigation on freedom of speech and the ability to engage in respectful debate on sensitive topics. In a statement, Surrey Police defended their decision to investigate the tweets, stating that they take all reports of hate speech seriously and must investigate any potential criminal offenses. However, Farrow and her supporters argue that she was simply expressing her opinion on a controversial issue and should not be subject to criminal investigation as a result. This incident raises important questions about the limits of free speech in the digital age and the role of law enforcement in policing online behavior. While it is important to protect individuals from discrimination and hate speech, some argue that criminalizing misgendering on social media sets a dangerous precedent for limiting freedom of expression. The debate over misgendering and the enforcement of laws surrounding it is not limited to the UK. In many countries around the world, there are ongoing discussions about the rights of transgender individuals and the responsibilities of others when it comes to respecting their gender identity. As the investigation into Caroline Farrow's tweets continues, it is likely that the conversation around misgendering and free speech will only intensify. It is crucial that all sides of the debate are heard and that any decisions made by law enforcement agencies are made with careful consideration of the potential implications for freedom of expression. In the meantime, Farrow remains steadfast in her belief that she has the right to express her opinions on social media without fear of being investigated by the police. Whether or not Surrey Police ultimately decides to press charges, this case will undoubtedly serve as a flashpoint in the ongoing debate over the limits of free speech in the digital age.

title: Wife of 39 years fails in divorce refusal appeal
text: decision, stating that Tini Owens had failed to establish that the original judge had made an error in law. The case, which has attracted widespread media attention, revolves around Tini Owens' claims that her marriage to Hugh Owens had irretrievably broken down. She cited her husband's alleged unreasonable behavior as the primary reason for seeking a divorce. However, Hugh Owens disputed these claims and argued that the marriage could be salvaged. Despite the family court ruling in favor of Hugh Owens, Tini Owens remained determined to secure a divorce. She expressed her disappointment at the Court of Appeal's decision, stating that she felt trapped in a loveless marriage and that her husband's behavior had caused her immense emotional distress. Tini Owens' legal team argued that the original judge had placed too much emphasis on the specific details of the alleged unreasonable behavior, rather than looking at the overall impact it had on the marriage. They contended that Tini Owens should not be forced to remain in a marriage that had clearly broken down beyond repair. However, the appeal judges disagreed with this argument, stating that the law on divorce in England and Wales requires that parties seeking a divorce must establish one of five specific grounds, which include adultery, unreasonable behavior, desertion, two years' separation with consent, or five years' separation without consent. In Tini Owens' case, the court found that her allegations of unreasonable behavior were not sufficient to meet the legal threshold for granting a divorce. The ruling has sparked renewed debate about the need for reform of divorce laws in England and Wales. Critics argue that the current system, which requires fault to be proven in order to obtain a divorce, is outdated and can lead to unnecessary acrimony between parties. They argue that a more no-fault based system, similar to those in place in other countries, would make the process of divorce less combative and more amicable. Despite the setback, Tini Owens has vowed to continue her fight for a divorce. Her legal team has indicated that they may seek permission to appeal the Court of Appeal's decision to the Supreme Court. In the meantime, Tini Owens remains in a legal limbo, unable to move on with her life until she is granted the divorce that she so desperately seeks.

title: North Korea: Mike Pompeo rejects 'gangster-like' accusation
text: After two days of talks with senior officials, he said efforts to push Pyongyang towards abandoning nuclear weapons had international backing. He stressed that denuclearisation was essential for North Korea's security and prosperity and reiterated the United States' commitment to achieving this goal through peaceful means. However, North Korea's foreign ministry issued a statement accusing the US of making unilateral demands and resorting to "gangster-like" tactics. The statement warned that if the US continued with this approach, North Korea would be forced to reconsider its commitment to denuclearisation. In response, Mike Pompeo dismissed the accusation, stating that the US had come to the talks with a sincere desire to discuss practical steps towards denuclearisation. He emphasized that the US was willing to provide security guarantees to North Korea and help the country achieve economic prosperity once denuclearisation was complete. The war of words between the US and North Korea highlights the delicate nature of the ongoing negotiations between the two countries. The Trump administration has made denuclearisation a top priority in its foreign policy agenda, but achieving this goal has proven to be a complex and challenging process. The talks between Mike Pompeo and North Korean officials were seen as a key opportunity to make progress on denuclearisation. However, the latest exchange of accusations has cast doubt on the prospects of reaching a lasting agreement. Despite the setbacks, Mike Pompeo remains optimistic about the possibility of achieving denuclearisation through diplomatic means. He has expressed confidence in the international community's support for the US-led efforts to persuade North Korea to abandon its nuclear weapons program. While the road ahead may be difficult, the US remains committed to engaging with North Korea in a constructive manner. The Trump administration sees denuclearisation as a crucial step towards achieving peace and stability in the region and is willing to continue the dialogue with North Korea to reach a mutually acceptable agreement. As the negotiations continue, the world will be closely watching to see if the US and North Korea can overcome their differences and make progress towards denuclearisation. The stakes are high, and the outcome of these talks will have far-reaching implications for the future of the Korean peninsula and the broader international community.

title: UN net meeting 'hit by hackers' causing website disruption
text: reports emerged of a cyber attack on the United Nations' website hosting the virtual conference. The incident, which occurred on the second day of the conference, disrupted access to critical documents and discussions among participating nations. The attack, believed to be the work of hackers, raises concerns about the vulnerability of online platforms hosting critical international meetings. With the increasing reliance on digital tools for communication and collaboration, ensuring the security and integrity of these platforms is of paramount importance. The UN Secretary-General, Antonio Guterres, condemned the attack as a threat to global cooperation and called for swift action to strengthen cybersecurity measures. He emphasized the need for international cooperation to combat cyber threats and safeguard the integrity of diplomatic engagements conducted online. Despite the disruption caused by the cyber attack, delegates at the Wcit continued their discussions through alternative communication channels. Security experts are working to identify the source of the attack and implement measures to prevent similar incidents in the future. The Wcit is a key forum for discussing issues related to international telecommunications and shaping the future of global communication networks. The treaty under consideration at this year's conference aims to address a wide range of topics, including cybersecurity, privacy, and access to information. The cyber attack on the UN website hosting the conference serves as a stark reminder of the challenges and risks associated with conducting diplomatic negotiations in the digital age. As more meetings and conferences move online, ensuring the security and reliability of digital platforms becomes crucial to maintaining the integrity of international dialogues. In response to the attack, the UN has called for heightened vigilance and cooperation among member states to protect against cyber threats. The incident highlights the need for greater investment in cybersecurity infrastructure and capacity building to defend against potential attacks on critical diplomatic forums. As the Wcit continues its deliberations on proposed changes to the international communications treaty, the cyber attack serves as a wake-up call for the global community to take proactive steps to strengthen cybersecurity measures and safeguard the integrity of online diplomatic engagements. Only through collective action and cooperation can we effectively address the threats posed by malicious actors seeking to disrupt international dialogues and diplomatic negotiations.

title: Head and neck cancer drug 'game changer'
text: in the UK for certain cancers, but this latest research indicates its potential as a game-changer for head and neck cancer treatment. The trial enrolled over 350 patients with advanced head and neck cancer who had already undergone chemotherapy. Half of the participants were given nivolumab, while the other half received standard chemotherapy. The results were striking - those who received nivolumab had a significantly higher survival rate compared to those who underwent traditional treatment. Dr. Robert Haddad, director of the Head and Neck Oncology Program at the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, described the findings as "very promising" and "practice-changing." He emphasized the importance of finding new and effective treatments for head and neck cancer, as traditional options have often been ineffective or resulted in debilitating side effects. Nivolumab works by boosting the body's immune system to target and destroy cancer cells. It is a type of immunotherapy that has shown great potential in treating a variety of cancers, including melanoma and lung cancer. For patients with head and neck cancer, a disease that is particularly challenging to treat, the introduction of nivolumab could be a crucial breakthrough. Despite the promising results, there are still challenges to overcome before nivolumab can become widely available for head and neck cancer patients. The drug is expensive, and not all healthcare systems may be able to afford it. Additionally, more research is needed to determine the best way to use nivolumab in combination with other treatments for optimal results. However, the results from this trial offer hope for patients with advanced head and neck cancer who may have previously felt their options were limited. Nivolumab has the potential to improve survival rates and quality of life for these individuals, offering a ray of hope in what can often feel like a bleak prognosis. The researchers involved in the trial are hopeful that nivolumab will be approved for use in head and neck cancer in the near future. They believe that this drug has the potential to revolutionize the way this type of cancer is treated, offering new hope for patients and their families. Overall, the results of this trial represent a significant step forward in the fight against head and neck cancer. With further research and development, nivolumab could become a cornerstone of treatment for this challenging disease, changing the game for patients and healthcare providers alike. Follow Michelle Roberts on Twitter: @mrobertsbbc

title: Brexit: Further clashes over work on NI port controls
text: By Mark DevenportBBC News NI Political Editor The controls are currently used for checks on agri-food products and animals. In July, the UK confirmed it intended to put in place similar controls for goods coming from the rest of the UK to Northern Ireland, as part of the Brexit arrangements. These plans have faced strong opposition from the EU and some political parties in Northern Ireland. The EU argues that these checks are necessary to protect the integrity of the single market, while some political parties believe they undermine the constitutional status of Northern Ireland. In recent weeks, tensions over these controls have escalated, with further clashes between the UK and the EU. The UK has accused the EU of being inflexible and bureaucratic, while the EU has accused the UK of trying to backtrack on the commitments made in the Brexit deal. The latest flashpoint comes over the construction of permanent facilities for these checks at Northern Irish ports. The UK government has announced plans to build these facilities, but the EU has raised concerns about their location and size. The EU argues that the UK's plans do not fully comply with the Brexit deal and has threatened legal action if changes are not made. The UK, on the other hand, insists that it is following the agreed protocol and accuses the EU of creating unnecessary obstacles. For businesses in Northern Ireland, these disagreements have raised concerns about the impact on trade and supply chains. Some businesses fear that delays and disruptions at the border could lead to higher costs and reduced competitiveness. Political leaders in Northern Ireland have also expressed their frustration with the ongoing disagreements. The Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) has accused the UK government of failing to stand up to the EU, while Sinn Féin has called for the EU to be more flexible in its approach. Amidst these tensions, there are calls for both sides to come together to find a solution that works for all parties. Some believe that compromise and cooperation are essential to avoiding further disruptions and ensuring the smooth flow of goods between Northern Ireland and the rest of the UK. As negotiations continue, all eyes will be on how the UK and the EU navigate these complex and contentious issues. The outcome will not only impact trade and commerce but also have wider implications for the future of Northern Ireland's relationship with the UK and the EU.

title: Zika virus: 'Strongest evidence yet' of effect on babies
text: Dr Tom Frieden, head of the Center for Disease Control (CDC), was testifying before politicians in Washington. He said that data from the cases of two infants in Brazil who died soon after birth indicated the strongest evidence yet of the impact of the Zika virus on babies. The evidence showed that both infants had severe neurological abnormalities that were consistent with Zika virus infection. This finding is alarming as it suggests that the virus can cause devastating birth defects in newborns, confirming what scientists and public health officials have long feared. Dr Frieden emphasized the urgency of the situation, stating that efforts to control the spread of the virus must be intensified to protect pregnant women and their babies. He urged for increased funding for research and public health initiatives to combat Zika and its potential consequences. The CDC has been closely monitoring the Zika virus outbreak and has been working with international partners to better understand the disease and develop strategies for prevention and control. The agency has been providing guidance to healthcare providers and the public on how to prevent Zika virus infection, especially in pregnant women. The discovery of the link between Zika virus and birth defects has raised concerns around the world, particularly in areas where the virus is known to be circulating. Pregnant women have been advised to take precautions to avoid mosquito bites and to seek medical advice if they develop symptoms of Zika virus infection. Efforts are also being made to develop a vaccine against Zika virus, but progress has been slow due to the complexity of the virus and the challenges involved in vaccine development. In the meantime, public health officials are focusing on mosquito control and awareness campaigns to reduce the risk of Zika virus transmission. The new evidence presented by Dr Frieden underscores the need for a coordinated and comprehensive response to the Zika virus outbreak. Governments, healthcare providers, and the public must work together to prevent further spread of the virus and protect vulnerable populations, especially pregnant women and their unborn babies. As scientists continue to study the Zika virus and its effects, it is crucial that resources and support are provided to those affected by the outbreak. The health and well-being of future generations depend on our ability to effectively combat this emerging public health threat.

title: Sound Of 2018 stars to play exclusive gig
text: Billie Eilish, who shot to fame in 2018 with her debut album "When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go?", has been announced as one of the headline acts for the exclusive gig. The singer-songwriter has garnered a massive following with her unique sound and bold style. Her hit songs like "Bad Guy" and "Bury a Friend" have become anthems for a new generation of listeners. Joining Eilish on stage will be the British indie-pop band Pale Waves. The group, fronted by Heather Baron-Gracie, has been making waves in the music scene with their infectious melodies and shimmering guitar riffs. Their debut album "My Mind Makes Noises" has received critical acclaim and has solidified their status as ones to watch in 2019. Not3s, the East London rapper known for his catchy hooks and charismatic stage presence, will also be performing at the gig. His breakout single "Addison Lee" catapulted him to fame in 2017, and he has continued to release hit after hit since then. With a growing fan base and an impressive discography, Not3s is sure to bring the energy and excitement to the stage. The exclusive gig at Maida Vale studios promises to be a night of stellar performances and unforgettable moments. Fans lucky enough to snag tickets will have the opportunity to see some of the most exciting artists of 2018 in an intimate setting. The event will be recorded for Radio 1 and will be broadcast to millions of listeners around the world. As the countdown to the gig begins, anticipation is building among fans and music enthusiasts alike. The opportunity to see these rising stars in such a unique and intimate setting is truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience. With their talent, charisma, and undeniable appeal, Billie Eilish, Pale Waves, and Not3s are sure to deliver a night to remember. So mark your calendars and get ready to witness the future of music at the exclusive Sound of 2018 gig. Whether you're a die-hard fan or a casual listener, this is one event you won't want to miss. Stay tuned for more updates and announcements as the date approaches, and get ready to be blown away by the sounds of tomorrow.

title: Mariam Moustafa death: Family not told about court case
text: Mariam Moustafa, 18, fell into a coma following the attack in Nottingham last February and later died of a stroke. Her father Mohamed said authorities showed "no respect" for the family, who did not know about the hearing. The lack of communication from the authorities has only added to their grief and frustration. The brutal attack on Mariam, a student living in Nottingham, shocked the community and raised concerns about the safety of young women in the city. The assailants, a group of teenage girls, were reportedly involved in a series of altercations with Mariam prior to the attack. Despite pleas from her family to intervene and protect her, little was done to prevent the tragic outcome. The family's anguish has been compounded by the lack of information about the court case and the progress of the investigation. It is unacceptable that they were not informed of the hearing, leaving them feeling helpless and excluded from the justice process. Mohamed Moustafa expressed his disappointment, stating, "We have been left in the dark, with no answers and no closure. It is a further insult to our daughter's memory." The grieving family continues to seek answers and justice for Mariam, whose life was cut short in a senseless act of violence. They are calling for a thorough investigation into the circumstances surrounding the attack and for those responsible to be held accountable for their actions. The lack of transparency and communication from the authorities has only deepened their pain and frustration. Mariam Moustafa's death has sparked a wider conversation about the safety of young women in public spaces and the need for more proactive measures to prevent such tragedies. The community in Nottingham has rallied in support of the Moustafa family, demanding justice and calling for greater awareness of the issues facing young women in the city. As the investigation into Mariam's death continues, her family remains hopeful that those responsible will be brought to justice and that her memory will be honored. They are determined to ensure that no other family has to endure the same heartache and loss that they have faced. The authorities must do better to keep families informed and involved in the pursuit of justice, to prevent further tragedies like Mariam's from occurring.

title: HS2 underground protest: Activists 'being forced out' of tunnel
text: HS2 Rebellion, who are camped out at Euston Square Gardens, say the team is burrowing a vertical tunnel causing crumbs of earth to fall around them. The activists dug tunnels to thwart their eviction. The group is protesting against the high-speed railway project known as HS2, which aims to link London to the Midlands and the North of England. The activists have been living underground for several weeks now, in an attempt to prevent the eviction of the protest camp. They believe that the construction of HS2 will have a devastating impact on the environment, destroying ancient woodlands and habitats for wildlife. However, the authorities have deemed their protest as illegal and have been trying to evict them from the site. The activists are now facing increased pressure as the authorities continue to dig tunnels in order to force them out. In response, the activists have issued a statement saying: "We will not be intimidated by these heavy-handed tactics. We are here to defend the environment and we will not leave until our voices are heard." The protesters have also received support from local residents and environmental groups, who have been providing them with food, water, and other supplies. There have been calls for the authorities to halt the eviction and engage in dialogue with the protesters to find a peaceful resolution. The situation at Euston Square Gardens remains tense, with both sides refusing to back down. The activists are determined to stay underground for as long as it takes to make their voices heard, while the authorities are determined to remove them from the site. The HS2 project has been a source of controversy since its inception, with critics arguing that it is damaging to the environment and will not provide the promised benefits. The protesters at Euston Square Gardens are just one of many groups who are opposed to the project and are willing to take action to try and stop it. As the standoff continues, it remains to be seen how the situation will be resolved. Both sides are entrenched in their positions, and it seems unlikely that either will give in easily. The activists are prepared to continue their underground protest, while the authorities are determined to evict them from the site. Only time will tell what the outcome of this tense situation will be.

title: Bishop Peter Ball victim withdraws from church abuse review
text: Peter Ball, 84, was jailed in October for offences against 18 teenagers and young men in the 1970s, 80s, and 90s. One of his victims, Rev. Graham Sawyer, has decided to withdraw from the church's review of the abuse he suffered at the hands of the disgraced bishop. Rev. Sawyer revealed that his decision to withdraw from the review was due to the lack of progress in holding senior clergy accountable for their role in covering up the abuse. He expressed frustration and disappointment with the Church of England's handling of the matter, stating that he felt let down and betrayed by the institution he once trusted. In a statement, Rev. Sawyer highlighted the need for transparency and accountability within the church, emphasizing that the survivors of Bishop Peter Ball's abuse deserved justice and closure. He criticized the church's handling of the case, accusing senior clergy of protecting their own interests instead of prioritizing the well-being of the victims. The Church of England has faced criticism for its response to allegations of abuse by Bishop Peter Ball, with many survivors and advocates calling for greater transparency and accountability. The independent review, led by safeguarding expert Dame Moira Gibb, was established to investigate the church's handling of the case and identify any failures in responding to the abuse. Rev. Sawyer's decision to withdraw from the review is a significant blow to the church's efforts to address the historic abuse perpetrated by Bishop Peter Ball. His courage in coming forward to share his story helped to shed light on the extent of the abuse and the complicity of senior clergy in covering it up. Despite facing setbacks in the review process, Rev. Sawyer remains committed to seeking justice for himself and his fellow survivors. He has vowed to continue fighting for accountability and reform within the church, calling on senior clergy to take responsibility for their actions and prioritize the safety and well-being of vulnerable individuals. The Church of England has acknowledged Rev. Sawyer's decision to withdraw from the review and expressed regret over the lack of progress in addressing the historic abuse. They have reiterated their commitment to supporting survivors and ensuring that lessons are learned from the failings of the past. As the church grapples with the aftermath of Bishop Peter Ball's crimes, Rev. Sawyer's courage and resilience serve as a reminder of the importance of holding institutions accountable for their failures and prioritizing the needs of survivors. His decision to withdraw from the review may have dealt a blow to the church's credibility, but it also serves as a powerful call to action for greater transparency and accountability in safeguarding practices.

title: Gareth Bayliss presents debut exhibition at Ipswich Art School
text: Richard HaughBBC News Bayliss, 35, studied at Ipswich Art School, which is now a gallery, before providing designs for clients including Dizzee Rascal, Mo Wax, and Adidas. His debut exhibition, titled "Reflections of the Past", opened at the Ipswich Art School last weekend to critical acclaim. The exhibition features a mix of Bayliss's early works from his time at art school, as well as newer pieces that showcase his evolution as an artist. The collection includes paintings, sculptures, and digital art, all of which explore themes of identity, memory, and nostalgia. One of the standout pieces in the exhibition is a large-scale mural that spans an entire wall of the gallery.
