This could involve providing financial assistance, helping them find alternative accommodation, or connecting them with support services to address underlying issues such as mental health or addiction. The implementation of the Homelessness Reduction Bill reflects a growing recognition of the need to take a more proactive and holistic approach to tackling homelessness. By intervening early and providing tailored support, it is hoped that the number of people sleeping rough or living in inadequate accommodation will be significantly reduced. Charities and advocacy groups have welcomed the passing of the bill, highlighting the positive impact it will have on vulnerable individuals and families. Jon Sparkes, Chief Executive of Crisis, stated, "This new law is a major step forward in ensuring that everyone who is homeless or at risk of homelessness gets the help they need to rebuild their lives." While the Homelessness Reduction Bill is a significant achievement, there are concerns about whether councils will have the resources and capacity to meet the increased demand for services. Local authorities will need to invest in training staff, expanding support networks, and securing funding to ensure that they can effectively implement the new legislation. Despite these challenges, the Homelessness Reduction Bill represents a crucial step towards creating a more compassionate and effective response to homelessness in the UK. It is a testament to the dedication and persistence of campaigners, MPs, and individuals who have worked tirelessly to make this legislation a reality. As the Homelessness Reduction Bill prepares to receive Royal Assent and become law, there is hope that it will mark the beginning of a new era in which homelessness is truly a rare and temporary experience for all individuals in the UK.

title: Gentoo penguins are four species, not one
text: By Helen Briggs BBC Environment correspondent According to new evidence, the birds are slightly different in shape and size, and can be told apart by their DNA. Counting them as separate species will help in conservation, they argue, making it easier to target efforts to protect them in the wild. Gentoo penguins are one of the most iconic inhabitants of Antarctica, known for their distinctive bright orange feet and captivating waddling walk. They are also the third largest species of penguin, after the Emperor and King penguins. But what many people don't know is that there are actually four different species of Gentoo penguins, not just one. Scientists have long suspected that there may be more than one species of Gentoo penguin, based on their physical differences and behavior. But it wasn't until recent genetic studies that this hypothesis was confirmed. By analyzing the DNA of Gentoo penguins from different populations, researchers were able to identify distinct genetic markers that separate them into four distinct species. The discovery of these four species of Gentoo penguins has important implications for conservation efforts. By recognizing them as separate species, conservationists can better understand their population dynamics, behaviors, and specific needs. This will allow targeted conservation efforts to be implemented to protect each species and ensure their survival in the face of threats such as climate change and overfishing. One of the major differences between the four species of Gentoo penguins is their distribution range. While all four species are found in Antarctica and the surrounding islands, each species has its own unique habitat preferences and breeding patterns. By understanding these differences, conservationists can work to protect the specific habitats that each species requires for survival. Another important factor to consider is that different species of Gentoo penguins may be more or less vulnerable to specific threats. By recognizing the unique genetic makeup of each species, scientists can assess their susceptibility to factors such as disease outbreaks, pollution, and habitat destruction. This information can then be used to develop tailored conservation strategies to address these threats and ensure the long-term survival of all four species of Gentoo penguins. In conclusion, the discovery that Gentoo penguins are actually four separate species highlights the importance of genetic research in conservation biology. By recognizing and understanding the unique characteristics of each species, scientists can develop targeted conservation efforts that will benefit the overall population of Gentoo penguins. This new understanding will help ensure that these charismatic birds continue to thrive in their frozen home at the bottom of the world.

title: Microsoft reports better-than-expected earnings
text: The firm reported a net income of $6.56bn (£3.94bn) for the quarter, up from $6.38bn a year earlier. Its earnings were boosted by strong sales of its new Xbox game console and its Surface laptops, which have seen increased demand as more people continue to work and learn from home. Microsoft's revenue for the quarter also beat expectations, coming in at $41.7bn compared to analysts' estimates of $41.03bn. The company's cloud computing division, Azure, continued to be a major driver of growth, with revenue increasing by 50% year-over-year. Satya Nadella, Microsoft's CEO, expressed optimism about the company's performance in the face of ongoing challenges caused by the global pandemic. He highlighted the importance of digital transformation in helping businesses and individuals adapt to the new normal, and emphasized Microsoft's commitment to providing tools and technologies to support this transition. In addition to its strong financial performance, Microsoft also announced several new initiatives aimed at driving future growth. The company unveiled plans to acquire Nuance Communications, a speech recognition and artificial intelligence company, in a deal valued at $19.7bn. This acquisition is seen as a strategic move to bolster Microsoft's cloud and AI capabilities, and further solidify its position as a leader in the tech industry. Microsoft's stock price rose in after-hours trading following the earnings report, reflecting investor confidence in the company's ability to navigate the challenges of the current economic climate. The company has maintained a strong position in the market, thanks to its diverse portfolio of products and services, and its focus on innovation and customer-centricity. Looking ahead, Microsoft is well-positioned to continue its growth trajectory, with the increasing digitization of businesses and societies around the world creating new opportunities for the company to expand its reach and impact. As more organizations embrace cloud computing, AI, and other digital technologies, Microsoft is poised to play a key role in shaping the future of technology and driving innovation in the years to come. Overall, Microsoft's better-than-expected earnings for the quarter underscore the company's resilience and adaptability in the face of a rapidly changing business landscape. With strong financial results, a focus on innovation, and a commitment to delivering value to customers, Microsoft is well-positioned for continued success in the months and years ahead.

title: Sony to sell PC unit and cut jobs
text: The company will also split its TV division into a separate subsidiary as part of its restructuring programme. The moves were announced as Sony forecast a net loss of 110 billion yen ($1.08 billion) for the year ending in March 2014. The decision to sell its PC unit comes as a result of declining sales in the computer market, with Sony struggling to compete against rivals such as Apple and Samsung. The company plans to focus its efforts on its more profitable businesses, including its smartphone and gaming divisions. Sony's PC unit, which includes the VAIO brand, has been a key player in the computer market for over 17 years. However, the division has faced stiff competition from other manufacturers and has struggled to turn a profit in recent years. As part of the restructuring, Sony will cut approximately 5,000 jobs, or around 3% of its global workforce. The job cuts will primarily affect employees in the PC and TV divisions, as well as in other areas of the company. In addition to selling its PC unit, Sony will also streamline its TV division by splitting it into a separate subsidiary. The move is intended to make the division more agile and responsive to changing market conditions, as well as to improve overall profitability. Sony has been struggling to turn around its TV business for several years, facing tough competition from companies such as Samsung and LG. The decision to split the division into a separate subsidiary is seen as a bold move to help reinvigorate the struggling business. Despite the challenges facing Sony, the company remains optimistic about its future prospects. In a statement, Sony President and CEO Kazuo Hirai said, "While these are difficult changes, they are necessary to ensure the long-term success of the company. We remain committed to delivering groundbreaking products and services that will excite consumers around the world." Analysts have welcomed Sony's decision to sell its PC unit and restructure its TV division, saying that the moves will help the company focus on its core strengths and improve profitability. However, they caution that Sony will need to continue to innovate and adapt to changes in the market in order to remain competitive in the long term. Overall, Sony's decision to sell its PC unit and cut jobs is a significant step in its restructuring programme. The company's focus on its more profitable businesses, such as smartphones and gaming, is expected to help drive future growth and ensure its long-term success in a rapidly changing market.

title: Cambridgeshire plesiosaur 'sea monster' could be 'new species'
text: Oxford archaeologists discovered the 165 million-year-old reptile bones at Must Farm quarry near Whittlesey. Dr. Carl Harrington and his team dug up the remarkably well-preserved remains of what appears to be a previously unknown species of plesiosaur, a large marine reptile that roamed the seas during the Jurassic period. The team was astounded by the size and condition of the bones, which belong to a creature estimated to have been over 10 meters in length. The plesiosaur's long neck, flippers, and sharp teeth indicate that it was a fearsome predator, likely feasting on fish and other marine creatures. The discovery of such a well-preserved specimen is a rare find and has the potential to greatly expand our understanding of prehistoric marine life. Dr. Harrington and his colleagues are currently working to clean and analyze the bones in more detail to confirm whether this is indeed a new species of plesiosaur. If their hypothesis is correct, it would be a groundbreaking discovery that could shed light on the diversity of marine reptiles during the Jurassic period. The team is also planning to conduct further excavation at the site to see if more remains of this mysterious sea monster can be unearthed. They hope that by piecing together more of the skeleton, they will be able to paint a more complete picture of what this plesiosaur looked like and how it lived. The discovery of this potential new species is not only exciting for the scientific community but also for the people of Cambridgeshire. The county has a rich history of paleontological finds, including the famous Cambridge plesiosaur found in the 19th century. If confirmed, this new species would add another chapter to the region's prehistoric legacy. As news of the discovery spreads, experts from around the world are eagerly awaiting further updates on the excavation and analysis of the plesiosaur bones. The find has the potential to rewrite the history books and open up new avenues of research into the ancient oceans that once covered the Earth. In the coming weeks, Dr. Harrington and his team will continue their painstaking work to uncover the secrets of this ancient sea monster. With each new bone they unearth, they are one step closer to unlocking the mysteries of a creature that ruled the seas millions of years ago. The world watches with bated breath as Cambridgeshire's latest paleontological find could rewrite the textbooks on prehistoric marine life.

title: Chris Christie rules himself out of White House race
text: Mr Christie held a news conference at the governor's office, where he told reporters: "Now is not my time." The Republican has spent the past week reconsidering calls from the party urging him to run for the White House in 2024. After months of speculation and anticipation, Christie finally put an end to the rumors by announcing that he will not be seeking the Republican nomination for president. He cited personal reasons for his decision, saying that he wants to focus on his family and his current role as governor of New Jersey. Christie's announcement came as a surprise to many within the Republican Party, who saw him as a strong contender for the nomination. With his brash style and no-nonsense approach to politics, Christie had garnered a loyal following among conservative voters. However, in recent months, his popularity had waned as some Republicans questioned his conservative credentials and ability to unite the party. Despite this setback, Christie remains a key figure in the Republican Party and is expected to play a significant role in the upcoming presidential election. Many are speculating that he could be tapped for a high-profile cabinet position or serve as a key advisor to the eventual Republican nominee. During his news conference, Christie spoke about the importance of unity within the Republican Party and urged his fellow party members to come together to defeat the Democrats in the next election. He expressed confidence in the party's ability to win back the White House in 2024, but stressed that it would require a united front and a clear vision for the future. As Christie closed his remarks, he thanked his supporters for their unwavering loyalty and pledged to continue fighting for conservative values and principles. While his decision not to run for president may have disappointed some within the party, Christie's commitment to the conservative cause remains unwavering. In the coming months, Christie will no doubt continue to be a prominent voice within the Republican Party, using his platform to advocate for conservative policies and push back against the Democratic agenda. While he may not be running for president in 2024, there is no doubt that Christie will continue to be a force to be reckoned with in American politics.

title: Gay marriage opposed by Welsh ministers David Jones and Stephen Crabb
text: His fellow Conservative and Wales Office deputy Stephen Crabb will also oppose the move. Prime Minister David Cameron faces criticism from some Tories for supporting the idea, as divisive debates continue to surface within the party. David Jones and Stephen Crabb, both Welsh ministers, have firmly stated their opposition to the proposed legislation that would allow same-sex marriage in Wales. Their stance has ignited a wave of controversy and debate within the Conservative Party, with arguments on both sides of the issue. Many see the advancement of gay rights and marriage equality as a sign of progress and inclusivity within society. Advocates argue that denying individuals the right to marry based on their sexual orientation is discriminatory and goes against the principles of equality and human rights. On the other hand, opponents like Jones and Crabb view marriage as a sacred institution traditionally reserved for heterosexual couples. They believe that changing the definition of marriage to include same-sex couples would undermine the sanctity of the institution and go against their personal beliefs. The debate within the Conservative Party reflects larger societal divisions on the issue of same-sex marriage. It highlights the complex balance between upholding individual rights and respecting traditional values, and showcases the ongoing struggle to find common ground on matters of morality and social policy. Despite facing backlash from some members of his own party, Prime Minister David Cameron has remained steadfast in his support for same-sex marriage. He has emphasized the importance of equality and civil rights for all individuals, regardless of their sexual orientation. Cameron's stance has put him at odds with more conservative members of the party, like Jones and Crabb, who are wary of any changes to the institution of marriage. The Prime Minister's support for same-sex marriage has led to increased tensions within the Conservative Party, with factions forming around differing views on LGBTQ+ rights and social policy. As the debate over same-sex marriage continues to unfold in Wales and across the UK, it remains to be seen how the Conservative Party will reconcile its internal divisions on the issue. The clash between traditional values and progressive ideals underscores the ongoing struggle for LGBTQ+ rights and acceptance within society.

title: Mark Kennedy: 'No misconduct by Nottinghamshire Police'
text: The IPCC concluded that the failings in the handling of Mark Kennedy's evidence did not amount to misconduct by Nottinghamshire Police. This decision comes after years of investigation into the actions of Kennedy, who infiltrated environmental activist groups in the mid-2000s. Kennedy's activities came to light in 2010 when he was unmasked as an undercover police officer. It was revealed that he had spent years posing as a leftist activist, gathering intelligence on environmental groups and participating in their activities. This led to the collapse of a trial against six activists who were charged with planning to occupy and shut down the Ratcliffe-on-Soar power station. The IPCC's investigation found that crucial evidence from Kennedy had not been properly recorded or shared with the defense team, leading to the collapse of the trial. However, they determined that this was not due to misconduct on the part of Nottinghamshire Police. Instead, they cited a series of "collective failings" in the handling of the case. The decision has sparked controversy, with critics accusing the IPCC of failing to hold the police accountable for their actions. Campaigners have long called for a full inquiry into Kennedy's role in infiltrating activist groups and the impact his actions had on the legal process. In response to the IPCC's findings, Nottinghamshire Police have issued a statement acknowledging the failings in the handling of Kennedy's evidence. They have pledged to learn from the mistakes made in this case and ensure that such errors are not repeated in the future. The collapse of the trial against the Ratcliffe-on-Soar protesters has raised questions about the use of undercover officers in policing and the lack of transparency surrounding their activities. Activists have raised concerns about the ethics of using officers like Kennedy to gather intelligence on political groups and whether the ends justify the means. The case has also shone a light on the broader issue of police accountability and the need for greater transparency in the legal system. As the debate continues, campaigners are calling for a thorough review of the practices and procedures surrounding undercover policing to prevent similar miscarriages of justice in the future. Overall, the IPCC's findings have reignited the debate around the actions of Mark Kennedy and the role of undercover officers in policing. The decision not to find misconduct by Nottinghamshire Police has left many unsatisfied, highlighting the need for greater scrutiny and oversight in the handling of cases involving undercover policing.

title: Middlesbrough Council children's services supervision continues
text: long in dangerous situations, with some experiencing physical abuse and neglect. However, since then, the council has been under strict supervision to ensure that necessary reforms are implemented to protect vulnerable children in the area. The latest update on Middlesbrough Council's progress in improving children's services supervision has shown some positive signs of change. A recent report highlighted that the council has made significant strides in addressing the issues raised earlier this year. There have been notable improvements in the way cases are handled, with a renewed focus on early intervention and prevention strategies. One of the key changes highlighted in the report is the increased collaboration between different agencies involved in child protection. Middlesbrough Council has been working closely with the police, health services, and schools to ensure that all professionals are equipped with the necessary tools and resources to identify and respond to cases of child abuse and neglect effectively. Furthermore, the report praised the council for its efforts in recruiting and training more social workers to cope with the increased demand for child protection services. By investing in its workforce and providing ongoing support and supervision, Middlesbrough Council has shown a commitment to improving the quality of care provided to vulnerable children. In addition to improving frontline services, the council has also focused on enhancing its oversight and governance structures. Regular reviews and audits are now in place to monitor the effectiveness of safeguarding practices and identify areas for improvement. This proactive approach has been instrumental in driving positive change within children's services supervision. Despite the progress made, there is still work to be done to ensure that all children in Middlesbrough are safe and protected. The council acknowledges that it will take time to fully address the systemic issues identified earlier this year. However, they remain committed to building on the improvements made so far and continue to work towards achieving the highest standards of child protection. Moving forward, Middlesbrough Council is determined to maintain its momentum and drive further improvements in children's services supervision. By working collaboratively with partner agencies, investing in its workforce, and strengthening its governance structures, the council is laying the foundation for a safer and more supportive environment for vulnerable children in the community. With continued dedication and perseverance, Middlesbrough Council is on track to ensuring that all children have the opportunity to thrive and reach their full potential.

title: Tikrit: Iran key in fight to wrest city from IS
text: Quds Force of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, is playing a key role in the battle to recapture the city of Tikrit from the Islamic State (IS) group. Gen Soleimani, a shadowy figure who is believed to have orchestrated Iran's military strategy in both Syria and Iraq, has reportedly been on the ground in Tikrit coordinating with Shia militias known as the Popular Mobilisation Units. The involvement of Iran in the battle for Tikrit underscores the complex dynamics at play in Iraq's fight against IS. While the Iraqi government is backed by a US-led coalition, it has also relied heavily on Iran for military support. Iran's influence in Iraq has grown significantly since the rise of IS in 2014. The Shia militias, known for their allegiance to Tehran, have been instrumental in pushing back the militant group and reclaiming territory lost to them. However, Iran's involvement in Iraq has raised concerns among Sunni Arab countries, particularly Saudi Arabia, which views Tehran's influence in the region as a threat to its own interests. The battle for Tikrit is seen as a crucial test for the Iraqi government and its allies in their fight against IS. The city, which fell to the militant group last year, has strategic importance as a gateway to Mosul, Iraq's second largest city still under IS control. The operation to retake Tikrit has been marred by reports of human rights abuses, with Shia militias accused of carrying out revenge attacks against Sunni civilians suspected of collaborating with IS. Human Rights Watch has called on the Iraqi government to investigate these allegations and hold those responsible for abuses to account. The United Nations has also expressed concerns about the situation in Tikrit and called for the protection of civilians caught in the crossfire. The involvement of Iran in the battle for Tikrit has further complicated an already volatile situation in Iraq. The country remains deeply divided along sectarian lines, with Sunni and Shia communities often at odds with each other. As the battle for Tikrit rages on, the international community will be closely watching to see how the Iraqi government handles the aftermath of the operation and whether it can effectively address the grievances of all its citizens in the wake of the fight against IS. For now, the focus remains on the military campaign to retake Tikrit and the role that Iran will continue to play in shaping the outcome of the conflict in Iraq.

title: In quotes: Reaction to US Libya deaths
text: US President Barack Obama "I strongly condemn the outrageous attack on our diplomatic facility in Benghazi, which took the lives of four Americans, including Ambassador Chris Stevens. The brave individuals who lost their lives in this senseless act of violence were dedicated public servants who were committed to improving the lives of people in Libya." President Obama's remarks came after news broke that the US Ambassador to Libya, Chris Stevens, was killed in an attack on the US Consulate in Benghazi. The attack, which occurred on the anniversary of the September 11th attacks, has shocked the international community and raised concerns about the security situation in Libya. The violence in Benghazi has sparked a wave of reactions from world leaders, with many expressing their outrage and condolences for the victims. French President Francois Hollande condemned the attack, calling it a "cowardly act of terrorism" and offering his support to the United States. British Prime Minister David Cameron also condemned the attack, stating that "the world must stand together to defeat these extremists who seek to harm us and our way of life." He expressed his condolences to the families of the victims and pledged to work with the US to bring those responsible to justice. Russian President Vladimir Putin offered his condolences to President Obama and the American people, calling the attack an "unthinkable tragedy." He emphasized the need for a united front against terrorism and pledged his country's support in the fight against extremism. UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon also condemned the attack, calling it a "grave violation of international law" and expressing his condolences to the families of the victims. He urged all parties in Libya to work towards a peaceful resolution to the conflict and to reject violence as a means of settling disputes. Meanwhile, the Libyan government has also denounced the attack, with Prime Minister Abdul Hamid Dbeibah calling it a "heinous crime" that goes against the values of Islam. He vowed to work with the US and other partners to bring the perpetrators to justice and to ensure the safety of diplomatic missions in the country. The attack in Benghazi has once again highlighted the challenges facing Libya as it struggles to rebuild after the ousting of Muammar Gaddafi in 2011. The country remains plagued by violence, instability, and armed groups, making it a difficult environment for diplomats and aid workers to operate in. As the investigation into the attack continues, world leaders have called for calm and unity in the face of this tragedy. The international community stands in solidarity with the United States and the victims of the Benghazi attack, vowing to work together to combat extremism and promote peace and security in the region.

title: Pte Sean Benton: Sister hopes Army will learn from Deepcut inquest
text: Pte Sean Benton, 20, from Hastings, was found with five gunshot wounds to his chest at the Surrey army base in 1995. The coroner, Judge Peter Rook, recently ruled that he had taken his own life. This conclusion has left many questions unanswered for Sean's family, especially his sister, Tracy Lewis. Tracy has been campaigning for the truth about her brother's death for over two decades. She believes that the army failed in its duty of care towards Sean and that the culture at Deepcut Barracks was toxic. Tracy hopes that the inquest will bring some closure to her family and shed light on the issues that led to her brother's tragic death. During the inquest, it was revealed that Sean had been subjected to bullying and harassment during his time at Deepcut Barracks. He had also complained of mistreatment by the staff and was struggling with the demands of army life. Tracy believes that these factors played a significant role in Sean's decision to take his own life. Tracy is now calling for the army to learn from the mistakes made at Deepcut Barracks and to implement changes to prevent similar tragedies from happening in the future. She wants to see better support systems in place for young soldiers who may be struggling with their mental health. Tracy also believes that there should be more accountability for those in positions of authority who fail to provide a safe and supportive environment for their recruits. The Ministry of Defence has released a statement in response to the coroner's ruling, expressing their condolences to Sean's family and acknowledging the failings that were identified during the inquest. They have promised to take the necessary steps to address these issues and improve the welfare of all personnel in the armed forces. While Tracy is glad that some progress has been made in holding the army accountable for her brother's death, she knows that there is still work to be done. She will continue to fight for justice for Sean and for all the other young soldiers who have lost their lives in similar circumstances. Tracy hopes that by sharing her story, she can help prevent future tragedies and ensure that no other family has to go through what hers has endured. As the inquest into Pte Sean Benton's death comes to a close, Tracy Lewis remains determined to seek justice for her brother and to ensure that the army learns from the mistakes of the past. She hopes that her efforts will lead to positive change within the military and prevent other families from experiencing the same heartache and loss. The legacy of Sean's death will be a reminder of the importance of caring for the mental health and well-being of all those who serve their country.

title: Coronavirus: Newquay man weeding his way around town
text: his mental health. "I've always struggled with anxiety and depression," Alex shared, as he meticulously plucked out weeds from the cracks in the pavement. "But during the lockdown, I found solace in weeding. It gave me a sense of purpose and control in a time of uncertainty." Alex's newfound hobby started out of necessity. With restrictions in place and traditional outlets for stress relief unavailable, he felt increasingly overwhelmed. One day, while taking a walk around his neighborhood, he noticed the neglected patches of weeds taking over the sidewalks. "I decided to do something about it," he said with a smile. As he continued weeding his way around town, Alex found himself engrossed in the task. The repetitive motion of pulling out weeds proved to be therapeutic, allowing him to focus his mind and block out intrusive thoughts. "It was like a form of meditation for me," he explained. "I could feel the tension releasing with each weed I removed." Beyond the mental benefits, Alex also felt a sense of pride in beautifying his community. His efforts did not go unnoticed, with neighbors expressing their gratitude for his hard work. "It's nice to know that I'm making a difference, no matter how small," he said humbly. Despite the easing of lockdown restrictions, Alex continues to weed regularly, finding comfort in the routine and sense of accomplishment it brings. "I've come to see it as my own form of therapy," he said. "It's become a part of my daily life now." As he navigates the challenges of living with anxiety and depression, Alex hopes to inspire others to find their own coping mechanisms during these uncertain times. "It may seem simple, but sometimes the smallest actions can have the biggest impact on your mental health," he said earnestly. With each weed he pulls, Alex Russell is not just clearing the pavement, but also clearing his mind. In a time when many are struggling with the effects of the pandemic on mental health, his story serves as a reminder of the power of finding ways to cope and thrive, even in the face of adversity.

title: British Airways fined £20m over data breach
text: The breach took place in 2018 and affected both personal and credit card data. The fine is considerably smaller than the £183m that the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) initially said it intended to impose last year, but still represents a significant penalty for the airline. The data breach involved the theft of data from British Airways' website and mobile app between April and July 2018. The stolen information included names, email addresses, and credit card details such as card numbers, expiry dates, and CVV codes. The breach affected around 400,000 customers, making it one of the largest data breaches in UK history. The fine was imposed by the ICO after an investigation found that British Airways had failed to implement adequate security measures to protect customer data. The ICO found that the airline had not implemented basic security measures such as multi-factor authentication and encryption, which could have prevented the breach from occurring. In a statement, the ICO said: "People entrusted their personal details to British Airways with the expectation that they would be properly protected. This serious data breach has caused financial and emotional distress to its customers. The fine imposed by the ICO reflects the gravity of the breach and the importance of data protection laws." British Airways has apologized for the breach and said it has made significant improvements to its security systems since the incident. The airline has also offered compensation to affected customers and has worked with credit card companies to ensure that any fraudulent transactions are reimbursed. Despite the fine, British Airways' parent company, International Airlines Group (IAG), reported a profit of £2.2bn in 2019. The airline has said that it will appeal the fine, arguing that it has taken steps to improve its security systems and that the penalty is disproportionate to the scale of the breach. The data breach has raised concerns about the security of personal data held by airlines and other businesses. The ICO has warned that all organizations must take their data protection obligations seriously and ensure that they have robust security measures in place to protect customer information. The fine imposed on British Airways is one of the largest ever issued by the ICO, sending a clear message that companies must prioritize data protection and ensure that they are taking all necessary steps to safeguard customer data.

title: Richard Desmond 'plans National Lottery bid'
text: The plans by Mr Desmond, who runs the Health Lottery, have been reported in the Financial Times. Camelot has held the UK's lottery franchise since it was set up in 1994. A bid from the media mogul could potentially shake up the lottery industry in the UK, which has been dominated by Camelot for over two decades. Desmond's Health Lottery operates as a series of 51 society lotteries, each representing a different geographical region in the UK. The Health Lottery was launched in 2011 and has been a competitor to the National Lottery ever since. With his experience in running a successful lottery operation, Desmond believes he has what it takes to compete with Camelot for the National Lottery franchise. If Desmond's bid is successful, it could mark a significant shift in the UK lottery landscape. Camelot has faced criticism over the years for its management of the National Lottery, with some critics arguing that the operator has become too focused on maximizing profits rather than supporting good causes. Desmond has a track record of philanthropy through the Health Lottery, which raises funds for health-related charities and projects across the UK. His bid for the National Lottery franchise could potentially see a greater emphasis on supporting charitable causes and community projects, which could appeal to those who have been critical of Camelot's management of the lottery. However, there are concerns about the potential impact of Desmond's bid on the National Lottery's charitable contributions. Camelot has consistently raised billions of pounds for good causes since it was established, and some worry that a new operator could affect the amount of money raised for charity. Furthermore, there are questions about whether Desmond's bid will be successful, given the strict regulations and criteria that must be met in order to operate the National Lottery. Camelot has a strong track record of running the lottery efficiently and effectively, and it remains to be seen whether Desmond can prove that he is capable of taking on such a significant responsibility. Overall, Richard Desmond's plans to bid for the National Lottery franchise could potentially bring about significant changes to the UK lottery industry. With his experience in running the Health Lottery and his focus on supporting charitable causes, Desmond could offer a fresh approach to managing the National Lottery. However, there are still many uncertainties surrounding his bid, and it will be interesting to see how the situation develops in the coming months.

title: Scientists find 'better way' to grow adult stem cells
text: Standard surfaces have proved limited for growing large amounts and retaining the stem cells' useful characteristics. It is hoped the discovery could lead to the creation of more efficient techniques for producing adult stem cells, which hold great promise in the field of regenerative medicine. Researchers at a leading university in the United Kingdom have made a breakthrough in the cultivation of adult stem cells by developing a novel approach. By utilizing a specially designed surface that mimics the natural environment of the cells, the scientists were able to significantly enhance the growth and retention of key characteristics of the stem cells. This discovery has the potential to revolutionize the way adult stem cells are cultivated and used in clinical applications. Dr. Sarah Johnson, the lead researcher on the project, explained the significance of their findings. "Traditional methods of growing adult stem cells on standard surfaces have presented challenges in maintaining the cells' properties and producing large quantities. Our new approach provides a better way to support the growth of these cells while preserving their unique characteristics, opening up new possibilities for their therapeutic use." One of the key advantages of this new technique is its scalability, allowing researchers to produce adult stem cells in larger quantities than ever before. This could have far-reaching implications for the treatment of a wide range of medical conditions, from degenerative diseases to injuries that require tissue regeneration. By improving the efficiency of stem cell production, this discovery holds the potential to accelerate the development of personalized regenerative therapies for patients in need. In addition to its applications in regenerative medicine, the enhanced cultivation of adult stem cells could also benefit the field of basic research. Scientists studying the properties and behavior of these cells will now have a more reliable and consistent source of material for their experiments, providing new insights into the fundamental mechanisms that govern stem cell function. The team of researchers is currently working on further refining their technique and exploring its potential applications in various medical contexts. They are optimistic that their discovery will open up new avenues for the use of adult stem cells in both research and clinical settings, offering hope for patients in need of innovative treatments for a variety of conditions. Overall, the development of a "better way" to grow adult stem cells represents a significant advancement in the field of regenerative medicine, with the potential to improve the lives of countless individuals in the future. By harnessing the power of these versatile cells, scientists are paving the way for a new era of personalized medicine and transformative therapies.

title: Prison day release rules to be tightened, minister says
text: Tighter rules about who is eligible for the scheme are to be introduced, the Ministry of Justice said. Prisoners will now have to meet stricter criteria in order to qualify for day release from prison. According to the new guidelines, only low-risk offenders who have shown good behavior and progress in their rehabilitation will be considered for day release. This means that individuals with a history of violent or dangerous behavior will no longer be eligible for the program. Additionally, prisoners who have failed previous attempts at day release will not be given another opportunity. The decision to tighten the rules comes after a series of high-profile incidents involving prisoners on day release. Last year, a man who was serving a sentence for robbery killed a member of the public while on day release. This tragedy sparked outrage and raised concerns about the effectiveness of the current system. Justice Minister, Robert Johnson, stated that the safety of the public must be the top priority when considering whether to grant day release to prisoners. He emphasized the need for a more thorough risk assessment process and increased supervision for those who are granted temporary release from prison. Under the new rules, prisoners will also be required to wear electronic monitoring devices while on day release. This will allow authorities to track their movements and ensure that they are complying with the conditions of their release. Any violation of these conditions will result in immediate return to prison. In addition to the stricter eligibility criteria, the Ministry of Justice will be investing in more resources for rehabilitation programs within prisons. The aim is to reduce reoffending rates and better prepare prisoners for life outside of prison. By addressing the root causes of criminal behavior, the government hopes to create a safer society for all. The changes to the day release program have been met with mixed reactions. Some believe that the tighter rules are necessary to prevent future tragedies, while others argue that they may hinder the chances of rehabilitation for certain prisoners. However, the Ministry of Justice remains committed to ensuring that the safety of the public is prioritized above all else. Overall, the new rules aim to strike a balance between rehabilitation and public safety. It is hoped that by implementing these changes, the day release program can continue to be a valuable tool in assisting prisoners in their transition back into society.

title: Historical child abuse support call by Simon Danczuk MP
text: Simon Danczuk's comments come after it emerged South Wales Police are looking into claims former House of Commons speaker George Thomas abused a child. Viscount Tonypandy, who was a Labour MP in Cardiff from 1945. Danczuk, a former Labour MP himself, has been a vocal advocate for survivors of historical child abuse and has been instrumental in exposing several cases of abuse within the UK political establishment. In a statement, Danczuk said, "It is deeply troubling to hear of yet another case of historical child abuse involving a prominent figure in British politics. The survivors of these horrific crimes deserve justice and support, and it is crucial that the authorities conduct a thorough investigation into these allegations." Danczuk has been campaigning for greater support for survivors of historical child abuse, calling for improved access to counselling and therapy services for those who have been affected. He has also called for a national inquiry into historical child abuse in order to uncover the full extent of the abuse that has taken place and to hold those responsible to account. The case of George Thomas, who died in 1997, has once again highlighted the issue of historical child abuse within the political sphere. Thomas was a powerful figure in Labour politics and served as Speaker of the House of Commons from 1976 to 1983. The allegations against him are particularly troubling given his influential position in British politics. Danczuk's advocacy for survivors of historical child abuse has earned him praise from many quarters, with organizations such as the NSPCC commending his efforts to bring these issues to light. Danczuk has also been a vocal critic of the way in which historical child abuse cases have been handled in the past, calling for greater transparency and accountability in the investigation and prosecution of such cases. The revelations about George Thomas have once again shone a spotlight on the issue of historical child abuse, and it is clear that there is still much work to be done in order to ensure that survivors receive the justice and support they deserve. Danczuk's calls for a national inquiry and improved support services are likely to gain further traction in light of this latest case, as pressure mounts on the government to take action on this crucial issue.

title: Cancer costing European Union countries 'billions'
text: The charity Cancer Research UK said it was a "huge burden". The figures, published in the Lancet Oncology, included the cost of drugs and health care for cancer patients in European Union countries. The study estimated that the total annual cost of cancer in Europe was around 126 billion euros. This accounts for not only the direct medical costs associated with cancer treatment, but also the indirect costs such as loss of productivity due to illness and premature death. The study found that the cost of cancer varied significantly between different European countries. The highest annual cost per capita was in Luxembourg, where it was estimated to be around 218 euros per person. This was followed by Germany, where the cost per capita was around 162 euros. In contrast, the lowest annual cost per capita was in Romania, where it was estimated to be only 20 euros per person. The report also highlighted the significant economic burden that cancer places on society as a whole. It estimated that the total cost of cancer in terms of lost productivity and premature death was around 52 billion euros per year. This represents a substantial drain on the European economy, with significant implications for healthcare systems and government budgets. In response to the findings, Cancer Research UK called for increased investment in cancer research and prevention strategies. They argued that by investing in early detection and treatment, as well as promoting healthy lifestyle choices, it is possible to reduce the economic burden of cancer on society. The study also highlighted the need for greater collaboration between European countries to address the growing challenge of cancer. By sharing best practices and working together to develop new treatment options, it is possible to improve outcomes for cancer patients and reduce the economic impact of the disease. Overall, the study underscored the significant financial costs associated with cancer in European Union countries. While the burden of cancer is high, there are opportunities to reduce this burden through investment in research, prevention, and collaboration. By working together, European countries can improve the lives of cancer patients and lessen the economic impact of this devastating disease.

title: Losing GSP+ can be 'very negative'
text: Sri Lanka could lose special trading rights with the bloc because of a failure to improve its human rights record, the European Union warned on Thursday. The country has been a beneficiary of the Generalized Scheme of Preferences Plus (GSP+) program, which allows developing nations preferential access to the EU market. However, continued concerns over human rights violations, including allegations of torture and restrictions on freedom of expression, have put Sri Lanka's eligibility for the program at risk. The GSP+ program has been a significant boon for Sri Lanka's economy, allowing the country to export goods to the EU with reduced tariffs, making its products more competitive in the European market. Losing GSP+ status could have severe economic consequences for Sri Lanka, leading to increased export costs and a loss of market share to countries that still have preferential access to the EU market. In addition to economic implications, losing GSP+ status could also have negative political and social consequences for Sri Lanka. The program is seen as a symbol of the country's commitment to human rights and good governance, and its withdrawal could further damage Sri Lanka's already tarnished reputation on the international stage. It could also strain diplomatic relations with the EU and other countries that prioritize human rights in their foreign policy. With the EU's warning, Sri Lanka now faces a crucial decision on how to address the concerns raised by the bloc. The government must take concrete steps to improve its human rights record, including investigating allegations of torture and ensuring freedom of expression for its citizens. Failure to do so could result in the loss of GSP+ status and the accompanying economic and political consequences. The EU has made it clear that compliance with international human rights standards is a non-negotiable condition for continued participation in the GSP+ program. The ball is now in Sri Lanka's court, and the government must act quickly and decisively to address the concerns raised by the EU and safeguard its special trading rights with the bloc. In conclusion, losing GSP+ status can be very negative for Sri Lanka, both economically and politically. The country must prioritize human rights and good governance if it wants to maintain its access to the EU market and avoid further damage to its international reputation. The stakes are high, and the government's response to the EU's warning will shape Sri Lanka's future relationship with the bloc and its standing in the global community.

title: Man guilty of killing unborn baby by kicking mum's stomach
text: injuries after Wilson kicked her in the stomach, causing her to lose her unborn baby. The incident occurred as a result of a long-standing feud between Bantala and Wilson, stemming from their previous relationship. The court heard that Wilson and the teenager had been lying in wait for Bantala, knowing that she was pregnant with Wilson's child. The brutal attack left Bantala in critical condition, with severe internal injuries and the loss of her baby. The emotional toll on her and her family cannot be overstated, as they must now come to terms with the tragic loss of a young life. Following a thorough investigation, Wilson was arrested and charged with child destruction and GBH with intent. The teenage accomplice was also charged with child destruction. Both defendants denied the charges, claiming that they did not intend to harm Bantala or her unborn child. However, the evidence presented in court painted a chilling picture of a premeditated and callous attack. The jury deliberated for several hours before reaching a verdict. In a packed courtroom, the foreperson read out the verdict: guilty on all counts. Wilson showed no emotion as the judge sentenced him to life in prison with a minimum term of 16 years. The teenager, who cannot be named for legal reasons, was sentenced to a juvenile detention facility for a period of five years. The courtroom erupted in a mix of emotions – relief, anger, and sadness. Bantala, still recovering from her injuries, expressed gratitude for the justice served. "No amount of time in prison can bring back my baby, but I am glad that they have been held accountable for their actions," she said in a statement. The tragic case has sparked a national conversation about the need for better support and protection for pregnant women facing domestic violence. Bantala's story serves as a stark reminder of the dangers that women face when trying to leave abusive relationships. As the court proceedings come to a close, Bantala's family has requested privacy as they continue to mourn the loss of their unborn grandchild. The community has rallied around them, offering support and condolences during this difficult time. The ripple effects of this senseless act of violence will be felt for years to come. But in the midst of tragedy, there is a glimmer of hope – that justice has been served and that Bantala can begin the long road to healing and recovery.

title: Tenerife beheading: Murder suspect 'haunted by voices'
text: Bulgarian Deyan Deyanov, 29, said he is haunted by voices that "direct how I act", and admitted having taken crack cocaine and LSD. Deyanov is currently standing trial for the brutal beheading of a British grandmother in Tenerife in 2011. During the trial, Deyanov claimed that the voices in his head made him commit the horrific crime. He described feeling like he was under the control of these voices, which directed him to carry out violent acts. Deyanov's defense team argued that he was not in control of his actions at the time of the murder due to his mental state and drug use. The victim, 60-year-old Jennifer Mills-Westley, was shopping in a supermarket in the popular holiday resort of Los Cristianos when Deyanov launched a vicious attack on her. He used a knife he had purchased earlier to stab and then decapitate her in front of horrified onlookers. The senseless and brutal nature of the crime shocked both locals and tourists on the island, leading to renewed calls for increased mental health support and drug rehabilitation services in Tenerife. The community has struggled to come to terms with the tragedy, and many are still haunted by the images of that fateful day. Deyanov's trial has been closely followed by the media, both in the UK and in Spain, where the murder took place. The case has raised questions about the connection between mental health issues, drug use, and violent crime. It has also sparked debates about the adequacy of support services for individuals grappling with mental health challenges. As the trial progresses, more details about Deyanov's past and his mental state at the time of the murder are expected to emerge. Witness testimonies and expert opinions will shed further light on the factors that may have contributed to this tragic event. Jennifer Mills-Westley's family continues to mourn her loss and seek justice for her senseless death. They have expressed their hope that Deyanov will be held accountable for his actions and receive the necessary help to address his mental health issues. The trial serves as a stark reminder of the devastating consequences that can result from untreated mental illness and substance abuse. It underscores the importance of providing timely interventions and support to those in need to prevent such tragedies from occurring in the future. The outcome of Deyanov's trial will undoubtedly have far-reaching implications for how society addresses the complex intersection of mental health, drug use, and violence.

title: Tata Steel: Pension fund deficit deters buyers, says Javid
text: The pension fund has more than 130,000 members and a deficit of £485m. He told the Business select committee: "It's not surprising that potential buyers are hesitant to take on Tata Steel with such a significant pension deficit looming over the company. This poses a significant challenge for any potential acquirer as they would have to grapple with finding a solution to the pension deficit in order to make the deal financially viable." Javid went on to express his concerns about the impact of the pension deficit on the sale process. He emphasized the importance of ensuring that the interests of the pension scheme members are protected while also finding a sustainable solution for the future of Tata Steel. The sale of Tata Steel's assets has been a matter of great concern for the British government as it looks to secure the future of the steel industry in the country. Tata Steel, which is one of the largest steel producers in the UK, has been facing financial challenges due to a combination of factors including global competition and the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic. The government has been in discussions with potential buyers to find a suitable bidder for Tata Steel, but the pension deficit has become a major sticking point in the negotiations. Javid highlighted the need for a buyer to have a strong plan in place to address the pension deficit and ensure the long-term sustainability of Tata Steel. The future of Tata Steel's UK operations hangs in the balance as the company continues to search for a buyer. The steel industry is a vital part of the British economy, providing thousands of jobs and supporting numerous other industries. The sale of Tata Steel's assets will have far-reaching implications for the country's manufacturing sector and economy as a whole. Javid's comments underscore the urgency of finding a solution to the pension deficit issue in order to facilitate the sale of Tata Steel. The government is committed to supporting the steel industry and ensuring that Tata Steel's assets are transferred to a buyer who can secure the future of the company and its employees. In the coming weeks, the government will continue to work closely with Tata Steel, potential buyers, and the pension trustees to address the pension deficit and facilitate a successful sale process. The future of Tata Steel's UK operations remains uncertain, but the government is determined to find a solution that safeguards the interests of the company's employees, pension scheme members, and the wider steel industry.

title: Wales weather: M4 clear after Storm Frank flooding
text: Witnesses described seeing vehicles aqua planing in the treacherous conditions, with some drivers losing control and skidding off the road. Emergency services were quick to respond, with the fire brigade called in to help rescue a trapped motorist whose car had become submerged in floodwaters. The Met Office warned that further heavy rain and strong winds were expected throughout the evening, urging residents to remain cautious while travelling. Local authorities advised against unnecessary journeys and encouraged people to stay indoors if possible. In Wales, the impact of Storm Frank was most keenly felt along the M4 motorway, where flooding caused chaos for commuters and holidaymakers alike. The severe weather conditions not only led to multiple crashes but also prompted the closure of several roads in the region. As the storm passed and the floodwaters began to recede, the clean-up operation got underway. Highways teams worked around the clock to clear debris from the roads and repair any damage caused by the flooding. Despite their efforts, it is likely to be some time before the full extent of the damage is known. The disruption caused by Storm Frank serves as a stark reminder of the unpredictable nature of the weather in Wales. With the threat of further storms looming on the horizon, residents are being urged to remain vigilant and take precautions to protect themselves and their property. The severe weather conditions may have subsided for now, but the impact of Storm Frank will be felt for weeks, if not months, to come. As communities come together to clean up and rebuild, the resilience and spirit of the Welsh people shines through, proving once again that they are able to weather any storm that comes their way. As the sun sets on another challenging day in Wales, the clear-up operation continues in earnest. With roads slowly reopening and normality gradually returning, the people of Wales can take comfort in the knowledge that they have weathered yet another storm and emerged stronger on the other side. While the memory of Storm Frank may fade with time, the lessons learned from this experience will undoubtedly remain. With climate change continuing to impact weather patterns around the world, it is vital that communities remain prepared and resilient in the face of future challenges. Until then, the people of Wales will continue to persevere, come rain or shine.

title: Cambridgeshire teen felt 'not believed' after abuse probe dropped
text: Chris Gould, 17, died in January 2019 while an informal patient at a mental health unit near Cambridge. Her parents told the inquest that clinicians felt alleged abuse was the "root" of her mental health struggles. The young woman had previously disclosed to healthcare professionals that she had been sexually abused by a family member, but despite this information, the police dropped the investigation due to a lack of evidence. This decision left Chris feeling abandoned and "not believed" by the authorities. Her parents described their daughter as a bright and creative teenager who had a passion for art and music but had been struggling with her mental health in the months leading up to her death. The inquest heard how Chris had been open about her feelings of depression and anxiety, and had reached out for help from various services. However, her parents claimed that their concerns about the abuse allegations were not taken seriously, and that they felt let down by the system. The mental health unit where Chris was receiving treatment had been made aware of the abuse allegations but reportedly did not investigate further. Her parents expressed their frustration and anguish at the lack of action taken to protect their daughter and bring her abuser to justice. Following her death, an independent review of the case was commissioned by the local authorities. The review found that there were missed opportunities to safeguard Chris and that the police and healthcare services had failed to fully investigate the abuse allegations. The tragic loss of Chris Gould has highlighted the importance of listening to and believing survivors of abuse. It also underlines the need for improved communication and collaboration between mental health services and law enforcement agencies to ensure that vulnerable individuals receive the support and protection they need. In response to the findings of the review, the local authorities have committed to implementing changes to better support young people with mental health issues and ensure that allegations of abuse are taken seriously and thoroughly investigated. The death of Chris Gould has had a profound impact on her family and friends, who continue to mourn her loss while striving to raise awareness about the issues that contributed to her tragic end. It is hoped that her story will serve as a catalyst for positive change and lead to better outcomes for other young people facing similar challenges.

title: Chase criticised for 'mocking' customers' spending habits
text: Many customers were left feeling insulted and livid after a recent tweet by Chase bank seemed to mock those who may be struggling financially but still indulge in small luxuries like takeaway coffee and short taxi rides. The tweet, which has since been deleted, sparked a wave of backlash from consumers who accused the bank of being out of touch and insensitive to the struggles that many people face. In the tweet, Chase shared a meme that depicted a person asking why they have a low bank balance despite not spending money on extravagant items like designer clothes or fancy dinners. The bank's response, which has been widely criticized as condescending and patronizing, suggested that perhaps the person should reconsider their spending habits, such as buying take-away coffee and short taxi rides. The implication that individuals should not treat themselves to small pleasures if they are facing financial difficulties struck a nerve with many consumers who felt that Chase was oversimplifying the complex reasons why someone may have a low bank balance. While it is true that cutting back on non-essential expenses can help improve financial health, the tweet seemed to overlook the systemic issues that contribute to financial insecurity for many people. Social media users were quick to call out Chase for their tone-deaf tweet, with many expressing their disappointment and anger over the bank's insensitivity. Some pointed out that for individuals living paycheck to paycheck, small indulgences like a cup of coffee or a short taxi ride can provide much-needed comfort and relief from the stresses of daily life. Others criticized Chase for failing to acknowledge the economic disparities that prevent some people from being able to save money, regardless of their spending habits. In response to the backlash, Chase issued a statement apologizing for the tweet and acknowledging that it missed the mark in addressing the challenges that many consumers face. The bank emphasized its commitment to helping customers achieve financial wellness and stated that it would be more mindful of its messaging in the future. However, the damage had already been done, and many customers vowed to take their business elsewhere in light of Chase's dismissive attitude towards their struggles. The incident serves as a reminder for businesses to exercise caution when discussing sensitive topics like personal finances and to consider the diverse experiences of their customers before offering unsolicited advice. As the controversy continues to unfold, it remains to be seen whether Chase will be able to regain the trust and loyalty of the customers it alienated with its ill-conceived tweet. In the meantime, the incident serves as a cautionary tale for businesses about the importance of empathy and understanding in their interactions with consumers.

title: Ashish: My LFW catwalk reflects British diversity
text: By Hannah Moore Newsbeat reporter The designer's multicoloured "midnight market" theme was inspired by the sequin shops of his home city, Delhi, and featured models of different ethnicities. "Fashion has the power to bridge cultures and bring people together," Ashish said after his London Fashion Week (LFW) catwalk show. Ashish Gupta, known for his vibrant and playful designs, is no stranger to using his platform to make powerful statements about diversity and inclusion. This season, he showcased a collection that celebrated the rich tapestry of British culture, with models of South Asian, Black, and White backgrounds strutting down the runway in colourful sequined garments. For Ashish, the LFW catwalk is more than just a showcase for his clothing line; it is a reflection of the world around him. "I wanted to celebrate the beauty of diversity and show that fashion is for everyone," he explained. "It's not about fitting into a specific mold, but about embracing our differences and celebrating what makes us unique." The designer's commitment to inclusivity was evident in every aspect of his show, from the diverse casting to the gender-fluid designs and body-positive messaging. Models of all shapes, sizes, and backgrounds were proudly featured on the catwalk, challenging traditional beauty standards and sending a powerful message of acceptance and diversity. "We live in a world that is increasingly interconnected, and it's important for the fashion industry to reflect that reality," Ashish said. "I hope that my show inspires others to embrace diversity and create a more inclusive and compassionate world." The response to Ashish's LFW show was overwhelmingly positive, with many praising the designer for his bold and unapologetic celebration of diversity. Fashion critics and industry insiders alike commended the designer for his inclusive approach to casting and design, noting that his collection was not only visually stunning but also socially relevant. As the fashion world continues to grapple with issues of diversity and representation, designers like Ashish serve as a shining example of how inclusivity can be both beautiful and empowering. By using his platform to showcase the beauty of different ethnicities and cultures, Ashish is paving the way for a more inclusive and diverse fashion industry. "My hope is that this show will inspire others to embrace diversity and celebrate the beauty of all individuals," Ashish concluded. "Fashion has the power to change hearts and minds, and I am proud to be a part of that movement."

title: Ex-Australian PMs make appeal over Bali Nine drug pair
text: Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran were given the death sentence in 2006 for leading a drug trafficking group known as the Bali Nine. The former prime ministers said they were deeply concerned about the situation facing the two Australians, who have spent over a decade on death row in Indonesia. In a joint statement, ex-Australian PMs Kevin Rudd, Tony Abbott, Julia Gillard, and Malcolm Turnbull urged Indonesian President Joko Widodo to show mercy and grant clemency to Chan and Sukumaran. They emphasized that both men had shown genuine remorse for their actions and had undergone significant rehabilitation during their time in prison. The statement highlighted the positive impact Chan and Sukumaran had made on the lives of their fellow inmates, as well as their commitment to helping others avoid making the same mistakes they had made. The former prime ministers praised the two men for using their time in prison to educate and support other prisoners, as well as for their efforts to promote rehabilitation and redemption. Rudd, Abbott, Gillard, and Turnbull appealed to President Widodo to consider the international outcry and calls for clemency from around the world. They stressed that the death penalty is a severe and irreversible punishment, and that Chan and Sukumaran should be given a chance to continue contributing to society through their rehabilitation work. The ex-Australian PMs also pointed out the strong diplomatic and trade relationship between Australia and Indonesia, and how the execution of Chan and Sukumaran could potentially strain those ties. They called on President Widodo to demonstrate Indonesia's commitment to a fair and just legal system by sparing the lives of the two Australians. The joint statement concluded with a plea for compassion and mercy, urging President Widodo to consider the positive impact Chan and Sukumaran could continue to have on society if given the chance to live. The former prime ministers expressed their hope that Indonesia would choose to show humanity and kindness in this difficult situation. It remains to be seen how President Widodo will respond to this latest appeal from the ex-Australian PMs, as well as the ongoing efforts from various human rights groups and supporters of Chan and Sukumaran around the world. The fate of the two Australians hangs in the balance, as the international community continues to rally behind them in their fight for clemency.

title: Sir Alan Parker, director of Bugsy Malone and Evita, dies aged 76
text: The double Oscar nominee's many other credits include Midnight Express, Mississippi Burning, The Commitments, Angela's Ashes, and Birdy. Evita composer Andrew Lloyd Webber tweeted Sir Alan had been "one of the few directors to truly understand musical theatre".  Sir Alan Parker, known for his visually stunning and emotionally resonant films, passed away at the age of 76. Throughout his career, he consistently pushed boundaries and challenged audiences with his bold storytelling and innovative filmmaking techniques. From the gritty prison drama of Midnight Express to the infectious musical energy of The Commitments, Sir Alan's diverse body of work showcased his versatility and commitment to storytelling. Born in London in 1944, Sir Alan began his career in advertising before transitioning to filmmaking. His directorial debut came with the 1976 film Bugsy Malone, a unique musical starring children in gangster roles. The film was a critical success and marked the beginning of Sir Alan's illustrious career in cinema. Over the years, Sir Alan continued to create groundbreaking films that explored themes of justice, morality, and humanity. His 1988 film Mississippi Burning, based on the true story of the murders of three civil rights activists, was a powerful indictment of racism and injustice in America. The film received critical acclaim and garnered several Oscar nominations, including Best Picture and Best Director for Sir Alan. In 1996, Sir Alan directed the epic musical biopic Evita, starring Madonna as Eva Perón. The film was a commercial success and received several Oscar nominations, including Best Original Song for "You Must Love Me". Sir Alan's collaboration with Andrew Lloyd Webber on Evita solidified his reputation as a visionary director who could bring musical theatre to the big screen with style and flair. Beyond his work in film, Sir Alan was also a respected writer and producer. His contributions to cinema will be remembered for their artistic vision, emotional depth, and social relevance. Sir Alan's impact on the world of filmmaking is undeniable, and his legacy will continue to inspire future generations of filmmakers. As news of Sir Alan's passing spread, tributes poured in from across the entertainment industry. Actors, directors, and producers alike paid their respects to a man who had left an indelible mark on the world of cinema. Sir Alan Parker may be gone, but his influence will live on through the timeless films he created.

title: War Horse musicians lose legal bid
text: The musicians took legal action last week following the theatre's decision to end their contribution of playing live over a pre-recorded soundtrack in the highly acclaimed production of War Horse. The decision came as a shock to the musicians, who have been an integral part of the show since its inception. The musicians, who are all highly skilled and experienced professionals, argued that their live music added an extra layer of emotion and depth to the performance, which would be lost if replaced with a pre-recorded soundtrack. They also claimed that the decision to replace them was a breach of their contracts with the theatre, which explicitly stated that they would be providing live music for the duration of the show. Despite their arguments, the theatre maintained that the decision to end the musicians' contribution was necessary due to financial constraints brought about by the ongoing Covid-19 pandemic. The theatre argued that using a pre-recorded soundtrack would not only save money but also reduce the risk of exposure to the virus for both the musicians and the rest of the cast and crew. The case went to court, where the musicians were represented by a team of legal experts who argued passionately on their behalf. However, after several days of deliberation, the judge ruled in favor of the theatre, stating that while the musicians were undoubtedly talented, the decision to replace them with a pre-recorded soundtrack was a reasonable and justifiable one given the circumstances. The musicians were devastated by the ruling, feeling that their contributions had been undervalued and unappreciated. Many of them had dedicated years of their lives to War Horse, pouring their hearts and souls into each performance, only to be replaced by a faceless recording. The decision also sparked outrage among fans of the show, who had come to appreciate and love the live music that added so much to the overall experience. Many took to social media to express their disappointment and frustration, calling for the theatre to reconsider their decision and reinstate the musicians. In response to the backlash, the theatre released a statement expressing their regret over the situation but reaffirming their commitment to ensuring the safety and well-being of all involved in the production. They also offered to meet with the musicians to discuss other opportunities within the theatre and explore ways in which their talents could still be utilized. Despite the disappointment and heartache, the musicians vowed to continue making music, whether on stage or off. They may have lost this battle, but their passion and determination to create beautiful music will always remain strong. And who knows, maybe one day they will once again take their place on the stage, filling the theatre with the sound of their music and the magic of their performance.

title: Taiwan loses diplomatic ally as Dominican Republic switches ties to China
text: Taiwan has said that it is "deeply upset" by the Caribbean nation's decision, which deepens its diplomatic isolation. The governments in Beijing and Taipei insist that countries cannot recognize both China and Taiwan, as they view Taiwan as a renegade province that must be reunited with the mainland, by force if necessary. The Dominican Republic's decision to sever ties with Taiwan and establish relations with China marks the latest in a series of blows to Taiwan's international presence. In recent years, a number of countries, including Panama, Burkina Faso, and Sao Tome and Principe, have switched allegiance from Taiwan to China, citing economic opportunities and pressure from Beijing. Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen denounced the Dominican Republic's move as a result of Chinese "dollar diplomacy," accusing Beijing of luring away Taiwan's allies with promises of investment and aid. Tsai has refused to bow to Beijing's demands to endorse the "One China" principle, which asserts Taiwan as part of Chinese territory. China, on the other hand, has welcomed the Dominican Republic's decision, hailing it as a step towards a more unified world. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Lu Kang reaffirmed China's commitment to the "One China" policy and expressed hope that more countries would follow suit in recognizing Beijing over Taipei. The loss of the Dominican Republic as a diplomatic ally is a significant setback for Taiwan, which now has only 19 countries that officially recognize its independence. The dwindling number of allies poses a challenge to Taiwan's ability to participate in international organizations and events, as well as to conduct meaningful diplomatic initiatives. Despite the diplomatic setbacks, Taiwan remains steadfast in its commitment to uphold its sovereignty and engage with the international community. President Tsai has vowed to strengthen Taiwan's domestic economy, enhance its military capabilities, and deepen its relations with like-minded countries that share its values of democracy and human rights. As Taiwan grapples with increasing pressure from China and dwindling international support, the global community must consider the implications of Taiwan's isolation. The Taiwan Strait remains a potential flashpoint for conflict between China and Taiwan, as both sides continue to assert their claims over the territory.
