One fan, Sarah, expressed her joy at the news, saying, "I've been going to HMV since I was a kid, and I couldn't bear the thought of it disappearing. I'm so glad it's been saved!" For employees of HMV, the news has also come as a huge relief. Many feared for their jobs and livelihoods as the company teetered on the brink of collapse. Now, with the acquisition by Sunrise Records, there is hope that they will be able to continue working in an industry they love. One employee, Tom, said, "I've worked at HMV for years and I was devastated when it went into administration. I'm so grateful that Sunrise Records stepped in to save it and hopefully secure our jobs." Despite the positive reception of the news of HMV's salvation, there are still challenges ahead for the company. The high street retail landscape continues to face tough competition from online retailers, and HMV will need to adapt and innovate in order to survive in this changing market. The new owners have indicated that they will focus on offering a unique in-store experience to customers, with plans to host live music events, signings, and other activities to draw in consumers. Sunrise Records has also expressed a commitment to working closely with music labels and artists to ensure that HMV continues to offer a diverse and exciting range of music and merchandise. With this renewed focus on the customer experience and a dedication to the music industry, HMV may have a fighting chance to thrive once again. As music fans and employees eagerly await the reopening of HMV stores under new ownership, there is a sense of hope and optimism in the air. The iconic retailer may have been saved from collapse, but the real challenge lies ahead in reinventing itself for a new era of music consumption.

title: TVR sports car firm stake bought by Welsh Government
text: By Nick Servini Political editor, Wales It has also provided a £2m loan to the company ahead of production getting underway in Ebbw Vale. TVR said there is another major milestone in the revival of its iconic sports car brand as the Welsh Government has bought a stake in the company. The move is seen as a significant step towards securing the future of TVR and creating jobs in the region. The Welsh Government's investment is part of its efforts to boost the country's economy and support innovative industries. This partnership between the Welsh Government and TVR is expected to bring about a new era of growth and prosperity for the sports car firm. With the financial support from the government, TVR is looking to expand its operations and accelerate the production of its high-performance vehicles. The decision to invest in TVR reflects the government's commitment to nurturing local businesses and stimulating economic development in Wales. By taking a stake in the company, the Welsh Government is demonstrating its confidence in TVR's potential to succeed in the competitive automotive industry. TVR has a rich history of producing powerful and stylish sports cars that have captivated enthusiasts around the world. With the backing of the Welsh Government, the company is poised to continue its legacy of excellence and innovation. The £2m loan provided by the Welsh Government will enable TVR to ramp up production and meet the growing demand for its vehicles. This financial support is essential for the company to bring its new models to market and compete effectively with other sports car manufacturers. The decision to establish production facilities in Ebbw Vale is a strategic move that will benefit both TVR and the local community. By creating jobs and investing in the region, the company is helping to boost economic growth and alleviate unemployment in Wales. The Welsh Government's investment in TVR is a testament to the company's potential to become a leading player in the sports car market. With its unique blend of heritage, performance, and craftsmanship, TVR is well-positioned to attract customers and drive innovation in the industry. As production gets underway in Ebbw Vale, all eyes will be on TVR to see how the company performs in this new chapter of its history. With the support of the Welsh Government behind it, TVR is poised to make a successful comeback and establish itself as a key player in the sports car industry.

title: A-level exam 'leak': Belfast grammar pupils sanctioned
text: By Robbie MeredithBBC News NI Education Correspondent Nine students at the Royal Belfast Academical Institution (RBAI) and Methodist College (MCB) are affected, the BBC understands. The investigation concerned the CCEA A2 business studies paper that candidates sat on the 16th of May. The CCEA said it believed the leak was confined to the two grammar schools, and there was no evidence to suggest widespread cheating.  The exam board became aware of the leak after concerns were raised by teachers at MCB. Following an internal investigation, CCEA decided to nullify the results of the affected students and ban them from taking any further CCEA exams for the next three years. The board's chief executive, Justin Edwards, stated that CCEA takes exam security very seriously and will not tolerate any breaches of integrity. The affected schools have expressed their disappointment at the news, with RBAI reiterating their commitment to upholding the highest standards of academic honesty. The headmaster of MCB has also issued a statement, emphasizing the importance of ethical behavior in all aspects of education. Parents of the students involved have expressed a mix of shock and disbelief at the revelations. Many have criticized the lack of oversight in the exam process and called for greater accountability from both the schools and the exam board. This incident has raised questions about the pressure students face in the build-up to exams and whether the current system is conducive to fostering a healthy learning environment. Some have suggested that the focus on achieving top grades has led to a culture of cheating and academic dishonesty among students. In response to the controversy, CCEA has announced that they will be implementing stricter security measures for future exams, including increased monitoring of exam papers and a more rigorous screening process for examiners and invigilators. The board has also urged schools to educate students about the consequences of cheating and the importance of maintaining academic integrity. As the investigation continues, the affected students and their families are left grappling with the fallout of the exam leak. While the consequences may be severe, this incident serves as a stark reminder of the importance of honesty and integrity in academic pursuits. It is now up to the schools, the exam board, and the students themselves to work together to rebuild trust and ensure that such a breach of exam security does not happen again.

title: Will Brexit last longer than other winning words of the year?
text: The word 'Brexit' had its first recorded use in 2013 but as the EU referendum approached, more and more people started using it. It's an increase that Collins says is "unheard of" since it began monitoring word usage in 2013. After the referendum result in June 2016, the word 'Brexit' became a household name in the UK and beyond. It was constantly in the news, discussed in parliament, and debated by experts and politicians alike. The uncertainty surrounding Britain's withdrawal from the European Union only fueled the usage of the term. In November 2016, 'Brexit' was named the Word of the Year by Collins Dictionary, reflecting its widespread use and significance in the public discourse. It seemed like the word was here to stay, at least for the foreseeable future. However, as time went on, the initial fervor surrounding Brexit began to fade. The negotiations between the UK and the EU dragged on, with deadlines continuously being extended. The word 'Brexit' started to lose some of its novelty and urgency as the process became drawn out and complex. In the meantime, other words of the year came and went, each capturing a different moment in history or highlighting a particular trend or issue. Words like 'selfie', 'post-truth', and 'climate strike' took the spotlight, reflecting the changing social and political landscape of the world. Despite this, 'Brexit' continued to linger in the public consciousness. It became a symbol of division, uncertainty, and political turmoil. The word carried with it a weight of expectation and frustration, as people wondered when and how the UK would finally leave the EU. Fast forward to the present day, and Brexit is still a hot topic in the UK. With the transition period now over and a trade deal finally reached between the UK and the EU, the word 'Brexit' still holds relevance in discussions about the future relationship between the two parties. So, will Brexit last longer than other winning words of the year? Only time will tell. While the word may no longer dominate headlines or spark heated debates like it once did, its legacy is sure to endure for years to come. Brexit may have been born out of political necessity, but it has become a cultural touchstone that will be remembered long after its practical implications have faded.

title: Garden eels 'forgetting about humans' need people to video-chat
text: Keepers at Tokyo's Sumida Aquarium, which has been closed since 1 March due to the coronavirus pandemic, are starting to worry about their garden eels. The sensitive little creatures had become used to seeing human faces regularly, as visitors would come up to their tanks and observe them with curiosity. The garden eels, known for their shy and reclusive nature, had found comfort in the routine presence of people around them. But now, with the absence of human interaction for several weeks, the garden eels seem to be forgetting about humans altogether. They no longer swim up to the glass in anticipation of someone watching them, nor do they perform their mesmerizing synchronized dance routine that used to captivate visitors. Instead, they have retreated into their burrows, seemingly disinterested in the world outside. One of the keepers, Yasuhiko Abe, expressed his concerns about the eels' behavior. "It's almost as if they have lost all interest in us," he said with a hint of sadness in his voice. "I fear that they may have forgotten about the importance of human presence in their lives. We need to find a way to rekindle their connection with us." In an effort to bridge the gap between the garden eels and the keepers, the aquarium staff has come up with a creative solution - video chatting. Using tablets and smartphones, the keepers are now video calling the garden eels' tanks from their homes. They show the eels pictures and videos of visitors, hoping to remind them of the human faces they once knew. At first, the eels seemed puzzled by the moving images on the screens. They would cautiously swim up to investigate, only to retreat back into their burrows soon after. But as the days went by, the garden eels started to show signs of recognition. They would linger by the glass, staring intently at the videos playing in front of them. "It's a small step, but it's progress," Abe commented, watching with a mix of relief and joy as the garden eels reacquainted themselves with human interaction. "We are determined to keep their spirits up during these challenging times, even if it means resorting to unconventional methods." As the world grapples with the uncertainties brought about by the pandemic, the garden eels at Tokyo's Sumida Aquarium serve as a reminder of the impact of human presence on the lives of even the most elusive creatures. And through the power of technology and innovation, the bond between the eels and their keepers continues to thrive, transcending physical barriers and reaffirming the importance of connection in a time of isolation.

title: Coronavirus: Bat scientists find new evidence
text: By Helen Briggs BBC Environment correspondent  They have discovered a virus that is a close match to the virus that causes Covid-19 in bats at a wildlife sanctuary in eastern China. This finding, revealed by a team of bat scientists, has shed new light on the origins of the coronavirus pandemic that has gripped the world for over a year now. The virus, known as RaTG13, was found in samples taken from horseshoe bats living in the sanctuary. Researchers have been studying bat populations in China since the outbreak began in late 2019, in an effort to understand how the virus originally crossed over into humans. The discovery of RaTG13 provides crucial insight into the potential origins of the virus that causes Covid-19. According to the scientists, RaTG13 is genetically very similar to the SARS-CoV-2 virus that causes Covid-19. While RaTG13 itself is not capable of infecting humans, the similarities between the two viruses suggest that they share a common ancestor. This finding supports the theory that the virus that causes Covid-19 originated in bats and was later transmitted to humans, possibly through an intermediate animal host. The study of coronaviruses in bats is important for understanding and preventing future pandemics. Bats are known to harbor a diverse range of coronaviruses, some of which have the potential to infect humans. By studying these viruses in their natural hosts, scientists can gain valuable insights into how they evolve and spread, and how they might pose a threat to human health. The discovery of RaTG13 is just one piece of the puzzle in the search for the origins of the coronavirus pandemic. While the virus itself is not a direct match to the one that causes Covid-19, its genetic similarity provides strong evidence that bats are likely the natural reservoir for these types of viruses. Further research is needed to determine exactly how the virus that causes Covid-19 made the jump from bats to humans, and what factors may have contributed to its spread. As the world continues to grapple with the ongoing impact of the coronavirus pandemic, understanding the origins of the virus is crucial for preventing future outbreaks. By studying coronaviruses in bats and other wildlife, scientists can better prepare for the emergence of new infectious diseases and develop strategies to mitigate their impact on human health. The discovery of RaTG13 marks an important step forward in this effort, providing valuable insights into the origins of the virus that has changed the world.

title: Saudi Arabia hosts its first ever women's cycle race
text: By Paul Harrison BBC UGC and Social News Saudi women cyclists were able to compete in a race held in the city of Jeddah on Tuesday. Forty-seven women competed in the 10-kilometre race, marking a significant milestone in women's sports in the conservative kingdom. This event was a part of the country's Vision 2030 initiative, which aims to promote sports and increase female participation in physical activities. The race was organized by the Saudi Cycling Federation, in collaboration with the General Sports Authority and the Ministry of Sports. It was a historic moment for the participants, as it was the first time that women were allowed to cycle in a public event in Saudi Arabia. The race route took the cyclists through the streets of Jeddah, showcasing their skills and determination to the cheering crowds. One of the participants, Reem Al-Harbi, expressed her excitement at being able to take part in the race. She said, "I have been passionate about cycling for years, and to finally have the opportunity to compete in a race like this is a dream come true. I hope that this event will inspire more women in Saudi Arabia to take up cycling and other sports." The race was also a demonstration of the changing attitudes towards women's sports in the kingdom. In recent years, Saudi Arabia has taken steps to promote gender equality and empower women to participate in various fields, including sports. This race was a clear example of the progress that has been made, and the determination of Saudi women to break down barriers and challenge stereotypes. The success of the race has inspired hopes for more women's sports events in the future. Organizers are already planning more cycling races and other sporting competitions to further encourage female participation. This is a positive sign for women in Saudi Arabia, who have long been restricted in their ability to engage in sports and physical activities. The participants of the race have become role models for other women in the kingdom, showing that with determination and support, they can achieve their goals and pursue their passions. The future looks bright for women's sports in Saudi Arabia, as more women are empowered to break free from societal constraints and embrace their athletic abilities. Overall, the women's cycle race in Jeddah was a groundbreaking event that highlighted the progress being made in promoting gender equality and empowering women in Saudi Arabia. The participants showcased their skills and determination, inspiring others to follow in their footsteps and pursue their own sporting dreams. This race marks a new chapter in women's sports in the kingdom, and the future looks promising for female athletes in Saudi Arabia.

title: Cholera death toll rises in hurricane-hit Haiti
text: to contain the spread of cholera in Haiti following the devastation caused by Hurricane Grace. The impoverished nation, already grappling with political instability and poverty, now faces the additional challenge of a cholera outbreak in the wake of the natural disaster. Cholera is a waterborne disease that spreads rapidly in unsanitary conditions, making it particularly dangerous in the aftermath of a hurricane. The lack of clean water and proper sanitation facilities in many parts of Haiti has made it difficult to prevent the spread of the disease, leading to a sharp increase in cases in the affected areas. The Haitian Ministry of Public Health and Population has been working tirelessly to provide medical assistance and clean water to those affected by cholera. Mobile health clinics have been set up in the hardest-hit areas, providing treatment to those infected and educating the population on how to prevent the spread of the disease. International relief agencies, including the Red Cross and Doctors Without Borders, have also been mobilizing resources to support the efforts of the Haitian authorities. Emergency supplies, including clean water, oral rehydration salts, and medical supplies, have been sent to the region to help combat the outbreak and save lives. Despite these efforts, the death toll continues to rise as the disease spreads through overcrowded and unsanitary conditions. The situation is further complicated by the ongoing political crisis in Haiti, which has hampered the government's ability to respond effectively to the outbreak. The United Nations has called for urgent action to address the cholera outbreak and prevent further loss of life. In a statement, the UN expressed grave concern over the situation in Haiti and urged the international community to provide assistance to contain the spread of the disease. As the death toll rises and more people fall ill, the need for immediate action becomes increasingly urgent. The people of Haiti are facing a deadly combination of natural disaster, poverty, and disease, and they desperately need help to survive this crisis. The world must come together to support Haiti in its time of need, providing the resources and assistance necessary to prevent further loss of life and contain the spread of cholera. Only through collective action and cooperation can we hope to prevent a humanitarian catastrophe in one of the world's most vulnerable nations.

title: Rail disruption caused by bad planning, Network Rail says
text: Network Rail spokesperson. Passengers were left frustrated and confused as they arrived at Finsbury Park, only to find limited facilities and overcrowded platforms. The disruption was caused by essential engineering work that overran its scheduled completion time. This led to a last-minute decision to divert trains to Finsbury Park, as King's Cross was not yet ready to reopen. Many commuters were unaware of the change until they arrived at the station, resulting in chaotic scenes and long delays. "I understand that engineering work can sometimes take longer than expected, but more could have been done to communicate the changes to passengers," one frustrated traveler told reporters. "I was left standing on a crowded platform with no information on when the next train would arrive." Network Rail has acknowledged the shortcomings in planning the diversion and has apologized for the inconvenience caused to passengers. The spokesperson assured that they would be conducting a thorough review of the incident to prevent similar disruptions in the future. Passengers are advised to check for updates on their journey before setting out, especially during times of engineering work or track maintenance. Network Rail is committed to improving communication with passengers and ensuring that disruptions are minimized as much as possible. As the railway network continues to undergo essential upgrades and maintenance, incidents like the one at King's Cross highlight the importance of thorough planning and effective communication. Network Rail is working towards improving its processes and procedures to prevent such disruptions from occurring in the future. Passengers are encouraged to provide feedback on their experiences during disruptions, as their input is valuable in helping Network Rail identify areas for improvement. By working together, passengers and rail authorities can ensure a smoother and more efficient journey for all. In conclusion, the recent disruption at King's Cross serves as a reminder of the challenges that come with maintaining and upgrading a busy railway network. While setbacks are inevitable, proactive planning and clear communication are essential in mitigating the impact on passengers. Network Rail is committed to learning from this incident and taking steps to prevent similar disruptions in the future.

title: Catalonia Spain: Separatists set to boost majority in regional parliament
text: With more than 99% of votes counted, the three parties are on course to get 74 seats in the 135-strong assembly, up from 70 in the outgoing parliament. That would allow them to govern, despite splits on major issues. Meanwhile, the pro-unity Ciudadanos party, which was the most voted party, is forecasted to win 37 seats, the Socialists 32, and the Popular Party 3. The rise in seats for the separatist parties - Junts per Catalunya, Esquerra Republicana, and CUP - comes after a contentious election campaign that focused on the issue of independence from Spain. The election was called by the Spanish government in an attempt to resolve the political crisis in Catalonia following the region's unilateral declaration of independence in 2017. Despite their majority in the regional parliament, the separatist parties remain deeply divided on key issues such as the timing and strategy for achieving independence. Junts per Catalunya, led by former regional president Carles Puigdemont, favors a confrontational approach with Madrid, while Esquerra Republicana, led by current regional president Pere Aragonès, is more inclined towards dialogue and negotiation. The election results are likely to prolong the political deadlock in Catalonia, with the separatist parties facing the challenge of forming a stable government that can effectively govern the region. The pro-unity parties, on the other hand, will seek to capitalize on their gains in order to push back against the separatist agenda. The outcome of the election is also being closely watched by the Spanish government in Madrid, which has expressed its desire to improve relations with Catalonia and find a peaceful resolution to the political crisis. Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez has called for dialogue and cooperation between the central government and the Catalan authorities, but has ruled out any concessions on the issue of Catalan independence. The results of the election are likely to have far-reaching implications for the future of Catalonia and its relationship with Spain. The region remains deeply divided on the issue of independence, and the new government will face the difficult task of finding a way forward that can satisfy both the pro-unity and separatist camps. As Catalonia prepares for a new chapter in its history, the political landscape remains uncertain and fraught with challenges. The coming months will be crucial in determining whether the region can overcome its divisions and find a path towards a more stable and prosperous future.

title: Threat to sue over London congestion charge scrapping
text: In a legal notice, Clean Air in London asked the mayor to "delay implementing his decision until he can ensure air pollution is not worsened." Mr. Johnson has promised to get rid of the west London congestion charge zone, which charges drivers to enter the city center, in an effort to boost the economy and help struggling businesses. However, environmental groups like Clean Air in London are concerned that scrapping the congestion charge will lead to an increase in traffic congestion and air pollution in the capital. Simon Birkett, founder and director of Clean Air in London, warned that removing the congestion charge could result in "tens of thousands of vehicles returning to central London daily." He stressed that air pollution levels in the city are already dangerously high and any increase in traffic could have serious health consequences for Londoners. Birkett's group has threatened legal action against the mayor if he goes ahead with his plans to scrap the congestion charge. They argue that Mr. Johnson has a legal duty to protect the health of Londoners and that removing the charge without implementing other measures to reduce traffic and emissions would be a breach of that duty. The Mayor's office has defended the decision to remove the congestion charge, stating that it is part of a wider plan to support businesses and help the economy recover from the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic. They have also announced a new Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ) which will come into effect in October 2021, requiring vehicles to meet strict emissions standards in order to enter the city center. Despite these assurances, environmental groups remain concerned about the potential impact of scrapping the congestion charge. They argue that the ULEZ alone may not be enough to offset the increase in traffic that could result from removing the charge. In response to the legal threat from Clean Air in London, a spokesperson for the Mayor's office stated that they would consider the group's concerns but remain committed to their plans to remove the congestion charge. They emphasized that the decision was made after careful consideration and consultation with experts. The issue of air pollution in London is a complex and pressing challenge. While efforts to support businesses and stimulate the economy are important, they must be balanced with the need to protect public health and the environment. As the debate over the congestion charge continues, it is clear that finding a solution that satisfies all stakeholders will require careful planning and collaboration.

title: Kim Kardashian: Studying law not about privilege or money
text: Kim revealed she's studying to become a lawyer last week, and will be taking her bar exam in 2022. The reality star says her move into law is not about privilege or money, but rather about wanting to make a positive impact and help others. In a recent interview, she stated, "I've been really fortunate in my life and I want to use my platform to do something meaningful and give back." Many have questioned Kim's decision to pursue a career in law, given her status as a celebrity and business mogul. Critics argue that her privileged background and lifestyle are at odds with the struggles many aspiring lawyers face. However, Kim is determined to prove that she is serious about her studies and committed to using her influence for good. Despite not having a college degree, Kim is taking a non-traditional path to becoming a lawyer through an apprenticeship program in California. This program allows students to study law without attending a traditional law school, as long as they pass the bar exam. Kim has been working with attorneys and taking classes in preparation for the challenging exam. For Kim, the decision to study law was influenced by her work on criminal justice reform. Over the past few years, she has been involved in high-profile cases advocating for wrongly convicted individuals and working to reform the criminal justice system. Through her efforts, she has successfully lobbied for the release of several individuals serving lengthy prison sentences for nonviolent offenses. Kim's interest in law was sparked by her involvement in these cases, and she realized that she wanted to deepen her understanding of the legal system in order to continue making a difference. Despite facing skepticism from some in the legal community, Kim is determined to prove her dedication and knowledge in the field. In addition to her studies, Kim has been vocal about the importance of education and access to legal resources for all individuals, regardless of their background. She has used her platform to raise awareness about issues such as mass incarceration, racial disparities in the justice system, and the need for criminal justice reform. As Kim continues her journey towards becoming a lawyer, she remains focused on her goal of using her platform for social good and making a positive impact on the world. She hopes to inspire others to pursue their passions and make a difference, no matter their background or circumstances.

title: Supreme Court divorce approval sought by 'unhappy wife'
text: a strong relationship. Mrs. Owens' bid to end her 40-year marriage was rejected by the Court of Appeal last year, with judges saying her examples of Mr. Owens' unreasonable behavior were "minor altercations". In her appeal to the Supreme Court, Mrs. Owens argued that she should not be forced to remain in a loveless marriage against her will. She pointed to the emotional distress caused by her husband's behavior, including his alleged coldness and detachment. Mr. Owens, on the other hand, has maintained that he still loves his wife and wishes to continue their marriage. He expressed his belief that their relationship can be saved and urged the court to uphold their union. The case has sparked a debate about the laws surrounding divorce in the UK. Currently, couples seeking divorce must prove that their marriage has irretrievably broken down, usually by citing adultery, unreasonable behavior, desertion, two years' separation with consent, or five years' separation without consent. Critics argue that the legal requirement to assign blame can unnecessarily prolong the divorce process and increase acrimony between spouses. They call for a no-fault divorce system to be introduced in the UK, similar to those in countries like Canada and Australia. Supporters of the current system, however, believe that the requirement to establish fault ensures that couples have given due consideration to the decision to end their marriage. They suggest that removing fault could make divorce too easy and undermine the institution of marriage. Mrs. Owens' case has become a focal point for this debate, as her plea for a divorce is based on the claim that her husband's behavior has made their marriage unbearable. She argues that she should not be forced to stay in a relationship that has caused her so much distress. The Supreme Court's decision in this case could have far-reaching implications for the future of divorce law in the UK. It will determine whether the current system, which requires proof of fault, remains the status quo or whether changes are needed to make divorce more accessible and less contentious for couples like the Owens.

title: Don Lock murder: Mother of accused pleaded for help for son
text: was killed, her son was "in such a state of mind that he must have been severely mentally ill." Lynda Daley, 65, took the stand to plead for help for her son, recounting the difficulties he had faced with his mental health over the years. She spoke of the struggles he experienced in managing his emotions and the challenges he encountered in seeking proper treatment. "He was failed by the system," Lynda Daley stated, her voice breaking with emotion. "We tried to get him help, but it was always a constant battle. He needed more support than we could provide on our own." Matthew Daley's defense team has argued that his actions on the day of the attack were a result of his mental illness spiraling out of control. They presented evidence of his history of psychiatric issues and his previous interactions with mental health services. In her testimony, Lynda Daley described the moments leading up to the tragic incident that took the life of Mr. Lock. She explained how her son had become increasingly agitated and paranoid in the days leading up to the attack, expressing fears that he was being followed and watched. "He kept saying that he needed to defend himself, that he was in danger," Lynda Daley recalled. "I knew he wasn't himself, but I didn't know how to help him. I wish we had gotten him the help he needed before it was too late." As she spoke, Matthew Daley sat in the courtroom, his head bowed in shame and remorse. He listened to his mother's words with tears in his eyes, the weight of his actions weighing heavily on him. Lynda Daley's testimony is a powerful plea for understanding and compassion for those struggling with mental illness. It serves as a reminder of the importance of recognizing the signs of mental distress and seeking help early on. The trial is ongoing, with the jury tasked with determining whether Matthew Daley is guilty of murder or if his actions were a result of his diminished responsibility due to mental illness. As the proceedings continue, the tragic loss of Donald Lock serves as a stark reminder of the devastating impact that untreated mental health issues can have on individuals and their loved ones. In the midst of the courtroom drama, Lynda Daley stands as a beacon of hope, advocating for better mental health support and understanding in society. Her plea for help for her son serves as a reminder that with the right resources and support, tragedies like the one that befell Mr. Lock could be prevented in the future.

title: Fortnite pro Jarvis banned for using cheat software
text: Jarvis Khattri was banned for using cheating software while playing the popular game. Fortnite creator Epic imposed the ban even though Mr Khattri used the software without malicious intent. The 17-year-old professional gamer, widely known as "FaZe Jarvis," posted a tearful video on his YouTube channel, apologizing to his fans and explaining that he had only intended to create entertaining content for his viewers. In the video, Jarvis expressed his deep regret for not realizing the consequences of using cheat software in an online game. He admitted that he made a mistake and acknowledged that his actions had violated the terms of service set by Epic Games. Despite his remorse, the ban remains in effect, and Jarvis's Fortnite career has been put on hold indefinitely. The use of cheat software in online gaming has been a contentious issue, with many players arguing that it undermines the integrity of the game and creates an unfair advantage for those who use it. Epic Games has taken a strong stance against cheating, implementing strict penalties for players caught using unauthorized software to gain an advantage. In response to Jarvis's ban, some members of the gaming community have expressed sympathy for the young pro player, citing his youth and lack of understanding of the consequences of his actions. Others, however, have criticized him for his reckless behavior and called for him to face the consequences of his actions. Jarvis's ban has sparked a wider discussion about the use of cheat software in online gaming and the responsibilities of professional gamers to uphold the integrity of the games they play. While some argue that Jarvis's ban is justified as a deterrent to others who may consider cheating, others believe that the punishment is too harsh for a young player who made a mistake. As the Fortnite community grapples with the fallout from Jarvis's ban, Epic Games has reiterated its commitment to maintaining a fair and competitive gaming environment for all players. The ban serves as a reminder that cheating in online games is not tolerated, regardless of the player's intentions. In the wake of the controversy surrounding Jarvis's ban, many players are calling for a more transparent and consistent approach to enforcing the rules against cheating in online gaming. As the debate continues, Jarvis Khattri's ban serves as a cautionary tale for professional gamers and casual players alike about the consequences of using cheat software in online games.

title: Elaine Doyle murder: DNA samples could give clues to death
text: Detectives used sticky tape to recover fibres from the dead girl's skin and found traces of DNA from "an unknown male" on Elaine's back. Forensic experts believe that these DNA samples could provide crucial clues to solving the case of Elaine Doyle's murder. Elaine Doyle, a 16-year-old schoolgirl, was found dead in a lane near her home in Greenock, Scotland in 1986. The discovery of the DNA samples has reinvigorated the investigation into her brutal killing, which has remained unsolved for over three decades. The use of modern forensic techniques, such as DNA analysis, has the potential to shed new light on the case and may finally bring justice for Elaine and her family. Detectives are now working tirelessly to trace the source of the DNA found on her body, hoping that it will lead them to the culprit responsible for her tragic death. In addition to the DNA evidence, detectives have also been re-interviewing witnesses and reviewing all available evidence from the original investigation. They are determined to leave no stone unturned in their pursuit of justice for Elaine. Elaine's family has been living with the pain of her loss for far too long and they are hopeful that this new breakthrough in the case will finally bring closure. They have never given up hope that the person responsible for her murder will one day be brought to justice and are grateful for the continued efforts of the police. The investigation into Elaine Doyle's murder has been one of the longest-running cold cases in Scottish history. Despite numerous appeals for information over the years, the case remained unsolved until now. The discovery of the DNA samples has given renewed hope to detectives and Elaine's family that they may finally be able to solve the mystery of her death. They are hopeful that the new evidence will provide the breakthrough they have been waiting for and bring closure to this tragic chapter in their lives. As the investigation continues, detectives are urging anyone with information about Elaine Doyle's murder to come forward. Even the smallest piece of information could be crucial in bringing the killer to justice and providing closure for Elaine's family. The use of DNA samples in the investigation is a testament to the advancements in forensic science over the last few decades. It serves as a reminder that no crime goes unpunished and that justice will prevail, no matter how much time has passed. In the coming weeks, detectives will be working tirelessly to analyze the DNA samples and follow up on any leads that may come from this new evidence. They are determined to bring closure to this long-standing cold case and finally provide justice for Elaine Doyle.

title: Joe Anderson: Liverpool mayor in police probe will not seek re-election
text: Mr Anderson, 62, made the announcement after Merseyside Police said he had been rebailed until February following his arrest earlier this month. He tweeted he was "disappointed" with the police decision as he strongly refutes all allegations against him. The decision not to seek re-election comes as a surprise to many, as Joe Anderson has been an influential figure in Liverpool politics for over a decade. Elected as the city's mayor in 2012, he has overseen significant developments and initiatives aimed at improving the lives of Liverpool residents. However, recent events have cast a shadow over Anderson's political career. The police probe, which is reportedly related to allegations of bribery and witness intimidation, has garnered widespread attention and raised questions about the mayor's integrity. In his statement, Anderson expressed his gratitude for the support he has received from the people of Liverpool throughout his time in office. He emphasized his commitment to serving the city and its residents, stating that he is proud of the work he has done as mayor. Despite his decision not to seek re-election, Anderson vowed to continue working for the benefit of Liverpool and its citizens. He stated that he will focus on his duties as mayor until the end of his term, and will work to ensure a smooth transition for his successor. The news of Anderson's decision has sparked speculation about who will succeed him as mayor of Liverpool. Several prominent political figures within the city have been mentioned as potential candidates, including current council members and community leaders. As the city prepares for a new chapter in its leadership, many are reflecting on Anderson's legacy and the impact he has had on Liverpool. His tenure as mayor has seen the city undergo significant transformations, with new developments and initiatives aimed at improving the quality of life for residents. However, the cloud of the police probe looms large, casting a shadow over Anderson's accomplishments and creating uncertainty about his future. As the investigation continues, all eyes will be on the mayor and the developments that unfold in the coming months. In the meantime, the people of Liverpool are left to ponder the implications of Anderson's decision and await further updates on the police probe. The city's political landscape is sure to undergo changes in the wake of this news, as residents grapple with the fallout from the allegations against their former mayor.

title: Bristol disabled cyclist accused of 'riding drunk'
text: Nik Royale asked a passing cyclist for help after finding himself "a bit lost" on a track in Bristol but was told to "go home as I should not ride drunk". However, what the cyclist did not know was that Nik, a disabled cyclist, was not drunk but rather struggling with a neurological condition that affected his balance and coordination. Despite trying to explain his situation, the passing cyclist continued to accuse Nik of being intoxicated. Feeling frustrated and misunderstood, Nik decided to continue on his own, determined to find his way back home. As he pedaled along the track, Nik's condition became more apparent as he swerved from side to side, struggling to keep his balance. It was then that he caught the attention of a group of teenagers who were riding their bikes nearby. Initially, the teenagers thought Nik was riding recklessly and endangering himself. However, upon closer inspection, they noticed something different about his cycling style. One of the teenagers, Sarah, approached Nik and asked if he needed help. Grateful for the offer of assistance, Nik explained his medical condition to Sarah and her friends. They were understanding and sympathetic, offering to escort him back home safely. Despite his initial encounter with the judgmental cyclist, Nik was touched by the kindness of these teenagers. As they rode together, Nik shared his passion for cycling and how it had become a form of therapy for him, helping him to cope with his condition. The teenagers listened intently, inspired by Nik's resilience and determination. Upon reaching Nik's home, he thanked Sarah and her friends for their kindness and support. He hoped that his encounter with them would help raise awareness about disabilities and the importance of being more understanding and compassionate towards others. Reflecting on his experience, Nik realized that there was still a long way to go in terms of changing people's perceptions of disabilities. He hoped that by sharing his story, he could help educate others and promote a more inclusive and supportive community for individuals with disabilities. Despite the initial accusation of riding drunk, Nik's encounter with the teenagers turned out to be a heartwarming reminder of the power of empathy and understanding. As he parked his bike and waved goodbye to his new friends, Nik felt grateful for the unexpected kindness that had brightened his day.

title: Rain forecast as Glastonbury Festival opens
text: Fans queued outside the Somerset site from dawn on Wednesday and counted down as the pedestrian gates were opened. Excitement filled the air as festival-goers rushed in to secure the best spot for their tents and camping gear. However, their spirits were slightly dampened by the forecast of heavy rain looming over the iconic Glastonbury Festival. As the dark clouds rolled in, organizers urged attendees to come prepared with rain gear and sturdy footwear to navigate the muddy grounds. Despite the less than ideal weather forecast, spirits remained high as festival-goers were eager to experience the world-renowned music and arts event. The Glastonbury Festival has a reputation for unpredictable weather, with rain often making an appearance during the weekend. However, this has never deterred the thousands of music lovers and culture enthusiasts who flock to the picturesque Somerset countryside to revel in the unique atmosphere. Alongside the incredible lineup of musical acts and artists, Glastonbury Festival also offers a wide array of activities, workshops, and installations to keep attendees entertained throughout the weekend. From yoga sessions to interactive art installations, there is something for everyone at this diverse and inclusive event. Despite the rain forecast, festival-goers remained undeterred, determined to make the most of their Glastonbury experience. As the first notes of music filled the air and the crowd erupted into cheers, any thoughts of the impending rain were quickly forgotten. The sense of community and camaraderie that permeated the festival grounds only served to enhance the overall experience for those in attendance. As the weekend progressed, the rain did indeed make its presence felt, turning the grounds into a muddy mess. But this did little to dampen the spirits of the festival-goers, who embraced the adverse conditions with a sense of humour and resilience. From impromptu mud sliding competitions to dance parties in the rain, attendees made the most of the challenging weather, creating unforgettable memories in the process. As the final day of the Glastonbury Festival approached, and the rain finally subsided, a sense of nostalgia and bittersweetness swept over the crowd. Many were already making plans to return the following year, rain or shine, knowing that the magic of Glastonbury would always prevail, regardless of the weather forecast. And as the last notes of music faded into the night sky, the festival came to a close, leaving behind a trail of memories and moments that would last a lifetime.

title: Tony Blair: Hard Irish border would be 'disaster'
text: Tony Blair: Hard Irish border would be 'disaster' The former UK PM said later he believed there was a "common desire" to make Northern Ireland a "special case" in Brexit negotiations. And during a recent interview, Blair emphasized the importance of finding a solution that avoids a hard border between Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland. Blair, who played a key role in the Northern Ireland peace process during his time in office, warned that any physical infrastructure at the border would pose a serious threat to the peace and stability achieved in the region. He stressed that a hard border would not only be logistically challenging but could also reignite tensions and undermine the progress made in the decades since the Good Friday Agreement. The former Prime Minister urged both the UK and the EU to work together to find a pragmatic solution that respects the unique circumstances of Northern Ireland. He proposed the idea of a "special economic zone" for the region that would allow for cross-border cooperation and economic integration while maintaining the integrity of the EU single market. Blair's comments come amid growing concerns about the potential impact of Brexit on Northern Ireland, which shares a border with the Republic of Ireland. The issue of the border has been a major sticking point in Brexit negotiations, with both sides struggling to find a solution that satisfies all parties involved. Blair's intervention is likely to add to the pressure on the UK government to come up with a workable plan for the border. Prime Minister Boris Johnson has repeatedly stated his commitment to avoid a hard border, but the details of how that will be achieved remain unclear. Many observers have warned that a failure to find a solution could have serious consequences for the peace and stability of Northern Ireland. The region has made significant progress in recent years, and any return to a hard border could threaten to unravel that progress. Blair's words serve as a reminder of the importance of finding a solution that works for all parties involved. As Brexit negotiations continue, all eyes will be on the UK government to see if they can deliver on their promise to avoid a hard border in Northern Ireland. The stakes are high, and the consequences of failure could be catastrophic. It is clear that the issue of the Irish border will continue to be a key focus of Brexit negotiations in the coming months.

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: Husband fears for her health
text: Richard Ratcliffe also expressed concern that his wife appeared to be "on the verge of a nervous breakdown". She was arrested during a visit to Iran in April 2016 accused of spying, a charge she and her family vehemently deny. Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, a British-Iranian dual national, has been imprisoned in Iran for over five years now, separated from her husband and young daughter. Her detention has been a source of anguish for her family, with her husband tirelessly campaigning for her release. In recent weeks, her health has deteriorated significantly, with Ratcliffe describing her as being in a "bad way". Concerns about her mental health have been exacerbated by the harsh conditions of her imprisonment, including solitary confinement and restricted access to medical treatment. Ratcliffe has been vocal in his criticism of the UK government's handling of his wife's case, accusing them of not doing enough to secure her release. He has urged Prime Minister Boris Johnson to intervene personally, but so far his appeals have fallen on deaf ears. The case of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe has become a focal point in the ongoing tensions between Iran and the UK, with her detention fueling diplomatic disputes between the two countries. The British government has been working behind the scenes to secure her release, but progress has been slow and the situation remains precarious. Ratcliffe is now calling for the UK to take a tougher stance against Iran, demanding that they exert more pressure on the Iranian authorities to release his wife. He has also criticized the Foreign Office for not doing enough to support him and his family during this difficult time. Despite the challenges they face, the Ratcliffe family remains hopeful that Nazanin will be reunited with them soon. They have been heartened by the outpouring of support from the public and are hopeful that international pressure will help bring about a resolution to her case. As the world watches and waits for a resolution, the fate of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe hangs in the balance. Her husband's fears for her health only serve to highlight the urgency of the situation and the need for swift action to secure her release.

title: Kit Harington reveals family connection to the 'Gunpowder Plot'
text: of Parliament in 1605. The connection between Kit Harington and the Gunpowder Plot runs deep, as he recently discovered that he is a direct descendant of Robert Catesby, the mastermind behind the infamous conspiracy. In an interview with BBC, Kit Harington shared his excitement about portraying his ancestor on screen. "When I found out about my family connection to the Gunpowder Plot, I was intrigued and fascinated by the story. It's a piece of history that has always captured my imagination," he said. As he delved deeper into his family's history, Kit discovered that Catesby was a Catholic who felt marginalized and persecuted by the Protestant government of the time. Motivated by his religious beliefs and a desire to overthrow the oppressive regime, Catesby hatched the plan to blow up the Houses of Parliament during the State Opening on November 5th, 1605. "It's a complex and challenging role to play, but I feel a deep connection to the character and the events that unfolded during that turbulent time in history," Kit explained. "I want to do justice to my ancestor's legacy and bring his story to life in a compelling and authentic way." The Gunpowder Plot has remained a significant event in British history, with Bonfire Night celebrations held annually on November 5th to commemorate the foiling of the conspiracy. Guy Fawkes, the most well-known member of the group, has often been mistakenly identified as the ringleader. However, it was Catesby who formulated the plan and recruited the conspirators, including Fawkes, to carry out the daring act of treason. As Kit Harington prepares to take on the role of Robert Catesby, he is immersing himself in the historical context of the Gunpowder Plot, studying the intricacies of the plot and the motivations behind it. "I want to bring a sense of authenticity and depth to the character, to delve into the complexities of Robert Catesby's beliefs and actions," he said. The new BBC One drama Gunpowder promises to shed light on the lesser-known aspects of the Gunpowder Plot, exploring the personal stories and motivations of the conspirators beyond the failed assassination attempt. With Kit Harington's personal connection to the events unfolding on screen, viewers can expect a captivating and nuanced portrayal of one of the most infamous chapters in British history.

title: Reaction: Gravitational waves discovery
text: Here's a selection of the reaction to news of the findings. Brian Cox, Royal Society professor for public engagement in science, said: This is a very exciting discovery for two reasons. Firstly, it confirms yet again that Einstein's Theory of General Relativity continues to stand the test of time in explaining the fundamental forces of the universe. The detection of gravitational waves provides strong evidence for the existence of black holes and other exotic phenomena predicted by the theory. Cox continued, "Secondly, this discovery opens up a new era of astronomy where we can now 'listen' to the universe and study objects and events that were previously hidden from our view. Just as Galileo's telescope revolutionized our understanding of the cosmos, the detection of gravitational waves will allow us to explore the universe in ways we never thought possible." Professor Stephen Hawking also weighed in on the significance of the discovery, stating, "Gravitational waves offer a new window into the universe, allowing us to observe events such as the collision of black holes that emit no light. This opens up new possibilities for studying the most extreme environments in the cosmos and testing our understanding of gravity under extreme conditions." Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson expressed his enthusiasm for the discovery, highlighting the collaborative effort of scientists from around the world. "The detection of gravitational waves is a testament to the power of international cooperation and the ingenuity of the human mind. This is a milestone in the history of science that will undoubtedly lead to groundbreaking discoveries in the years to come." Not all reactions were enthusiastic, however. Some skeptics questioned the validity of the findings and the potential impact on our understanding of the universe. Dr. Jane Smith, a physicist from the University of Cambridge, raised concerns about the implications of the discovery. "While the detection of gravitational waves is certainly a remarkable achievement, we must approach this new field of study with caution. It is important to thoroughly verify and validate the results before making any bold claims about the nature of the cosmos." Despite differing opinions, one thing is clear – the discovery of gravitational waves has opened up a new frontier in our exploration of the universe. With the ability to observe phenomena beyond the reach of traditional telescopes, scientists are now poised to unravel some of the greatest mysteries of the cosmos. As research in this field progresses, we can expect even more astonishing revelations that will shape our understanding of the universe for generations to come.

title: August Bank Holiday: Where to avoid on roads and rail
text: Major work on the railways will mean no trains in or out of London Euston on Saturday and Sunday. The vast majority of roadworks on motorways were completed or lifted by Friday morning, with work not set to resume until Tuesday to accommodate the long August Bank Holiday weekend. However, those planning to travel over the holiday weekend are advised to avoid certain areas where traffic congestion is expected to be particularly heavy. A spokesperson for Highways England warned that major routes such as the M25, M4, and M5 are likely to be busier than usual, with holidaymakers heading to popular tourist destinations along the south and west coasts. In addition to the usual congestion hotspots, drivers should be aware that some areas will be affected by ongoing roadworks and closures. The M3 motorway, for example, will have lane restrictions in place near Winchester, while sections of the M4 will be reduced to one lane near Reading. Delays are expected on the M5 near Bristol and Gloucester due to ongoing smart motorway works. Those planning to take the train out of London are also warned to expect disruption, as Network Rail carries out essential maintenance work over the bank holiday weekend. In addition to the closure of London Euston station, engineering works will also affect services to and from Liverpool Lime Street, Birmingham New Street, and Manchester Piccadilly. Passengers are advised to check for alternative routes and allow extra time for their journeys. Replacement bus services will be in operation for some routes, but these are likely to be busier than usual and may take longer to complete. For those looking to travel further afield, airports are expected to be busy over the bank holiday weekend. Heathrow, Gatwick, and Manchester airports are all reporting high volumes of passengers, with some flights already fully booked. Passengers are advised to arrive at the airport well in advance of their departure time and to check for any delays or cancellations before setting off. Despite the potential for disruption, millions of people are expected to travel over the August Bank Holiday weekend to make the most of the last long weekend of the summer. Whether heading to the coast, the countryside, or abroad, travellers are urged to plan ahead, allow extra time for their journeys, and stay informed about any disruptions or delays.

title: Subsidy for non-existent flights costs Stormont £2.3m a year
text: the growth of routes to North America and the Middle East from Belfast International Airport. However, it has emerged that a subsidy of £2.23m per year is still being paid to airlines for flights that do not exist. The subsidy was agreed as part of the devolution deal, with the rationale being that it would help support airlines as they developed new long-haul routes from Northern Ireland. But five years after the APD cut, the flights that the subsidy was designed to support have not materialized. This revelation has sparked criticism from both politicians and the general public, with questions being raised about the effectiveness of the subsidy and the need for greater transparency around government spending. The Department for the Economy, which oversees the subsidy, has defended the payments, stating that they are necessary to incentivize airlines to launch new routes and provide connectivity for Northern Ireland. However, critics argue that this money could be better spent on other priorities, such as improving public transport infrastructure or investing in key sectors like healthcare and education. The subsidy is set to continue for the foreseeable future, with no plans in place to reassess the need for it or to reallocate the funds to more pressing areas. In light of this controversy, there have been calls for greater accountability and scrutiny of government spending, particularly when it comes to subsidies for private companies. It is clear that the issue of subsidizing non-existent flights is a complex one, with arguments on both sides about the benefits and drawbacks of such support. As the debate continues, it remains to be seen whether the subsidy will be re-evaluated or if it will continue to be paid out without any changes. For now, the £2.23m per year subsidy remains a contentious issue that highlights the challenges of balancing economic development with fiscal responsibility.

title: Coroner in plea to Shropshire Council over river safety
text: The body of Hayden Reynolds-Evans, 18, from Shrewsbury, was found in the River Severn in the town in March. Coroner John Ellery wrote to Shropshire Council before about the river around the time of Reynolds-Evans' tragic death, urging them to improve safety measures along the riverbanks. In his letter, Coroner Ellery highlighted the need for better signage warning of the dangers of the river, particularly during periods of high water levels. He also called for increased patrols along the river to deter risky behavior and prevent further tragedies like the one that befell Reynolds-Evans. Shropshire Council has faced criticism in the past for not doing enough to ensure the safety of those using the River Severn. In response to the Coroner's plea, the Council has pledged to review their current safety measures and explore ways to enhance safety along the riverbanks. Local residents have expressed their concerns about the lack of adequate safety measures along the River Severn, citing the need for improved fencing, signage, and supervision in popular riverside areas. Many feel that more needs to be done to prevent further loss of life in the river. The tragic death of Hayden Reynolds-Evans has brought the issue of river safety in Shropshire into the spotlight. Many are calling for swift action to be taken to prevent further tragedies and ensure the safety of those enjoying the natural beauty of the River Severn. Coroner John Ellery's plea to Shropshire Council underscores the urgency of the situation and the need for immediate action to improve safety measures along the riverbanks. The Council must take this plea seriously and work quickly to implement the necessary changes to prevent further loss of life in the River Severn. As the community mourns the loss of Hayden Reynolds-Evans, they are also calling on Shropshire Council to prioritize river safety and take the necessary steps to prevent future tragedies. The Council's response to the Coroner's plea will be closely watched, as residents hope to see tangible improvements in safety along the River Severn in the near future.

title: Welsh A&E waiting time target missed again
text: The latest figures from the Welsh government show 84.3% of patients were treated within four hours in March, a slight increase from the previous month. This number rose to 85.9% in April, continuing the positive trend. However, despite these improvements, the percentage remains below the Welsh government's target of admitting, transferring, or discharging 95% of patients within four hours. Health officials have acknowledged that the National Health Service (NHS) in Wales is facing significant challenges in meeting the A&E waiting time target. The increasing demand for services, coupled with staffing shortages and limited resources, has put a strain on the healthcare system. While efforts are being made to address these issues, more needs to be done to ensure timely and effective care for all patients. Patients and their families have expressed concerns over the prolonged wait times in A&E departments across Wales. Many have reported waiting for hours to receive treatment, with some even being left in corridors due to overcrowding. This has raised questions about the quality of care being provided and the impact it has on patient outcomes. In response to these challenges, health officials are working to implement strategies to improve A&E waiting times and ensure that patients receive the care they need in a timely manner. This includes increasing staffing levels, streamlining processes, and improving communication between healthcare providers. Additionally, efforts are being made to encourage patients to seek alternative forms of care, such as visiting a GP or using urgent care services, to help alleviate pressure on A&E departments. Despite the ongoing challenges, healthcare professionals in Wales remain dedicated to providing high-quality care to all patients. They continue to work tirelessly to ensure that patients receive the treatment they need, when they need it. However, they also recognize the need for additional support and resources to help them meet the growing demand for services. In conclusion, while there have been some improvements in A&E waiting times in Wales, the latest figures show that the Welsh government's target of treating 95% of patients within four hours is still not being met. Health officials are aware of the challenges facing the NHS in Wales and are working to address them, but more needs to be done to ensure that patients receive timely and effective care. By working together and implementing strategies to improve A&E services, we can strive to meet the needs of all patients and ensure that they receive the care they deserve.

title: Forestry England names its first writers in residence
text: Zakiya Mckenzie, from Bristol, and Tiffany Francis, from Petersfield, Hampshire, won a competition to mark the commission's centenary. Writers in the Forest sought applicants from underrepresented groups to "diversify nature writing". Ms Mckenzie said it was a huge honor to be named one of Forestry England's first writers in residence, particularly as a woman of color in a predominantly white industry. Growing up in Bristol, Mckenzie developed a deep connection to nature through visits to local parks and forests. She often felt like an outsider in these spaces, not seeing many people who looked like her represented in nature writing. As a writers in residence, Mckenzie hopes to bring her unique perspective to the forefront and inspire others from diverse backgrounds to engage with the natural world. Tiffany Francis, on the other hand, hails from the picturesque countryside of Hampshire. She has always been drawn to nature and its beauty, finding solace in the peace and tranquility of the forest. As a writer in residence, Francis aims to capture the essence of these natural landscapes and share her love for the environment with a wider audience. Forestry England hopes that by appointing writers from different backgrounds, they can help to diversify nature writing and make it more inclusive. The commission recognizes the importance of representation in literature and believes that by showcasing a variety of voices, they can reach a broader audience and inspire more people to connect with nature. Both Mckenzie and Francis will spend several weeks in forests across England, immersing themselves in the natural surroundings and drawing inspiration from the beauty of the landscape. They will have the opportunity to engage with visitors, lead workshops, and create pieces of writing that reflect their experiences in the forest. Forestry England is excited to see what the writers in residence will produce during their time in the forests and is looking forward to sharing their work with the public. The commission hopes that by highlighting the voices of Mckenzie and Francis, they can start to shift the narrative around nature writing and encourage more diversity in the field. As the first writers in residence for Forestry England, Mckenzie and Francis have a unique opportunity to shape the future of nature writing and pave the way for other underrepresented voices to be heard. Their contributions will undoubtedly inspire a new generation of writers to explore the natural world and share their stories with the world.

title: International GCSEs to be axed from school league tables
text: The change is part of the government's overhaul of the exam system in England. New GCSEs in maths and English, which feature little or no coursework and exams at the end of the two-year course, are set to replace the International GCSEs in these subjects. The decision has sparked debate among educators and parents, with some welcoming the move as a return to a more rigorous and traditional exam system, while others express concerns about the impact on students who may struggle with the more challenging content. Supporters of the government's decision argue that the new GCSEs will provide students with a more accurate assessment of their abilities in key subjects. They believe that the removal of coursework will eliminate the potential for bias and cheating, ensuring that grades are based solely on students' performance in the final exams. Proponents also argue that this change will better prepare students for the demands of higher education and the workplace, where performance in timed examinations is often a key measure of success. However, critics of the move worry that the elimination of International GCSEs from school league tables will have a negative impact on students who may excel in these exams but struggle with the new GCSE format. They argue that International GCSEs offer a more flexible and inclusive assessment model, which allows students to demonstrate their knowledge and skills through a combination of coursework and exams. By removing these exams from consideration in school rankings, critics fear that students who do not perform well under exam conditions may be unfairly disadvantaged. In addition to concerns about the impact on individual students, some educators worry about the broader implications of the shift away from International GCSEs. They argue that these exams provide schools with a more accurate measure of student progress and achievement, as they are designed to be more challenging and rigorous than traditional GCSEs. By removing International GCSEs from school league tables, these educators fear that schools may be incentivized to focus on preparing students for exams at the expense of a more holistic and engaging education. Overall, the government's decision to axe International GCSEs from school league tables represents a significant shift in the assessment of student achievement in England. While supporters welcome the move as a return to a more traditional exam system, critics are concerned about the potential impact on individual students and the broader education system. As the new GCSEs are implemented and schools adapt to the changes, it remains to be seen how this shift will affect students' learning experiences and outcomes in the years to come.

title: Scottish Gin Society rapped over Facebook adverts
text: misled viewers about the effects of alcohol consumption. The ASA deemed that the posts breached CAP Code rules relating to social responsibility and misleading advertising. The ten Facebook adverts in question featured images of people enjoying gin cocktails in various social settings, accompanied by captions such as "Let the fun be GIN" and "Gin for the win". While the SGS argued that the posts were intended to be light-hearted and aimed at promoting responsible drinking, the ASA found that they instead promoted a culture of excessive alcohol consumption. In its ruling, the ASA highlighted the importance of promoting responsible drinking in all advertising related to alcoholic beverages. It stated that the SGS's posts failed to provide clear messaging about the need to drink in moderation and portrayed alcohol consumption in a glamorous and carefree light. The ASA's decision has drawn mixed reactions from members of the Scottish Gin Society and the wider public. Some have criticized the ruling as an overreach by the advertising watchdog, arguing that the posts were clearly intended as light-hearted and harmless. Others have expressed support for the ASA's decision, stating that the promotion of responsible drinking should always be a priority in advertising campaigns. In response to the ruling, the Scottish Gin Society has issued a statement acknowledging the ASA's decision and expressing its commitment to promoting responsible drinking in all future advertising efforts. The society has stated that it will work closely with the ASA to ensure that its marketing materials comply with industry standards and guidelines. This incident serves as a reminder of the importance of responsible advertising in the promotion of alcoholic beverages. While it is important for brands to engage with consumers in a creative and appealing manner, it is equally crucial for them to prioritize the promotion of safe and responsible drinking practices. Moving forward, the Scottish Gin Society and other alcohol-related brands must ensure that their marketing materials convey a clear and consistent message regarding responsible drinking. By doing so, they can continue to promote their products in a positive and ethical manner while also upholding industry standards and regulations.

title: Neo-Nazi group led by 13-year-old boy to be banned
text: By Daniel De SimoneBBC News Feuerkrieg Division, an international group that largely existed online, said earlier this year it had dissolved. But Home Secretary Priti Patel has announced plans to ban the neo-Nazi organization, led by a 13-year-old boy. The Feuerkrieg Division, based in the United States, has been described as a dangerous and extremist group that promotes hate and violence. Its members have been linked to a number of violent incidents, including the vandalization of Jewish cemeteries and the distribution of racist propaganda. The decision to ban the group comes after a joint investigation by law enforcement agencies in the UK and the US uncovered evidence of their activities. The group's leader, who cannot be named for legal reasons, is reported to have used social media to recruit and radicalize members, many of them young and vulnerable individuals. Patel described the group as a "poisonous ideology" that has no place in society. "We must do everything we can to root out extremism in all its forms and protect our communities from those who seek to spread hate and division," she said. The ban on the Feuerkrieg Division is part of the government's wider efforts to counter extremism and hate speech. In recent years, there has been a growing concern about the influence of online platforms in spreading extremist ideologies and radicalizing individuals. The decision to ban the group has been welcomed by anti-discrimination campaigners and community leaders. They have called for a united front against hate and extremism, urging people to report any suspicious activities or individuals to the authorities. While the ban is a significant step in the fight against extremism, experts warn that more needs to be done to address the root causes of radicalization. They emphasize the importance of education and community engagement in preventing individuals from being drawn into violent ideologies. As the government moves to outlaw the Feuerkrieg Division, it sends a clear message that hate and intolerance will not be tolerated in the UK. The ban serves as a reminder that extremism in all forms, whether online or offline, poses a serious threat to our society and must be confronted head-on. In the coming weeks, authorities will work to enforce the ban and investigate any remaining members of the group. While the road ahead may be challenging, the government is committed to protecting the public from the dangers of extremism and ensuring a safe and inclusive society for all.

title: Coronavirus: Self-employed bailout ‘problematic’
text: By Faisal Islam Economics editor Rishi Sunak, however, repeatedly spelt out difficulties in applying the same terms as his recent bailout for staff. He refused to commit to a precise date for help, saying there were issues about the fairness of providing financial assistance to self-employed individuals. The Chancellor's announcement of measures to support employees affected by the coronavirus pandemic has been largely welcomed, but the omission of self-employed workers from the same level of support has sparked concerns. Many self-employed individuals have seen a significant decrease in income due to the pandemic as work opportunities have dried up and businesses have shut down. Without the safety net of employee benefits such as sick pay and paid leave, self-employed workers are facing financial uncertainty. Sunak acknowledged the challenges faced by self-employed workers during the crisis but stressed that finding an appropriate way to provide financial support to this group was more complex than the support offered to employees. He highlighted the need to ensure that any assistance provided was fair and did not create unfair advantages or disadvantages. The Chancellor stated that the government was exploring various options to support self-employed individuals but did not provide a timeline for when these measures would be implemented. Sunak emphasized the need for careful consideration and evaluation to ensure that the support package for self-employed workers was comprehensive and effective. Critics, however, have spoken out against the delay in providing assistance to self-employed workers, arguing that the government's inaction could have severe consequences for millions of individuals who rely on self-employment for their livelihoods. They have called for urgent action to address the financial struggles faced by this group. The Federation of Small Businesses (FSB) has urged the government to expedite the process of providing financial assistance to self-employed workers, warning that delays could result in irreversible damage to the economy. The FSB emphasized the importance of supporting self-employed individuals, who play a crucial role in the UK's workforce and are vital to the economic recovery. As the government continues to grapple with the economic fallout of the coronavirus pandemic, the issue of support for self-employed workers remains a key concern.
