While Sunak has pledged to address the challenges faced by this group, questions remain about the timing and effectiveness of the assistance that will be provided. In the coming weeks, self-employed individuals will be closely watching for updates from the government and hoping for relief from the financial uncertainty they currently face.

title: Windows 7 hardest hit by WannaCry worm
text: computers in over 150 countries. This unprecedented cyber attack has caused chaos and disruption on a global scale, crippling businesses, hospitals, and government agencies. The WannaCry ransomware encrypts files on infected computers and demands payment in Bitcoin to unlock them. Windows 7, the operating system most affected by WannaCry, has been particularly vulnerable to this attack due to its widespread use and the lack of security updates provided by Microsoft. While Microsoft released a patch to protect against the vulnerability exploited by WannaCry in March 2017, many users failed to install it, leaving their systems exposed. Security experts have warned that the impact of WannaCry could have been significantly reduced if organizations had taken basic security measures such as keeping their software up to date and implementing proper cybersecurity protocols. However, the sheer scale of the attack has highlighted the urgent need for improved cybersecurity practices and greater cooperation between governments, businesses, and cybersecurity experts. The WannaCry attack has also raised concerns about the increasing threat posed by ransomware and other forms of cybercrime. As technology becomes more integrated into our daily lives and businesses, the potential for cyber attacks to cause widespread disruption and financial loss continues to grow. It is imperative that organizations invest in robust cybersecurity measures to protect their data and infrastructure from future attacks. In response to the WannaCry attack, Microsoft has taken the unusual step of releasing security updates for unsupported versions of Windows, including Windows XP and Windows Server 2003. This move underscores the seriousness of the threat posed by WannaCry and the need for all users to take immediate action to protect their systems. While the immediate impact of the WannaCry attack may be devastating, it also serves as a wake-up call for organizations and individuals to prioritize cybersecurity and take proactive steps to secure their systems against future threats. By learning from this experience and implementing strong cybersecurity practices, we can minimize the risk of falling victim to similar attacks in the future. As the global community continues to grapple with the aftermath of WannaCry, it is clear that cybersecurity is no longer just a technical issue – it is a critical business and societal issue that requires urgent attention and action. The lessons learned from this attack must be heeded, and all stakeholders must work together to strengthen our defenses against cyber threats and ensure the security and resilience of our digital infrastructure.

title: Neil McEvoy: Commission reconsiders decision to recognise new party
text: The Electoral Commission is reconsidering whether to officially register the Welsh National Party. It follows a threatened legal challenge by Plaid Cymru. Mr McEvoy said the decision to reconsider the recognition of his party was a clear attempt to stifle competition and limit democratic choice in Wales. Neil McEvoy, a former Plaid Cymru member and now leader of the Welsh National Party, believes that his party has met all the necessary criteria for registration. He claims that the Electoral Commission's decision to revisit the matter is politically motivated and designed to protect the interests of the established parties. Plaid Cymru, on the other hand, argues that the Welsh National Party does not have sufficient support or a clear identity to warrant official recognition. They have raised concerns about Mr McEvoy's leadership style and his controversial statements on social media, which they believe could damage the reputation of Welsh politics. The dispute between the two parties highlights the growing tensions within Welsh politics as new players emerge onto the scene. The Welsh National Party has been positioning itself as a fresh alternative to the traditional party politics in Wales, promising to bring about radical change and challenge the status quo. Mr McEvoy has been vocal in his criticisms of the current Welsh government, accusing them of being out of touch with the needs of the people. He has called for greater transparency and accountability in politics, as well as a focus on issues such as housing, healthcare, and education. Despite the challenges facing his party, Mr McEvoy remains confident in its ability to make a significant impact on Welsh politics. He believes that there is a growing appetite for change among the Welsh electorate, and that his party is well-placed to capitalize on this momentum. The Electoral Commission's decision to reconsider the registration of the Welsh National Party has thrown a spanner in the works for Mr McEvoy and his supporters. However, he remains determined to fight for his party's right to be recognized and to contest future elections. It remains to be seen how this dispute will play out in the coming weeks and months. The future of the Welsh National Party hangs in the balance, as the Electoral Commission weighs up the evidence and considers the arguments put forward by both sides. One thing is for certain: the political landscape in Wales is changing, and Neil McEvoy is at the center of it all.

title: Soap bubble screen is 'the world's thinnest display'
text: An international team produced a display that uses ultrasonic sound waves to alter the film's properties and create either a flat or a 3D image. The bubble mixture is more complex than traditional soap bubble solutions, with the addition of nanoparticles that help stabilize the film and prevent it from popping too quickly. The world's thinnest display works by emitting ultrasonic sound waves at specific frequencies, which cause the soap bubble film to vibrate and change its thickness. This allows the display to switch between a flat, 2D image and a 3D image with depth and dimension. Dr. Emily Zhang, the lead researcher on the project, explained the technology behind the soap bubble screen. "We are essentially using the soap bubble as a thin film that can be manipulated by sound waves. By adjusting the frequency and intensity of the sound waves, we are able to control the thickness of the bubble and create different visual effects." The potential applications for this technology are vast, ranging from advertising displays to immersive entertainment experiences. The thinness of the bubble display allows for flexibility and portability, making it ideal for use in various settings. In a demonstration of the soap bubble screen, the team projected a series of stunning images and videos that seemed to float in mid-air. Viewers were amazed by the lifelike quality of the 3D images and the vibrant colors produced by the display. Despite its innovative design, the soap bubble screen still faces some challenges, such as the fragility of the bubbles and the need for a controlled environment to prevent interference from external factors. The team is currently working on addressing these issues to make the technology more practical and accessible for commercial use. Dr. Zhang is optimistic about the future of the soap bubble display technology. "We believe that this technology has the potential to revolutionize the way we interact with digital content. Imagine having a display that can be rolled up like a piece of paper or easily transported in a small package. The possibilities are endless." As the team continues to refine the soap bubble screen, they hope to eventually bring this cutting-edge technology to the market and transform the way we experience visual media. With its unique combination of ultrasonic sound waves and soap bubbles, the world's thinnest display is poised to make a big splash in the world of entertainment and communications.

title: Oil firms 'need fresh strategies' says PwC report
text: PwC said companies should be looking to deploy fresh strategies, following a sustained fall in the price of oil. It suggested they should look to reduce costs "in a sustainable manner" and find efficiencies by keeping tax costs in control. The report highlighted the need for oil firms to adapt to the changing market conditions and explore new opportunities for growth. One of the key recommendations in the report was for oil firms to focus on technology and innovation to improve operational efficiency. By investing in new technologies such as automation and digitalization, companies can streamline their operations and reduce costs. This could involve implementing advanced data analytics to optimize production processes or adopting remote monitoring systems to increase safety and reduce downtime. Furthermore, the report emphasized the importance of diversification in order to reduce risk and remain competitive in the long term. Oil firms should consider expanding into new markets or investing in renewable energy sources to hedge against fluctuations in oil prices. By diversifying their business portfolios, companies can create new revenue streams and ensure their sustainability in the face of changing market dynamics. Another key aspect highlighted in the report was the need for oil firms to prioritize environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations in their business strategies. With increasing scrutiny on the environmental impact of oil production, companies need to demonstrate their commitment to sustainability and responsible business practices. This could involve implementing eco-friendly initiatives, reducing carbon emissions, or investing in renewable energy projects. Overall, the PwC report underscored the importance of oil firms adopting new strategies to navigate the challenges posed by the current market environment. By focusing on cost reduction, technology adoption, diversification, and ESG considerations, companies can position themselves for long-term success and growth. As the oil industry continues to evolve, it is crucial for firms to remain agile and innovative in order to thrive in a rapidly changing landscape. With the right strategies in place, oil companies can overcome market volatility and create value for their stakeholders.

title: Child sex abuse inquiry: Priest 'tried to control' investigation
text: A former North Yorkshire detective said officers were "excluded" from inquiries at Ampleforth College in 1995 and 2002. But former head teacher Father Leo Chamberlain denied influencing any investigations into child sex abuse at the prestigious Catholic school. The detective, who spoke on condition of anonymity, revealed that police were prevented from conducting thorough investigations into allegations of abuse at the college due to interference from Father Chamberlain and other senior figures within the institution. He claimed that there was a culture of silence and protection of abusers at Ampleforth, which hindered the police's efforts to uncover the full extent of the abuse. Father Chamberlain, who served as head teacher at Ampleforth from 1992 to 2005, denied the allegations and stated that he fully cooperated with the police whenever they approached him regarding the abuse allegations. He insisted that he had no influence over any investigations and that he was committed to ensuring the safety and well-being of the students at the college. However, the detective's claims are supported by several former students who have come forward with their own accounts of abuse at Ampleforth. One former pupil, who wished to remain anonymous, described how he was sexually assaulted by a member of staff at the college and how his complaints were dismissed by Father Chamberlain and other senior staff members. The former detective also alleged that the Catholic Church exerted pressure on the police to limit their investigations into the abuse at Ampleforth. He claimed that there was a reluctance to prosecute abusers within the church and that investigations were often impeded by the church hierarchy. The revelations come as part of the ongoing Independent Inquiry into Child Sexual Abuse (IICSA), which is currently examining the extent of child sex abuse within the Catholic Church in England and Wales. The inquiry has already heard harrowing testimonies from survivors of abuse at various institutions, including Ampleforth College. The IICSA has called for a full investigation into the allegations of interference by Father Chamberlain and others at Ampleforth College, and has urged the Catholic Church to cooperate fully with the inquiry. The church has stated that it is committed to addressing the issue of child sex abuse and has apologized to the survivors for the harm that was done to them. As the inquiry continues, more survivors are expected to come forward with their accounts of abuse, shining a light on the dark history of child sex abuse within the Catholic Church and the institutions associated with it.

title: FE funding body threat over sixth form involvement
text: Colleges Wales says its backing for a new funding commission is in question unless school sixth forms are part of its remit. The new body would replace the Higher Education Funding Council, which is currently responsible for allocating public funding to further education colleges and universities in Wales. The move comes after concerns were raised that school sixth forms have been left out of the conversation when it comes to funding and oversight. Colleges Wales argues that including school sixth forms in the remit of the new funding commission is essential to ensure a fair and comprehensive approach to education funding in Wales. "The current system is fragmented and inefficient, with different funding bodies responsible for different parts of the education system. Including school sixth forms in the remit of the new funding commission would bring a much-needed level of coherence and consistency to the allocation of public funds," said a spokesperson for Colleges Wales. The threat to withdraw backing for the new funding commission highlights the growing tensions between further education colleges and school sixth forms in Wales. While both play a crucial role in the education system, there have been longstanding disputes over funding and resources. Supporters of including school sixth forms in the remit of the new funding commission argue that it would ensure a more holistic and joined-up approach to education policy in Wales. By bringing together all parts of the education system under one funding body, they believe that resources can be allocated more efficiently and effectively. However, critics warn that including school sixth forms in the remit of the new funding commission could lead to funding cuts for further education colleges, which already face significant financial challenges. They argue that school sixth forms receive a disproportionate share of public funds compared to colleges, and that any changes to the funding system should be carefully considered to avoid disadvantaging one sector over the other. The debate over the involvement of school sixth forms in the new funding commission is likely to continue in the coming months, as the Welsh government seeks to overhaul the education funding system. Colleges Wales has made it clear that they will not support the new funding commission unless school sixth forms are included in its remit, setting the stage for a potentially contentious battle over the future of education funding in Wales.

title: Dinas Dinlle beach erosion plan unveiled
text: It is believed a flood defence built to protect Dinas Dinlle near Caernarfon, Gwynedd, from coastal flooding in 1994 has made the problem worse. Environmental experts have pointed out that the concrete structure has caused the erosion of the beach, leading to concerns about the long-term sustainability of the area. Local residents and business owners have noticed the gradual disappearance of the sandy beach, which used to be a popular destination for tourists and locals alike. With the sea levels rising due to climate change, the erosion problem has only worsened over the years. The once-thriving beach area now looks like a shadow of its former self, with rocks and debris exposed where the sand used to be. In response to these concerns, a new erosion plan has been unveiled by local authorities. The plan aims to address the issues caused by the flood defence structure and implement new measures to restore the beach to its former glory. One of the key components of the plan is the removal of the concrete structure that is believed to be exacerbating the erosion problem. By removing the barrier, natural processes such as sediment transport and wave action can help rebuild the beach over time. Additionally, the erosion plan includes the implementation of soft engineering solutions such as beach nourishment and dune restoration. These measures will help stabilize the beach and provide protection against future erosion. The local community has welcomed the new plan, hoping that it will be successful in restoring Dinas Dinlle to its former beauty. However, some experts have raised concerns about the long-term effectiveness of the erosion plan. They argue that climate change will continue to pose challenges to coastal areas, and that more sustainable solutions need to be implemented to protect vulnerable areas like Dinas Dinlle. While the removal of the flood defence structure is a positive step, more comprehensive measures may be needed to ensure the long-term resilience of the beach. Despite the challenges ahead, the unveiling of the erosion plan is a positive development for Dinas Dinlle. By recognizing the issues caused by past interventions and implementing new solutions, the local authorities are taking proactive steps to address the erosion problem and protect the beach for future generations. With the support of the community and continued efforts to monitor and adapt to changing environmental conditions, Dinas Dinlle has a chance to regain its status as a vibrant and thriving coastal destination.

title: Hobbit fans given taster of new Peter Jackson film
text: Rises and the latest James Bond installment, Skyfall, have also caused a stir among film fans. However, for many devoted followers of J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth stories, the release of a taster for The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey is the most eagerly anticipated of them all. Peter Jackson, renowned for his stunning vision of Tolkien's world in the Lord of the Rings trilogy, has once again taken up the director's chair for The Hobbit. The taster showcases beautiful scenery, epic battles, and of course, the lovable Bilbo Baggins portrayed by Martin Freeman. The response from fans has been overwhelmingly positive, with many expressing their excitement for the journey back to Middle-earth. The glimpse into the upcoming film has sparked discussions and speculation about how Jackson will bring this beloved tale to life on the big screen. In addition to Freeman's portrayal of Bilbo, the trailer introduces audiences to a host of new and familiar characters. Ian McKellen reprises his role as the wise wizard Gandalf, while Andy Serkis returns as the twisted and tormented Gollum. Fans also catch a glimpse of the group of dwarves led by Thorin Oakenshield, played by Richard Armitage. The attention to detail in the visuals, costumes, and makeup is a testament to Jackson's commitment to bringing Tolkien's world to life in the most authentic way possible. From the sweeping landscapes of the Shire to the dark depths of the Misty Mountains, every frame of the trailer is filled with the magic and wonder that fans have come to expect from Jackson's films. As fans eagerly await the release of The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey, the taster has only served to whet their appetite for more. The anticipation for this film is palpable, with many already marking their calendars for the highly anticipated premiere. With the release of this tantalizing taster, Peter Jackson has once again proven himself to be a master storyteller, capable of captivating audiences with his intricate and immersive vision of Middle-earth. As the countdown to The Hobbit's release continues, fans around the world are counting down the days until they can embark on this extraordinary journey once more.

title: Cardiff Airport: Bristol backs Wales Euro 2020 bid
text: Footballing body Uefa says venue cities must have two airports nearby to ensure rival fans are kept apart. But while Cardiff has only one, Bristol Airport is about 50 miles (80km) from the Welsh capital. This geographic proximity has led Bristol Airport to throw its support behind Cardiff's bid to host matches during the Euro 2020 tournament. In a statement released today, Bristol Airport CEO Dave Lees expressed enthusiasm for the partnership with Cardiff Airport. "We believe that by working together, we can provide a more seamless travel experience for fans attending matches in Wales," Lees said. "Our airport is well-equipped to handle the influx of visitors, and we are committed to making sure that everyone has a safe and enjoyable journey." With Wales having qualified for the Euro 2020 tournament, there is a heightened sense of excitement among football fans in both countries. Cardiff is eager to showcase its hospitality and infrastructure as a potential host city, and Bristol's backing only strengthens Wales' bid. The collaboration between the two airports is seen as a positive step towards ensuring that fans can travel easily between the two cities during the tournament. Welsh football fans have also welcomed Bristol's support, seeing it as a demonstration of regional unity and cooperation. Many supporters have expressed their gratitude for the efforts being made to facilitate travel to and from Cardiff for the tournament. "It's great to see Bristol Airport getting involved and helping out," said one fan. "It just goes to show that when it comes to football, borders don't matter as much as the spirit of the game." The bid to host Euro 2020 matches in Cardiff is part of a broader initiative to promote Wales as a premier destination for sports events. The Welsh government has been working tirelessly to upgrade facilities and improve transportation links to ensure that the country can compete with other European cities for hosting rights. The support from Bristol Airport is seen as a validation of these efforts and a sign that Wales is on the right track. As the tournament approaches, anticipation is building among football fans in both Wales and England. With Bristol Airport backing Wales' bid, there is a sense of shared excitement and enthusiasm for the upcoming matches. If successful, Cardiff and Bristol could become one of the few dual-city host arrangements for the prestigious Euro tournament, further cementing their status as key players in the world of football.

title: London Underground: How does the Tube compare globally?
text: claims that it will lead to reduced customer service and safety concerns. TfL argues that the closure of ticket offices is part of a modernization plan that will make the Underground more efficient and customer-focused. But how does the London Underground, known affectionately as the Tube, compare globally? The London Underground is one of the oldest and most extensive metro systems in the world. Opened in 1863, it has grown to include 11 lines and over 250 miles of track, serving a population of over 8 million people. The Tube is known for its iconic logo, distinctive roundels, and famous announcements like "Mind the Gap." In terms of ridership, the London Underground is one of the busiest metro systems in the world. With over 1.3 billion passenger journeys each year, it consistently ranks as one of the top public transportation systems globally. The Tube operates 24 hours a day on some lines, providing round-the-clock service to Londoners and visitors alike. Compared to other metro systems around the world, the London Underground has a reputation for reliability and efficiency. Despite occasional delays and disruptions, the Tube generally runs on time and offers frequent services to its passengers. The network is well-maintained, with regular upgrades and improvements to infrastructure to ensure a smooth travel experience. One of the unique features of the London Underground is its deep-level tunnels, which allow trains to travel under the city's congested streets. The Tube is known for its complex network of interchanges and connections, making it easy for passengers to transfer between different lines and reach their destinations quickly. Additionally, the Tube's iconic map, designed by Harry Beck in 1931, has become a symbol of London's transport system and is recognized around the world for its simplicity and clarity. In terms of cleanliness and safety, the London Underground compares favorably to other metro systems globally. Stations are regularly cleaned, and security measures are in place to ensure the safety of passengers at all times. CCTV cameras and staff patrols help to deter crime and antisocial behavior, making the Tube a relatively safe and secure mode of transportation. Despite its strengths, the London Underground faces challenges in terms of overcrowding and capacity constraints. During peak hours, trains can become packed with passengers, leading to discomfort and frustration for commuters. TfL is working on expanding the network and increasing capacity on key routes to address these issues and improve the overall travel experience for passengers. In conclusion, the London Underground stands out as one of the world's most iconic and efficient metro systems. With its extensive network, reliable service, and unique features, the Tube continues to be a vital part of London's transportation infrastructure and a symbol of the city's heritage and history.

title: European Commission predicts 'turning point' in Europe
text: The Commission said there were "signs of hope" that had started to turn into "tangible positive outcomes". But in the eurozone - the 18 nations that use the euro - it predicted growth of 1.1% next year. This is the first time in many years that the eurozone is expected to see sustained growth.  The positive forecast comes after a long period of economic turmoil in Europe, with many countries struggling to recover from the effects of the 2008 financial crisis. Unemployment rates have been high, especially among young people, and many countries have faced austerity measures in an attempt to reduce their debt burdens.  However, the European Commission is now optimistic about the future, citing improving economic indicators and a more stable political environment. The Commission's Vice-President Valdis Dombrovskis said, "We are at a turning point in Europe. The worst of the crisis is behind us, and we are now starting to see the benefits of our efforts to reform and strengthen our economies."  One key factor in the predicted growth is the recovery of several major European economies, including Germany and France. These countries have seen increased industrial production, exports, and consumer spending, all of which have contributed to their economic recovery.  In addition, the Commission expects the European Central Bank's monetary policy measures to continue supporting economic growth in the eurozone. The ECB has implemented measures such as low interest rates and quantitative easing to stimulate the economy, and these policies are expected to remain in place for the foreseeable future.  However, the Commission also warned of potential risks to the eurozone's recovery, including rising global trade tensions and uncertainty surrounding Brexit. The UK's impending departure from the European Union could have negative consequences for both the UK and the EU, potentially disrupting trade and economic growth.  Overall, the European Commission's prediction of a "turning point" in Europe is a positive sign for the continent's economic future. If the forecasted growth materializes, it could bring much-needed relief to many European countries and help to create a more stable and prosperous Europe. But policymakers will need to remain vigilant and proactive in addressing potential risks to ensure that the predicted growth becomes a reality.

title: Second footballer comes forward over abuse at Crewe Alexandra
text: Steve Walters - who was the club's youngest debutant in 1988 - has spoken to the Guardian newspaper. Ex-Crewe player Andy Woodward has also waived his anonymity about abuse he suffered at the club. Walters revealed that he had been through a "harrowing" experience at Crewe Alexandra, echoing Woodward's sentiments and shedding light on the disturbing culture of abuse that existed within the club during that time. In his interview with the Guardian, Walters recounted the abuse he suffered at the hands of a senior figure at Crewe when he was just a teenager. He described how the abuse had a lasting impact on his mental health and well-being, as well as his ability to trust others. Walters' decision to come forward and share his story is a courageous one, as he joins Woodward in bringing attention to the widespread issue of abuse in football. The revelations from both Walters and Woodward have sent shockwaves through the footballing community, prompting calls for a full investigation into the abuse that took place at Crewe Alexandra. The club itself has issued a statement offering support to any former players who may have been affected, and has promised to cooperate fully with any inquiries that may arise. The Professional Footballers' Association (PFA) has also vowed to provide assistance to any players who have been victims of abuse in football, and has urged others to come forward and speak out about their experiences. The PFA has emphasized the importance of supporting survivors and ensuring that justice is served for those who have been affected by abuse. The revelations from Walters and Woodward have sparked a renewed discussion about the need for greater protections for young players in football, as well as the need for clubs to take a zero-tolerance approach to abuse of any kind. The footballing authorities have been called upon to review their safeguarding policies and procedures to ensure that incidents like those at Crewe Alexandra never happen again. As more and more former players come forward to share their experiences, it is clear that the issue of abuse in football is a systemic one that requires a comprehensive response from the footballing community. The bravery of individuals like Steve Walters and Andy Woodward in speaking out about their experiences will hopefully lead to a greater awareness of the issue and ultimately bring about much-needed change in the sport.

title: Saudi blogger Raif Badawi flogging postponed second time
text: No reason has been given, but last week Mr Badawi was reported to be physically unfit to face the penalty after receiving the first flogging. He had been sentenced to 1,000 lashes, 10 years in prison, and a hefty fine for insulting Islam on his blog. The news of the postponement comes amidst international pressure and condemnation of Saudi Arabia's human rights record. Governments, human rights organizations, and individuals around the world have been calling for Badawi's release and for an end to the practice of flogging. The United Nations has described Badawi's punishment as "cruel and inhuman" and has urged Saudi Arabia to overturn his sentence. Amnesty International has named him a prisoner of conscience and is campaigning for his release. The postponement of the flogging is a small victory for Badawi and his supporters, but the threat of his punishment still looms. Saudi Arabia's legal system and enforcement of Islamic law leave little room for clemency, and the fate of Badawi remains uncertain. The case has put a spotlight on the kingdom's human rights abuses and has sparked a debate about the balance between religious freedom and the rule of law in Saudi Arabia. Many believe that Badawi's sentence is a violation of his right to freedom of expression and a harsh punishment for simply expressing his opinions. Badawi's wife, Ensaf Haidar, who has been campaigning tirelessly for her husband's release, expressed relief at the postponement but also voiced her frustration at the continued uncertainty surrounding his case. She remains hopeful that international pressure will help secure his release and put an end to his suffering. Despite the postponement, the fact remains that Badawi is still languishing in prison, separated from his family and facing an uncertain future. The continued threat of flogging hangs over him like a dark cloud, a constant reminder of the harsh reality of living in a country where freedom of expression is severely restricted. As the world watches and waits for updates on Badawi's case, his supporters are renewing their calls for justice and urging Saudi Arabia to uphold its human rights obligations. The postponement of the flogging is a small victory, but the fight for Badawi's freedom is far from over.

title: Australia ministers submit new higher education bill
text: Senators voted against the higher education reform bill on Tuesday night by 33 votes to 31. The legislation would have cut university funding by 20%. This unexpected outcome has left the government reeling, as they had counted on the support of key crossbenchers to pass the bill. In response to the defeat, Education Minister Sarah Henderson announced that the government would be submitting a new version of the bill in an effort to secure the necessary votes for its passage. The revised bill is expected to address some of the concerns raised by opponents, such as the impact of funding cuts on the quality of education and accessibility for students from disadvantaged backgrounds. Opposition leader, Penny Wong, has criticized the government for its attempt to push through these cuts to higher education funding, arguing that it would disproportionately affect students and hinder the country's ability to compete on a global scale. She has called for a more comprehensive approach to addressing the challenges facing the education sector, including increasing funding for universities and providing greater support for students. On the other hand, supporters of the bill argue that cuts to university funding are necessary in order to address budgetary constraints and ensure that resources are allocated more efficiently. They believe that universities should be able to operate more independently and focus on areas of research and study that are most relevant to the needs of the country. The debate over higher education funding has been a contentious issue in Australia for many years, with both sides of the political spectrum advocating for different approaches to addressing the challenges facing the sector. While there is consensus on the importance of investing in education to support economic growth and innovation, there is disagreement on the best way to achieve this goal. As the government prepares to introduce the new higher education bill, it will need to engage with stakeholders from across the sector to build support for its proposals. Universities, students, and academics will be closely watching the developments in Parliament, as the outcome of this legislation will have far-reaching implications for the future of higher education in Australia. Despite the setback in the Senate, the government remains determined to press ahead with its agenda to reform higher education funding. The coming weeks are likely to see intense negotiations and lobbying as both sides of the debate seek to influence the outcome of the new bill. The fate of the legislation remains uncertain, but one thing is clear - the future of higher education in Australia hangs in the balance.

title: Sherlock: Praise for 'perfect' series finale
text: Mail's Sarah Vine declared that Sherlock's series finale was "a masterclass in storytelling" and described it as "the culmination of six years of extraordinary television". Fans and critics alike have been quick to heap praise on the beloved detective series, which has captured the imaginations of viewers around the world. One of the standout moments of the finale was the electrifying showdown between Sherlock Holmes and his arch-nemesis, the cunning and diabolical Moriarty. The tension was palpable as the two masterminds engaged in a battle of wits, each trying to outsmart the other. It was a thrilling sequence that kept viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end. Benedict Cumberbatch's performance as Sherlock was pitch-perfect, showcasing the character's trademark intelligence and wit, while Andrew Scott's portrayal of Moriarty was chilling and captivating. The emotional depth of the finale was also a highlight, with Sherlock's complex relationships taking center stage. The bond between Sherlock and his loyal friend and companion, Dr. John Watson, was explored in greater depth, showcasing the deep affection and mutual respect between the two men. The scenes between Sherlock and Watson were some of the most powerful and moving moments of the episode, showing the strength of their friendship in the face of adversity. In addition to the stellar performances by the cast, the series finale was praised for its sharp writing and clever plot twists. The intricate web of mysteries and puzzles kept viewers guessing until the very end, with unexpected revelations and shocking twists keeping the suspense at an all-time high. The finale tied up loose ends from previous seasons while also setting the stage for future adventures, leaving fans eager for more. Overall, Sherlock's series finale has been met with universal acclaim, with critics and fans alike hailing it as a fitting conclusion to the beloved series. The Guardian's Lucy Mangan summed it up best when she declared that the finale was "a triumph of storytelling and a testament to the talent of everyone involved". As viewers bid farewell to Sherlock Holmes and Dr. John Watson, they can take comfort in the knowledge that the iconic detective duo will live on in the hearts and minds of fans for years to come.

title: Pound falls as Theresa May indicates Brexit date
text: It also hit its lowest level against the dollar since the beginning of July. On Sunday, the prime minister said she would trigger Article 50, the clause needed to start the process, by the end of March 2017. This announcement sent shockwaves through the financial markets, causing the pound to drop even further. Analysts attribute the pound's sharp decline to the uncertainty surrounding the United Kingdom's exit from the European Union. Theresa May's decision to trigger Article 50 earlier than expected has raised concerns about the potential economic impact of Brexit. Investors fear that a 'hard Brexit', where the UK leaves the EU without securing a trade deal, could have serious consequences for the British economy. The pound's fall is also a reflection of the political turmoil in the UK. The prime minister faces increasing pressure from both the pro-Brexit and anti-Brexit camps within her own party. Some MPs are calling for a 'clean break' from the EU, while others are advocating for a 'soft Brexit' that maintains closer ties with the bloc. This internal division has added to the uncertainty surrounding the Brexit process, causing further volatility in the currency markets. In addition to the political and economic challenges facing the UK, the pound's decline can also be attributed to external factors. The US dollar has been strengthening in recent weeks, buoyed by solid economic data and expectations of a rate hike by the Federal Reserve. This has put additional pressure on the pound, causing it to lose ground against the greenback. As the pound continues to struggle, British businesses and consumers are feeling the pinch. Imported goods have become more expensive, leading to higher inflation and reduced purchasing power. Traveling abroad has also become more costly, as holidaymakers find their pounds are worth less in foreign exchange markets. Some analysts believe that the pound's decline may have a silver lining for the UK economy. A weaker currency could boost exports by making British goods more competitive in international markets. However, this potential benefit may be offset by the negative impact on inflation and consumer spending. In the midst of these challenges, the Bank of England faces a difficult balancing act. The central bank must decide whether to intervene to support the pound or allow it to fall further in order to boost exports. Whatever course of action it takes, one thing is clear - the road ahead for the UK economy is likely to be a bumpy one as the country navigates the uncharted waters of Brexit.

title: Stonehenge tunnel 'would cause devastation'
text: Kate Fielden lives near the ancient monument and said the landscape would need to be "gouged out" to create the two-mile (3.2km) tunnel along the A303. Transport Secretary Grant Shapps announced plans for the Stonehenge tunnel in an effort to alleviate traffic congestion and improve the flow of vehicles near the historic site. However, many locals, including Fielden, are strongly opposed to the tunnel project due to concerns about the potential impact on the delicate ecosystem surrounding Stonehenge. Fielden described the proposed tunnel as a "destructive solution" that would cause irreparable damage to the landscape and disrupt the natural surroundings of the ancient monument. The Stonehenge tunnel has been a contentious issue for years, with environmentalists, archaeologists, and local residents expressing their fears about the negative consequences of the construction. Opponents argue that the tunnel would destroy important archaeological sites, disturb wildlife habitats, and alter the natural beauty of the area. In response to these concerns, a spokesperson for the Department for Transport stated that "extensive research and planning" have been conducted to minimize the potential harm to the environment during the construction phase of the tunnel. The spokesperson also emphasized the importance of improving the traffic flow around Stonehenge, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most iconic ancient monuments in the world. Despite these reassurances, Fielden and other opponents remain skeptical about the long-term impact of the tunnel on the landscape surrounding Stonehenge. They argue that the benefits of reduced traffic congestion do not outweigh the potential devastation caused by the construction and operation of the tunnel. The controversy surrounding the Stonehenge tunnel highlights the delicate balance between preserving cultural heritage and modernizing infrastructure in the UK. As the debate rages on, both sides will continue to voice their opinions and concerns in the hopes of reaching a compromise that protects the environment while addressing the transportation needs of the region. For now, the fate of the Stonehenge tunnel remains uncertain as the government faces mounting pressure from various stakeholders to reconsider the project. As Fielden and her fellow activists continue to fight for the preservation of the ancient landscape, the future of Stonehenge hangs in the balance. Only time will tell whether the tunnel will be constructed or if alternative solutions will be pursued to address the traffic issues near this historic site.

title: Ikea looks set to open more small stores in the UK
text: UK boss Javier Quinones said the London shop was a "learning experiment" but its success meant the format was likely to expand to other UK cities. The Swedish furniture giant Ikea is known for its sprawling warehouse-style stores located on the outskirts of cities, attracting customers looking to browse through its wide range of affordable home furnishings. However, with changing shopping habits and the rise of online shopping, Ikea has recognized the need to adapt its business model to meet the demands of modern consumers. The opening of smaller, more accessible stores in city centers is a strategic move by Ikea to capture a different demographic of customers who may not have the time or means to travel to its larger stores. These smaller stores will offer a curated selection of Ikea's most popular products, making it easier for customers to browse and purchase items without having to navigate through the vast expanse of a traditional Ikea store. Quinones emphasized that the smaller stores will not replace the existing larger Ikea stores but will complement them, providing customers with more options for shopping. The success of the London store has proven that there is a demand for this new format, and Ikea is confident that it can replicate this success in other UK cities. Quinones also hinted at the possibility of opening even smaller, more specialized stores that focus on specific product categories, catering to niche customer needs. The shift towards smaller stores is also a response to the changing retail landscape, with many retailers moving towards a more digital-focused approach to meet the needs of the ever-evolving consumer. Ikea has invested heavily in its online platform, offering customers the option to shop online and have their purchases delivered directly to their homes. The smaller stores will complement Ikea's online offering, providing customers with a seamless shopping experience that combines the convenience of online shopping with the tactile experience of browsing products in person. Overall, Ikea's decision to open more small stores in the UK reflects its commitment to staying relevant and adapting to the changing needs of its customers. By offering a variety of shopping options, Ikea aims to provide customers with greater flexibility and convenience, ensuring that they can access its products wherever and whenever they choose. With the success of the London store paving the way, Ikea looks set to revolutionize the way we shop for home furnishings in the UK.

title: US Senate immigration bill starts debate
text: bill for being too lenient on immigration, while some Democrats argue it doesn't go far enough to provide a pathway to citizenship for undocumented immigrants. One of the key provisions of the Senate bill is the creation of a pathway to citizenship for around 11 million undocumented immigrants currently living in the United States. This pathway would include passing background checks, paying taxes, and demonstrating knowledge of English and US civics. It would take around eight years for these individuals to gain permanent residency, and another five years to become eligible for citizenship. Republican Senator John Smith, a key supporter of the bill, emphasized the need for comprehensive immigration reform. "Our current system is broken and outdated. We need to create a fair and efficient process for those who want to come to the US and contribute to our society," he stated. However, not all Republicans agree with Senator Smith. Senator Jane Doe criticized the bill, arguing that it provides "amnesty" to undocumented immigrants and does not do enough to secure the US-Mexico border. "We cannot reward lawbreakers with a path to citizenship. We need to prioritize national security and protect American jobs," she stated. On the other side of the aisle, Democratic Senator Maria Gonzalez voiced her concerns with the bill, particularly regarding the lack of protections for immigrant workers and families. "We need to ensure that all immigrants are treated fairly and have access to essential services. This bill falls short in protecting the most vulnerable in our communities," she remarked. Despite these differing opinions, there is a sense of optimism in the Senate that a compromise can be reached. Both Democrats and Republicans have expressed a willingness to work together to find common ground on the issue of immigration reform. The debate on the Senate bill is scheduled to continue for the next few weeks, with amendments and revisions expected to be proposed. The final version of the bill will then be sent to the House of Representatives for further consideration. If the bill passes both chambers of Congress, it will then be sent to President Biden's desk for his signature. President Biden has expressed his support for comprehensive immigration reform and has urged Congress to act swiftly to address the issue. Overall, the Senate immigration bill represents a crucial step towards modernizing the US immigration system and providing a pathway to citizenship for millions of undocumented immigrants. The coming weeks will be critical in determining the fate of this landmark legislation.

title: Auschwitz victim Jane Haining's relatives attend reunion
text: "The recently discovered document offers fresh insight into the life of Jane Haining from Dunscore. In total, some 14 of her relatives attended the event in Edinburgh. One of them, Catriona Topping, said she felt that the reunion was a powerful and emotional experience. Hearing about their ancestor's bravery and sacrifice firsthand was both heart-wrenching and inspiring. Jane Haining, a Church of Scotland missionary, was arrested by the Nazis in Budapest in 1944 for protecting Jewish children in her care during the Holocaust. She was sent to Auschwitz and tragically died there at the age of 47. Her story is one of incredible courage and selflessness, and her relatives gathered to honor her memory and pay tribute to her legacy. The reunion was a bittersweet occasion, filled with tears and laughter as family members shared stories and memories of Jane. It was a chance for them to connect with their past and celebrate the strength and resilience of their ancestor. The discovery of the document shed new light on Jane's life and added to the rich tapestry of her story. Catriona Topping spoke passionately about the impact of Jane's actions on their family. She described her as a hero and a role model, someone who had faced unimaginable hardships with grace and dignity. The reunion brought them closer together as a family, united in their admiration for Jane and the values she represented. As they reflected on Jane's life and legacy, her relatives were struck by the importance of remembering and honoring those who had suffered and perished in the Holocaust. They pledged to continue sharing Jane's story and educating others about the horrors of that dark period in history. Their commitment to keeping her memory alive was a powerful testament to the enduring impact of her courage and sacrifice. The reunion ended on a somber note, with a moment of silence to honor all those who had lost their lives in the Holocaust. Jane Haining's relatives left the event with a renewed sense of purpose and a determination to ensure that her legacy would never be forgotten. In a world plagued by division and hatred, the story of Jane Haining serves as a reminder of the power of love and courage in the face of evil. Her relatives are determined to keep her memory alive and continue spreading her message of compassion and solidarity. As they parted ways, they knew that Jane's spirit would live on in their hearts and inspire future generations to stand up against injustice and oppression."

title: Three-point turn may be dropped from UK driving test
text: Agency (DVSA) is considering removing the three-point turn from the UK driving test in an effort to modernize and better reflect real-life driving situations. The DVSA believes that more relevant maneuvers, such as using a satellite navigation system, will better prepare learners for the challenges they will face when they are out on the road independently. In addition to the removal of the three-point turn, other maneuvers that may be added include parallel parking, independent driving, and following directions from a digital map. The use of satellite navigation systems in the driving test reflects the increasing reliance on technology in modern-day driving. Many drivers now use GPS devices or smartphone apps to navigate to their destinations, and the DVSA believes that the ability to use such systems effectively is an essential skill for new drivers to have. However, some critics have raised concerns about the potential removal of the three-point turn from the driving test. They argue that this maneuver is a fundamental skill that all drivers should possess, as it is a common maneuver that is necessary in a variety of driving situations. Eliminating the three-point turn from the test could mean that learners do not have the opportunity to practice and demonstrate this important skill. In response to these concerns, the DVSA has stated that the three-point turn will still be taught as part of driving lessons. Learners will still need to demonstrate that they can perform the maneuver safely and effectively, but it will no longer be a required part of the practical driving test. The trial of the new practical exam will involve about 1,000 learners who will be randomly selected to take part. These learners will have the opportunity to demonstrate their driving skills using the new maneuvers and will provide feedback on their experience. The DVSA will use this feedback to evaluate the effectiveness of the new test format and make any necessary adjustments before implementing it nationwide. Overall, the potential changes to the UK driving test aim to ensure that new drivers are equipped with the skills and knowledge necessary to drive safely and confidently in today's technologically advanced world. By incorporating relevant maneuvers such as using satellite navigation systems, the DVSA hopes to better prepare learners for the realities of modern-day driving.

title: Homeless mental health and drugs services 'broken' in Wales
text: By Daniel Davies, BBC Wales Correspondent. Funding is too low to cope with a "rough sleeping crisis" in Wales, according to a committee report which also cited a lack of leadership. The report highlights the dire state of homeless mental health and drug services in Wales, with many individuals falling through the cracks due to inadequate support and resources. The Welsh Government has been called upon to address these systemic failures and provide the necessary funding to improve services for those experiencing homelessness, mental health issues, and drug addiction. The committee report points to a lack of coordination between agencies, resulting in fragmented and ineffective support for some of the most vulnerable individuals in society. Homeless individuals often face multiple challenges, including mental health issues and drug addiction, which can make it even more difficult for them to access the services they desperately need. Without proper support, these individuals may end up in a cycle of homelessness, substance abuse, and deteriorating mental health. The stigma surrounding mental health and drug addiction further compounds these challenges, making it difficult for individuals to seek help and for services to be adequately funded and supported. The committee report emphasizes the need for a holistic approach to addressing homelessness, mental health, and drug addiction in Wales, highlighting the importance of coordinated care and support for those in need. Rough sleepers are among the most vulnerable individuals in society, facing constant threats to their physical and mental well-being. With limited access to services and support, many rough sleepers are left to fend for themselves, often resorting to unhealthy coping mechanisms such as substance abuse. The committee report calls for urgent action to address the "broken" state of homeless mental health and drug services in Wales, emphasizing the need for increased funding, better coordination between agencies, and improved leadership to guide a more effective and comprehensive approach to tackling these issues. Without adequate support and resources, individuals experiencing homelessness, mental health issues, and drug addiction will continue to suffer, perpetuating a cycle of hardship and despair. The Welsh Government must take immediate steps to address these systemic failures and ensure that all individuals have access to the care and support they need to rebuild their lives and overcome the challenges they face.

title: Police 'outnumbered' by Middlesbrough and Newcastle sledging crowds
text: Large crowds congregated to frolic on Newcastle's Town Moor and Flatts Lane Country Park in Middlesbrough on Wednesday and Thursday. Covid regulations allow police to issue fines for organised gatherings but the rules do not apply for crowds simply enjoying the outdoors. In both cities, the unseasonably cold weather brought out hoards of eager sledgers, taking advantage of the rare opportunity to enjoy the winter snowfall. The contagious joy of flying down the slopes on sledges seemed to override any concerns about social distancing or potential risks of spreading the virus. Despite the ongoing pandemic, scenes of laughter and excitement filled the air as families and friends came together to make the most of the wintry conditions. However, these scenes of merriment have proven challenging for local authorities, particularly the police, who found themselves outnumbered by the large crowds. Police officers on patrol in both Newcastle and Middlesbrough struggled to enforce Covid regulations and ensure that the sledging crowds were adhering to social distancing guidelines. With the sheer number of people gathered in one place, maintaining order and ensuring everyone's safety became a difficult task for the already stretched police force. In Newcastle, officers were seen trying to gently remind sledgers to keep their distance from one another, but the excitement of the moment often made it hard for people to comply with the guidelines. Despite their best efforts, it was clear that the police were overwhelmed by the sheer volume of people enjoying the snow. Similarly, in Middlesbrough, police found themselves outnumbered by the crowds at Flatts Lane Country Park. With sledgers coming from far and wide to enjoy the snowy slopes, the park became a hub of activity that was difficult for the police to manage effectively. While some officers tried to engage with the public and encourage them to follow the rules, others focused on ensuring that everyone remained safe and did not put themselves or others at risk. As the sun began to set on both towns, the sledging crowds slowly dispersed, leaving behind memories of a day filled with laughter and fun. Despite the challenges faced by the police in managing the crowds, it was clear that the sense of community and joy created by the snow brought people together in a way that was truly heartwarming. Looking ahead, local authorities will need to carefully consider how to balance the need for public safety with the desire for people to enjoy moments of happiness and connection, especially during these difficult times. The challenge of managing large crowds in the midst of a global pandemic is a complex one, but with cooperation and understanding from all parties involved, it is possible to strike a balance that ensures both safety and joy for all.

title: MPs doubt supermarket scheme to spot carers
text: By Rebecca KeatingBBC News Sainsbury's has begun training staff to look for signs that customers may be caring for elderly or disabled people. They are being taught to identify subtle cues such as customers buying large quantities of certain items, spending long periods of time in the store, or seeming particularly fatigued or stressed. The supermarket chain says this initiative is part of their commitment to support carers in the community. However, some MPs have expressed doubts about the effectiveness and ethics of this scheme. Labour MP Sarah Jones believes that it is not the responsibility of supermarket staff to be monitoring their customers for signs of caring responsibilities. She argues that this could easily lead to misinterpretations and potential privacy violations. Furthermore, Conservative MP Mark Spencer has raised concerns about the potential for discrimination and stereotyping. He worries that this scheme could unintentionally target certain groups, such as ethnic minorities or young people, based on outdated assumptions about caregiving responsibilities. In response to these criticisms, Sainsbury's has defended their program as being well-intentioned and designed to provide support to those in need. They have emphasized that staff training includes guidelines for approaching customers in a sensitive and non-intrusive manner. The supermarket chain has also stated that their goal is to offer assistance and resources to carers who may be struggling in their roles. Despite these assurances, there is still a lingering skepticism among some MPs about the feasibility and potential pitfalls of this scheme. The fact remains that identifying carers solely based on their shopping habits could lead to misjudgments and unintended consequences. It is important for organizations like Sainsbury's to tread carefully and consider the broader implications of their initiatives. Moving forward, it will be crucial for Sainsbury's to engage in ongoing dialogue with stakeholders, including MPs, carers, and advocacy groups, to ensure that their scheme is implemented in a responsible and ethical manner. By working together and addressing concerns proactively, the supermarket chain can better support carers in the community while respecting their privacy and autonomy. In conclusion, while Sainsbury's should be commended for their efforts to support carers, there are legitimate concerns about the effectiveness and implications of their scheme. It is essential for all parties involved to collaborate and strive for a solution that balances the needs of carers with the principles of privacy and dignity. Only then can initiatives like this truly make a positive impact on the lives of those who need support the most.

title: Supreme Court to hear transgender school bathroom case
text: June. The Supreme Court is set to hear arguments in a landmark case involving transgender rights and discrimination in public schools. The case concerns a Virginia public school district trying to prevent a female-born 17-year-old transgender student from using the boys' bathroom. The district argues that allowing the student, who identifies as male, to use the boys' restroom would violate the privacy rights of other students.  The student, referred to as 'John Doe' in court documents, has been fighting for the right to use the bathroom that aligns with his gender identity for years. He argues that being forced to use the girls' restroom is not only embarrassing and uncomfortable but also stigmatizing and discriminatory.  The case has garnered widespread attention and sparked a national conversation about transgender rights and equality in schools. Advocates for transgender rights argue that denying students like John Doe access to the restroom that matches their gender identity is a form of discrimination and can have negative psychological and emotional effects on transgender individuals. Opponents of transgender rights argue that allowing students to use the restroom that aligns with their gender identity could pose safety concerns and violate the privacy rights of other students. They argue that biological sex, rather than gender identity, should determine which restroom students use.  The Supreme Court's decision in this case could have far-reaching implications for transgender rights and equality in public schools across the country. It could establish a precedent for how schools handle issues related to transgender students, including restroom access, dress codes, and sports participation.  The justices are expected to rule on the case before the end of June, and the decision is likely to be closely watched by advocates and opponents of transgender rights alike. It remains to be seen how the court will navigate the complex legal and social issues at play in this case and what impact its decision will have on the rights of transgender individuals in the United States. As the country grapples with issues of gender identity and equality, this case serves as a reminder of the ongoing challenges faced by transgender individuals and the importance of ensuring that all students are treated with dignity, respect, and equality in the public school system. The Supreme Court's decision in this case will undoubtedly have a significant impact on the future of transgender rights in America.

title: Family of man shot dead by sheriff's deputy awarded $4 damages
text: reports of loud music coming from his home. The deputy fired multiple shots, hitting Hill with a lethal round to the head. The tragic incident sparked outrage and raised questions about police use of force in the community. Hill's family filed a lawsuit against the sheriff's department, alleging excessive force and negligence on the part of the deputy involved. After a lengthy legal battle, a jury awarded the family $4 in damages – $1 for funeral expenses, and $1 for each of Hill's three children for their loss. The jury's decision to only award $4 in damages has been met with widespread criticism and disbelief. Many see it as a slap in the face to the family who lost their loved one in such a senseless and unnecessary manner. The symbolic amount of compensation has left many wondering if justice was truly served in this case. The family's attorney has vowed to continue fighting for justice and accountability in the wake of the jury's decision. They plan to appeal the verdict and seek a more substantial award for the family's pain and suffering. They believe that the jury's decision was a miscarriage of justice and that the family deserves better than what they were given. The sheriff's department has defended the actions of the deputy, stating that he was acting in self-defense when he shot Hill. They argue that Hill posed a threat to the deputy and that he was justified in using deadly force. However, many in the community believe that the deputy's response was excessive and that Hill did not deserve to die for simply playing loud music in his own home. The case has reignited debates about police brutality, racial bias, and the need for accountability in law enforcement. It has brought attention to the systemic issues within the criminal justice system that disproportionately affect communities of color. The shooting of Gregory Vaughn Hill Jr. is just one example of the many tragedies that have occurred at the hands of law enforcement in the United States. As the family continues to grieve the loss of their loved one, they remain committed to seeking justice and holding those responsible accountable for their actions. The $4 in damages may be a small monetary amount, but it carries a powerful message – that the life of Gregory Vaughn Hill Jr. was priceless, and that his death should not have been in vain.

title: Wales Book of the Year: Owen Sheers wins top prize
text: Pink Mist also took the Roland Mathias poetry award. Francesca Rhydderch won the fiction prize with The Rice Paper Diaries and Meic Stephens took the creative factual award for Rhys Davies: A Writer's Life. In Welsh, Ioan Kidd won the Welsh language award for his book Y Felin, a poignant exploration of identity and culture in modern Wales. The Wales Book of the Year awards ceremony was held at the Tramshed in Cardiff, where the winners were announced to a thrilled audience of authors, publishers, and literature enthusiasts. The prestigious event celebrates the best in Welsh literature across various genres, showcasing the talent and creativity of Welsh writers. Owen Sheers, who won the top prize for Pink Mist, expressed his gratitude and excitement at being recognized for his work. The powerful poetry collection, inspired by interviews with soldiers who served in Afghanistan, explores the lasting impact of war on individuals and their families. Sheers' poignant words and vivid imagery resonate with readers, conveying the human cost of conflict in a deeply moving way. Francesca Rhydderch's The Rice Paper Diaries captivated judges and readers alike with its rich storytelling and intricate characters. Set against the backdrop of Japan in the aftermath of World War II, the novel delves into themes of love, loss, and redemption. Rhydderch's lyrical prose and evocative descriptions transport readers to a different time and place, immersing them in a world of beauty and turmoil. Meic Stephens' exploration of Rhys Davies' life and work in Rhys Davies: A Writer's Life was hailed for its thorough research and insightful analysis. The book sheds light on the enigmatic Welsh writer, revealing the complexities of his career and personal struggles. Stephens' passion for Welsh literature is evident in his engaging narrative, drawing readers into the world of a literary icon. Ioan Kidd's Y Felin stood out for its exploration of Welsh identity and heritage, delving into the complexities of language, culture, and community. Kidd's poetic language and vivid descriptions capture the essence of Wales, celebrating its traditions and history. The Welsh language award recognizes Kidd's dedication to promoting Welsh literature and language, showcasing the richness and diversity of the Welsh literary scene. Overall, the Wales Book of the Year awards highlighted the wealth of talent and creativity present in Welsh literature. From poetry to fiction to creative non-fiction, the winning books offer unique perspectives and compelling narratives that resonate with readers of all backgrounds. The awards ceremony was a testament to the thriving literary community in Wales, celebrating the power of words to inspire, educate, and entertain.

title: Concern over drivers using social media at the wheel
text: By Ben Mundy Newsbeat reporter The head of roads policing in England and Wales, Chief Constable Suzette Davenport, says people are increasingly posting updates, taking photos, and video while driving, raising concerns about the dangers of using social media at the wheel. Davenport has warned that the use of social media while driving is a growing problem that is putting lives at risk. She highlighted that drivers engaging with their phones and other electronic devices are not only breaking the law but also endangering themselves and others on the road. In recent years, the rise of smartphones and social media platforms has made it easier for drivers to access and use their devices while behind the wheel. The allure of staying connected and updated with friends and followers can be tempting, but the consequences of distracted driving can be severe. Research has shown that using a mobile phone while driving can significantly increase the risk of accidents. Studies have indicated that texting or browsing social media can make drivers up to 23 times more likely to be involved in a crash. These alarming statistics emphasize the importance of staying focused and attentive while operating a vehicle. Chief Constable Davenport stressed the need for drivers to prioritize safety over their social media habits. She emphasized the importance of putting away phones and other distractions while driving, as even a momentary lapse in attention can have devastating consequences. Law enforcement agencies are cracking down on distracted driving, including the use of social media behind the wheel. Police officers are actively looking out for drivers who are texting, scrolling through social media feeds, or taking photos while driving. Offenders face hefty fines, penalty points on their licenses, and even possible disqualification from driving. Despite the dangers and legal consequences, some drivers continue to engage with social media while on the road. The pressure to stay connected and the fear of missing out on updates can lead to risky behaviors behind the wheel. Chief Constable Davenport urged drivers to resist the temptation to use social media while driving and to prioritize safety at all times. She emphasized that there is no message or notification worth risking lives for and encouraged motorists to focus on the road ahead. As the number of drivers using social media at the wheel continues to rise, it is essential for individuals to take responsibility for their actions and make safe choices while driving. By staying focused and attentive, drivers can help prevent accidents and ensure the safety of themselves and others on the road.

title: West Coast Main Line bid probe 'must be external'
text: investigation should be conducted by an external, independent body to ensure transparency and fairness. The West Coast Main Line bid probe has caused outrage and confusion among passengers and industry experts alike. The cancellation of the franchise award to FirstGroup has raised serious questions about the integrity of the bidding process and the accountability of the government. Many have criticized the lack of oversight and the failure to properly scrutinize the bids, leading to the debacle that has ensued. Labour has been vocal in their calls for an external investigation into the matter, citing concerns over potential conflicts of interest and bias within the current system. Shadow Transport Secretary, Maria Eagle, has demanded that an independent body be appointed to conduct a thorough review of the bidding process and to identify any potential irregularities or improprieties that may have occurred. Eagle stated, "The government's handling of the West Coast Main Line bidding process has been nothing short of a shambles. It is imperative that we get to the bottom of what went wrong and hold those responsible to account. An external investigation is the only way to ensure that the truth is uncovered and that the public's trust in the system is restored." In response to these calls, the government has reiterated their commitment to conducting a comprehensive review of the bidding process and has promised to make the findings public. Transport Secretary, Grant Shapps, has vowed to take swift action to rectify the mistakes that led to the cancellation of the franchise award and to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. Despite these assurances, questions continue to linger about the government's ability to conduct a fair and impartial investigation into the matter. Many believe that an external body would provide greater transparency and ensure that all parties involved are held accountable for their actions. As the debate over the West Coast Main Line bid probe rages on, passengers are left in limbo, unsure of what the future holds for one of the country's busiest railway lines. The need for a thorough and independent investigation is clear, and it is now up to the government to act decisively and restore confidence in the integrity of the bidding process. Only then can we hope to prevent similar controversies from arising in the future and ensure that passengers are put first in all decisions regarding the country's rail network.

title: Children need more exercise - especially girls, study says
text: recommended one hour of physical activity per day. The study, published in the journal Pediatrics, highlighted the gender disparity in exercise levels, with girls significantly less likely to meet the guidelines compared to boys. Dr. Emily Cooper, lead author of the study, expressed concern over the findings, stating that "physical activity is crucial for children's overall health and well-being." She emphasized the importance of promoting active lifestyles from a young age to help combat the rising rates of childhood obesity and associated health problems. The study also revealed that socio-economic factors played a significant role in determining children's activity levels. Children from wealthier families were more likely to engage in regular physical activity compared to those from lower-income households. This disparity highlights the need for targeted interventions to ensure that all children, regardless of their background, have access to opportunities for exercise and physical play. In response to the study's findings, health experts are calling for increased efforts to promote physical activity among children, particularly girls. Dr. Sarah Johnson, a pediatrician and fitness advocate, emphasized the importance of providing diverse and engaging opportunities for children to be active. She suggested that schools, communities, and families work together to create a supportive environment that encourages regular exercise and movement. One initiative that has shown promise in promoting physical activity among children is the introduction of active play spaces in schools and neighborhoods. These spaces provide children with access to safe and enjoyable opportunities for outdoor play, helping them develop healthy habits that can last a lifetime. Despite the challenges highlighted in the study, there is optimism that with concerted efforts and collaboration, we can increase physical activity levels among children, especially girls. By prioritizing the health and well-being of our youngest generation, we can help them grow into healthy, active adults who are better equipped to face the challenges of modern life. As the research continues to underscore the importance of regular physical activity for children, it is essential for parents, educators, and policymakers to work together to create a supportive environment that promotes and encourages exercise. By prioritizing the health and well-being of our children, we can help them lead healthier, happier lives now and in the future.

title: Italy coalition: Thousands rally in Rome against cuts
text: Wielding red flags and placards, they urged the centre-left Prime Minister, Enrico Letta, to scrap austerity measures and focus on job creation. Public trust in his fragile coalition with the centre-right is dropping, as thousands took to the streets of Rome to voice their dissatisfaction with the government's economic policies. The rally, organized by trade unions and left-wing political parties, drew a diverse crowd of protesters who voiced their concerns about the impact of austerity measures on the most vulnerable members of society. Many held signs denouncing cuts to social services and demanding a more equitable distribution of wealth. "We are tired of being ignored by the government," said one protester, Maria Rossi, a 45-year-old teacher. "Our schools are crumbling, our healthcare system is overwhelmed, and our young people are leaving the country in search of opportunities. We need change, and we need it now." The rally comes at a precarious time for Letta's coalition government, which has been struggling to maintain stability amid growing discontent over its economic policies. The Prime Minister has faced criticism from both the left and the right for his handling of the country's financial crisis, with many accusing him of prioritizing the interests of foreign investors over those of ordinary Italians. Despite Letta's efforts to reassure the public that his government is committed to addressing the country's economic challenges, the rally in Rome underscored the deepening divide between the political elite and ordinary citizens.
