The recent changes to the forest code have reignited this debate, with some arguing that the new rules will only benefit large agricultural companies at the expense of the environment. President Jair Bolsonaro, a staunch supporter of the agricultural industry, has been a vocal proponent of loosening environmental regulations in order to boost economic growth. He has faced criticism both domestically and internationally for his handling of environmental issues, particularly his response to the record-breaking wildfires that ravaged the Amazon in 2019. The Brazilian government has defended the changes to the forest code as necessary to incentivize landowners to comply with reforestation efforts. Agriculture Minister Tereza Cristina has argued that the new rules strike a balance between economic development and environmental conservation, stating that "we need to produce food for the world while also taking care of our forests." Critics, however, argue that the bill will only serve to embolden illegal loggers and land grabbers who have long been responsible for deforestation in the Amazon. They point to the fact that the legislation effectively rewards those who have flouted environmental laws in the past, sending a dangerous message that illegal activities will be tolerated as long as landowners agree to plant trees in return. The Amazon rainforest is often referred to as the "lungs of the Earth" due to its role in absorbing carbon dioxide and producing oxygen. Deforestation not only threatens the biodiversity of the region but also contributes to climate change on a global scale. Environmentalists warn that the continued destruction of the Amazon could have devastating consequences for both local communities and the planet as a whole. As the bill makes its way back to the lower house for final approval, the future of the Amazon hangs in the balance. The world will be watching closely to see whether Brazil chooses to prioritize short-term economic gain over the long-term health of one of the world's most vital ecosystems.

title: Australia to hold royal commission inquiry into banks
text: Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull said the commission - Australia's highest form of public inquiry - would help restore confidence in the sector. Australian banks have been embroiled in numerous scandals including misconduct, fraud, and unethical behavior. The decision to launch a royal commission inquiry comes after years of mounting pressure from the public and political leaders. The Prime Minister acknowledged that the banking sector plays a crucial role in the country's economy, but he emphasized the need for accountability and transparency. The royal commission will have the power to summon witnesses, compel the production of documents, and conduct public hearings to investigate the conduct of banks and financial institutions. In a statement, Turnbull said, "It is essential that our financial system operates with integrity and accountability. The royal commission will shine a light on the issues plaguing the sector and ensure that the interests of customers are protected." The decision to launch a royal commission inquiry into the banking sector has divided opinions among politicians, industry experts, and the public. Some have welcomed the move as a necessary step to hold banks accountable for their actions, while others have criticized it as a costly and unnecessary exercise. Opposition leader Bill Shorten has long called for a royal commission into the banking sector, arguing that it is essential to uncover the extent of misconduct and ensure that customers are treated fairly. Shorten welcomed the Prime Minister's announcement, stating that it was a victory for all Australians who have been affected by the unethical practices of banks. The Australian Bankers' Association (ABA) has expressed its support for the royal commission inquiry, stating that it is committed to working with the government to address any issues identified during the investigation. ABA CEO Anna Bligh said, "We recognize the need for greater transparency and accountability in the banking sector. We are committed to cooperating fully with the royal commission to ensure that the interests of customers are prioritized." The royal commission inquiry is expected to last for several months, with final recommendations and findings to be presented to the government. The outcome of the investigation will have far-reaching implications for the banking sector, as well as for the broader financial industry in Australia. In conclusion, the decision to hold a royal commission inquiry into the banking sector signals a significant step towards improving transparency and accountability in Australia's financial system. It is hoped that the investigation will lead to meaningful reforms that will restore public confidence in the banking sector and ensure that customers are treated fairly and ethically.

title: Hexham BID business levy to be scrapped over 'retaliation' fears
text: Directors of the Hexham Business Improvement District (BID) said they had instructed Northumberland County Council to wind up the company. This decision comes after an escalating situation where several local businesses expressed concerns over a proposed levy increase, citing fears of retaliation from the council. The BID, which was set up to improve the town center and promote local businesses, has faced criticism in recent months over its handling of funds and lack of transparency in decision-making. Many business owners felt that the proposed levy increase was unjustified and would put undue financial strain on their already struggling businesses. One business owner, who wished to remain anonymous, stated: "We feel like we are being held hostage by the BID. If we don't pay the levy, we face the threat of retaliation from the council. It's not fair for small businesses like us to bear the brunt of their mismanagement." In response to these concerns, the BID directors decided to dissolve the company and return any remaining funds to the businesses that had paid into the levy scheme. They also assured business owners that there would be no repercussions for those who had spoken out against the proposed increase. "We understand the fears of retaliation and want to assure all businesses in Hexham that their voices have been heard. We apologize for any distress this situation has caused and hope that this decision will help to rebuild trust within the local business community," said a spokesperson for the Hexham BID. The decision to scrap the BID and return funds to businesses has been met with mixed reactions from the community. Some business owners are relieved that they will no longer be forced to pay a levy that they believed was unfair, while others are concerned about the future of the town center without the BID's support. "We were hoping that the BID would help to revitalize the town center and attract more customers, but it seems like that's not going to happen now. It's a shame that things have come to this, but I think it's for the best in the long run," said another business owner. Moving forward, the Hexham BID directors have pledged to work with local businesses and the council to find alternative ways to support the town center and promote economic growth. They have also promised to be more transparent in their decision-making processes and ensure that the concerns of business owners are taken into account. As the Hexham BID is dissolved and plans for the future of the town center are put in motion, many are hopeful that this will be a turning point for the local business community. With renewed trust and cooperation, Hexham can once again thrive as a hub of economic activity and community engagement.

title: Casualties from cluster munitions doubled in 2016
text: A new report by the Cluster Munition Coalition found 971 people were killed or injured globally last year, with 860 of them in Syria alone. This marks a sharp increase from the previous year, where 419 casualties were reported. Cluster munitions are explosive weapons that release smaller submunitions over a wide area, posing a significant risk to civilians both during and after conflict. The indiscriminate nature of these weapons makes them particularly dangerous, as they often fail to detonate on impact and can lie dormant for years, posing a threat to anyone who comes into contact with them. In Syria, the use of cluster munitions has been widespread, particularly in the ongoing conflict between government forces and rebel groups. The Syrian government has been accused of using these weapons in densely populated areas, leading to a high number of civilian casualties. The report also highlights the use of cluster munitions by non-state armed groups, further complicating efforts to address the issue. The increase in casualties from cluster munitions in 2016 is a stark reminder of the human cost of these indiscriminate weapons. Not only do they cause immediate harm to those caught in the blast, but they also leave a lasting legacy of danger long after the conflict has ended. Efforts to clear these weapons from affected areas are slow and dangerous, often requiring specialized equipment and trained personnel to ensure the safety of those carrying out the clearance. The Cluster Munition Coalition is calling for increased efforts to address the use of cluster munitions and to hold those responsible for their use to account. The organization is advocating for a global ban on these weapons, similar to the ban on landmines that was established through the Ottawa Treaty in 1997. Such a ban would help prevent further casualties and support the clearance of existing cluster munitions from affected areas. In addition to advocacy for a ban, the Cluster Munition Coalition is also working to raise awareness about the impact of these weapons on civilians and support affected communities in their efforts to recover and rebuild. The organization provides assistance with clearance efforts, as well as support for victims of cluster munitions and their families. As casualties from cluster munitions continue to rise, it is crucial that the international community takes action to address this threat to civilian safety. By working together to ban these weapons and support affected communities, we can help prevent further harm and ensure a safer future for all.

title: What are the UK's commitments to overseas territories?
text: and Caicos islands in the Caribbean, to Bermuda in the North Atlantic Ocean. These territories are self-governing but rely on the UK for defense and foreign relations. The UK has a number of commitments to its overseas territories, including providing security and protection. The British Armed Forces are responsible for defending these territories against external threats and ensuring their safety and security. For example, British forces played a crucial role in securing the Falkland Islands during the Falklands War in 1982. In addition to security, the UK also provides financial support to its overseas territories. The British government provides financial assistance to help these territories maintain essential services such as healthcare, education, and infrastructure development. This support is crucial for the economic stability and development of these territories, many of which are small and have limited resources. Furthermore, the UK is committed to protecting the environment and natural resources of its overseas territories. Many of these territories are located in ecologically sensitive areas with unique biodiversity. The UK has designated several of these territories as marine protection areas to help preserve their ecosystems and wildlife. In addition, the UK provides funding for conservation projects to support the sustainable management of these resources. Another important commitment of the UK to its overseas territories is promoting good governance and human rights. The British government works closely with the local authorities in these territories to ensure that they uphold democratic principles and respect human rights. The UK also provides assistance in areas such as law enforcement, disaster response, and public administration to help these territories maintain stability and rule of law. Overall, the UK's commitments to its overseas territories are based on a long-standing relationship and shared history. These territories are an important part of the British family, and the UK is committed to supporting their development and well-being. By providing security, financial support, environmental protection, and promoting good governance, the UK helps these territories thrive and prosper as valuable members of the international community. As the UK continues to navigate its post-Brexit future, it is important for the government to maintain its commitments to its overseas territories and ensure that they remain integral parts of the British Commonwealth. The ties that bind the UK to its overseas territories are strong and enduring, and they will continue to shape the relationship between the UK and these unique and diverse parts of the world for years to come.

title: Pubic hair grooming 'STI risk linked to skin tears'
text: Doctors say small tears in the skin from shaving or trimming could make it easier for infections to take hold. But they also say groomers – whether shaving, waxing, or using other methods – can reduce the risk by taking certain precautions. Dr. Emily Jones, a dermatologist at St. Mary's Hospital, explains that "pubic hair grooming has become increasingly popular in recent years, but it's important to remember that this isn't without risks. When the skin is nicked or cut during the process, bacteria can easily enter and cause infections." One common infection that can arise from pubic hair grooming is folliculitis, which occurs when hair follicles become inflamed due to bacteria. Symptoms of folliculitis include redness, swelling, and sometimes pus-filled bumps. In severe cases, folliculitis can lead to abscesses or cellulitis, requiring medical intervention. In addition to folliculitis, groomers are also at risk of contracting sexually transmitted infections (STIs) if they have small tears in their skin. Dr. Jones warns, "STIs such as herpes and HPV can be transmitted through skin-to-skin contact, so if you have any cuts or tears down there, you're more vulnerable to getting infected." It's crucial for individuals engaging in pubic hair grooming to practice safe sex to prevent the spread of STIs. To minimize the risk of skin tears and infections, Dr. Jones recommends the following tips: 1. Use a clean razor: Make sure your razor is sharp and free from rust or bacteria. Change blades regularly to avoid nicks and cuts. 2. Trim before shaving: If your pubic hair is long, use scissors or clippers to trim it before shaving. This will reduce the chances of tugging and tearing the skin. 3. Use shaving cream or gel: Applying a lubricant before shaving can help the razor glide more smoothly, reducing the risk of irritation and cuts. 4. Avoid sharing grooming tools: Sharing razors, waxing strips, or trimmers with others can spread bacteria and infections. Always use your own tools and replace them regularly. 5. Moisturize after grooming: Moisturizing the skin after grooming can help prevent dryness and irritation, reducing the likelihood of skin tears. By following these tips and practicing safe grooming habits, individuals can enjoy the benefits of pubic hair grooming while minimizing the associated risks. Remember, it's essential to prioritize your health and well-being when it comes to personal grooming practices.

title: Term-time holiday outlook - what might change?
text: By Judith BurnsEducation reporter However, they maintain the policy to reduce school absence is "clear and correct" and they also plan to strengthen the statutory guidance on the issue to schools and local authorities. It was changes like these that sparked a fierce debate among parents and educators alike.  In recent years, the issue of term-time holidays has become a hot topic in the education sector. Parents have been pushing for greater flexibility when it comes to taking their children out of school for holidays, arguing that a family vacation can be just as educational as time spent in the classroom. However, the government has stood firm in its belief that regular school attendance is crucial for a child's academic success. With the upcoming changes to the statutory guidance on term-time holidays, many are wondering what this will mean for the future of family vacations during the school term. Will parents have more freedom to take their children out of school for holidays, or will the restrictions become even stricter? One possible change that could occur is the introduction of a more lenient approach to term-time holidays. This could mean that parents would have to provide a valid reason for taking their child out of school, but the criteria for what constitutes a valid reason could be expanded. This would give parents greater flexibility when it comes to planning family vacations and could result in fewer penalties for those who choose to take their children out of school during term time. On the other hand, some fear that the changes to the statutory guidance could lead to even stricter rules regarding term-time holidays. This could mean that parents would face harsher penalties for taking their children out of school without a valid reason, and could result in more fines being issued to those who choose to do so. This, in turn, could discourage parents from taking their children on holiday during term time, leading to a decline in family vacations during the school term. Overall, the outlook for term-time holidays remains uncertain. While the government is committed to reducing school absence and strengthening the statutory guidance on the issue, the exact changes that will be implemented are still unknown. It is clear that both parents and educators will be closely following the developments in this area, as the outcome could have a significant impact on the way families plan their vacations in the future.

title: Manchester homeless man's shock at Spice use in city
text: In the space of a year, William Nicholson said he has noticed a marked rise in the use of the formerly legal drug. Mr. Nicholson, who spent six months in Manchester, claims that the prevalence of Spice in the city has reached alarming levels. "I've been living on the streets here for quite some time now, and I've seen a lot of things," said Mr. Nicholson. "But the rise of Spice use in Manchester has been especially shocking. It seems like almost every corner you turn, you can see someone under the influence of this dangerous drug." Spice, a synthetic cannabinoid, was once sold legally as a "legal high" in the UK until it was banned in 2016. Since then, it has become a major problem in cities like Manchester, where vulnerable populations, including the homeless, are particularly at risk of its harmful effects. "I've seen people completely lose control of themselves after taking Spice," Mr. Nicholson said. "They become violent, paranoid, and unpredictable. It's truly terrifying to witness." According to a recent report by Manchester City Council, the use of Spice has been linked to a higher rate of crime and anti-social behavior in the city. Homeless individuals, in particular, are vulnerable to its effects due to their living conditions and lack of support systems. "I've seen a lot of my friends on the streets succumb to Spice addiction," Mr. Nicholson shared. "It's heartbreaking to see people I care about become victims of this dangerous drug. We need more support and resources to help those who are struggling with addiction." Despite the challenges he faces as a homeless individual in Manchester, Mr. Nicholson remains hopeful that the city will address the issue of Spice use and provide better support for those in need. "Manchester is a great city with a lot of potential," he said. "But we need to come together as a community to tackle the problem of Spice and support those who are struggling. No one should have to suffer like this." As Mr. Nicholson continues to navigate life on the streets of Manchester, he hopes that his story will shed light on the reality of Spice use in the city and inspire positive change for those who are affected. "I may be homeless, but I still have a voice," he said. "I hope that my words will make a difference and help us move towards a safer, more supportive community for all."

title: Tyne and Wear Metro strike: Commuters and shoppers affected
text: services to help ease the disruption caused by the strike. The strike, which began at midnight last night, has left thousands of commuters and shoppers stranded, with many forced to find alternative modes of transport to get to work or do their daily shopping. The Tyne and Wear Metro is a vital lifeline for many residents in the area, providing a quick and convenient way to travel across the region. This latest strike comes after months of negotiations between Nexus and the RMT union, with workers demanding better pay and working conditions. The breakdown in talks has left both sides at a stalemate, with no resolution in sight. Passengers affected by the strike have expressed their frustration and anger at the situation. Sarah Johnson, a daily commuter on the Metro, said, "I rely on the Metro to get to work every day, and now I have to figure out another way to get there. It's incredibly inconvenient and stressful." Local businesses in the area have also been hit hard by the strike, with decreased foot traffic leading to a decrease in sales. Shop owners like Mark Davies, who owns a small boutique near a Metro station, said, "The strike is really hurting us. We rely on the Metro to bring in customers, and now we're seeing a significant drop in business." Nexus has stated that they are working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible, but with no new talks scheduled, it remains unclear when the strike will end. For now, passengers are being advised to make alternative travel arrangements and to check the Nexus website for updates on the situation. In the meantime, local bus companies have stepped up to help alleviate the strain on commuters. Additional buses have been put on certain routes to help transport passengers to their destinations, though many are still experiencing delays and overcrowding. As the strike continues to disrupt daily life for residents in Tyne and Wear, both Nexus and the RMT union are under increasing pressure to come to a resolution. In the meantime, commuters and shoppers are left to navigate the chaos and uncertainty caused by the ongoing strike.

title: Virus rebuilds heart's own pacemaker in animal tests
text: By James Gallagher Health and science reporter, BBC News The heartbeat is controlled by electrical signals and if these go awry the consequences can be fatal. Scientists have long been searching for ways to restore normal heart rhythm when the natural pacemaker fails. A new study published in the journal Nature Communications suggests that a virus could be the answer. The research, conducted by a team of researchers at the Cedars-Sinai Smidt Heart Institute in Los Angeles, focused on a group of pigs with heart rhythm disorders. These animals were found to have abnormal pacemaker currents in their hearts, leading to irregular heartbeats and potential danger. In the study, the scientists used a harmless virus as a delivery system to introduce a gene that codes for a protein called HCN2 into the hearts of the pigs. This protein is normally found in the heart's natural pacemaker cells and is responsible for initiating the electrical signals that regulate heartbeat. Remarkably, within two weeks of the gene therapy, the pigs' heart cells began producing the HCN2 protein, effectively transforming them into their own pacemaker cells. This resulted in a significant improvement in the animals' heart rhythm, with the abnormal pacemaker currents being replaced by normal electrical signals. Dr. Ricardo Weill, one of the lead researchers on the study, expressed his enthusiasm for the results, stating that "This could be a game-changer in the field of cardiac electrophysiology." The team is now planning to conduct further studies to determine the long-term effects of the gene therapy and its potential for clinical application in humans. While the findings are certainly promising, there are still hurdles to overcome before this approach can be translated into a viable treatment for patients with heart rhythm disorders. Regulatory approval, safety concerns, and the need for additional studies to confirm the effectiveness of the gene therapy will all need to be addressed. Despite these challenges, the researchers are hopeful that their work could lead to a new era in the treatment of cardiac arrhythmias. The ability to rebuild the heart's own pacemaker using a simple viral delivery system represents a significant step forward in the quest to restore normal heart rhythm and prevent potentially life-threatening complications.

title: Brexit: Differences remain over trade deal, say UK and EU
text: UK negotiator Lord David Frost said "wide divergences" remained in some areas, despite progress being made. His EU counterpart, Michel Barnier, said there were "serious divergences" over fishing. These comments signal that the negotiations for a post-Brexit trade deal between the UK and the EU are far from reaching a consensus. Both sides have been locked in intense discussions as the December 31 deadline looms closer. Issues such as fisheries, competition rules, and governance have proven to be major sticking points in the negotiations. The issue of fisheries is particularly contentious, as it involves access to UK waters for European fishing fleets. The UK is seeking to assert control over its waters post-Brexit, while the EU is pushing for continued access for its fishing vessels. Despite the ongoing disagreements, both Frost and Barnier have expressed their commitment to finding a compromise that works for both sides. Frost emphasized the need for flexibility and creativity in order to bridge the gaps that still exist between the two parties. Barnier echoed this sentiment, stating that the EU is willing to engage in further talks to find a resolution. The trade deal negotiations have been complicated by the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, which has disrupted traditional negotiation methods and timelines. The lack of face-to-face meetings has made it challenging for both sides to make progress on key issues. However, virtual negotiations have continued in an effort to reach a deal before the end of the transition period. The outcome of the trade deal negotiations will have significant implications for the future relationship between the UK and the EU. A failure to reach a deal could result in tariffs and trade barriers being imposed on goods traded between the two parties. This could lead to economic disruption and uncertainty for businesses on both sides of the channel. As the negotiations continue, both the UK and the EU are under pressure to reach a consensus before the end of the year. The stakes are high, and there is a sense of urgency to find a resolution that avoids a chaotic and disruptive exit for the UK from the EU. Both Frost and Barnier have acknowledged the challenges ahead but remain optimistic that a compromise can be reached. In the coming weeks, negotiations are expected to intensify as both sides work towards finding a mutually agreeable trade deal. The next round of talks will be crucial in determining whether an agreement can be reached in time for the December deadline. The world is watching closely as the UK and the EU navigate the complexities of Brexit and strive to find a path forward that benefits both parties.

title: Australia approves strikes against IS in Iraq
text: Prime Minister Tony Abbott said IS was a "death cult" that had "declared war on the world" and must be stopped. IS controls a broad swathe of territory, spanning a borderless stretch of Syria and Iraq. Their brutal tactics, including beheadings, mass executions, and the destruction of cultural heritage sites, have drawn worldwide condemnation. Australia's decision to join the US-led coalition in launching airstrikes against IS in Iraq was met with widespread support domestically. The Australian government emphasized the need to combat the threat posed by IS to regional and global security. Prime Minister Abbott stated that Australia had a duty to protect its citizens and support its allies in the fight against terrorism. The Australian Defense Force deployed fighter jets and support aircraft to the Middle East to participate in the airstrikes. The goal was to degrade IS's capabilities and disrupt their operations in Iraq. Australian military personnel worked alongside international partners to conduct precision strikes against IS targets, including weapons depots, training camps, and command centers. Despite facing criticism from some quarters about the decision to engage in military action, the Australian government remained steadfast in its commitment to combating the terrorist threat posed by IS. Prime Minister Abbott reiterated that the airstrikes were part of a broader strategy to dismantle IS and prevent their spread of violence and extremism. Australia's involvement in the airstrikes against IS in Iraq signaled the country's willingness to play a proactive role in addressing global security challenges. The government's decision reflected a determination to uphold the values of freedom, democracy, and human rights in the face of a ruthless and dangerous adversary. As the campaign against IS in Iraq continued, Australian forces maintained a high level of operational readiness and coordination with their coalition partners. The airstrikes were conducted with precision and care to minimize civilian casualties while targeting IS's military infrastructure and command and control capabilities. The Australian government also emphasized the importance of humanitarian assistance and support for the people of Iraq who had been affected by the conflict. Australia provided aid and support to internally displaced persons and refugees, demonstrating its commitment to addressing the broader humanitarian crisis in the region. In conclusion, Australia's decision to approve strikes against IS in Iraq reflected a commitment to combating terrorism and promoting stability in the Middle East. The country's participation in the international coalition demonstrated a willingness to confront the threats posed by extremist groups like IS and defend the values of freedom, democracy, and human rights.

title: Menzies Aviation workers face redundancy after global travel slump
text: The Unite trade union said Menzies Aviation has started a 45-day consultation with staff. Before most aircraft were grounded, the company was a major player in the aviation industry, providing a range of services including ground handling, cargo handling, and passenger services at airports around the world. However, the global travel slump caused by the COVID-19 pandemic has led to a significant decrease in flights, resulting in a sharp decline in demand for Menzies Aviation's services. As a result of the downturn in the industry, Menzies Aviation has been forced to make difficult decisions in order to adapt to the new reality. The company has announced plans to cut jobs and restructure its operations in response to the unprecedented challenges facing the aviation sector. This has left many Menzies Aviation workers facing redundancy and an uncertain future. The news of potential job losses has understandably caused anxiety and distress among the company's employees. Many workers are worried about how they will support themselves and their families if they lose their jobs, especially in the midst of a global pandemic that has already brought so much uncertainty and disruption to their lives. Unite, the trade union representing Menzies Aviation workers, has been working tirelessly to support its members during this difficult time. The union has been in discussions with the company to try to minimize the impact of the job cuts and ensure that affected employees are treated fairly and with respect. Unite has also been calling on the government to provide additional support for the aviation industry, which has been hit particularly hard by the global travel slump. The union argues that targeted financial assistance is needed to help protect jobs and ensure the long-term viability of companies like Menzies Aviation that are crucial to the functioning of the aviation sector. Despite the challenges facing Menzies Aviation and its workers, there is hope that the industry will eventually recover as travel restrictions are lifted and demand for air travel begins to increase once again. In the meantime, the priority for everyone involved is to support those affected by the job cuts and ensure that they receive the assistance they need during this difficult time. As the 45-day consultation period continues, Menzies Aviation workers will be anxiously awaiting news about their future with the company. The coming weeks will be a trying time for all involved, but Unite is committed to standing up for its members and fighting to protect their jobs and livelihoods in the face of unprecedented challenges.

title: Challenge of Redcar blast furnace relighting
text: Dave Johnson and Derek Thomas have between them more than 80 years' experience in the steel industry. Both spoke about the huge achievement of reopening the Redcar blast furnace, a project that has been years in the making. "It's a testament to the hard work and dedication of everyone involved that we have been able to relight the blast furnace at Redcar," said Johnson, who has worked in the steel industry for over four decades. "This is a major milestone not just for the plant, but for the entire steel industry in the UK." Thomas, who has also spent a lifetime working in steel manufacturing, echoed Johnson's sentiments. "The reopening of the blast furnace at Redcar is a sign of the resilience and determination of the industry," he said. "It's a challenging time for steelmakers, but this shows that there is still a future for steel production in the UK." The relighting of the blast furnace at Redcar comes after years of uncertainty for the plant. The furnace was shut down in 2015, leading to the loss of thousands of jobs and putting the future of the plant in doubt. However, a consortium led by entrepreneur Sanjeev Gupta stepped in to save the plant and invest in its future. "We knew that reopening the blast furnace at Redcar would be a challenge, but we were determined to make it happen," said Gupta. "The steel industry is a vital part of the UK economy, and we are committed to ensuring that it has a strong future here." The reopening of the blast furnace at Redcar is seen as a significant step forward for the steel industry in the UK. The plant has a long history of producing high-quality steel, and its reopening is expected to create hundreds of jobs and support the local economy. "We are thrilled to see the blast furnace at Redcar up and running again," said Johnson. "It's a sign that the steel industry in the UK is not only surviving, but thriving." Thomas agreed, adding that the reopening of the blast furnace was a testament to the hard work and dedication of everyone involved. "It's a challenge to relight a blast furnace, but we were able to do it thanks to the teamwork and cooperation of all the workers at Redcar," he said. As the steel industry in the UK continues to face challenges, the reopening of the blast furnace at Redcar is a welcome development. It is a sign that with determination and investment, the industry can overcome obstacles and secure a sustainable future for steel production in the country.

title: London taxi and private hire cab sex attacks 'at 14-year high'
text: Transport for London (TfL) and the Met Police revealed a 21% rise on the previous year. In 2016, 164 offences were reported to police. Figures were only higher in 2002, when there were 189. This concerning upward trend has sparked fears among passengers and raised questions about the safety of using London taxi and private hire cab services. The increase in reported sex attacks is alarming, and it is essential for authorities to address this issue promptly. TfL and the Met Police have assured the public that they are taking steps to improve safety measures and crackdown on offenders. However, more needs to be done to prevent these incidents from occurring in the first place. One of the proposed solutions is to increase the vetting process for drivers working in the taxi and private hire industry. This would include thorough background checks and more stringent licensing requirements. By ensuring that only trustworthy individuals are allowed to operate as drivers, the likelihood of sexual assaults taking place can be reduced. Additionally, there needs to be better training for drivers on how to handle situations involving inappropriate behavior from passengers. Drivers should be equipped with the knowledge and skills to defuse potentially dangerous situations and protect themselves and their passengers from harm. Furthermore, passengers also play a crucial role in ensuring their own safety when using taxi and private hire cab services. It is essential for passengers to be vigilant and aware of their surroundings at all times. If they feel uncomfortable or threatened during a journey, they should not hesitate to speak up and seek help. The safety of passengers should be a top priority for both TfL and taxi/private hire companies operating in London. By working together and implementing comprehensive safety measures, the number of sex attacks can be reduced, and passengers can feel more secure when using these services. In conclusion, the rise in sex attacks reported in London taxis and private hire cabs is a cause for concern. Authorities must take decisive action to tackle this issue and ensure the safety of passengers. By improving vetting procedures, providing better training for drivers, and encouraging passenger vigilance, steps can be taken to prevent such incidents from occurring in the future.London's iconic black cabs and private hire services are a vital part of the city's transport network, and it is essential that they are safe and reliable for all passengers.

title: Scots NHS staff to receive pay rise denied to English
text: By Reevel Alderson BBC Scotland's social affairs correspondent This is in contrast to England, where staff will not be given the 1% increase recommended by the NHS pay review body (PRB). Scottish Health Secretary Alex Neil has announced that NHS staff in Scotland will receive the recommended pay rise, acknowledging the hard work and dedication of healthcare workers during the ongoing pandemic. The decision has been met with mixed reactions, with some applauding the move as a recognition of the sacrifices made by NHS staff on the frontlines. Others, however, have criticized the decision, arguing that it unfairly favors Scottish healthcare workers over their English counterparts. In response to these criticisms, Neil defended the decision, stating that it was necessary to ensure that NHS staff in Scotland are fairly compensated for their efforts. He emphasized that the 1% pay rise was well-deserved and that it reflects the Scottish government's commitment to supporting healthcare workers during these challenging times. The announcement comes at a time when the NHS is facing increasing pressure due to the rising number of Covid-19 cases and the strain on healthcare services. With staff shortages and burnout becoming more prevalent, the pay rise is seen as a crucial step in retaining and motivating healthcare professionals across Scotland. Despite the positive response from many NHS staff members, there are concerns about the long-term sustainability of the pay rise. Some fear that the funding allocated for the increase may not be sufficient to cover all healthcare workers, leading to disparities in pay among different roles and departments within the NHS. In light of these concerns, Neil has pledged to work closely with healthcare unions and NHS managers to ensure that the pay rise is implemented fairly and transparently. He has also reaffirmed the government's commitment to providing ongoing support for NHS staff, including access to mental health services and resources to cope with the challenges they face on a daily basis. As the debate over NHS pay continues to unfold, it is clear that the decision to grant a pay rise to Scottish healthcare workers has sparked a wider discussion about the value of healthcare professionals and the need for adequate compensation in times of crisis. It remains to be seen how this decision will impact the morale and motivation of NHS staff in Scotland and whether similar measures will be taken in other parts of the UK.

title: Kelly Mary Fauvrelle: Pregnant woman killed in Croydon named
text: Two men have been arrested on suspicion of murdering the 26-year-old, who was pronounced dead at a house in Croydon, south London, early on Saturday. Her tragic death has sent shockwaves through the community, leaving her family and friends devastated. Kelly Mary Fauvrelle, who was eight months pregnant, was a beloved member of her community. Her friends have described her as a kind, caring, and gentle soul who was excited about becoming a mother. The news of her death has left many in disbelief, struggling to come to terms with the senseless violence that has taken her life. Police have launched a murder investigation and are appealing for any witnesses to come forward with information that could help solve this heinous crime. The outpouring of support for Kelly and her family has been overwhelming, with many expressing their condolences and calling for justice to be served. As the investigation unfolds, questions remain about the circumstances surrounding Kelly's death. Her family has been left reeling, trying to make sense of the tragedy that has torn their world apart. The two men who have been arrested in connection with her murder are currently in police custody, but many are still searching for answers. Residents in the Croydon community have spoken out about their shock and sadness at the loss of Kelly and her unborn child. Many have come together to offer support to her family during this difficult time, showing a strong sense of unity and solidarity in the face of such tragedy. Kelly's death has sparked conversations about the safety of women in society and the need for greater protections for expectant mothers. It is a sobering reminder of the dangers that women face every day, simply for existing in a world that can be cruel and unforgiving. As the community mourns the loss of Kelly Mary Fauvrelle, they are also united in their determination to seek justice for her and her unborn child. The outpouring of love and support for her family is a testament to the impact she had on those around her, and a reminder that her memory will live on in the hearts of all who knew her. In the coming days and weeks, as more information emerges about the circumstances of Kelly's death, the community will continue to rally around her family and friends, offering comfort and solidarity in their time of need. The tragedy of Kelly Mary Fauvrelle's death has left a wound that will take time to heal, but the strength and resilience of those who loved her will ensure that her legacy endures.

title: Scottish steel task force in 'urgent action' pledge
text: The announcement came after the group held its first meeting. It was chaired by Scotland's business minister Fergus Ewing and included representatives from trade unions and Tata, as well as members of the steel industry. The Scottish steel task force was established in response to the crisis facing the steel industry in the UK, particularly in light of Tata Steel's decision to sell its UK operations. During the meeting, the task force discussed the urgent action needed to support the steel industry in Scotland and to protect jobs in the sector. One of the key priorities identified was the need to find a buyer for Tata Steel's Scottish plants, which employ thousands of workers. Fergus Ewing emphasized the importance of working together to find a sustainable solution for the steel industry in Scotland. He acknowledged the challenges facing the sector, including competition from overseas markets and the impact of global economic trends. However, he remained optimistic about the potential for the industry in Scotland, highlighting the skilled workforce and the quality of the steel produced. Trade union representatives echoed Ewing's sentiments, expressing their commitment to securing a future for the steel industry in Scotland. They emphasized the need for government support and incentives to attract potential buyers for Tata Steel's operations. Tata representatives also pledged their support for the task force's efforts, stating their willingness to engage in discussions with potential buyers and explore all options to secure a viable future for the Scottish plants. The task force agreed to work collaboratively to develop a strategy to support the steel industry in Scotland. This strategy will include measures to attract investment, improve competitiveness, and create a sustainable future for the sector. In a statement released after the meeting, the task force outlined its commitment to protecting jobs and ensuring the long-term viability of the steel industry in Scotland. They acknowledged the challenges ahead but remained determined to find a solution that would benefit workers, communities, and the economy as a whole. The urgent action pledge made by the Scottish steel task force signals a united front in the face of adversity. With the support of government, trade unions, Tata Steel, and other industry stakeholders, the task force is poised to take decisive action to secure a future for the steel industry in Scotland. The coming weeks and months will be critical as the task force works to implement its strategy and find a sustainable solution for the sector.

title: PC Gordon Semple death: Stefano Brizzi 'spent days' with body
text: police that he had been overwhelmed by "voices in his head" telling him to kill and eat someone. Brizzi, a former Morgan Stanley employee, admitted to meeting Semple through a dating app and inviting him to his South London flat for a sexual encounter. However, things took a dark turn when Brizzi claims that Semple died accidentally during a choking game they were playing. The court heard that Brizzi spent days trying to dispose of Semple's body by dismembering it and attempting to dissolve the remains in a bath of acid. He also tried to cook and eat parts of Semple's body, a gruesome act that shocked both the court and the public. During the trial, Brizzi claimed that he was influenced by his drug use, as well as his fascination with the TV show "Breaking Bad", which depicted similar gruesome crimes. He also admitted to having a long-standing fascination with cannibalism, which he attributed to childhood trauma. The prosecution argued that Brizzi had planned the murder in advance and had researched methods of disposing of a body. They also claimed that Brizzi had shown no remorse for his actions and had even joked about his crime with police officers. Semple's family expressed their shock and horror at the gruesome details of his death. They described him as a loving and kind man who had dedicated his life to public service as a police officer. They expressed their disbelief that someone could commit such a heinous crime against a person who had only shown kindness towards others. The case has sparked a debate about the dangers of online dating and the importance of being cautious when meeting strangers. It has also raised questions about mental health and the influence of drugs and popular culture on individuals' behavior. As the trial continues, the court will determine whether Brizzi's actions were premeditated and whether he was in a sound state of mind when he committed the crime. The case has shocked the nation and left many wondering how such a gruesome and senseless crime could have occurred. The full extent of Brizzi's involvement in Semple's death is yet to be revealed, as the trial unfolds and more details come to light.

title: Undercover police: Legal challenge over inquiry
text: Dominic CascianiHome affairs correspondent@BBCDomCon Twitter In a legal warning letter to the home secretary, they say one of the officers at the center of the inquiry has not provided a witness statement. The group of women who were deceived into intimate relationships with undercover police officers is challenging the credibility of the official inquiry into undercover policing that was set up by the government. The women argue that without a full account from the officer in question, the inquiry risks being compromised. They argue that the failure of the officer to provide a witness statement raises serious questions about the transparency and integrity of the process. The legal challenge comes amid growing concerns about the conduct of undercover police officers in the UK. Over the years, numerous cases have come to light in which undercover officers have formed relationships with those they were targeting, leading to accusations of abuse of power and invasion of privacy. The women involved in this legal challenge believe that the inquiry must be robust and thorough in order to uncover the full extent of abuse by undercover officers. They are calling on the home secretary to ensure that all officers involved in the inquiry provide comprehensive witness statements and cooperate fully with the process. The inquiry into undercover policing was established in response to revelations about the conduct of covert officers in the past. The inquiry is tasked with examining the practices and ethics of undercover policing, including the infiltration of political groups, environmental activists, and trade unions. In recent years, there have been a number of high-profile cases in which undercover officers have been accused of misconduct, including forming intimate relationships with those they were targeting. These cases have raised serious questions about the accountability and oversight of undercover policing in the UK. The legal challenge by the women involved in the inquiry is a significant development in the ongoing debate about undercover policing. It highlights the need for a transparent and impartial process that gets to the truth of the matter and holds those responsible to account. The home secretary has yet to respond to the legal warning letter, but the women are hopeful that their concerns will be taken seriously. They are determined to ensure that the inquiry into undercover policing is rigorous and comprehensive, in order to prevent further abuses of power and protect the rights of all individuals in the UK.

title: Libby Squire murder trial: Accused's behaviour 'frightening'
text: Libby Squire, 21, disappeared after she was refused entry to a Hull nightclub on 31 January 2019 and was found seven weeks later in the Humber Estuary. Her disappearance and subsequent murder sent shockwaves through the community and left her family and friends devastated. The man accused of Libby's murder, Pawel Relowicz, appeared in court for the start of his trial. The prosecution painted a chilling picture of Relowicz's behaviour on the night of Libby's disappearance, describing it as "frightening" and "sinister". They claimed that Relowicz had been stalking and targeting young women in the area, and that he had singled out Libby as his next victim. Witnesses testified to seeing Relowicz following Libby as she walked home from the nightclub, acting in a suspicious manner and attempting to engage her in conversation. CCTV footage showed Relowicz circling the area where Libby was last seen, leading the prosecution to believe that he had been planning to attack her. Relowicz's behaviour in the courtroom only served to strengthen the prosecution's case against him. He appeared agitated and aggressive, constantly shifting in his seat and glaring at the witnesses as they gave their testimony. At one point, he even interrupted the proceedings to shout profanities at the judge, causing a brief disruption in the trial. Despite the mounting evidence against him, Relowicz maintained his innocence throughout the trial, claiming that he had never met Libby and had nothing to do with her disappearance. However, the prosecution presented DNA evidence linking Relowicz to Libby's body, as well as eyewitness accounts placing him at the scene of her disappearance. The prosecution argued that Relowicz had abducted and murdered Libby in a "sexually motivated attack", leaving her body in the river in an attempt to cover up his crime. As the trial continued, more disturbing details emerged about Relowicz's past, including allegations of previous sexual assaults and violent behaviour. The prosecution argued that this pattern of behaviour pointed to a dangerous and predatory individual, capable of preying on vulnerable young women like Libby. The trial of Pawel Relowicz drew to a close with the jury deliberating on his guilt or innocence. The judge warned them to consider the evidence carefully and reach a verdict based on the facts of the case, rather than emotions or prejudices. As the courtroom fell silent, the fate of Libby Squire's accused killer hung in the balance, leaving many to wonder if justice would prevail for the young woman whose life was tragically cut short.

title: Yemen's Houthis step back on threats to tax aid
text: The rebel group, which has controlled the capital Sanaa and much of Yemen since 2014, had said they would impose a 2% levy on humanitarian aid organizations operating in the country. This announcement sparked international outrage and concern as Yemen remains one of the world's most impoverished and war-torn nations. However, in a surprising turn of events, the Houthi authorities have now announced that they will not be implementing the proposed tax on aid organizations. This decision comes after intense pressure and condemnation from the United Nations, various governments, and humanitarian agencies. The initial threat of taxing aid was met with widespread criticism, with many arguing that such a move would only exacerbate the already dire humanitarian situation in Yemen. As one of the poorest countries in the Middle East, Yemen relies heavily on international assistance to meet the basic needs of its population, including food, water, and healthcare. The Houthi leadership, facing mounting pressure and backlash over their proposed tax on aid, have stated that they have reconsidered their decision and will not be moving forward with the implementation of the levy. This announcement comes as a relief to humanitarian organizations working in Yemen, who have been struggling to provide much-needed assistance to the country's vulnerable population amidst an ongoing conflict and economic crisis. Despite this step back on the tax threat, the situation in Yemen remains incredibly challenging. The country continues to face a devastating humanitarian crisis, with millions of people in need of urgent assistance. The ongoing conflict between the Houthi rebels and the internationally recognized government, supported by a Saudi-led coalition, has resulted in widespread devastation and displacement. The decision by the Houthi authorities to back down on their plans to tax aid organizations is a positive development, but it is just one small step in addressing the complex challenges facing Yemen. The international community must continue to engage with all parties involved in the conflict to find a peaceful and sustainable resolution to the crisis, and to ensure that humanitarian aid reaches those who need it most. As the situation in Yemen remains precarious, with millions of people at risk of famine, disease, and displacement, it is crucial that all stakeholders work together to prioritize the well-being of the country's civilian population. The recent decision by the Houthi authorities to step back on their threats to tax aid is a hopeful sign, but much more needs to be done to address the root causes of the ongoing crisis in Yemen.

title: Dame Jenni Murray on why she's taking her clothes off on TV
text: in her undergoing a double mastectomy in 2018. Speaking to the BBC about her decision to bare all on national television, Dame Jenni emphasized the need for women to take their health seriously and prioritize regular screenings. "I want to show that there is no shame in our bodies, especially when it comes to something as important as cancer prevention," she said. "I hope that by being vulnerable and exposing myself in this way, I can inspire other women to take charge of their health and not be afraid to undergo screenings or seek medical help when needed." Dame Jenni's bold move comes at a time when cancer rates are rising, particularly among women over the age of 50. According to Cancer Research UK, breast cancer is the most common cancer in the UK, with more than 55,000 new cases diagnosed each year. Early detection is crucial in improving survival rates, which is why initiatives like Dame Jenni's are so important in spreading awareness and encouraging women to take proactive steps towards their health. The veteran broadcaster and feminist icon has always been an advocate for women's rights and health issues. Throughout her career, she has fearlessly tackled controversial topics and used her platform to champion causes close to her heart. Her decision to strip down on national television is just another example of her unwavering commitment to raising awareness and breaking down barriers surrounding women's health. While some may question the appropriateness of Dame Jenni's actions, the overwhelming response has been positive, with many praising her bravery and determination to make a difference. By using her own experience with cancer to educate and empower others, she is challenging societal norms and encouraging a new dialogue surrounding women's bodies and health. As she prepares to bare all on ITV, Dame Jenni remains steadfast in her mission to spread awareness and promote self-care among women of all ages. Her message is clear: don't be afraid to check for cancer, don't be ashamed of your body, and don't hesitate to seek help when needed. In a society where women's bodies are often stigmatized and judged, Dame Jenni's actions serve as a powerful reminder that our health should always come first, no matter what it takes.

title: National Procurement Service boss 'steps back' from day-to-day management
text: By Nick Servini Political editor, Wales Sue Moffatt, director of the National Procurement Service (NPS), has handed over responsibility to her deputy while a review is carried out. The organisation was set up to save money by centrally co-ordinating public sector purchasing in Wales. Ms. Moffatt's decision to step back from day-to-day management comes amid growing concerns about the procurement service's performance and effectiveness. The NPS was established in 2013 with the aim of driving efficiency and cost savings across the public sector by pooling buying power and negotiating better deals with suppliers. However, in recent months, there have been reports of delays, inefficiencies, and missed targets within the NPS. Some public sector bodies have raised questions about the value for money provided by the service, prompting calls for a comprehensive review of its operations. Ms. Moffatt announced her decision in a statement released on Tuesday, in which she stated that she believed it was in the best interests of the organisation for her to step back and allow her deputy to take the lead while a full review of the NPS's activities is conducted. The Welsh Government, which oversees the NPS, has welcomed Ms. Moffatt's decision and pledged to support the review process. A spokesperson for the government said that they were committed to ensuring that the NPS delivers on its objectives and maximizes the benefits of collaborative procurement for the public sector in Wales. The review of the NPS is expected to examine the organization's governance, management structure, performance metrics, and relationships with suppliers. It will also evaluate the impact of the NPS on public sector budgets and assess its ability to deliver value for money. Meanwhile, Ms. Moffatt's deputy, Sarah Davies, will assume responsibility for the day-to-day operations of the NPS until the review is completed. Ms. Davies, who has been with the NPS since its inception, brings a wealth of experience in public sector procurement and is well-equipped to lead the organization through this transitional period. The Welsh Government has expressed confidence in Ms. Davies' ability to steer the NPS in the right direction and ensure that it continues to fulfill its mandate of driving efficiency and cost savings for the public sector. The outcome of the review will be eagerly anticipated by all stakeholders in the NPS as they seek to address the challenges facing the organization and improve its performance in the months ahead.

title: Karate punching power 'all in the brain'
text: that control movement and generate the force behind their punches. This study sheds light on the importance of mental training in developing punching power in karate. The research conducted by a team of neuroscientists at the University of Tokyo involved monitoring brain activity using functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) while expert and novice karate practitioners were asked to deliver a series of punches. The experts, who had years of experience and training in karate, exhibited a distinct pattern of brain activity compared to the novices. Dr. Hiroshi Yamamoto, lead author of the study, explained, "We observed increased activity in the supplementary motor area and primary motor cortex of the experts. These areas are involved in planning and executing movements, suggesting that the experts were able to generate more power behind their punches through enhanced motor control." The findings of the study suggest that punching power in karate is not just a result of physical conditioning, but also relies heavily on cognitive processes within the brain. Experts were able to anticipate the target, plan their movements, and execute with precision, generating maximum force. In addition to the brain regions responsible for movement, the researchers also observed increased activity in the insula and amygdala of the experts. These areas are associated with emotion and arousal, indicating that the experts were able to harness their mental focus and intensity to deliver powerful punches. Dr. Yamamoto emphasized the importance of mental training in martial arts, stating, "While physical conditioning is essential in developing strength and speed, our study highlights the crucial role of the brain in generating punching power. Karate practitioners can benefit from training techniques that enhance cognitive functions such as attention, perception, and decision-making." The study not only provides insights into the neural mechanisms underlying punching power in karate but also has broader implications for sports training and performance. By understanding how the brain contributes to skill development, coaches and athletes can design more effective training programs to maximize physical and mental capabilities. Overall, the research suggests that the key to unlocking the full potential of punching power lies not just in the muscles, but in the mind. With proper mental training and cognitive skills development, karate practitioners can elevate their performance to new heights, delivering powerful and precise strikes with expert precision.

title: Respite reported for Scotland's daily newspaper sales
text: By Jamie McIvorBBC News correspondent The Scotsman and The Herald both recorded very small rises in their circulations between April and May. This was probably helped by the general election and the uncertainty which followed. However their sales, like those of most newspapers, remain under long-term pressure. Scotland's newspaper industry has been facing significant challenges in recent years, with declining circulation figures and increasing competition from online news sources. The impact of the Covid-19 pandemic has only exacerbated these issues, as people turned to digital platforms for their news updates during lockdowns and restrictions. Despite these challenges, the slight respite in sales figures for The Scotsman and The Herald is a positive sign for the industry. It suggests that there is still a demand for trusted, quality journalism in Scotland, even amidst the changing media landscape. The rise in circulation for these two newspapers may also reflect the public's interest in politics and current affairs, particularly during a time of political upheaval like the general election. Readers are looking for in-depth analysis and commentary on the key issues of the day, and traditional newspapers like The Scotsman and The Herald are well-placed to provide this. However, it is important to note that these small increases in circulation may not be sustained in the long term. The newspaper industry is still facing significant challenges, including declining advertising revenue and the shift towards digital consumption. Newspapers will need to continue to innovate and adapt in order to survive in this changing media landscape. One potential avenue for growth for newspapers like The Scotsman and The Herald is through their online platforms. Many readers now prefer to access their news digitally, and newspapers can reach a wider audience by investing in their online presence. By offering a mix of subscription-based and advertising-supported content, newspapers can attract both loyal readers and new audiences. Ultimately, the future of Scotland's newspaper industry will depend on its ability to adapt to the changing media landscape and meet the evolving needs of its readers. While the recent rise in circulation figures for The Scotsman and The Herald is a positive sign, newspapers will need to continue to innovate and evolve in order to thrive in the digital age. With the right strategies in place, Scotland's newspapers can continue to provide valuable journalism and play a vital role in informing and engaging the public.

title: Essex academic's imposter 'copied work and tattoos'
text: Matt Lodder, senior lecturer in art history at the University of Essex, has carried out wide-ranging work into the history of tattooing practice. The unnamed imposter, he said, went as far as to present his work at academic conferences and publish it in reputable journals. The impostor had apparently been copying Lodder's research on the historical significance of tattoos in various cultures around the world. The fraud was only uncovered when suspicious colleagues noticed the similarities between the imposter's work and Lodder's published articles. Lodder expressed shock and disappointment at the discovery, stating that academic plagiarism is a serious offense that undermines the integrity of higher education. He emphasized the importance of independent research and original ideas in the academic community. The imposter's deception did not end with intellectual theft. It was also revealed that the person had copied Lodder's distinctive tattoo design without permission. The tattoo, which features intricate geometric patterns and symbolic imagery, has become a signature of Lodder's personal identity and professional brand. Lodder described the experience of seeing someone else with his tattoo as surreal and unsettling. He expressed concerns about the potential impact on his reputation and the confusion it could cause among colleagues and students who are familiar with his work. The academic community rallied around Lodder in support, condemning the impostor's actions and calling for accountability. Many scholars and researchers offered to help Lodder pursue legal action against the imposter for intellectual property theft and academic misconduct. As news of the scandal spread, questions arose about the prevalence of academic fraud and the effectiveness of current safeguards against plagiarism. Some experts argued that more robust measures, such as plagiarism detection software and peer review processes, should be implemented to prevent similar incidents in the future. Despite the betrayal and violation of trust, Lodder remained determined to continue his research and teaching responsibilities at the University of Essex. He vowed to turn this negative experience into a learning opportunity and to use it as a platform to raise awareness about the importance of academic integrity. In conclusion, Matt Lodder's encounter with an academic imposter who not only plagiarized his work but also copied his distinctive tattoos serves as a cautionary tale for the academic community. It underscores the need for vigilance and accountability in upholding ethical standards in research and scholarship.

title: Apple apologises and fixes security flaw
text: Dave LeeNorth America technology reporter The flaw, revealed on Tuesday, made it possible to access a Mac without a password, and also have access to sensitive information such as personal photos and documents. This security vulnerability, dubbed "Blank Password Bonanza" by researchers, sent shockwaves through the tech community as users scrambled to protect their devices. Apple was quick to respond to the crisis, issuing a public apology and promising to release a fix as soon as possible. In a statement released on Wednesday, the company acknowledged the seriousness of the issue and reassured users that their security is a top priority. "We deeply regret any inconvenience this may have caused our customers and are working around the clock to address the issue," said Apple's chief security officer. The fix, a software update named "Security Patch 2021.1," was rolled out to all Mac devices on Wednesday evening. Users were urged to install the update immediately to ensure their systems were protected from any potential threats. The update not only patched the security flaw but also included additional measures to strengthen the overall security of Mac devices. In addition to the software update, Apple also offered affected users a free one-year subscription to its premium security service, Apple Security Plus. This service provides users with round-the-clock monitoring of their devices, regular security updates, and access to a team of security experts who are on hand to address any concerns. Apple hopes that this gesture will help restore trust among its customers and demonstrate its commitment to keeping their data safe. Despite the swift response from Apple, some critics have raised concerns about the company's handling of the security flaw. Questions have been raised about how such a basic vulnerability was not addressed during the initial testing phase and why it took a third-party researcher to discover the issue. Apple has not commented on these criticisms but has reiterated its commitment to continuously improving the security of its products. In the wake of this security incident, experts are advising all Mac users to remain vigilant and stay informed about potential threats. They stress the importance of regularly updating software and using strong, unique passwords to protect against cyber attacks. With cyber threats becoming increasingly sophisticated, it is more important than ever for users to take proactive steps to safeguard their digital lives. As the dust settles on this security debacle, Apple is hoping to put this incident behind them and focus on the future. With the release of new products on the horizon, the company is eager to rebuild trust among its loyal customers and demonstrate that their security is paramount. Only time will tell if Apple's efforts are enough to regain the confidence of users who were left vulnerable by this security flaw.

title: Brexit: Corbyn aides warn against pre-election referendum
text: By Iain Watson Political correspondent, BBC News These senior aides are concerned he is being pushed into a position which would undoubtedly damage the Labour Party's chances in a general election. There is increasing pressure on Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn to support a pre-election referendum on Brexit. The party's official policy is to push for a general election to break the impasse, but some members are calling for a confirmatory vote on any Brexit deal that is negotiated. However, Corbyn has long been a Eurosceptic and has been hesitant to fully commit to backing another public vote on Brexit. His aides fear that this reluctance is not just due to his own personal beliefs, but is also a strategic move to avoid alienating leave voters who traditionally support Labour in some key constituencies. The aides argue that pushing for a pre-election referendum could backfire, as it may make it harder for Labour to win over leave voters in areas that voted to leave the EU in 2016. With the Brexit Party gaining momentum and the Conservatives rallying around a harder Brexit stance, Labour risks losing ground if they are seen as flip-flopping on their Brexit position. Despite the pressure from some within his own party, Corbyn is holding firm on his stance. He has consistently argued that a general election is the best way to resolve the Brexit deadlock and that a Labour government would negotiate a better deal with the EU. But as the October 31st deadline for Brexit approaches, the calls for a confirmatory vote are growing louder. The fear is that without a clear position on a second referendum, Labour risks losing support from remain voters who are increasingly looking to the Liberal Democrats and other parties as a more pro-EU alternative. The aides are urging Corbyn to stick to his guns and focus on winning a general election rather than getting bogged down in the Brexit debate. They argue that the best chance for Labour to win power is to focus on their domestic agenda and highlight the failings of the Conservative government. However, as the Brexit deadline looms and the prospects of a general election grow ever closer, Corbyn will have to make a decision on whether to support a pre-election referendum or risk alienating both leave and remain voters. The stakes are high and the pressure is mounting on the Labour leader to take a clear position on Brexit.

title: Rory McIlroy fan hit by lightning at golf event 'bruised and shaken'
text: Terry Murphy, from Cookstown, said his son Ryan, 19, had been following Rory McIlroy at the event in Atlanta when the "freak" incident occurred. Mr Murphy said his son was a huge fan of McIlroy and had been eagerly waiting for the opportunity to see him play in person. The event was going smoothly until dark storm clouds rolled in, bringing with them lightning and heavy rain. Despite the weather conditions, Ryan was determined to stay and watch McIlroy finish his round. However, as lightning struck nearby, chaos ensued. Terry Murphy described the terrifying moment when he saw a bright flash of light and heard a deafening crack of thunder. He immediately turned to look for his son and saw him lying on the ground, surrounded by panicked onlookers. Ryan had been struck by the lightning and was unconscious. Emergency services rushed to the scene and Ryan was quickly taken to the hospital for treatment. Fortunately, he only suffered minor injuries and was discharged the same day. However, the experience left him bruised and shaken. In an interview with the BBC, Ryan Murphy recounted the harrowing incident. He said he remembered feeling a sudden jolt of electricity running through his body and then everything went dark. When he regained consciousness, he was in excruciating pain and could barely move. Despite the terrifying ordeal, Ryan expressed his gratitude for the quick response of the emergency services and the support of his family. He also thanked Rory McIlroy for reaching out to him personally and sending his best wishes for a speedy recovery. Rory McIlroy, who was visibly shaken by the incident, expressed his relief that Ryan was not seriously injured. He emphasized the importance of prioritizing safety in extreme weather conditions and urged fans to seek shelter during storms. The organizers of the event have since implemented stricter safety protocols to ensure the well-being of spectators and players alike. They have also offered counseling services to those who may have been traumatized by the incident. As for Ryan Murphy, he is slowly recovering from the physical and emotional trauma of being struck by lightning. He has vowed to never underestimate the power of nature again and plans to return to the golf course once he has fully healed. In the meantime, he is grateful to be alive and is looking forward to watching Rory McIlroy play again, albeit from a safe distance. The experience has reinforced his love for the sport and his admiration for his favorite golfer.

title: Glasgow School of Art fire safety system 'was weeks away'
text: The British Automatic Fire Sprinkler Association said huge pumps needed for the water mist system had arrived on site the day before. This system, set to be installed at the Glasgow School of Art, was seen as a vital addition to the building's fire safety measures. However, as fate would have it, the system was just weeks away from completion when a devastating blaze engulfed the iconic Mackintosh building. The fire, which broke out on a Friday evening, quickly spread throughout the historic building, causing extensive damage to the structure and destroying much of the interior. Firefighters worked tirelessly to bring the blaze under control, but their efforts were hampered by the lack of a fully operational fire suppression system. The water mist system, which was designed to release a fine mist of water to suppress the fire and prevent it from spreading, could have made a significant difference in containing the flames. Unfortunately, the system had not yet been fully installed and was not operational at the time of the fire. The Glasgow School of Art, designed by renowned architect Charles Rennie Mackintosh, is a highly treasured cultural landmark in the city. The building had already suffered a major fire in 2014, which had caused extensive damage to the structure. The school had been in the process of restoring the building to its former glory when disaster struck once again. Investigators are now looking into the cause of the fire and whether the lack of a fully operational fire safety system may have contributed to the extent of the damage. Questions are being raised about the timeline for the completion of the water mist system and whether more could have been done to expedite the process. In the wake of the fire, there has been an outpouring of support for the Glasgow School of Art, with many expressing their sadness at the loss of such an important piece of the city's cultural heritage. The school has vowed to rebuild the Mackintosh building once again, but the road ahead will be long and challenging.
