As the investigation continues, it is clear that fire safety measures must be a top priority for all historic buildings. The Glasgow School of Art fire serves as a stark reminder of the importance of having robust systems in place to protect these architectural treasures for future generations. Hopefully, lessons will be learned from this tragedy, and steps will be taken to prevent such a devastating loss from happening again.

title: Pakistanis respond after 'spy pigeon' detained in India
text: BBC Trending What's popular and why It all started when a 14-year-old boy in an Indian village close to the border with Pakistan found a white pigeon with a number stamped on its feathers. Little did he know that this seemingly ordinary bird would spark a diplomatic incident between the two neighboring countries. The pigeon was detained by Indian authorities on suspicion of being a spy sent by Pakistan. The bird was found carrying a coded message and an identification ring with a phone number from Pakistan. This bizarre incident quickly went viral on social media, with netizens from both countries sharing memes and jokes about the alleged espionage pigeon. Pakistanis responded to the news with a mixture of amusement and disbelief. Many took to social media to mock the Indian authorities for their paranoia, suggesting that the pigeon was simply a lost bird looking for its way home. Some even joked that the pigeon should be awarded a medal for successfully infiltrating Indian territory undetected. Others, however, expressed concern over the escalating tensions between the two countries and called for a peaceful resolution to the situation. They criticized the Indian authorities for jumping to conclusions and urged them to focus on more pressing issues affecting both nations. In response to the detainment of the pigeon, Pakistani authorities denied any involvement in espionage activities and demanded the immediate release of the bird. The Pakistan Foreign Office issued a statement calling the incident "absurd and baseless" and urged Indian officials to handle the situation with maturity and restraint. Meanwhile, Indian officials defended their decision to detain the pigeon, citing national security concerns and the need to investigate any potential threats to the country. They stated that the bird would be thoroughly examined by intelligence agencies to determine if it posed any real danger. As the standoff continued, tensions between India and Pakistan reached a new high, with both countries exchanging heated statements and accusations. The espionage pigeon became an unlikely symbol of the long-standing animosity between the two nuclear-armed neighbors. In the midst of the diplomatic row, ordinary citizens on both sides of the border called for calm and peaceful dialogue to resolve the issue. Many hoped that the bizarre incident would serve as a wake-up call for the authorities to prioritize diplomacy over hostility and work towards building a more stable and harmonious relationship. Only time will tell whether the spy pigeon saga will be remembered as a silly misunderstanding or a cautionary tale of the dangers of unchecked nationalism and suspicion. But one thing is for sure: in the age of social media, even a seemingly innocent bird can become a viral sensation and trigger a global outcry.

title: A US judge asked lawyers to explain the lyrics to Thriller
text: By Mark Savage BBC Music reporter US Tax Court Judge Mark Holmes had always been puzzled by the rap at the end of Michael Jackson's hit song "Thriller." So, during a recent court case, he took the opportunity to ask the lawyers present to explain the lyrics to him. The judge, known for his love of music, questioned the attorneys about the meaning behind the iconic track's spoken-word section, which features Vincent Price delivering a sinister monologue. He wanted to know if there was any significance to the words and how they related to the case at hand. As the lawyers stumbled to provide a satisfactory explanation, Judge Holmes decided to investigate the lyrics himself. He listened to the song repeatedly, trying to dissect the cryptic words uttered by Price as he describes malevolent creatures lurking in the night. After much contemplation, the judge concluded that the lyrics to "Thriller" were simply meant to create a spooky atmosphere and entertain listeners. He realized that sometimes, art doesn't always have a deeper meaning but is intended purely for enjoyment. Despite his best efforts, Judge Holmes couldn't shake off his curiosity about the song's enigmatic rap. He pondered over its significance, wondering if there was a hidden message that had eluded him. Eventually, he reached out to music experts for their insights. They explained that the spoken-word section in "Thriller" was inspired by horror movies of the time and was meant to add a chilling effect to the song. The experts also noted that the rap was a reflection of Jackson's fascination with the supernatural and his desire to create a thrilling experience for his audience. Armed with this newfound knowledge, Judge Holmes felt satisfied with the explanation. He realized that sometimes, lyrics in music can be open to interpretation and don't necessarily have a definitive meaning. As the court case came to a close, Judge Holmes couldn't resist playing "Thriller" in his chambers, fully appreciating the song in a new light. The haunting melody and eerie lyrics now held a special place in his heart, thanks to his quest to unravel their mysteries. In the end, Judge Holmes learned that sometimes, it's okay not to fully understand every aspect of art. Sometimes, it's enough to simply enjoy the experience and let the music speak for itself. And that's exactly what he did as he listened to "Thriller" one more time, appreciating its ghostly charm and timeless appeal.

title: Belfast homeless: At least five dead since January, says charity
text: worse by the conditions they experience on the streets. At least five people have tragically lost their lives since the beginning of January in Belfast, according to the charity. The Welcome Organisation, which provides support to the homeless community in the city, has been working tirelessly to address the needs of rough sleepers and those who are vulnerable. They offer a range of services, from emergency shelter and food provision to mental health support and addiction services. Despite their best efforts, the harsh reality is that homelessness is a complex issue with no easy solutions. Many people living on the streets face a multitude of challenges, from mental health issues and addiction to a lack of affordable housing and support networks. One of the key contributing factors to the deaths of rough sleepers is the lack of access to healthcare and appropriate support services. Homeless individuals often struggle to access medical care or mental health services, leading to untreated conditions that can be life-threatening. The stress and trauma of living on the streets can also exacerbate existing health problems, making it even harder for individuals to seek help. The Welcome Organisation has been calling for urgent action to address the root causes of homelessness and to provide better support for those who are living on the streets. They are advocating for increased funding for homeless services, improved access to healthcare, and better coordination between agencies to ensure that vulnerable individuals receive the support they need. In addition to addressing the immediate needs of rough sleepers, it is essential to tackle the underlying systemic issues that contribute to homelessness. This includes ensuring that there is an adequate supply of affordable housing, providing mental health and addiction services, and addressing poverty and inequality in the community. The deaths of those who have died while experiencing homelessness in Belfast are a tragic reminder of the urgent need for action. Every life lost is a devastating loss, and it is essential that we as a society come together to address this crisis and ensure that everyone has a safe place to call home. The Welcome Organisation is committed to continuing their vital work in supporting the homeless community and advocating for change, but they cannot do it alone. It is time for all of us to step up and take action to end homelessness and prevent further unnecessary deaths on the streets.

title: Tube passengers forced to walk off train in Underground
text: Commuters endured another day of misery when services were delayed, disrupted or cancelled on parts of the network. London Underground apologised for disruptions and admitted customers "deserved better", while Tube passengers were forced to walk off a train stranded between stations due to a signal failure. The incident occurred during rush hour on one of the busiest lines, leaving hundreds of frustrated passengers stranded in a dimly lit tunnel. Reports from passengers described the lack of communication from staff, with many unsure of what was happening or when they would be able to continue their journey. One passenger, Sarah, shared her experience on social media, expressing her disappointment at the lack of support from staff during the ordeal. "We were stuck on the train for over an hour before we were told we had to walk to the nearest station. It was chaos down there, with no clear directions or assistance from staff. It was a nightmare," she said. Another passenger, John, described the ordeal as "unacceptable" and called for better contingency plans to be in place for such situations. "It's not the first time this has happened, and it won't be the last unless something changes. Passengers deserve better than this," he said. London Underground issued a statement apologising for the disruption and reassuring customers that measures were being taken to prevent a similar incident from occurring in the future. "We understand the frustration and inconvenience caused to passengers today and are working to improve our services and communication during disruptions. We are continually reviewing our procedures to ensure incidents like this are minimised," the statement read. Despite the apology, many passengers expressed their frustration at the ongoing issues plaguing the network and called for more transparency and accountability from transport authorities. Some even questioned the reliability of the service and whether they could trust it in the future. As commuters made their way to alternative transport options or decided to brave the journey on foot, the disruption served as a stark reminder of the challenges facing London's aging transport infrastructure. With an ever-increasing demand for services and limited resources to meet it, incidents like these highlight the need for urgent investment and modernisation to prevent further disruptions and ensure a more reliable service for all passengers. Until then, commuters may have to brace themselves for more days of uncertainty and frustration on their daily commutes.

title: Artificial intelligence 'as good as cancer doctors'
text: By James Gallagher Health and science reporter, BBC News website The Stanford University team said the findings were "incredibly exciting" and would now be tested in clinics. Eventually, they believe using AI could revolutionise healthcare. Artificial intelligence has long been hailed as the next big thing in healthcare, with the potential to outperform human doctors in a wide range of medical tasks. Now, a new study from Stanford University has shown that AI may be as good as cancer doctors at diagnosing and treating patients. The research, published in the journal Nature Medicine, involved training an AI system using vast amounts of data on lung cancer. The AI was then tested against a panel of 6 expert radiologists in diagnosing the disease in over 1,000 cases. Surprisingly, the AI system matched the accuracy of the human doctors in detecting cancerous nodules in lung scans. This groundbreaking result has the potential to revolutionize cancer diagnosis and treatment, with the AI system being able to quickly and accurately identify tumors that may have been missed by human doctors. The Stanford researchers believe that this technology could eventually be used in clinics around the world, helping to improve the accuracy and efficiency of cancer diagnosis. By harnessing the power of AI, doctors could catch tumors earlier, leading to improved survival rates and better patient outcomes. But while the potential benefits of AI in healthcare are clear, there are still some challenges that need to be overcome. For example, there are concerns about the ethics of using AI to make life-changing decisions for patients. Additionally, there is a risk that if AI systems are not properly trained or monitored, they could make errors that have serious consequences for patients. Despite these challenges, the Stanford University study represents a major step forward in the field of AI in healthcare. If the technology can be successfully integrated into clinical practice, it has the potential to transform the way we diagnose and treat cancer, ultimately saving lives and improving patient care. As the researchers continue to test and refine their AI system, the future of healthcare looks brighter than ever. With the potential to revolutionize the field of medicine, AI could soon be as good as cancer doctors – or even better – at diagnosing and treating patients. And that's an incredibly exciting prospect for the future of healthcare.

title: Stockholm truck attack: Who is Rakhmat Akilov?
text: Rakhmat Akilov, an Uzbek asylum seeker, ran from the scene still covered in blood and glass on 7 April 2017, and was arrested hours later in a northern suburb of Stockholm. He was jailed for 28 years in June 2018 after being found guilty of carrying out a terrorist attack by driving a stolen truck into pedestrians on a busy street in the Swedish capital. The attack, which occurred in the heart of Stockholm's shopping district, left five people dead and injured 10 others. It was Sweden's deadliest attack in decades and sent shockwaves through the country. Akilov admitted to the crime during his trial, saying he wanted to punish Sweden for its involvement in the fight against the Islamic State group in Iraq and Syria. Prior to the attack, Akilov had expressed sympathy for extremist groups and had been denied asylum in Sweden. He had also been ordered to leave the country in December 2016 but had gone into hiding instead. Despite being on the radar of security services, he was able to carry out the attack with relative ease, raising questions about the country's ability to prevent such incidents in the future. In the aftermath of the attack, Swedish officials pledged to crack down on extremism and tighten security measures to prevent similar incidents from happening again. The government also beefed up its intelligence capabilities and increased cooperation with other countries to better track and monitor individuals with potential ties to extremist groups. Akilov's case highlighted the challenges that European countries face in dealing with the threat of terrorism, particularly from individuals who are radicalized online and carry out attacks on their own without direct support from established terrorist organizations. It also raised questions about the effectiveness of asylum and immigration policies in identifying and screening individuals who may pose a security risk. Despite his conviction, Akilov remains a divisive figure in Sweden, with some viewing him as a misguided individual who fell victim to extremist propaganda, while others see him as a cold-blooded terrorist who should never be released from prison. His case has underscored the complexities of dealing with terrorism in a society that prides itself on openness and tolerance. As Sweden continues to grapple with the aftermath of the Stockholm truck attack, the country is facing a new set of challenges in addressing the root causes of extremism and preventing future acts of violence. Only time will tell if the lessons learned from this tragic event will help prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.

title: Egypt court quashes Red Sea islands' transfer to Saudis
text: Egypt's President Abdul Fattah al-Sisi announced that Tiran and Sanafir would be transferred in April, during a visit by Saudi Arabia's King Salman. More than 150 people were jailed in connection with protests over the decision to cede the islands, which sparked widespread anger and criticism from opposition groups and activists. The transfer of the islands to Saudi Arabia was seen as a controversial move, with many Egyptians viewing it as a violation of national sovereignty and territorial integrity. The decision led to mass protests across the country, with demonstrators condemning the government for giving away Egyptian land in exchange for financial aid from Saudi Arabia. Opposition figures and human rights groups accused the government of ignoring legal procedures and bypassing parliamentary approval in order to push through the transfer of the islands. Critics also alleged that the decision was part of a wider attempt by President al-Sisi to curry favor with the Saudi leadership and secure financial and political support for his regime. In response to the protests and mounting criticism, Egypt's government cracked down on dissent and arrested hundreds of activists and demonstrators. Many of those detained were charged with inciting violence, disrupting public order, and spreading false information about the transfer of the islands. However, despite the government's efforts to suppress opposition to the decision, the issue continued to be a flashpoint for unrest and controversy in Egypt. The transfer of the islands also faced legal challenges, with several court cases challenging the constitutionality of the agreement with Saudi Arabia. In June, an Egyptian court ruled that the transfer of Tiran and Sanafir to Saudi Arabia was unconstitutional and void. The court's decision was hailed as a victory by opponents of the agreement, who had long argued that the government had acted unlawfully in ceding the islands. President al-Sisi's government, however, pledged to appeal the ruling and vowed to continue efforts to transfer the islands to Saudi Arabia. The government argued that the islands had historically belonged to Saudi Arabia and that the transfer was part of a longstanding border demarcation agreement between the two countries. Despite the court's ruling, the controversy over the islands and their transfer to Saudi Arabia is far from settled. The issue remains a divisive and contentious one in Egypt, reflecting broader concerns about governance, accountability, and respect for the rule of law in the country.

title: Coronavirus: Cases are recorded in 64 NI schools
text: monitoring the situation closely across Northern Ireland's schools, with a total of 64 schools reporting confirmed cases of coronavirus. The news comes as many schools reopened their doors to students for the first time since the pandemic hit earlier this year. The DE emphasized that the safety and well-being of students and staff remains their top priority, and they are working closely with school leaders to ensure appropriate measures are in place to prevent further spread of the virus. Education Minister Peter Weir has reiterated the importance of following public health guidelines to keep the school community safe. He emphasized the importance of social distancing, regular hand washing, and wearing face coverings in shared spaces. Despite the precautions taken by schools, the confirmed cases serve as a stark reminder that the virus is still present in our communities. The DE is urging students and staff to continue to be vigilant and to report any symptoms or potential exposure to the virus. The news of coronavirus cases in schools has undoubtedly caused concern among parents, many of whom are already anxious about sending their children back to school during a global pandemic. However, the DE is reassuring parents that they are taking all necessary steps to ensure the safety of students and staff. In response to the confirmed cases, some schools have implemented additional measures such as enhanced cleaning protocols, staggered break times, and remote learning options for students who may need to self-isolate. School leaders are working tirelessly to adapt to the ever-changing situation and to provide a safe learning environment for everyone. The DE is also working closely with the Public Health Agency to conduct contact tracing and to identify any close contacts of the confirmed cases. This will help to prevent further transmission of the virus within schools and the wider community. As the situation continues to evolve, the DE is urging everyone to remain vigilant and to follow public health advice to protect themselves and others. By working together and adhering to guidelines, we can help to prevent the spread of coronavirus and keep our school communities safe. The confirmed cases in schools serve as a stark reminder of the challenges posed by the virus, but with the collective effort of students, staff, and parents, we can navigate these difficult times. The DE remains committed to supporting schools and ensuring the safety and well-being of everyone involved in the education system.

title: Drones hamper US firefighting efforts
text: Lives were put at unnecessary risk because helicopters could not fly, said fire department officials. The helicopters were helping to contain a large wildfire in San Bernadino county over the weekend. Five drones spotted hovering over the fire were hindering efforts to combat the blaze, forcing the aircraft to be grounded. The presence of the drones not only posed a threat to the firefighters on the ground but also prevented crucial water drops from the helicopters. Firefighters struggled to gain control of the wildfire without the aerial support, allowing the flames to spread rapidly and endangering nearby communities. Fire department officials issued a plea to the public to refrain from flying drones in areas affected by wildfires, emphasizing the importance of allowing emergency responders to do their jobs without interference. The unauthorized use of drones in such situations is not only illegal but also endangers lives and property. The incident in San Bernadino county highlights the growing problem of drone interference during firefighting operations. In recent years, there have been numerous reports of drones disrupting firefighting efforts across the United States. This poses a serious challenge for emergency responders, who rely on helicopters and other aircraft to contain wildfires and protect communities. Efforts to address the issue include increased awareness campaigns and stricter regulations on drone usage in fire-prone areas. However, the problem persists, with some drone operators ignoring the warnings and putting lives at risk. The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has also issued guidelines for drone operators to avoid flying near wildfires and other emergency situations. Violating these guidelines can result in fines and penalties for reckless behavior. Despite these measures, the issue of drone interference remains a significant concern for firefighters and emergency responders. The use of drones in firefighting operations is a valuable tool for gathering information and assessing the extent of the wildfire. However, when drones impede the efforts of firefighting aircraft, the consequences can be devastating. As the wildfire in San Bernadino county continues to burn out of control, officials are urging drone operators to cooperate with emergency responders and avoid flying in the area. The safety of both firefighters and the public depends on everyone working together to combat wildfires effectively. Only through collaboration and responsible behavior can we prevent unnecessary risks and protect lives and property.

title: Baby ashes scandal 'will not happen again'
text: to Holyrood in response to the scandal surrounding the disposal of baby ashes at Mortonhall Crematorium in Edinburgh. An investigation in 2013 exposed the practice of cremating babies and then burying their ashes without the knowledge or consent of the families. Maureen Watt, the Minister for Public Health, pledged that the new legislation would ensure that such a scandal would never happen again. She emphasized the importance of providing greater transparency and accountability in the handling of baby remains, highlighting the need for trust to be rebuilt between bereaved families and the cremation industry. The Burial and Cremation (Scotland) Bill aims to introduce a number of key measures to address the issues raised by the baby ashes scandal. One of the main provisions is the requirement for all crematoriums to provide families with clear information about the cremation process and the disposal of ashes. This includes obtaining the explicit consent of parents before carrying out any cremation. In addition, the bill sets out new regulations for the storage and disposal of ashes, ensuring that they are handled with the utmost care and respect. Crematoriums will be required to keep detailed records of all cremations, including information about the disposal of ashes and any other relevant details. The legislation also includes provisions for the appointment of inspectors to oversee the implementation of the new regulations. These inspectors will have the power to carry out inspections of crematoriums and investigate any complaints or concerns raised by families. During the debate in the Scottish Parliament, MSPs from all parties expressed their support for the bill and the need to prevent a repeat of the baby ashes scandal. Many shared the stories of constituents who had been affected by the scandal, highlighting the devastating impact it had on families already dealing with the loss of a child. The unanimous vote in favor of the general principles of the Burial and Cremation (Scotland) Bill is a clear indication of the cross-party consensus on the need for greater regulation in this area. Maureen Watt acknowledged the emotional significance of the issue, stating that the new legislation was a crucial step towards ensuring that families could have confidence in the handling of their loved ones' remains. As the bill progresses through the legislative process, further details will be ironed out and additional protections put in place to prevent any future abuses. The Scottish Government is committed to working closely with stakeholders and bereaved families to ensure that the new regulations are robust and effective in safeguarding the dignity and respect of all those who have lost a loved one.

title: Putin critic Bill Browder freed after brief arrest in Spain
text: interpol arrest warrant requested by Russia. The financier and high-profile critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin was detained after attending a conference in Madrid. Mr Browder has been a long-time thorn in the side of the Russian government, particularly due to his campaigning for sanctions against Russian officials alleged to be involved in human rights abuses. His work has focused on seeking justice for his lawyer, Sergei Magnitsky, who died in a Russian prison in 2009 after uncovering a massive corruption scheme involving Russian officials. The arrest warrant against Mr Browder was originally issued by Russia in 2017, but it was later deemed invalid by Interpol due to being politically motivated. Despite the warrant being cancelled, Russian authorities have continued to harass and target Mr Browder, accusing him of various crimes in an attempt to silence his criticism of the Russian government. Mr Browder's release from custody in Spain has sparked outrage and condemnation from human rights groups and political leaders around the world. Many see his arrest as a blatant abuse of the Interpol Red Notice system by Russia and a violation of Mr Browder's right to freedom of speech. In response to his ordeal, Mr Browder has vowed to continue his fight against Russian corruption and human rights abuses. He remains undeterred in his mission to seek justice for Sergei Magnitsky and to hold Russian officials accountable for their crimes. The incident has once again brought international attention to the deteriorating human rights situation in Russia under President Putin's leadership. Critics argue that the Russian government's crackdown on dissent and its targeting of political opponents is a clear violation of international norms and human rights standards. As Mr Browder prepares to return to his home in the United Kingdom, he has received an outpouring of support from the international community. Governments and human rights organizations have called for an investigation into his arrest and have demanded that Russia end its harassment of him. Despite the alarming turn of events, Mr Browder remains resolute in his commitment to fighting for justice and accountability in Russia. He has become a symbol of the struggle against authoritarian regimes and a powerful voice for those who have been silenced by oppression. In the face of adversity, Mr Browder's determination and courage continue to inspire all those who believe in the universal values of freedom, democracy, and human rights. His release from custody in Spain may have been a temporary victory, but his battle against Russian impunity is far from over.

title: Ben Affleck slavery row leads to TV show suspension
text: Finding Your Roots, similar to the BBC's Who Do You Think You Are?, researches celebrity family histories. A review into an episode, which aired in October, concluded Affleck lobbied the show's producers to omit details about his slave-owning ancestors. This decision has now led to the suspension of the hit PBS program. The controversy surrounding Ben Affleck's episode has brought to light the ethical considerations involved in tracing family histories, especially for public figures. Many viewers and critics have criticized the actor for trying to suppress information about his family's past, arguing that it is important for individuals to confront uncomfortable truths about their heritage. In response to the uproar, PBS released a statement announcing the suspension of Finding Your Roots. The network emphasized the importance of maintaining integrity and transparency in their programming, stating that they would be conducting an internal review to determine the extent of Affleck's influence on the episode in question. Ben Affleck himself has issued a public apology for his involvement in the editing process, acknowledging that he was embarrassed by the revelation of his ancestors' slave ownership. The actor expressed regret for trying to censor that part of his family history, stating that he had learned a valuable lesson about the importance of honesty and integrity in genealogical research. The suspension of Finding Your Roots has sparked a broader conversation about the implications of uncovering ancestral connections to slavery. Many historians and genealogists argue that it is crucial for individuals to confront and acknowledge these connections, as they are a part of the larger narrative of American history. While the future of the show remains uncertain, the controversy has shed light on the complexities of uncovering and confronting difficult truths about our past. As viewers await the results of PBS's internal review, there is a growing consensus that transparency and honesty should be paramount in the exploration of family histories, especially when it comes to sensitive topics such as slavery. In conclusion, the Ben Affleck slavery row has highlighted the ethical dilemmas inherent in researching celebrity family histories. The suspension of Finding Your Roots serves as a reminder of the importance of honesty and integrity in genealogical research, and the need to confront uncomfortable truths about our past. As the investigation into this incident continues, it is clear that the conversation around ancestral connections to slavery will continue to evolve and spark important discussions about our shared history.

title: Bird family tree shaken by discovery of feathered fossil
text: By Helen Briggs BBC News The turacos, or banana-eaters, are today found only in Africa, living in forests and savannah. A beautifully preserved fossil bird from 52 million years ago has shaken up the bird family tree, revealing new insights into the evolution of these colorful creatures. The fossil, named Eofringillirostrum boudreauxi, was discovered in the Green River Formation in Wyoming, USA. It is believed to be the oldest known turaco fossil, with its long, slender beak and striking plumage resembling modern-day species. Dr. Amanda Bennett, lead author of the study published in the journal Nature, described the fossil as a "game-changer" in our understanding of turaco evolution. She explained that the discovery challenges previous assumptions about the origins of these unique birds. "Turacos are known for their vibrant colors and distinctive calls, but their evolutionary history has long been a mystery," Dr. Bennett said. "This fossil provides crucial evidence that turacos have ancient roots, dating back millions of years." The fossil bird belonged to a group of birds known as the Cuculiformes, which includes cuckoos and roadrunners. However, its unique combination of features, including the presence of specialized feathers associated with modern turacos, suggest that it is an early member of the turaco lineage. Dr. Bennett and her team used advanced imaging techniques to study the fossil in detail, revealing intricate details of the feathers and the structure of the beak. They found that Eofringillirostrum had adapted to a diet of fruit, similar to its modern relatives, further supporting its placement within the turaco family. The discovery of Eofringillirostrum adds a new branch to the bird family tree and fills in an important gap in our understanding of avian evolution. Its presence in North America, far from the species' current range in Africa, raises questions about how these birds spread across the globe over millions of years. Dr. Bennett hopes that further research on turaco fossils and their relatives will shed light on the evolutionary history of these charismatic birds. By studying their ancient ancestors, scientists can learn more about the factors that shaped the diversity of bird species we see today. As more fossils are unearthed and analyzed, the story of the turacos and their colorful cousins continues to unfold, revealing the remarkable journey of birds through time and space. The discovery of Eofringillirostrum is a testament to the power of fossils to illuminate the hidden history of life on Earth.

title: Corrie Mckeague search petition signed by 21,000
text: Corrie Mckeague, 23, was last seen in Bury St Edmunds in September. On Friday, Suffolk Police confirmed it had ended its search of waste at Milton landfill, near Cambridge. His mother Nicola has been tirelessly searching for answers regarding her son's disappearance, and has now turned to the public for support. A petition calling for the search to continue has garnered over 21,000 signatures, with people from all over the country expressing their solidarity with the Mckeague family. The support for the petition has been overwhelming, with many individuals sharing their own personal stories of loved ones who have gone missing. In a statement, Nicola expressed her gratitude for the outpouring of support, saying, "I am truly touched by the number of people who have signed the petition and shown their support for Corrie. It means so much to me and my family as we continue to search for answers." The petition calls for Suffolk Police to resume their search efforts for Corrie, with many signatories urging the authorities to explore all possible avenues in the investigation. Despite the landfill search coming to an end, there are still many unanswered questions surrounding Corrie's disappearance, and his family remains determined to find out the truth. In response to the petition, Suffolk Police have stated that they are reviewing all available evidence and are committed to pursuing any new leads that may arise. Detective Superintendent Katie Elliott, who is leading the investigation, said, "We understand the concerns of Corrie's family and the public, and we are doing everything we can to piece together what happened to him." The search for Corrie has captured the attention of people across the country, with many expressing their frustration over the lack of progress in the case. Supporters of the petition have been using social media to raise awareness and keep Corrie's story in the public eye, in the hopes that new information may come to light. As the petition continues to gain momentum, Nicola remains hopeful that the increased pressure on authorities will lead to a breakthrough in the case. She is encouraging anyone with information about her son's disappearance to come forward and help bring closure to her family. The search for Corrie Mckeague may have reached a standstill, but the determination and resilience of his family and supporters show no signs of waning. With over 21,000 signatures backing their cause, the Mckeague family will not rest until they have the answers they so desperately seek.

title: Liposuction rise linked to gym wear trend
text: Rajiv Grover, from the British Association of Aesthetic Plastic Surgeons, says latest UK data shows procedures have gone up 12% in a year, from 2,039 in 2020 to 2,285 in 2021. This rise in liposuction procedures has been linked to the increasing popularity of gym wear trends, which encourage people to showcase their bodies in fitted clothing. Grover explains that the influence of social media and celebrity culture has played a significant role in driving the demand for liposuction. Many people are now seeking to achieve the sculpted, toned bodies they see on their favorite influencers and celebrities. The rise in social media platforms has also made people more conscious of their appearance and more likely to seek cosmetic procedures to achieve their desired look. The rise in gym wear trends has also contributed to the normalization of cosmetic procedures such as liposuction. With more people wearing form-fitting clothing that highlights their bodies, there is increased pressure to have a flawless physique. Liposuction offers a quick and efficient way to remove stubborn fat deposits and achieve a more toned and sculpted appearance. However, Grover warns that while liposuction can be an effective way to enhance one's appearance, it is important for individuals to have realistic expectations and understand the potential risks and complications associated with the procedure. He advises people to consult with a qualified and experienced plastic surgeon before undergoing any cosmetic procedure to ensure they are fully informed about the process and potential outcomes. Despite the rise in liposuction procedures, Grover emphasizes the importance of maintaining a healthy lifestyle through diet and exercise. While liposuction can help remove excess fat, it is not a substitute for a healthy lifestyle. He encourages individuals to focus on overall health and wellness by incorporating regular exercise and a balanced diet into their daily routine. In conclusion, the rise in liposuction procedures in the UK has been attributed to the growing popularity of gym wear trends and the influence of social media and celebrity culture. While liposuction can be an effective way to achieve a more toned and sculpted appearance, it is important for individuals to have realistic expectations and prioritize their overall health and wellness. By combining cosmetic procedures with a healthy lifestyle, individuals can achieve their desired aesthetic goals while also maintaining their well-being.

title: City sanguine on snap election call
text: June.' The announcement of a snap election by Prime Minister Theresa May has sent shockwaves through the business community, with the pound experiencing a significant boost in value. The decision to call for an early election on June 8th caught many by surprise but has been met with a positive response from investors. The pound surged by 1% following the news, reaching its highest level in months. This increase in value is seen as a vote of confidence by the markets, as investors welcome the prospect of a stable government that can steer the country through the uncertainty of Brexit negotiations. However, the stock market has not responded as positively, with the FTSE 100 falling by more than 2% in the wake of the election announcement. This drop in value is likely due to the uncertainty surrounding the upcoming election and the potential impact it could have on businesses operating in the UK. Despite the initial market reaction, many analysts believe that the snap election could actually benefit the economy in the long run. A decisive victory for Theresa May's Conservative Party could provide the stability needed to secure a favorable Brexit deal, which could in turn boost investor confidence and stimulate economic growth. On the other hand, a strong showing by the opposition Labour Party or other opposition parties could introduce a new set of challenges for the economy. The prospect of a hung parliament or a coalition government could lead to further uncertainty and potentially disrupt the Brexit negotiations, which could have negative repercussions for businesses and the economy as a whole. As the country prepares for another round of political campaigning, businesses will be keeping a close eye on the election developments and the potential impact on the economy. The outcome of the snap election could have far-reaching consequences for businesses operating in the UK, particularly those that are heavily reliant on trade with the European Union. Overall, the announcement of a snap election has injected a sense of urgency and anticipation into the business community. With just a few weeks to go before polling day, businesses will be closely monitoring the political landscape and preparing for any potential changes that could arise as a result of the election. The coming weeks are sure to be a period of heightened uncertainty and volatility for businesses, as they navigate the shifting political landscape in the lead-up to the June 8th election.

title: Foals: Oxford band go from squat parties to Albert Hall
text: By Greg CochraneNewsbeat music reporter "There were two things we didn't want to do," recalls frontman Yannis Philappakis. "One was not do a record, and the other was not tour America." Philappakis, the lead singer of Oxford band Foals, is reflecting on the band's journey from humble beginnings playing in squats to headlining prestigious venues like the Royal Albert Hall. Formed in 2005, Foals quickly gained a reputation for their energetic live shows and intricate, math-rock influenced sound. Their debut album, Antidotes, released in 2008, captured the attention of music critics and fans alike, with its blend of angular guitar riffs and propulsive rhythms. "We were always ambitious," Philappakis continues. "We wanted to make music that was exciting and different, that pushed boundaries and challenged the listener. And we wanted to take that music to as many people as possible." Their determination paid off, as subsequent albums Total Life Forever (2010), Holy Fire (2013), and What Went Down (2015) saw Foals steadily grow their fanbase and expand their sound. Songs like "My Number" and "Mountain at My Gates" became anthems of the indie music scene, while the band's reputation as a formidable live act continued to soar. But it was their 2019 album, Everything Not Saved Will Be Lost – Part 1 and its ambitious follow-up, Part 2, that solidified Foals' status as one of the UK's most innovative and exciting bands. The albums showcased a more experimental and electronic sound, with themes of environmentalism and political unrest running throughout. "We wanted to make a statement with these records," Philappakis explains. "We wanted to address the urgent issues facing our world today and use our platform to raise awareness and provoke thought." Foals' dedication to their craft and their fearless approach to pushing boundaries have earned them critical acclaim and a loyal following around the world. They have played headline shows at iconic venues like London's Alexandra Palace and Glastonbury Festival, and have toured extensively in Europe, North America, and beyond. As they prepare to take the stage at the Royal Albert Hall, a dream venue for many musicians, Foals reflect on their journey from squat parties to sold-out arenas. "It's been a wild ride," Philappakis smiles. "But we're just getting started. There's still so much more we want to achieve, so much more music we want to make, and so many more people we want to reach. The journey continues."

title: Samsung Odyssey virtual reality headset announced for Windows
text: By Leo Kelion Technology desk editor HMD Odyssey joins previously announced VR headsets and hand controllers from Dell, HP, Lenovo, Acer and Asus to form the growing family of devices designed for Microsoft's new Mixed Reality platform. Samsung's entry into the virtual reality market comes as no surprise, given the company's reputation for cutting-edge technology and high-quality products. The Samsung Odyssey virtual reality headset boasts some impressive specs, including a dual 3.5-inch AMOLED display with a combined resolution of 2880 x 1600 pixels, providing a sharp and immersive visual experience. The device also features a 110-degree field of view, which is one of the widest available on the market, allowing users to fully immerse themselves in the virtual world. In terms of comfort, the Odyssey headset comes equipped with high-quality AKG headphones, ensuring that users can enjoy crisp and clear audio while exploring virtual environments. The headset also features a built-in microphone for communication with other players or virtual assistants, further enhancing the overall experience. One of the standout features of the Samsung Odyssey headset is its inside-out tracking technology, which eliminates the need for external sensors or cameras. This makes setup quick and easy, as users can simply plug in the headset and get started without the hassle of setting up additional equipment. The inside-out tracking also provides precise and responsive tracking of the user's movements, enhancing the overall immersion and realism of the virtual experience. The Samsung Odyssey headset is designed to work seamlessly with Windows Mixed Reality, Microsoft's new platform that aims to bring virtual reality and augmented reality together in a single ecosystem. With access to a wide range of apps and games from the Windows Store, users can enjoy a diverse selection of content to suit their preferences and interests. Overall, the Samsung Odyssey virtual reality headset offers an impressive package of features and capabilities that make it a compelling choice for both casual users and enthusiasts alike. With its high-quality display, immersive audio, and easy setup, the Odyssey headset is sure to provide a compelling virtual reality experience for those looking to explore new worlds and experiences. As virtual reality technology continues to evolve and improve, devices like the Samsung Odyssey headset are paving the way for a more immersive and engaging virtual experience. With its high-resolution display, comfortable design, and advanced tracking technology, the Odyssey headset is a standout addition to the growing family of devices available for the Windows Mixed Reality platform.

title: Poet Philip Gross wins Wales Book of the Year
text: work, A Bright Acoustic, won the T.S. Eliot Prize earlier in the year. Gross, who is also a Professor of Creative Writing at the University of South Wales, expressed his gratitude for the recognition, stating that he was thrilled to receive such prestigious awards for his poetry. I Spy Pinhole Eye is a collection of poems that explores themes of perception, memory, and the passage of time. Gross's distinctive voice and lyrical style have earned him critical acclaim, with many praising the depth and emotional resonance of his work. The judges of the Wales Book of the Year award described the collection as "a masterful blend of the personal and the universal, filled with haunting imagery and poignant reflections on the human experience." In addition to the £10,000 cash prize, Gross also received a specially commissioned piece of artwork by the Welsh artist Valériane Leblond. The award ceremony, held at Cardiff Castle, was attended by a host of literary luminaries, including fellow poets and writers from across Wales and beyond. Gross's success at the Wales Book of the Year awards reflects the ongoing vitality of Welsh literature and the rich tradition of poetry in the country. Wales has a long history of producing world-class poets, from Dylan Thomas to R.S. Thomas to Gillian Clarke, and Gross's work stands as a testament to the continuing strength of this literary heritage. As Gross continues to garner accolades for his poetry, he remains dedicated to his craft and to the power of language to illuminate the human experience. In a world that is often chaotic and overwhelming, poetry offers a means of making sense of the world, of finding beauty and meaning in the everyday. Gross's work reminds us of the importance of art and creativity in our lives, and of the ways in which literature can speak to our deepest fears, hopes, and dreams. With I Spy Pinhole Eye, Philip Gross has added another chapter to his already illustrious career, solidifying his place as one of Wales's most talented and respected poets. His work continues to inspire and move readers, inviting them to see the world through his eyes and to share in the joy and wonder of language.

title: National Farmers' Union condemns flooding plans
text: valuable to be sacrificed for these proposals. The National Farmers' Union (NFU) has strongly condemned the latest plans to combat flooding by turning agricultural land into water catchment areas. Engineers have argued that by creating ponds and bogs on high ground, they can slow down the flow of rainwater, reducing the risk of flash flooding downstream. This approach has been successful in some areas, with experts pointing to improved water quality and biodiversity as additional benefits. However, NFU president Peter Kendall remains skeptical. In a statement released earlier today, he expressed deep concern over the potential impact on farmers and their livelihoods. "Farmland is far too valuable to be sacrificed for these proposals," Kendall said. "Not only would this disrupt agricultural activities, but it could also lead to a loss of income for many farmers who rely on their land to sustain their businesses." Kendall went on to highlight the importance of finding a balance between flood prevention and agricultural needs. "While we understand the need to address the issue of flooding, we must also consider the wider implications of such drastic measures," he added. "Farmers play a crucial role in feeding the nation, and we cannot afford to jeopardize their ability to continue doing so." The NFU has proposed an alternative approach to tackling flooding, focusing on improved land management practices and more sustainable drainage systems. Kendall stressed the importance of working together with farmers to find solutions that benefit both the environment and agriculture. Environmental groups have expressed support for the NFU's stance, with many highlighting the potential long-term damage that could result from converting farmland into water catchment areas. "We need to be mindful of the impact on biodiversity and soil health," said one spokesperson. "While flooding is a serious issue that needs to be addressed, we must approach it in a way that does not compromise the future of our agricultural sector." As the debate continues, it remains to be seen how authorities will proceed with the proposed flooding plans. While the need to protect communities from flooding is undeniable, finding a solution that satisfies both environmental and agricultural concerns will undoubtedly be a complex challenge. The NFU has vowed to continue advocating for the interests of farmers, ensuring that their voices are heard in the decision-making process.

title: Welsh Conservative leader contender Paul Davies 'not grey'
text: By Aled ap Dafydd BBC Wales political correspondent The interim leader of the Tory assembly group has been described by a party insider as a "man in a beige suit". The Preseli Pembrokeshire AM said neither he nor his colleagues thought of him as a stereotypical politician, favoring the traditional grey attire and bland personality. Paul Davies, who is currently vying for the position of Welsh Conservative leader, has been making waves in the party with his distinct style and approach to politics. Unlike his opponents, Davies has been seen as a breath of fresh air, bringing a new energy and vibrancy to the leadership race. In a recent interview, Davies spoke about the need for the Welsh Conservatives to move away from the old way of doing things and embrace a more modern and dynamic approach. He emphasized the importance of connecting with voters on a personal level and being authentic in their interactions. Davies' charisma and down-to-earth nature have endeared him to many within the party, with some even comparing him to former Prime Minister David Cameron. His willingness to engage with the public and listen to their concerns has set him apart from the other candidates, who have been accused of being out of touch with ordinary Welsh people. Despite his unconventional approach, Davies has a solid track record in Welsh politics, having served as an AM for over a decade. He has held a number of key positions within the party, including Shadow Minister for Health and Social Services, where he has garnered a reputation for being a strong and effective lawmaker. As the leadership contest heats up, Davies remains a frontrunner in the race, with many members of the party rallying behind him. His grassroots campaign has been gaining momentum, with supporters praising his authenticity and commitment to representing the interests of the Welsh people. While some may dismiss Davies as just a "man in a beige suit", his supporters see him as a beacon of hope for the future of the Welsh Conservatives. With his bold vision and unwavering dedication to the party, Paul Davies is proving that he is anything but grey. If elected as leader, he could bring about a new era of success and prosperity for the Welsh Conservatives, setting them on a path towards victory in future elections.

title: Iceland mayors object to Google snow
text: By News from Elsewhere......as found by BBC Monitoring Jón Páll Hreinsson says this could put overseas tourists off visiting Bolungarvík in the picturesque Western Fjords. The mayor of Bolungarvík, a small town on the coast of Iceland, is unhappy with Google's depiction of snow in the area. According to Hreinsson, the images of snow on Google Maps are not accurate and do not reflect the true beauty of the winter landscape in Bolungarvík. Hreinsson believes that the inaccurate portrayal of snow on Google Maps could deter tourists from visiting the town, as they may be put off by the idea of heavy snowfall and difficult travel conditions. In reality, the snow in Bolungarvík is light and fluffy, creating a stunning winter wonderland that attracts visitors from around the world. The mayor is not the only one who is unhappy with Google's representation of snow in Iceland. Several other mayors in the country have also expressed their concerns, citing similar reasons for their objections. They believe that Google's inaccurate depiction of snow could have a negative impact on tourism in their respective regions, as potential visitors may be deterred by the misleading imagery. Despite the objections of the mayors, Google has not indicated that they will make any changes to the way snow is depicted on their maps. The tech giant relies on satellite imagery to create its maps, and it is possible that the images of snow in Iceland do not accurately capture the unique characteristics of the snow in the region. In response to Google's refusal to make changes, the mayors of Bolungarvík and other towns in Iceland are considering other avenues to address the issue. They have discussed the possibility of creating their own mapping service that accurately reflects the snow and winter landscapes in their respective regions. By creating their own maps, the mayors hope to provide potential tourists with a more accurate portrayal of the beauty of Iceland in the winter months. For now, however, the mayors are left to grapple with Google's depiction of snow on their maps. They are urging the tech giant to reconsider their approach and work with local authorities to ensure that the images accurately reflect the beauty of Iceland's winter landscapes. Until then, tourists may need to rely on other sources of information to plan their visit to Bolungarvík and other picturesque towns in the Western Fjords.

title: Hinkley Point C nuclear emissions 'underestimated'
text: The Stop Hinkley group said reactors will discharge more radioactive waste into the Severn Estuary. The group's complaint relates to three key points regarding the Hinkley Point C nuclear power plant. Firstly, they argue that the potential environmental impact of the plant has been significantly underestimated. According to their analysis, the discharge of radioactive waste from the new reactors is expected to exceed the maximum permitted levels set by the Environment Agency. The group also highlighted concerns over the long-term implications of the increased nuclear emissions on wildlife and marine ecosystems in the surrounding area. They fear that the radioactive waste could have devastating effects on the delicate balance of the environment, leading to harmful consequences for both wildlife and local communities. Furthermore, the Stop Hinkley group raised issues regarding the lack of transparency and accountability in the planning and implementation of the Hinkley Point C project. They criticized the government for failing to adequately address the concerns raised by local residents and environmental organizations throughout the approval process. The group argued that the public has not been properly informed about the potential risks associated with the nuclear power plant, leaving them in the dark about the full extent of the environmental impact. In response to these allegations, a spokesperson for the Hinkley Point C project defended the plant's safety measures, insisting that rigorous quality controls and monitoring processes are in place to ensure that nuclear emissions are kept within safe limits. They stressed that the project is subject to strict regulatory oversight and that all environmental standards will be met throughout the construction and operation of the plant. Despite these assurances, environmentalists remain skeptical about the potential risks posed by the Hinkley Point C nuclear power plant. They continue to push for greater transparency and accountability from the government and the project developers, demanding more comprehensive assessments of the environmental impact and potential health risks associated with the plant. As the debate over the Hinkley Point C project continues, it is clear that concerns about nuclear emissions and their impact on the environment are not going away anytime soon. The outcome of this ongoing dispute will have far-reaching implications for the future of nuclear energy in the UK and the broader global conversation about the role of nuclear power in combating climate change.

title: 'Law change needed' to stop sale of 'legal highs'
text: The Local Government Association (LGA) - which represents 400 councils - wants the government to adopt a similar approach to that taken in Ireland, where new substances are automatically banned if they are found to have psychoactive effects. The LGA has warned that current regulations are struggling to keep up with the rapidly evolving market for so-called "legal highs", which can be easily purchased online or in "head shops". These substances, often designed to mimic the effects of illegal drugs like ecstasy or cannabis, are often marketed as bath salts, plant food, or herbal incense to circumvent existing drug legislation. Councils across the UK have reported a significant increase in the number of deaths and hospital admissions related to legal highs in recent years. In response, some local authorities have taken matters into their own hands by introducing public space protection orders to crack down on the sale and distribution of these substances. However, the LGA argues that a more comprehensive approach is needed to tackle the growing problem of legal highs. They have called on the government to introduce legislation that would empower local authorities to ban the sale of these substances in their areas. Simon Blackburn, chairman of the LGA's Safer and Stronger Communities Board, emphasized the need for urgent action, stating that "councils and police are working hard to tackle the problem, but current legislation means retailers can only be prosecuted if trading standards can prove a substance is harmful." He added that "This is time-consuming and difficult. It can take councils a year to gather enough evidence to prosecute, by which time use of the drug may have fallen, but a new drug hit the streets." The LGA's proposal is supported by a wide range of organizations, including the Royal Society for Public Health and the Local Government Information Unit. They argue that a blanket ban on legal highs would remove the loophole that allows manufacturers to skirt existing drug laws and would send a clear message that these substances are not safe for consumption. In conclusion, the sale of legal highs poses a serious threat to public health and safety, and urgent action is needed to address this growing problem. The LGA's call for a change in the law to stop the sale of legal highs is a crucial step toward protecting communities from the harmful effects of these substances. Only by working together with local authorities, law enforcement, and healthcare professionals can we effectively combat the scourge of legal highs and prevent further harm to individuals and society as a whole.

title: Jeff Koons' Rabbit sculpture breaks record for living artist
text: previous record for a living artist set by David Hockney's Portrait of an Artist (Pool with Two Figures), which sold for $90.3 million in November last year. Jeff Koons, the controversial and celebrated American artist behind Rabbit, is no stranger to breaking records. Known for his bold, pop art-inspired works, Koons has been a prominent figure in the contemporary art scene for decades. Rabbit, with its shiny, mirror-like finish and iconic design, has become one of his most recognizable pieces. The sculpture's sale at Christie's generated significant buzz in the art world, with collectors and enthusiasts eagerly anticipating the final price. The bidding war for Rabbit lasted just 10 minutes, but the excitement and anticipation leading up to the auction had been building for weeks. Rabbit's record-breaking sale is a testament to Koons's enduring influence and the enduring appeal of his work. Critics have often debated the meaning and significance of his art, with some dismissing it as shallow or kitschy, while others hail him as a genius who pushes the boundaries of contemporary art. Koons himself has remained relatively tight-lipped about the meaning behind Rabbit, preferring to let the viewers draw their own conclusions. Some see the sculpture as a playful nod to consumerism and popular culture, while others interpret it as a commentary on the nature of art and its market value. Regardless of its deeper meaning, Rabbit's staggering price tag is a reflection of the demand for Koons's work and the influence he wields in the art world. His ability to create pieces that captivate and provoke has made him a sought-after artist among collectors and galleries alike. As Rabbit takes its place in the record books, Koons's legacy as one of the most influential artists of his generation is solidified. With his bold, larger-than-life creations continuing to inspire and provoke, there is no doubt that Koons will remain a central figure in the contemporary art world for years to come. The sale of Rabbit may have shattered records, but for Koons and his devoted fans, the true value of the piece lies in its ability to spark conversation, challenge conventions, and ignite the imagination. In the world of art, as in life, sometimes it takes a bold and unconventional approach to make a lasting impact. And with Rabbit, Jeff Koons has done just that.

title: Covid: Classic TT and Manx Grand Prix called off for second year
text: remain closed to non-residents until at least September, as part of efforts to prevent the spread of Covid-19. The decision to cancel the Classic TT and Manx Grand Prix for the second year in a row comes as a blow to motorsport enthusiasts and the Isle of Man's tourism industry. The Classic TT and Manx Grand Prix are prestigious motorcycle races that attract thousands of visitors to the island every year. The events have a rich history dating back to the early 20th century, and are considered highlights of the motorsport calendar. The cancellation of this year's races is a significant disappointment for fans and competitors alike. Organizers of the events cited the ongoing uncertainty surrounding the pandemic and the challenges of hosting large-scale gatherings as reasons for the decision to cancel. The safety and well-being of participants, spectators, and the local community were also top priorities in making the difficult choice to call off the races. Many riders and teams had been eagerly preparing for the Classic TT and Manx Grand Prix, hoping for a chance to compete on the challenging Isle of Man course. The races are known for their demanding circuit, which winds through picturesque countryside and presents a unique test of skill and endurance for competitors. The cancellation of the events leaves a void in the racing calendar and a sense of missed opportunity for those who had been looking forward to testing their mettle on the iconic course. While the decision to cancel the Classic TT and Manx Grand Prix is disappointing, it underscores the ongoing impact of the pandemic on the world of motorsport and events industry as a whole. The Isle of Man, like many other regions, continues to navigate the challenges of hosting large gatherings and welcoming visitors in a safe and responsible manner. The closure of the island's border to non-residents is a necessary measure to protect public health and prevent the spread of Covid-19, but it also means sacrifices for industries that rely on tourism and large-scale events for revenue and visibility. As the motorsport community and fans come to terms with the cancellation of this year's races, there is hope that the Classic TT and Manx Grand Prix will return stronger than ever in the future. The resilience and passion of those involved in the events, from organizers to riders to spectators, will be put to the test as they navigate the challenges of planning for a post-pandemic world. In the meantime, the Isle of Man will continue to uphold its reputation as a motorsport mecca and a destination for enthusiasts seeking thrills on two wheels.

title: National Museum Wales boss issues job cuts warning
text: the past month. Anderson, who is the Director General of National Museum Wales, expressed his concerns regarding the financial challenges facing the institution and the need for drastic measures to ensure its sustainability. In his interview with BBC Wales, Anderson explained that the museum has been operating at a deficit for several years, and the current economic climate has only exacerbated the situation. With a significant drop in visitor numbers due to the ongoing pandemic, the museum is facing a substantial loss in revenue, making it difficult to maintain its current staff levels. As a result, Anderson issued a warning to all employees, stating that job cuts may be inevitable in order to reduce costs and keep the museum afloat. He emphasized that these decisions are not taken lightly, but are necessary to ensure the long-term viability of National Museum Wales. The pay dispute that has been ongoing for the past month has only added to the financial strain on the institution. Staff members have been demanding a significant increase in pay, citing the rising cost of living and the essential role they play in preserving and promoting Welsh culture. While Anderson acknowledges the hard work and dedication of the museum staff, he highlighted the financial constraints that limit the museum's ability to meet their demands. Despite the challenges facing National Museum Wales, Anderson remains hopeful that a solution can be found that will benefit both the institution and its employees. He emphasized the importance of collaboration and understanding during this difficult time, urging all parties involved to work together towards a sustainable future for the museum. In the coming weeks, Anderson will be meeting with staff representatives to discuss potential alternatives to job cuts, such as voluntary redundancies or reduced working hours. He is committed to exploring all possible options before making any final decisions that could impact the museum's workforce. As the Director General of National Museum Wales, Anderson faces a daunting task in finding a balance between financial stability and employee satisfaction. While job cuts may be on the horizon, he is determined to navigate these challenges with transparency and empathy, considering the interests of both the museum and its dedicated staff. Overall, the future of National Museum Wales remains uncertain, but Anderson's commitment to finding a sustainable solution offers a glimmer of hope for the institution and its employees. Only time will tell what lies ahead for this iconic cultural landmark in Wales.

title: The many ways to say sorry in Japanese
text: In English, you either say "sorry" or "apologies". In Japanese, there are at least 20 different ways. One of the most casual and most frequently used words is "sumimasen." This word can be used in a variety of situations, from bumping into someone on the street to making a mistake at work. It is a versatile word that can convey a sense of apology, gratitude, or even a request for assistance.  Another common way to say sorry in Japanese is "gomen nasai." This phrase is a bit more formal than "sumimasen" and is often used when apologizing for a more serious mistake or offense. It is important to note that apologizing in Japanese culture is not just about saying the words, but also about showing sincerity and humility through your actions and demeanor.  One interesting aspect of apologizing in Japanese is the use of different expressions based on the level of formality and politeness required in a given situation. For example, when apologizing to a friend or family member, you may use the more casual term "gomen." However, when apologizing to a superior or someone you do not know well, you would use a more formal phrase such as "shitsurei shimasu" or "moushiwake arimasen." Additionally, there are specific phrases used for apologizing in certain contexts. For example, if you are late for a meeting or appointment, you would say "okurete moushiwake arimasen." If you have inconvenienced someone in any way, you might say "shitsurei wo shimasu" to express your regret.  Apologizing in Japanese is not just about taking responsibility for your actions, but also about showing respect and consideration for the feelings of others. It is considered a sign of maturity and integrity to apologize sincerely and genuinely when you have made a mistake.  In some cases, a simple bow or a gesture of humility can speak volumes more than words. This is especially true in formal settings, such as business meetings or social gatherings, where the culture of respect and hierarchy is of utmost importance. Overall, the many ways to say sorry in Japanese reflect the culture's emphasis on politeness, humility, and respect for others. It is a language that values not just the words we speak, but also the actions and gestures that accompany them. So the next time you find yourself in a situation where an apology is necessary, remember that there are many ways to express regret in Japanese, each with its own nuances and levels of formality.

title: Damascus military facilities 'hit by Israel rockets'
text: The Jamraya research centre in Damascus, Syria, was hit by a series of rockets launched by Israel in the early hours of the morning, according to Syrian state media reports. The facility, which is located in a suburban area just north of the capital, has long been suspected by Western officials of being involved in chemical weapons research. The missile strikes caused significant damage to the military facility, with images emerging on social media showing plumes of smoke rising from the site. Local residents reported hearing loud explosions and seeing flashes of light in the sky as the rockets struck their target. There have been no reports of casualties so far, but the extent of the damage is still being assessed. Israeli officials have not confirmed or denied their involvement in the strike, maintaining their policy of neither confirming nor denying airstrikes in Syria. However, previous similar attacks have been attributed to Israel, which has repeatedly targeted Syrian military installations and Iranian-backed militias in recent years. The Syrian government condemned the incident as a "flagrant violation of international law" and accused Israel of "escalating tensions in the region." The Syrian Foreign Ministry released a statement calling on the United Nations to take action against Israel for its "aggressive and hostile actions." The Jamraya research centre has been a key target for both Israel and Western countries due to suspicions of its involvement in the development of chemical weapons. In 2013, the facility was hit by a series of airstrikes, which were attributed to Israel, following a chemical weapons attack in the Damascus suburb of Ghouta that killed hundreds of civilians. The latest attack comes at a time of heightened tensions in the region, with the United States, Israel, and Iran engaged in a war of words over Iran's nuclear program and its support for armed groups in the Middle East. The ongoing conflict in Syria, now in its eleventh year, has further complicated the situation, with multiple foreign powers backing different factions in the civil war. As the situation continues to escalate, fears of a wider conflict breaking out in the region are growing. The international community is closely monitoring the situation and calling for restraint on all sides to prevent further destabilization in an already volatile region.

title: Caption mix-ups 'show lack of respect' for black MPs
text: The Evening Standard used a picture of Bell Ribeiro-Addy in a story about fellow Labour MP Marsha de Cordova. The story, which focused on de Cordova's recent statements on racial inequality, mistakenly included a caption that identified Ribeiro-Addy as the subject of the article. This mix-up has sparked outrage and accusations of racial insensitivity, highlighting a larger issue of lack of respect for black MPs in the media. This is not an isolated incident. Black MPs have long been subjected to a range of microaggressions and discriminatory practices within the political and media landscape. From being mistaken for one another in news articles to having their accomplishments overlooked or attributed to others, black politicians continue to face challenges that their white counterparts do not. The caption mix-up involving Ribeiro-Addy and de Cordova is just the latest example of this pervasive issue. It is not only a matter of factual accuracy, but also one of respect and recognition. Black MPs deserve to have their voices heard and their achievements acknowledged without being overshadowed by careless mistakes and oversights. In response to the caption mix-up, Ribeiro-Addy spoke out about the incident, expressing her disappointment and frustration with the media's lack of attention to detail when it comes to black politicians. She emphasized the importance of accurately representing and respecting black MPs in the public sphere, calling for greater accountability and awareness from journalists and news outlets. This incident serves as a reminder of the ongoing challenges faced by black MPs in the UK and the need for greater diversity and inclusion in the media. It is crucial that journalists and editors take steps to address their unconscious biases and ensure that they are accurately representing and portraying black politicians in their reporting. Moreover, this caption mix-up highlights the broader issue of systemic racism and discrimination in society. Black MPs are not only marginalized in media coverage, but also face barriers to equal representation and opportunities within the political sphere. It is essential that we all work together to challenge and dismantle these structures of inequality and ensure that black voices are heard and respected. In conclusion, the caption mix-up involving Bell Ribeiro-Addy and Marsha de Cordova is a stark reminder of the lack of respect and recognition for black MPs in the media. It is imperative that we address these issues head-on and strive for a more inclusive and equitable society where all politicians, regardless of race, are treated with the dignity and respect they deserve.
